review.title: Great atmosphere.
review.reviewText: Easy checkin. Great location. 360 views from top floor.

review.title: You may be in vegas
review.reviewText: This hotel is a factory, so you feel like you are in Vegas. The rooms are tiny, just enough room for a bed. The staff is incompetent and if you need them to fix things, plan on making multiple requests. Stay elsewhere!

well located, nice amenities 
too long of a wait to check-in

review.title: Hassle
review.reviewText:
There was a really long, long line to check in.  It took about an hour.  That was unexpected and felt like being at the airport.  The rooms are nice, but the hallways look old.

An additional $60+ a day for parking.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good good

review.title: Great central hotel
review.reviewText: Very clean, well run hotel really near Union Sq. A great central location to base yourself for a trip to SF.

review.title: Easy access to everything.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Took the BART train from airport to Powell Street and a short walk from there to hotel. Location puts you with in easy walking distance to great food and fun. Public transportation ie hop on hop off buses, street cars, cable cars, efficient and fun. Cabbies are friendly and very affordable.

review.title: Tower 2 very good
review.reviewText: Good hotel and front bar in lobby. Close to everything
Hotel was nice just a little too far from Fishermans wharf

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Pretty good location , close to cable car . Close to shopping and restaurants . No the best in sf. A lot of homeless near by over all ok no complaints

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: 40th floor, great view of the Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: Hilton Union square
review.reviewText: Furnishings were worn and tired and overall disappointing. The large number of homeless people around the hotel made walking in the immediate area feel threatening at times. Lobby bar area was noisy and crowded so not a relaxing place to sit. Lack of dining facilities in the hotel but good selection of restaurants locally.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location was good for sights, shopping and transport.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Bathroom way too small.  Herb/kitchen food terrible.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Very good location walking distance to many attractions. Little on the expensive side but well worth it all staff are very helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Wharf,  Golden Gate Bridge Cable Car rides, shops and much more

review.title: Gnats
review.reviewText: Hotel management sent me a text message asking how I liked the room.  I replied back honestly that the room had gnats and no Wi-Fi access.  They apologized and offered another room which I accepted for when I returned later that evening.  When I returned the front desk said that the room was for the next day - not the current.  Why pursue client satisfaction if you're not prepared to react to problems that may arise?  Marketing guys should be shot for that one.
review.negativeRemarks: Remove the text message satisfaction survey.
review.locationRemarks: Everything

review.title: Terrible room.
review.reviewText: The location is nice. The staffs are friendly. However, the mattress and pillows need to be replace. Woke up with a sore neck and back every morning. Will not be staying here again.

review.title: The hotel is in a perfect area for convenience
review.reviewText: We spend 4 nights and played golf around the San Francisco area and it was great

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location and no issues at all. Can't go wrong here and would stay again.

review.title: Hotel in expensive area with homeless every corner
review.reviewText: Location not the best. Union square 5 mins away but nothing there except designer shops. 4 of us stayed in a room and was only given 3 sets of towels had to get more from the pool. Pool was on 16th floor and surrounded by a court yard of rooms which blocked the sun and created a wind tunnel it was freezing cold. Hotel very very busy, queues for everything. Tried self parking the transit van but the roof to low in parking so surprise surprise I had to pay exulted for vallet parking. Rooms ok but not any better than anywhere else I stayed and noise from room next door till after midnight first night of stay. Stopped at 16 places this break, all the others were great and cheaper but much better. Not worth the money at all

review.title: Short Stay, San Francisco
review.reviewText: When we registered I was unhappy to find that there was no wifi in the room.  The room was less than perfect, creased curtains, grubby carpet, broken bathroom door and less than adequate facilities in the bathroom, e.g. no surfaces to put your toiletries.  However, when I complained I was immediately offered a free upgrade, staff responded in a professional and courteous manner to my concerns and made me feel valued.  I felt that they took me seriously and responded speedily.  The upgrade meant that I had complimentary wifi and a better spec room.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and eventually the room
review.negativeRemarks: In 2016 there should be free wifi all over the hotel instead of only in the reception area.
review.locationRemarks: Location was ok, fairly central to the city and close to shops and bus services.

review.reviewText: Near shopping and restaurants good location but rooms look a little worn also lots of repairs going on

review.title: Nice hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, we just expected our room to be a little better based off of the pictures on the website. The pool area was very clean but the hot tub is too small for such a large hotel. It was almost always full when we tried to use it and would have to wait for people to leave. You can also hear everything in the hallways (people talking, doors closing, and the elevator ding). The hotel is located by a ton of shops, restaurants, bars, and the cable cars and subway.
3 night stay was very enjoyable and the hotel was very convenient for shops bars and restaurants
review.negativeRemarks: More seating area for eating food

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText:
Just back from Union Square this was a great location for the buses, cable cars and hop on hop off buses. There was a really convenient coffee shop in the foyer, which was handy for taking something back to the room without spending loads.
Room was large and the bathroom facilities were very good, powerful shower, lots of space.
I didn't find the room too noisy considering we were in the middle of San Fran and on the 5th floor.
We definitely choose this hotel again.

review.title: Great location but maid service was spotty
review.reviewText: I stayed 8 nights, one day room was partially cleaned, one day no maid service by 5:15 pm, and one day no coffee.  The front desk responded quickly, but it was very annoying.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location, nice pool and hot tub
review.negativeRemarks: Rug in room could be replaced
review.locationRemarks: Near every kind of public transportation.  Plenty of shops and restaurants nearby.

review.title: Good hotel for price but homeless people near by.
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to union square and a Westfield shopping centre . Onsite parking very very expensive .

review.title: Hotel was close to China town
review.reviewText: Would not stay there again.  The door man was on cell phone and not opening door for most guests.  The water temp in shower was awful and it drained so slow you were standing in about 6 inches.  The front desk staff was super slow.  Overall not impressed.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Best location.car hire across road. Irish pub on next cnr with free WiFi. Decent coffee in Union square a stone's throw away. ( when is America going to start making decent coffee). On numerous trips to the States find ing a decent coffee is nearly impossible. Great shopping on doorstep. Hop on hop off bus in Union Square. Hilton has a well priced convenience store and cafe

review.title: 25th AnniversRy trip
review.reviewText: We were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary.  When we arrived, the attendant at the front desk provided complimentary breakfast buffet vouchers for 2 + vouchers for the week of pastry, fruit and drink for every day that we were there.  Thankful, room was clean, well sized, limited drawer space for clothes though. Need bigger drawers.  Security was tight, as its close to the tenderloin district.  Liked the location as its Close to great restaurants and Union Square and the cable cars.  Enjoyed overall our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Not enough Drawer space for clothes
review.locationRemarks: Close to great restaurants, Union square and cable cars.

review.title: Nice hotel in central location
review.reviewText: Good time but wouldn't go if you want a view or a nice pool area. Confusion with charging a fee on your credit card each night

review.title: Hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Good hotel in convient location. Staff were very friendly and helpful.
Bathroom door would not close,  no privacy.  Rooms are a bit small but clean.

review.title: Nice hotel but nothing special
review.reviewText: Good location you can find anything on first floor from food to souvenirs. Hot tub and heated pool on 16 floor just between 3 towers. Rooms size like in another hotels and nothing special, pretty much clean and well maintained. Parking $12 per hour and food in hotel expensive, but you can eat somewhere around for decent price.

review.title: Central location to food and shopping
review.reviewText: Our room was taken but the staff offer us a bigger room as replacement. And check in was prompt

review.title: Satisfactory
review.reviewText: Given the accommodation is expensive in SF, meet the expectation with the price paid. No special service. The buildings are huge. My room was pretty far away from elevator hall.

review.title: Good location, upgrade offer was welcome.
review.reviewText:
Had a great visit, hotel was well located near bus stops. Room was clean and staff responded to our requests. Breakfast included was a great benefit, though area could be larger. Though we didn't do a lot of shopping this trip, we can see that there are a lot of stores in the area.

Upon checking in, we were offered a room upgrade which included the breakfast and wifi, which was very fast and reliable.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast cafe could be more spacious
review.locationRemarks: Near tour bus stop and other transportation

review.title: Good hotel in downtown
review.reviewText: l, well located in downtown SF, close to Union Sq and not far from Chinatown touristic places. Big hotel, convention type. Rooms are very nice.

review.title: Vacation with my daughter
review.reviewText: First time in San Francisco and this hotel was spot on. The location was perfect. Close to wonderful shopping and cable cars. Will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great Location & Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, lots of in house amenities, convenient and kind staff
review.locationRemarks: Pier and trolley nearby

review.title: Nicely Located, but pricey
review.reviewText:
We had a wonderful stay at the hotel. The room was clean, and spacious. Situated a couple of blocks away from the cable car main track, it was easy to step out of the hotel and walk around.
The only sad part is that the hotel is way over charging for breakfast. So I went out the next morning to a local diner not too far, and still got over charged (but less!), I guess it's the price to pay for staying downtown?
review.negativeRemarks: Offer better pricing.

review.title: Great Hotel, great location, great staff
review.reviewText:
Great amenities, staff and location and love the bustling atmosphere.  Staff was especially accommodating and friendly.  Parking is pricey but luckily staff directed me to parking across the street which is cheaper.

Rooms are spacious but the bed is so far from the TV; oddly planned room which just had a ton of space between the bed and the TV/desk for no apparent reason.

Wifi is pricey.

Great fitness centre.
review.positiveRemarks: Gym and pool were especially good.
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger TV, complimentary wifi

review.title: Convenient location but room too small
review.reviewText: Great location, clean room, elevator moves fast. But room is a little too small.

review.title: Nice hotel very close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Confortable room and free wifi y you are a hhonors member. The hotel is very well located near union square.

review.title: Mostly positive but some room for improvement
review.reviewText:
The room was spacious, clean, tidy and comfortable as I would have hoped for from this sort of hotel.

The staff were mostly very helpful and friendly, with just a single occasion where they needed to take the time and listen to what we were actually trying to ask.

The biggest issue I have was with the lack of included Wi-Fi - I think it's terrible for a world class hotel in the middle of San Francisco to not offer this.  It's a small cost for the hotel which would have helped us make the most of our holiday - get with the times!

review.title: Visiting the city of SF
review.reviewText: Enjoyed every minute. Toured both the City and Monterey and Carmel. Staff at Hotel was wonderful. Helpful, friendly and pleasant.  The hotel was located downtown and very accessible to shopping, restaurants and Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Niothing
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Beautiful hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: Had a great room on 41st floor...just a beautiful view of the city.  Wonderful hotel...enjoyed my stay.

review.title: Moved out as fast as we could
review.reviewText: We checked in, were disgusted with the location and the condition of the common areas, found a hotel in Fisherman's Wharf that could accomodate us for the rest of our vacation, stayed one night, and checked out as fast as we could. This may be a good hotel for a business trip, but not a family vacation.

review.title: Nice hotel within walking distances of major attra
review.reviewText: I stayed there during the Marathon weekend , close to the starting line,
review.negativeRemarks: na
review.locationRemarks: Close to major attractions

review.title: Central location, but room in needs minor tune up
review.reviewText: Clean room, but not enough electrical outlets.Some outlet were loose and needed replacing as well.  Water pressure was too low in the shower and difficult to adjust. I would still recommend the hotel based on the location.
review.negativeRemarks: room needs some attention.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square.

review.title: Excellent hotel in the middle of the city.
review.reviewText: This is an excellent hotel in the middle of the city. The hotel is clean, open and a very good value. There is plenty of things to do within walking distance of you can walk a short distance and catch the cable car. One day we walked across the street and rented a car from one of the many rental companies there.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, open, well situated, good coffee.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if they had free in room wifi.
review.locationRemarks: It is in a great location and there are many things to do nearby like hopping on a cable car, shopping, dining, sightseeing.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the shopping area.
review.reviewText: The hotel room is clean, comfortable. Staff are nice. I would recommend this wonderful hotel.

review.title: Hotel charged us to park which was not advertised
review.reviewText: 47 dollar parking fee and a 7.50 garage tax? Room was supposed to be a king but we got a queen.   Very noisy.  Also room service food was cold and unpleasant.  We had a great time but the charges were disappointing.

review.title: Enjoyed a New Hotel Experience
review.reviewText: Usually we stay at a hotel nearby; however, we needed two rooms for this trip and Hilton beat the price hands down so we decided to try a new hotel. We were pleasantly surprised with the ease of getting to the hotel, leaving our car with valet, and the superb directions to the Academy of Sciences we were given. The hotel staff were all very friendly, quickly saw to all our needs, and the rooms were clean, quiet, and comfortable. The bonus was the hotel was also located near Union Square right where we wanted to be. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel. Thank you!

review.title: Nice hotel in the "heart" of Union Square
review.reviewText: Everyone that we met was very nice and courteous.  Basic items such as bottled water was extremely over priced, but that's hotel life!

review.title: Registration Check-in......
review.reviewText:
I entered the registration check-in line as number 3 in the queue.  Two clerks working--should be quick.  Next thing I know one registration clerk left---number of guests now about 7 or so.  Clerk didn't return.   Single clerk working had challenges with a check-in.  End of story--took 45 minutes to check-in as third in line.  Others behind me even longer.

Next day---needed info about leaving and reentering parking garage that clerk should have furnished during check-in registration.  Concierge solution--wait in check-in registration line again.  Longer line this time. Deja Vu.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice pastries/baked goods off lobby downstairs.
review.negativeRemarks: Check-in registration and parking info.
review.locationRemarks: Too close to tenderloin area---do an internet search on this.  Know where you are going/areas walking through.

review.title: Uncomfortable,
review.reviewText: WiFi was not available as advertised on expedia. We has to upgrade to get wifi. Customer service was bad.
Very small room!!! No HHonors due to ordering through  Expedia.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is very nice but just don't look out the window and look on the back street. Homeless people all over everyone tells you go right not left you are in "tenderloin " area and to watch the homeless. It's sad such a nice hotel is surrounded by this.
Had a great experience would visit again likes the location just wish they had more restaurants

review.title: It was really nice and close to everything.
review.reviewText: I really had an amazing time there! The hotel staff were really nice, friendly and helpful! The room was clean and very comfy! I had a room with two queen beds! i had a really great experience there!

review.title: Costs very high
review.reviewText: Nice room but expensive!! Parking is convenient but also expensive! Manhattan is cheaper than San Francisco! Clean rooms and great staff !

review.title: I expected more for a "Hilton" hotel
review.reviewText: I was expecting a lot more for a "Hilton" hotel. Traveled from Texas to California for a few days. Room was very small. Could barely move around or lay my luggage down. First room we got, hair all over the floor and on the towels. They didn't even bother to sweep or vacuum from the previous people. Second room we got, sheets had holes in them. Payed a lot of money to stay here for the dirtiness we got. Will not be coming back to this room. They didn't even say they were sorry for giving us the first dirty room.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: That hotel is in a good location, the room were clean and comfortable, helpful staff. I recommend that hotel! Great price in comparison to the others in the area!

review.title: Great hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Only complaint is the constant crowd of smokers just outside the door of the hotel.

review.title: Great location. Close to everything. Great views.
review.reviewText: We stayed at the hotel for 8 days during our first visit to San Fransisco. We could not have asked for better! Easy access to the whole city. Great amenities. Excellent staff full of information. It was an outstanding experience!

review.title: Central to Market Street
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, clean, quiet. Market Street just around the corner. Close to BART and cable cars.

review.title: Nice hotel nice area for shopping
review.reviewText: Union square nice location for this hotel. Very convenient transportation, nice for shopping and dining

review.title: Not to friendly staff
review.reviewText: Te staff on the reception was terrible the y didnt reserved our room as agreed....

review.title: Great property/Location/Botoque style Restroom
review.reviewText: I was most likely placed in a third party overflow reservation room. Bathroom was botique style and had very limited space. I was very surprised with the bathroom space for a Hilton property.

review.title: rrally disappointed
review.reviewText: Room layout is small and makes no sense (toilet in front of the sink). Glass doors to bathroom so light on wakes everyone else up. Staff was not helpful and first put us in a tower without complete elevator access. We had 2 large suitcases so not happy.

review.title: Small bathroom sink
review.reviewText: The sink area was quite tiny & model behind the toilet. Very unusual set up.

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful stay at that Hilton. The hotel was close enough to lots of places I wanted to go and see. Thanks fir the great customer service.

review.title: Nice hotel with excellent location
review.reviewText: Very nice and confortable hotel with excellent location near  Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: Size of rooms, too small

review.title: Rude Staff
review.reviewText: Staff at front desk was not nice...refused to explain charge on account saying only it was "the rate plan."  Cops took down (literally, to the ground) a purse snatching thief right at the main door as we were waiting for an Uber.
review.locationRemarks: Location was sketchy to the south - one block south and beware of homeless.

review.title: Clean and quiet, nice pool, very comfortable bed.
review.reviewText: Great location close to Union Square and all the shopping, very nice hotel with all the amenities that my husband and I like.
review.positiveRemarks: Very happy with everything, nice and quiet, comfortable bed.  Very easy going feeling, hustling and bustling main lobby, loved it.
review.negativeRemarks: Happy with everything.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the shopping and restaurants and Union Square, loved it.

review.reviewText: Room small, full size beds instead of queen size. Booked room with bay view, got there had to pay a good bit more to upgrade to get a view. Hotel did not have the Hilton honors lounge like New York Hilton where you could relax and have breakfast and snacks throughout the day. One of the main reasons we chose to book with Hilton.

review.title: Good location for shopping
review.reviewText: Suite we reserved was not available upon arrival. They moved us into a smaller room (older room, stains in carpet, dresser drawer wacky, only one chair) and at our request (we had to ask), adjusted the rate accordingly. Hotel staff very pleasant.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Quick service, comfy beds, right next to union square, close to restaurants and bars

review.title: Hotel in Central Location
review.reviewText: Reception staff can at times be unhelpful and frustrating. Queues to check in are long and tiring, there must be a way of speeding up this process.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in process
review.locationRemarks: Central location to cable car and the trolley buses to Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Nice hotel and close to fishermens wharf.
review.reviewText: Nice clean hotel close to the down town shopping.

review.title: Comfortable and nice hotel
review.reviewText: Ever Hotel is close to Fishermen's wharf.Not recommend you walk there.No free parking.

Hotel room was quite small, but comfortable. Convenient location for shopping during the day, but some closeby areas are sketchy at night. Room service pretty limited for such a big hotel. Overall, was pretty clean, and staff was very friendly and helpful!

review.title: not worth the money
review.reviewText: There was a conference going on diring he duration of my stay. Check in took 45 minutes after travelling for most of the day. There was no wifi service in my room and I had to spend 30 mins on the phone with the Hilton IT service for them to tell me there was an issue with the wifi service in my room and they could not help me at the momen. This was very inconvenient as I had a lot of work to complete that evening. There is no room service menu and the food at the market downstairs was not great at all.
The location of this hotel is very good, very close to metro, railway station.

review.title: AM Burbank, CA
review.reviewText: I definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. By the time I was there for check in because I waited 6min after I called sweet Nick upgraded my room to a better view and higher level he was so nice and lovely thank you for everything I really enjoyed my stay I will definitely stay again.

review.title: Not great location, near rough neighbourhood
review.reviewText: Paid for the upgrade to a new room with breakfast included. Room was dated and breakfast was a pastry in a paper bag and pretty bad coffee in a paper cup to be consumed in the hotel lobby. Nothing impressive about this hotel at all. There were issues requiring the cops out the front the night we stayed and it looked like a regular occurrence. Walk one way it's ok, go the other and there are slot of people on the streets. Certainly wouldn't take my family there.

review.title: Huge hotel, horrible beds
review.reviewText: If you plan to stay here do not get the average room. You have to get an upgraded room if you expect any level of comfort. We stayed 2 nights in the 3rd tower and our backs still haven't recovered from the worst beds ever! 1st tower is quite nice had been recently remodeled and is much more comfortable, but it's about $50 more per night. We also parked at the parking garage directly across the street for $35 per night or $39 per night if you need in/out privileges instead of the hotels $55 self park fee or $69 valet parking fee. Well worth the savings.

review.title: Nice and in a great area!
review.reviewText: Attended a conference for work. Great meeting rooms.

photos.caption: Tiny pool and hot tub for such a large hotel
Cable cars are only a few blocks away

review.title: Room with a view and room without a view
review.reviewText: Over the course of my 9-day visit, I stayed in two different rooms at the Hilton, one on the 11th floor with a fabulous view of the roof, and one on the 35th floor with a great view of the city, as well as the hotel's tiny pool and hot tub on the 16th floor. Both rooms had plenty of space, but the beds were really hard.  The store/restaurant in the lobby was super expensive with very few choices for a 4-star hotel. And the bar in the lobby made for a really loud and crowded entry to the hotel. The bright spot in this stay was the hotel staff. They seemed really focused on guest services. This is from the check in staff to the concierge, from security to room cleaners.  Another plus is this hotel is only a few blocks away from the famous cable cars.

review.title: Great hotel, not the best part of town.
review.reviewText: Close walking distance to a lot of places, but not the best part of town.  Hotel alone was great just wouldn't stay there for vacation again

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice. Bart train stops about two blocks away and can be taken to/from Oakland and San Francisco airports. The rooms were clean and updated. The cable doesn't work good. Nice location depending on what type of environment you are used to. It was very busy and there are a lot of homeless people. If you are not used to homeless people it's probably not the place for you.

review.title: My stay was very pleasant.
review.reviewText: My room was quiet and very clean.  The room was newly renovated and very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is located in the center of downtown.  It is about a five minute walk from public transportation and shops.
review.negativeRemarks: Perhaps making clients aware of the concierge service.  I was delighted to learn about nearby places of interests and available car service.
review.locationRemarks: The location is right in the middle to everything.  There are a number of things to see and do.  The hotel is located near major shops and restaurants

review.title: Great hotel. Central location to everything.
review.reviewText: Surprised panhandlers were right outside front door of the hotel begging for money. Would have liked hotel staff to.police this better.  Don't want to sound snobby but we paid a great deal for our vacation. My kids and I were very sympathetic to the plight of the homeless and we were approached all over the city.

review.title: Good hotel, but....
review.reviewText: Staff upon check-in seemed very stone faced unfriendly.  The room I stayed in had some kind of constant noise sounded like faint hammering or rattling of pipes. When I went into bathroom sombody had urinated and not flushed toilet. I also found a empty juice bottle behind desk and walls were very thin heard next room over. Lobby area was very noisy with a bar right in middle. Hotel should put bar in separate area away from check-in.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location close to shops, transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaniness, noise issues.
review.locationRemarks: Shops, restaurants, transportation. Borders tenderloin, watch for aggressive homeless pepole.

photos.caption: View from a standard king room

review.title: Conference-friendly
review.reviewText: Stayed one night while attending a conference at the hotel. They were very accommodating as they offered to hold bags before check in and after check out. Hotel staff was helpful. Room was clean and nice. Nothing to complain about!

review.title: ok hotel, close enough to everything
review.reviewText: no free wi fi, breakfast wasn't cheap a little dated
review.negativeRemarks: free wi fi, modernising
review.locationRemarks: good location

review.title: Big hotel, ok for a conference
review.reviewText: The hotel is ok, the rooms are ok, the facility is packed with people. Even as a "business hotel" I would put this one in the hectic category. Also, the room service options are pitiful. The one positive, the staff are certious, attentive and prompt. But this would be the hotel that I stayed at because there weren't any other options...and usually there are.
review.negativeRemarks: Problems de something that actually resembles real room service. The option currently available is beneath Hilton.
review.locationRemarks: Location is good, central, and convenient to many things.

review.reviewText: During check-in, found out that expedia-reserved room details (bed type, etc) were not honored.

review.title: SF short trip
review.reviewText: It was a great short trip to SF in late May. We picked this hotel was for the location closed to Union Square and the mid Market area. It was a nice hotel overall but unfortunately that we didn't get a room with city view.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Waited about 45 minutes to check in. Bathroom was filthy, dried up urine all over the toilet seat. Had to call front desk twice before housecleaning showed up. Made the call from our cells phones because the room phone was not working. Room was so cold & thermostat did not work. Don't think I would stay here again.

review.title: Perfect location in Union Square.
review.reviewText: The Hilton was a perfect choice for us! Heated pool, hot tub, beautiful rooms. Amazing location.

review.title: Close to everything.
review.reviewText: Came to SF for a concert at Davies Symphony Hall. Easy to use bus or taxis. Or walking if you like to walk.
review.positiveRemarks: Arrived early morning/were checked in early about 10:00 a.m. Never had that happen before. All hotel staff very helpful. Pool/hot tub. Nice bath soaps
review.negativeRemarks: Larger gift shop.
review.locationRemarks: China town, fisherman's wharf, Davies symphony hall, ocean beach, local restaurants, brewery, parks

review.title: We were greeted by friendly staff.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very beautiful and large. We enjoyed our stay there. It had a spectacular view.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was beautiful and very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Room service took about 3 calls and almost an hour later. We asked for glasses to be brought to our room for drinking water.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco has lots of attractions nearby and the bus and trolley systems were easily accessible.

review.title: Close to everything especially the cable car
review.reviewText: Excellent! Location with super staff! 👍👍👍😁😁👍👍👍👍

review.title: Loved being close to great shopping.
review.reviewText: Everything was clean the staff was very nice and helpful.  I enjoyed my stay and will stay again. The convenience of staying at the Hilton in Union Square was awesome so much great shopping so many awesome places to eat just had a blast and the weather was phenomenal.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText:
The hotel was fine but the price not so much. The room was good but the tub gets clogged often, the water wouldn't go down. In several occasions there wasn't any toilet paper. And even though we said we were four there was only three towels every time.

The room service wasn't very good. The food we ordered was bad.
However, breakfast was exquisite.
No wifi in the room, this is very unconfortable and my room was far away from the lobby (3-1249)
review.positiveRemarks: the room is very clean and big. It is confortable
review.negativeRemarks: to give us wifi in the room
review.locationRemarks: very good location and good restaurant nearby

review.title: Great location, friendly staff!
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff, clean rooms and lobby. Walking distance to restaurants and attractions.

review.title: Do not stay here! Awful!!!
review.reviewText: Stayed here two nights with my mother and it was awful! We were excited about the hotel but quickly found that this hotel did not meet the Hilton standards. We found dog poop in the lobby along with drunk guests in the lobby who almost assaulted us on our way to the elevator, blood on the blankets on the bed and the circuit blew in the room and we had no electricity in the bathroom and hallway early in the morning before checking out. We couldn't shower in the dark and took them over an hour to fix the problem. All the while, Housekeeping kept trying to get in the room and pressuring us to leave. We complained to the manager at check out 12 noon and we got the brush off~"We will note this". The manager offered us breakfast volchers, but with the power outage we had already purchased coffee and breakfast downstairs in the lobby. Staff was unhelpful and the hotel was disgusting. Will never stay here again and will rethink staying at a Hilton in the future.

review.title: Nice Quality for the Price, unsafe location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is one of the largest I have ever stayed in with nearly 2,000 rooms. Walking into the lobby is almost overwhelming because there are so many people. The staff was friendly and professional and took care of all of our needs.  The rooms were large and comfortable, but the bathroom doors would not fully close and the wifi did not work consistently. 

My biggest concern to anyone staying here is the location.  While we were able to walk just about anywhere we wanted to go the neighborhood did not feel very safe. There were a lot of people in distress in the streets who were very aggressive.  We ended up using a car or taxi to get around because we did not feel safe walking the streets.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was wonderful.  They helped us with everything from switching rooms to getting a rental car.
review.negativeRemarks: The room appeared to be recently remodeled but there were some things that still needed attention such as the bathroom door
review.locationRemarks: Location is a quick walk to chinatown or the financial district.  About 30 minutes to Fisherman's warf.

review.title: Nice hotel in the center, close to Union Square
review.reviewText: We decided to check out one day earlier from the hotel and rebooked the last day in Hilton SF Airport as we rented a car and drove to Carmel. The hotel waved a fee for earlier departure once we told that we are still staying in the same chain. It was a very pleasant experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, food shop inside the hotel. Very convenient if you come back late in the evening.
review.negativeRemarks: It seems the hotel needs some renovations and upgrade

review.title: It's fine.  Nothing special
review.reviewText: We reserved 2 rooms. When we got there, they charged us an additional $30 per room/per night for queen beds vs. doubles. Our rooms were not adjoining. We went back to the lobby because we needed adjoining. They moved us, refunded our $30 per night/per room, but then charged us an additional $40 per night/room for "newly renovated" rooms.  We ended up with 2 double beds in one room (my 4 children sharing beds loved that, said sarcastically) and 1 king bed in the other room.  Obviously, not newly renovated. Maybe several years ago? It was already a costly room (s) but not at all worth the additional charges and it feels like a scam.  As HiltonHonors members, we are typically treated much better.  Overall very disappointed with our stay and the additional costs that we felt as if we had no other choice.
review.negativeRemarks: "upgrade" charges were ridiculous.  Adjoining rooms for families with children, obviously. Pool was closed. $42 buffet breakfast for kids too?
review.locationRemarks: lots of shopping, lots of restaurants

review.title: Good stay in San Fancisco.
review.reviewText: I got this hotel at a good price maybe because it was a Friday. i thoroughly recommend it. Great location and clean quite room. The staff were helpful.
This was a nice hotel in the square Union area.  The area had some good restaurants nearby that were within walkable distance.
Excellent location near Union Square.  Line was long for check in so they gave us an upgrade. Great facility with all the amenities.

Bathrooms totally awkward. Looks like a total redesign meant to look very modern. Sink was oblong with a single spout/handle on one end against the wall. Only lighting for the mirror was behind the frame on the mirror. Tough for shaving p, make up etc. !  Towel bar was at head height right next to the toilet. 
The bedding was nice but the mattress dipped a bit to the center. I did like the mirror on the closet door. Only place to put on make up. Light from the window. 
We have stayed at many Hiltons. One of their "member" groups. This hotel is Not up to snuff.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
I want to give special recognition to your lost and found department.  I left a camera in the room and when I called, they very kindly went to the room, found it and delivered it to my associate.

The room itself was clean and comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly and competent staff who went out of their way to make this a pleasant stay.
review.negativeRemarks: I had a very long walk from the elevator in Tower 3 to my room.  After walking down 3 long corridors I was almost back to the elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square.  Easy access to the airport and bridges.

review.title: Good hotel, but the wifi was not working
review.reviewText: The wifi was out for my 24-hour stay, which needless to say, was incredibly frustrating,.
review.negativeRemarks: Consisitent wifi. Lobby was really loud.

review.title: Close to Union Square, ok hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located near Union Square shopping area. Check-in was so-so and no help. Charges for everything- parking $47, internet $13. It can feel a little crowded at times but there was a conference going on. When you came out of the elevator into the lobby you can smell urine. The bed are too small "double beds", you want queen beds you have to pay an additional $30.
review.positiveRemarks: Conveniently located near Union Square shopping area.
review.negativeRemarks: If you are staying at their hotel, parking and internet should be free as a courtesy. Standard beds should be queen and not full size.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located near Union Square shopping area.

review.title: to expensive
review.reviewText: room was very small. comfortable but too cramp for type of hotel. so call 5 star facility.bathroom was very small and cramp.
review.negativeRemarks: make the bathroom bigger.also most 5 star hotels do not charge for wifi but this hotel does. not good!!!

review.reviewText: Great rooms very comfortable and clean.  Amenities were as expected.
Had a one day visit in San Fransisco, stayed at the Hilton. Hotel was beautiful inside and out. Location was convienent and service was great.

review.title: Eh
review.reviewText:
The fridge in the room kept making loud humming sounds, plus the noise the AC made when it kicked on kept me up all night.  Walls are paper thin.  I could hear a gentlemen in the adjoining room, cough and clear his throat.  That's pretty dang thin!  

Terrible room.  Shower was disgusting.  I booked a king bed but was given a queen size.  

Based on my room condition, this was not a 4 star hotel.  I certainly paid a 4-star rate but didn't receive the same value in return.  Just because it's big and near downtown, doesn't make it a 4 star.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing.  The hotel appeared nice but my room was horrible.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't put anyone in that room.

review.title: Good comfortable hotel.
review.reviewText: The hotel is a couple blocks away from Union Square; so that's a very convenient location.  But it does border the Tenderloin district.  So make sure to not go that direction towards Civic center, or if you have to, walk with companions and stick with the big streets.  The room is clean, comfortable, and does not feel outdated.  The outdoor pool and gym are good size.  We didn't use other facilities in the hotel but in general it seems like a big hotel that has good standards.
Great location with late night check in and noon check out times!
review.positiveRemarks: Walking distance to MUNI system, easily accessible

review.title: Centric
review.reviewText: The Hotel is just plain and lacks a good restaurant. On the other hand, it is very centric, walking distance to everything. Very clean, small rooms with great view.
Overall a great hotel service was great. It's located close to public transportation which makes commuting easy.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: It was a great experience. Nice hotel. Although they never answered when I called multiple times for room service.

review.title: Close to the mall
review.reviewText:
Very friendly staff. The gift shop is way overpriced and so is the snack bar area. $4/$6 for a bottle of water. 

Great view!

review.title: Nice hotel. close to unión square
review.reviewText: Perfect hotel. I attend a simposio And All esa perfect
The location is strategic. It is closed to the shopping centers and restaurants. Excellent service and friendly staff.

review.title: Disappointing experience for a 4 star hotel
review.reviewText: Crowded and noisy lobby. Long wait for check in.  Twenty customers - two clerks.  Small room. Charges for everything- parking $47, internet $13. Long wait for elevators. My rating - 2.5 - 3.0
Small rooms, smaller bathroom!! Views are bad. Old carpet in hallways. Food/snacks are crazy over priced!!

review.title: Not quite 4 star
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located but service was bad. Check-in was so-so and no help rendered for our car and luggage. The bellman at the door helped everyone else but us with the luggages. Instead of helping he actually told us to move our car away while we were unloading our baggages. This is pretty unacceptable. Room was not fully made up too despite request. Concierge service was good though.

review.title: Beautiful room and excellent staff.
review.reviewText: Really great,  except no restaurant and the lobby is a giant,  loud open bar. The rooms and staff are excellent.

review.title: Pleasant stay as usual.
review.reviewText: I've stayed at this same hotel many times and love it as always. close to market street and all the attractions downtown has to offer.

review.title: Nice hotel - close to everything - easy access
review.reviewText: Close to Bart station - easy connection to airport

Hotel was nice but our room needed a little updating. Restaurant was good but expensive.  We stayed on the 8th floor and the street noise was incredibly loud, car honks and emergency vehicles. There are a lot of homeless people in area. Upon arrival there was a woman urinating on the side walk next to the hotel. If you walk in the wrong direction you end up in a very shady area of town. I've been to S.F. many times and this was not the best trip.

review.title: In the middle of everything!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, can feel a little crowded at times but there was a conference going on. Room was quiet and very nice. Only thing I would ask is better pillows. Other than that, was great.

Was ripped off at the restaurant and was told by the manager how do I figure I was overcharged. I personally think it was scam that the cashier was running. She told me my total was $41, handed her my debit card, the register flickers, and next thing I was charged $56. You confront and she acts like seeing doesn't know what your talking about. I waited 3 hours to be checked into my room. Initially was told that there were no rooms available at the moment and they would text me. I sat in the lobby for 3 hours and finally just went back to the front desk and they checked me in no problem. When I asked them why didn't they text me, the said the people in t back are too busy.

review.title: Nice hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: I had a room upgrade, the staff member offered it to me for a nice price.  The view was excellent.

review.title: Outdated & expensive
review.reviewText: One of the worst experiences I've had in a hotel recently. The prices were out of this world > $550 per night for a terrible outdated room with a queen bed. Make sure to get a renovated room, which they didn't have available.
review.negativeRemarks: Terrible decor.

review.title: Nice hotel in common areas
review.reviewText: Would have expected a bit nicer room and bed being a HILTON?

review.title: They assigned another guest checking in our room
review.reviewText: Worst Hotel Ever! They gave other people our room within an hour of us checking in. Hotel staff were rude and unapologetic they locked us out of our room 3 times after that. No restaurant so room service is  just a weird airport like deli bar they bring up. The staff has zero information they don't even know the number to the front desk and that is at conceriege he actually said "I don't know the number I just dial extension 6201" I stayed at the same hotel 10 years ago and it was amazing so it was very disappointing this time to say the least !

Rooms were just "ok". Staff was pleasant and helpful. Do not recommend eating at the Breakfast buffet. Overpriced for mediocre/cold food. We spent $80 on breakfast for my husband and I and the food was horrible. Not worth a second trip back to the buffet.

review.title: Nice downtown San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was nice. The room was extra roomy and cozy. We loved it. Parking was expensive but there is a parking garage right across the street thats a little cheaper.
The cabinet door wouldn't shut completely, closet door had deep scratches in it, and the room was small for the amount paid per night.
review.positiveRemarks: We were honors members and received complimentary wi fi, close ice machine, and water bottle dispensaries.
review.negativeRemarks: It should have better maintenance on furniture.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was close to a bart station and bus stops.

review.title: Nice hotel with clean, spacious room
review.reviewText: hilton sanfrancisco is a nice hotel with clean room and it is very close to main shopping area. It is only few minutes away by walk. Furnitures looked a bit old but it was very clean.
It was relaxing and amazing. I would definitely come back again!

review.title: Reasonable Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a happening area with plenty to do. Was taken aback by the rampant vagrancy, general cleanliness of the street and the out in the open drug use. Not the fault of the hotel by any means but a consideration. Had my familywiht me so it was an issue. Would stay here again if on business and needed a reasonably priced brand hotel. Staff was good though I did have an issue with the breakfast vouchers. They do not work in the restaurant as promised. Easily the most expensive breakfast I have ever had. $130 for 3. Ridiculous even by hotel breakfast standards. Good gym and adequate pool.
review.positiveRemarks: Good gym. Easy access to other desirable areas of San Fran.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need to be updated. They are "clean" but its been a while.
review.locationRemarks: Lots happening but issues as noted above. Not the fault of the hotel but needs to be considered.

review.reviewText: Hotel is OK for business but room rate expensive. On-site eating is expensive.
Good location but quite old hotel. There is no vent in the bathroom. The old air conditioner is working fine b

review.title: Very comfortable and quietly  excellent location.
review.reviewText: Love this hotel experience  was nice. We went for valentine  cruiser and we really enjoy the weekend everything was close and walk we really love it san francisco streets

review.title: Hotel union square
review.reviewText: It was a nice stay with a nice view friendly staff nice location
Downtown. Nice facilities. Would have been nice to know that the pool was closed for the season. I was given a free room upgrade upon check in. A king size bed for the price of a queen.
Rooms are small no bar on the 46th floor like it said on the website

Room was recently remodeled and quiet. Bed was comfortable.
The only thing I thing I didn't like was that I found a used soap left in the shower.

review.title: City view
review.reviewText: Big hotel; small ample rooms.  workout facility is pretty big, but equipment could use some upgrading.  found the bed to be uncomfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds.  Restaurant/Deli in the lobby should open earlier and stay open later.

review.reviewText: I was so pleased with our experience. My son was going to UCSF for a procedure so we got a room so we wouldnt have to drive in the morning, we did not realize at the time of booking that it was Superbowl Weekend. Even though the hotel was EXTREMELY busy the staff gave us a late check out so that my son could rest after his procedure. it was greatly appreciated and we will definitely be staying at the Hilton next time.

review.title: Easy walk to union square.
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Check in was a breeze. Loved the room, loved the location. Staff was very eager to help with any questions. Will be staying here again.

review.title: good central location
review.reviewText:
hotel in a good central location, 5 min walk from Powell street bart station.

Well appointed room with very comfortable beds.

hotel was hosting some Super Bowl events which meant we could not use the 46th floor bar. This upset us as was one of the things we had been looking forward to.
review.locationRemarks: centrally located in union Square. In the heart of the shopping district. close to cable car lines taking you to the bay front.

review.title: All around excellent Hilton experience
review.reviewText: check in was terrific.  the front desk rep was friendly and quick in checking me in.  the room was perfect for me.  it was clean, quiet, easy to get in and out of hotel considering it is a big hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: the location was perfect and good amenities
review.negativeRemarks: bottled water and free wi-fi in room for all guests would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: close to union square, shopping, nightlife, restaurants and transportation.

review.reviewText:
Room was very old and outdated.
Location of hotel was great!!

review.title: Old and tired
review.reviewText: The room was terrible.  No style or decor.  Totally down market.  At 2:30am they started drilling into the walls above us and the hotel staff seemed surprised we were bothered by it.  They made the workers stop but it resumed again at 6am.  I will never stay here ever again. They should have comped our room but I didn't have time to haggle with them.

review.title: Good location, the vibe wasn't good.
review.reviewText:
Got there 11:30 AM they did NOT let us check in but if I upgrade for $100 more they would let me check on at 11:30. NOT good at all. I had to wait till 3:00 PM. The room was almost OK. Never mentioned the city fee of $32.50 daily and another added fee of $9.00 I think this charges should be up front before reservation. Coffee shop was ok but way over priced, $3.00 for can of Coke, $6.00 for bottle of water, $16.00 for slice of Pizza so on....
I had got lot more in Marriott Hotel only two block away. for less expense. Over all did not like it at all. NOT going back.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hilton Union Square is a great location - close to all the shops and trolley car and union square.  Nightly rate was excellent and they have a coffee shop downstairs for take away drinks and food which is very handy for the family.
review.positiveRemarks:
Location - fabulous
Nightly rate was great
Great bar area
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom needed lots of little fixes.
review.locationRemarks: great location.  Walk to shops, union square, trolley car.  Take the trolley or taxi to Fisherman's wharf.  Lots of restaurants and rental car place

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText:
Stayed for 2 nights, good service, too crowded.
Good thing we stayed for only 3 days.
Expensive parking rate

review.title: Excellent hotel in central location.
review.reviewText: We had a very positive experience at this hotel which we had selected due to its quality and location at Union Square. It did live up to expectations and we would have no hesitation in staying there again, although we would look at an alternative to paying the high cost of parking at the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The quality of the rooms and bedding, including the choice of pillows. The location was great.
review.negativeRemarks: We were disappointed that despite making our booking in February that we did not have rooms next to each other, as requested at the time of booking.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, shopping, restaurants, cable car.

review.title: Pretty Basic
review.reviewText: This place is huge. I mean like 'where the hell are we now' huge. The rooms are fine...clean and normal, professional staff. The view from the restaurant at the top is pretty awesome.

review.title: A little over priced ,early check In extra US25+
review.reviewText: Comfortable beds but the room was a little tight,quite noisy due to plumbing and noisy neighboring rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Lifts should include card access only.
review.locationRemarks: Close to all amenities

review.title: It was not comfortable
review.reviewText: The first room was very old and the bathroom was not working correctly after changing the room was small and shared four people  with two full beds
review.locationRemarks: ok

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, staff accordenly, confort as expected

review.title: Very good hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
Very good hotel close to Union Square & very safe with doorman on each entrance & exit
The location is close to cable cars & buses to get you around the city
It's used as pick off & drop off points for Big Bus Tours & a Yosemite Tour we took
The rooms were very clean & staff were very helpful & polite they helped us change travellers cheques & confirmed trips we had booked.
The doorman at the Mason Street entrance (I think he was called Ulisses) helped us phone & track our Super Shuttle which was super late - without his help we would of been lost on how to contact our late Shuttle & reduced a lot of stress.
There were works happening whilst we were there to update or move the front desk, but it didn't disrupt any of the services or enjoyment of the hotel - it was handled very professionally
Will use again
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room, helpful staff, great location, felt very safe
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great location, Union Square is on its door step with great shopping, restaurants & takeaways. Plenty of things to do :)

review.title: Location, 3 stars hotel
review.reviewText: Good Location but Noisy Hotel , Under construction, Busy Lobby with only two restaurants. Upon request they change my room ( flood tub, water on windows, smoker room )  to a remodeled one but still not too much of a difference Tiny room.. 3 Star Hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Unión Square
review.reviewText:
The hotel's location is very good, you can walk to the city of China, the Westfield Shopping Mall, Union Square, in less than 10 minutes, even to Embarcadero or Fisherman's Wharf if you like walking for 20 or 30 minutes . There are many shops , restaurants and tourist buses also available nearby.
The rooms are spacious and clean , no complaints , everything worked as it should
review.locationRemarks: Many restaurants, dinners, stores, mall at walking distance

review.title: Never again
review.reviewText:
Have stayed here every year for NYE for the last 5 years and this year was by far the worst.  First room was in Tower 3, avoid this tower no matter what.  Tiny rooms and drafty hallways.  Changed rooms and even paid for an upgrade and was moved to a room that was located poolside, with the jacuzzi right outside our only window.  Plus, the room had a giant beam right in the middle of it.  Awful.  
In addition to the room issues, the lobby was under construction which was a bit cumbersome.  During this time it meant no room service would be available and they kicked out Starbucks which used to be in the lobby in favor of their own coffee shop/grab-n-go snack shop.  Looked great and offered some decent snacks and drinks.  However, we were charged different prices daily.  One day 2 cookies were $4, the next they wanted to charge us $8!!!  When we questioned it, the staff was adamant and argumentative.  On another receipt we noticed we were charged $6 for 2 cans of soda when they were priced at $2 each (which was already high).
All totaled I would give the stay 2.5 or maybe 3 stars.  We've already decided to give up our yearly tradition and stay somewhere else.  It's a great location, but there are plenty of accommodation options in the area.

review.title: Good central location
review.reviewText:
Located close to Union Square the hotel is central for the major shops and the transport links including the iconic cable cars. Probably for this reason the area is very busy and crowded both day and night. It is wise to pre-book restaurants to avoid a long wait for a table to become free.

The hotel's lobby area is manic, everyone rushing to be somewhere else or standing in large groups obstructing those rushing to be somewhere else!

Check in was exceedingly slow.

The staff at the concierge desk was extremely helpful as was the staff at the Tower Tours desk situated nearby who arrange for guests to be collected from and returned to the hotel on each tour.

The major car hire companies are almost immediately over the road from the hotel which was very convenient for picking up the hire car after checking out from the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: There were no dining facilities apart from a few tables beside counters serving snacks and coffees. A decent restaurant is essential.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shops and major stores. Easy access to the public transport system and the many, but very busy, restaurants.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Good experience for the price, room and bathroom is a bit tight in space.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom sink is above normal height, faucets hard to close so can drip if not pushed hard to shut off
review.locationRemarks: convenient location to everything

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: The Hotel has a perfect location just blocks away from great shopping in the city center.

review.title: Hilton Hotel at Union Square, San Francisco
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay at this Hilton property. The staff was very helpful, very clean rooms and a perfect location for my visit. The one down-size, the hotel does not have a full service restaurant after the breakfast meal. I had to seek outside venues for dinner meals, even when I preferred staying in. Otherwise, the facility gains my vote. I would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The location to all of the sites I was interested. The tour office was very helpful. Glide Church is right across the street from the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The addition of a full-service restaurant would help to improve the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Very good location. the Powell Street Car line was just a few blocks away Union Square just blocks away and China Town within walking distance.

review.title: Nice hotel in downtown area
review.reviewText: Excellent costumer service. Very good for families with children.

review.title: Union Square Best Hotel
review.reviewText:
Great location , valet parking
Good restaurant and a great room , 
What more can you ask for ?

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was well located in union square, good service and very clean

review.title: Great location. Horrible attitude from staff.
review.reviewText: Stayed during Christmas at checkin the lady offered an upgrade including room with a view, Internet and continental breakfast ( please don't take it ) with a daily charge of $20.At checkout the statement showed $30. Tried to talk about it. Super rude. Please check before you sign anything. Read everything.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Was only a one night stay but found the hotel to be very handy for getting about city centre. Had some great shopping as well as plenty of food and drink options nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: Only slight disappointment was a lack of affordable options for breakfast in the hotel. Choice was fairly limited and expensive.

review.title: worst parking and security experience
review.reviewText:
The overall experience was good. Great hotel with great room service but have the worst experience while valet parking. 
It is 31st night bad traffic in the downtown. It took me 1 hr to reach the valet parking. 
Even though I have a valet spot, the security didn't allowed me in for half hr. Even though the valet manager was ready to help the security officer was abusive and was not listening. Completely spoiled our mood for the 31st. 
Not worth of a 60$/ day valet parking.

review.title: Great Location!!!!
review.reviewText: This is our second time at this hotel. We found the service and facilities to be just average.  One of those hotels where you just are in and out...great location though!!!

review.title: Great central location close to Union Square
review.reviewText: We arrived Xmas Day and that may explain the massive wait to check in.  Other than that wait, our four night stay was wonderful and was without incident (other than a broken hairdryer - which was replaced by room service with 15-20 minutes).  Loved the location - close to numerous restaurants, shopping and the cable car system.  Never took advantage of the hotel's dining as for breakfast you had the option of the Herb N' Kitchen (cafateria style) or a too expensive buffet.  Not sure if I'll be back as there are a numerous other hotel options in the Union Square area.  Chose the Hilton this visit as was best price compared to other in the area.

review.title: Below average
review.reviewText: Upon check in,front desk staff said they were out of room with 2 beds,we had 4 people.They checked for close to 30 mins,finally they found a room with 2 small double beds,cleaning Ness was average.

review.title: Central
review.reviewText: All good once we found the hotel as the traffic was manic with boxing day sales.

review.title: Hotel room
review.reviewText: I enjoyed it, it was fun, the bathroom door was weird, but enjoyable.  The staff was friendly, and the location was awesome. The check-in was great, and there were no issues.  The check-out was awesome as well, no problems.  Also, the cleaning staff was great and made sure that all of the room was clean.  We were able to gain access to the city's major attractions through the transit system.  Also, I would definitely recommend this hotel to other visitors.  Additionally, I would stay at this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: The location to the city's attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: I can't say, I just didn't like how the bathroom door locked.
review.locationRemarks: It is in a great location for access to the city's attractions.

review.title: Good hotel and nice location for shopping
review.reviewText: The room is clean & spacious. Only I didn't like was room service was till 10 pm. it's a hilton hotel you must provide 24 hours room service. After 10 pm I asked for a wine opener the guest service person told me I had to wait for 1.5 hours which was crazy & guess what after the wait they didn't even bother sending the wine opener. Basically room service is bad.  Rest everything is good in the hotel.

review.title: Very good location and very kind staff.
review.reviewText: Very good location and very good staff and good room service. Hotel size is very big, so I could not know everything, but overall very good hotel.

review.title: Outdated noisy rooms
review.reviewText: Stayed at tower 3. Very outdated building dirty hallways and small rooms. Definitely not a 4 star hotel more loook like a dirty inn.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great customer service very happy rooms are great and clean.,,hotel staff very friendly.

The hotel is centrally located, so that I could walk around the city easily. The staff was friendly and helpful. The one minor complaint I have are the long lines for the coffee every morning in the cafe in the lobby. But otherwise loved my stay and would recommend the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: I walked to China town, the embarkment and little Italy and the shopping area. It was all very close.

review.title: Very well located
review.reviewText:
We stay a full week visiting San Fco nice stay great Expedia package 
Think twice about renting a car the parking can be very expensive all around S Fco

review.title: Nice hotel close to downtown attractions
review.reviewText: Easy distance to downtown attractions and with easy access to public transportation to reach other tourist sites. Very comfortable stay.

review.title: Convenient, nice, but one staff member has issues.
review.reviewText:
I've stayed at this hotel before and have had no problems. It's convenient, but just don't go walk to your left when exiting the front entrance (especially at night). You'll walk into an area known as the Tenderloin, and it's not known for its steak dinners. Walk to your right (Union Square). It's a nice area and safe. 

Now the bad:

When I checked in, the front desk clerk asked if I would like a room upgrade for $40 a night. I said no thank you, finished things up, and went to my room. 

The morning I left, they slid my statement under the room door. I noticed a $40 extra charge for the room for each night, plus taxes. About $139. I called the front desk, and mentioned to the woman who answered that I did not request an upgraded room.  I couldn't even tell this was an upgraded room. She gave me an attitude, and inferred I was lying. After a few minutes of this, she said she'll check my paperwork, and what I signed. She then comes back on the phone and realizes I didn't sign or agree to an upgraded room. No apology, but she says she'll remove the charge.

The whole experience on the phone was unpleasant. The way things should be run, is they should say, "we're sorry, we'll look into it and take care of it." Instead I was treated like someone trying to scam the hotel. They made a mistake. Mistakes happen. Just correct it. Instead I get an attitude from the front desk and then feel like I'm getting blamed for their mistake.  I end up not feeling welcomed as a guest.
review.negativeRemarks: Read about my experience above.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square down the street.  For tourists, also walk down Market Street down to the Ferry Building for your initial feel of San Francisco.

review.title: Perfect for Union Square and Westfield Mall!
review.reviewText: We wanted to spend a couple of nights near Union Square to soak in some city Christmas spirit and this was the perfect spot! Two blocks from great shopping, great restaurants all around and several Muni transport options nearby.  Generic city Hilton that seems to have been recently remodeled.  Everything (public spaces and room) was clean and in excellent condition.  I love the room amenities and the room was clean and comfortable.  The room decor was pleasing as well.  Hotel amenities (gym, wifi stations, restaurants) were nice too.  The parking was really great, you could almost park outside your room!  Now for the less than perfect part... Check-in was a disaster.  It took over 40 minutes from getting into the line (1:32 pm) to getting our room key (2:22 pm) !  Our FD agent (who was very welcoming and apologetic) said they were upgrading their room key programming system.  I work at a luxury resort and would suggest that 1. System upgrades take place in the middle of the night, not at prime check-in time; 2. All terminals and all agents be working at the desk to expedite guest check-in; 3. Managers be communicating to guests waiting in line rather than hovering in groups behind the desk looking busy with something other than customer service.  It was the worst hotel check- in we have ever experienced, and we travel a lot.
review.positiveRemarks: Just about everything, especially location, comfort, cleanliness and amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: Check-in process.  A guest in line with us said he had read reviews that check-in was poor at this hotel. Improve from feedback!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Westfield Mall, all forms of Muni transit, lots of restaurants. A really convenient location.

review.title: Nice & close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: This was the perfect hotel to shop & enjoy food along with the Christmas experience!

review.title: Central Location San Francisco
review.reviewText: Central location. Spacious room Courteous and helpful staff.  Street noise and heating system noise.  Slow checkin
review.negativeRemarks: There was considerable noise from the street, and the air conditioning system was quite noisy.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to shopping.

review.title: Great staff, very clean, close to shopping!
review.reviewText: Within walking to great shopping.  Hotel staff very accommodating. Rooms are very comfortable, super housekeeping.  Front desk staff very kind and helpful.

review.title: Union square Hilton
review.reviewText: We came to help my boyfriend's boss' son move and with it being 4 stars I was expecting  a lot more. There were old, visible stains on the carpet by the main door, nicks on the bathroom door some yellow spots on the bathroom wall. A bottle and condoms sat in the hallway in front of a door for two days from a few rooms down. No mini fridge in the room so food had to be thrown away. Bathroom doors should have locks. However, staff was extremely friendly and accomidating.

review.title: Worst part of our trip
review.reviewText:
Let me start by saying that I'm not crazy or even remotely difficult to please...

Here's a list of our experiences and I'll try to leave my impressions to the end:
-Hotel check-in took an hour.  25 minutes of which we stood at the counter while the font desk clerk looked up thing without saying anything to us.
-We booked a junior suite with two queen beds.  We received a strange corner room with three double beds.  I'm 6'3".  Double beds are not comfortable and it sure seems like the extra looking by the front desk clerk was due to them giving our room away.
-Wallpaper was peeling off of in multiple areas of the room.  The bathroom faucet handle was crooked with very little water pressure.  I clearly indicated we were a family of four - received three towels both nights.
-When checking out, the Hilton system went down and they couldn't tell me what room charges they were accrediting to us.  Instead, it was expected that I would simply trust that it would be handled correctly.

The hotel was poor in quality, couldn't care less if we stayed there - in fact, we felt more like a bother, you can't count on receiving the room you book, and we're now done staying at Hilton hotels.  The location is pretty good though.  So, if they changed everything about the hotel except the location, it would be pretty good.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything else
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square, Metreon, museums, cable car turnaround, etc.

review.reviewText:
housekeeping needs a lot of improvement 

Had a creaky toilet door/ narrow path to walk in room as desk console was pushed away from wall and eats into walking space in room/ poor water pressure during shower as half of water goes down into bath tub ( yet there are campaign posters to save water everywhere in hotel) so we end up taking longer to shower/ room was not made up first day/ necessities not replaced some days/ we hang our bath towels but we get supplied new ones each day so we had 6 unused bath towels stacked up by time we leave, yet there was a drive to save the planet

Complaints are tended to quickly though and that's good

review.title: Crowded and over priced
review.reviewText: When you need a hotel room in the city during the holidays, I guess you will always get overpriced. But regardless of that, this hotel does not deserve 4 stars. Long wait at front desk to check in, upon check in, staffer tried to upgrade us to nicer room for an additional $100. After waiting for so long to actually check in, this felt rude and very inappropriate. Room was awkward, only the bare minimum toiletries. Nothing 4 star about it.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Great!  Very nice staff. Wonderful hotel and close to everything. Very quiet as well other than the usual downtown noises

review.title: Nice Location
review.reviewText:
You can hear everything from your room. Courtains were dirty, filters very dusty, closet door loose.
Location is great and staff friendly.

review.title: Nice hotel but not worth the money and hassle
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice and right in the middle of downtown which I guess not surprisingly they charge over $50 for parking each night. Even though there were public parking close by but still expensive. So I think if not for specific reasons that you have to stay in downtown, which is always crowded and nowhere to find parking, it just not worth the additional money to stay here.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice clean room and staffs were nice. Convenience to the downtown area.
review.negativeRemarks: parking too expensive
review.locationRemarks: downtown SF, union square, lots of shopping and stores

review.title: Not what you'd expect from Hilton
review.reviewText:
Hotel needs some serious updating and rennovations. 
1. Had to ask for robes and towels
2. Hearing every single detail of the couple having sex in the room next to us was interesting
3. Being below the hotel laundry room made it impossible to sleep
4. Water offered to guest in the conference room smelled and tasted moldy
5. Room Service only offered in the morning and evening
6. No lounge 
7. Street noise from pedestrians was heard until after 4a.m.
review.negativeRemarks: I'd like a refund

review.title: Would stay again. Really enjoyed the Hilton.
review.reviewText: Was in town before a cruise for the holidays. Great Staff, great location, would stay again
it is an excellent hotel, would recommend and stay again. the only thing is the bath room was awkward, entering and exit directly in room at foot of bed.

review.title: Super friendly staff and spacious rooms!
review.reviewText: Everyone at the Hilton was extremely friendly especially the bell boy staff and guest services! The rooms were really nice and spacious. I cannot wait to stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location with walking distance to all of the downtown shopping.

review.reviewText: Wonderful time. Nice getaway weekend. Visited Union Square and all the xmas decorations. Beautiful. ..

review.title: Didn't like the service
review.reviewText:
The overall stay was not great for me even though the facilities are 4-star quality. There was just a number of smaller things that added up annoying me over my stay. 
There was ...
... no hairdryer and I waited longer with wet hair for one while I needed to leave 
...the safe was closed and when I asked them to open it, I first got tooth paste offered instead, then waited >20 min for security before I needed to leave. It got never opened during my stay
...towels were changed everyday also they were orderly put on the rack as asked for by the hotel
...When I gave back my key card,  the man at the front desk gave me very honestly 20 us back which I accidentally gave him with the key cards. However, then he explained to me in detail that he could have easily kept it and just gives it back because I am a student. I am not a student but a doctor and I think basic honesty should be normal and nothing you rub in someone's face
...I asked whether they have safes at the luggage room so that I can leave my laptop until the evening after checking out for the day. The front desk said yes. The men at the luggage room said no and then one treated my as if that is a ridiculous thought and asked multiple times whether  I don't trust him. So he made a big issue out of it, even though it's not personal but a professional issue for me. So I ended up feeling horribly treated and this person not trustworthy to be responsibly guarding my valuables.

review.title: Great location to shopping and restaurants.
review.reviewText: The hotel is an excellent facility with all of the amenities you would expect from one of the nices Hilton properties.  The location is close to numerous restaurants and Union Square shopping.  The cable car location is just a few blocks away so no need for a car if you want to venture over to Fishermen's Warf.

review.title: Disappointing from the start
