review.reviewText: Checked in to 2 rooms with lots of luggage and had to drive own car to parking lot around the block from hotel.  Valet not available at front of hotel - only after driving car around block to parking garage ourselves.  Hotel charges for internet when most hotels include this feature at no charge.  Hotel room had old and outdated furniture and décor.  Wallpaper peeling off on all 4 walls with nobs missing from furniture and chair worn so much that you sunk to the bottom.  Could hear everyone who went down the hall.  Extremely disappointing for a Hilton hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location near shopping and some restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet service should be available at the front door.  Guest should not have to drive car around block.  Internet should be included.  Update rooms.

review.title: Nice location near union square
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very nice and accommodating. - We purchased one night through Expedia which included parking, but we thought it was for valet. It was no trouble and they didn't sweat us or charge us extra.  We also had a really nice drink at sunset at Cityscape restaurant where our waiter took some nice pictures of us overlooking the fantastic view. The only problem we had was with our room. We were in tower 3 on the 10th floor, which is near a corner of the building. I don't know why, but the hallway outside our room was *freezing* which caused us to crank up the heat in the room. Because the heat was on all night, we felt pretty dehydrated and dried out the next morning. Also, the hot water didn't work well in the shower, and the sink faucet was very wobbly and felt like it was going to come right out of the sink itself. All in all, the hotel is nicely located, and a good value, but they could fine tune a few details.
Very accessible to anywhere but parking fee too pricey

review.title: Hilton let us down!
review.reviewText: I realize that we are in the city, and hotel rooms tend to be smaller, however this room was TINY, beds were saggy. house cleaning didn't even come to clean the room.  We had to call for additional towels every day, (we booked for four people yet they constantly only delivered three)  Staff was less then friendly, there was no ability to rent movies in the rooms,  the web site stated that there was breakfast in the on site cafe - however, the only breakfast available was a $38 brunch. Our room had a very tiny window in the corner, so it felt like we were staying in a box.  No full length mirror in room.  I could go on but instead, I suggest you keep looking before you book this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The bar on the top floor was very nice and provided entrainment - as in a woman getting tackled to the ground by two security officers and hauled out
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING  - beds, housekeeping, staff, in room entertainment
review.locationRemarks: shopping close by, plenty of places to eat which you will need because you won't want to pay $38 per person for breakfast.

review.title: Beautiful hotel very close to union square
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very clean and beautiful and the ambiance is very relaxing.  Check in was very quick. It is located at walking distance from Union square and Westfield mall which is very convenient for shopping. 
On the whole an amazing place to stay.
It is tidy and convenient. It is close to the downtown and famous destinations.

review.title: Not what I expected in a Hilton property
review.reviewText: In the heart of SF, this hotel did not have the typical amenities that you see in any standard hotel.  The room was very noise and not accommodating.  Very disappointed.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise, On demand movies, room access, cost of parking.
review.locationRemarks: close to Union Square

review.title: Convenient.
review.reviewText: Check in was a challenge. Staff was curt, almost to the point of rudeness

review.title: Small beds...
review.reviewText: For almost $400 a night--- OK. Queen beds were really tiny...seemed more like large single beds to me..

review.title: So outdated - yuck.
review.reviewText: This hotel has renovated some floors - but certainly not all. Our room as yuck. Outdated and just felt grimy. A huge disappointment for a HILTON.
review.negativeRemarks: Every room should be remodeled. Also - the lobby was an eye sore. Out of date and looked like it was under construction but not sure if it REALLY was.

review.title: Hotel restaurants mediocre
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was all right.  It was a little noisy on the weekend because of football game guests.  The real downside was the food in the hotel which was buffet.  At best, the food was mediocre, especially in the evening.  The neighborhood has deteriorated since I was in San Francisco last ( probably 20 years ago).
review.negativeRemarks: The buffet meals.

review.title: Disappointed....
review.reviewText:
I figured after reading all the great reviews and the fact this was a Hilton this would be a great place to stay. Not the case! The room was tiny and the bathroom was even smaller....the vanity was on top of the toilet. Dust bunnies throughout the room and dirt in the corners. The drinking glasses were dirty. The pool was closed for maintenance which was happening right outside my window. 

The location of the hotel was not safe. Again the reviews made it seem like it was....coming from AK it was not safe at all and I had to walk over sleeping bodies in the street the first night just to get back to our hotel from dinner.
review.positiveRemarks: the staff was very kind and friendly even when I complained about the room. The hotel was booked so I could not be moved.
review.negativeRemarks: I think I mentioned all the bad in my experience, you could improve it all.
review.locationRemarks: the location was not safe. Homeless sleeping on the street right next to the hotel and very sketchy people walking around the hotel as well.

review.title: Knees in the sink.
review.reviewText: This room was very carefully engineered to use every conceivable inch of space.  The bathroom is adequate but very small; reminded me of the time years ago when a colleague noted that he could sit on the John and brush his teeth at the same time.  Clean and efficient is how I would describe it, and if that gets me a lower price and the Hotel profits...so be it.
review.locationRemarks: It is in San Francisco.  What more could you want?

review.reviewText: Shady part of the city but well situated ... Hotel was under renos

review.title: Standard business hotel.
review.reviewText: Needs some color and designer personal touches to create a more interesting atmosphere.

There were problems with wifi not working in the rooms or conference areas.   There was remodeling going on so that affected the food/beverage choices available.  For the price of it, I expected better.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Hotel staffs were unfriendly. lack of customer service.

review.title: not great
review.reviewText: so the wifi did not work (even in the lobby), the pool was out of commission, and the hotel was undergoing construction. plus, the bathroom door for our room was not very secure, which isn't very fun when you're sharing a room.

review.title: ONE HOUR
review.reviewText: ONE HOUR IN CHECK IN LINE AT 11:00pm on a Sunday. Need I say more?
review.negativeRemarks: check in time

review.title: A corporate hotel not suitable for tourists
review.reviewText:
I stayed at this hotel with my son for 11 nights while on vacation in San Francisco. We choose this hotel because of a great deal from Expedia. It was a large hotel and we would ordinarily stay in a much smaller hotel.

Check-in was smooth and only took 10 minutes. The room was large and clean. We were on the 9th floor in Tower 2 overlooking O'Farrell Street and the car park opposite.

The hotel is currently undergoing renovations. Because of this and the large number of corporate guests, it was impossible to get a seat in the lobby before 9pm in order to access the free wi-fi. 

Because of the renovations, the bar was relocated to the restaurant on the 46th floor of Tower 1. The views of San Francisco from the bar are amazing. However, unless you are staying in Tower 1, the journey to the bar is not easy. We visited the bar on 6 occasions. The bar featured the strangest aspect of our stay. On all 6 occasions, we were served our beer in long, slim glasses. It became apparent by our 3rd visit that all of the corporate guests were being served beer in regular pint glasses. We came to the conclusion that the bar staff had implemented a coding system to distinguish between the corporate guests and the tourists. Why they would choose to do this is not clear.

Overall, the hotel was fine although it was large and difficult to navigate. The location was excellent. If you are a tourist, be prepared for a very crowded hotel full of conference guests.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was excellent. The view from the 46th floor bar was superb. The location was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Staffing levels at the check-in desk could be improved. We saw several large queues at various times during our stay. The cost of wi-fi is excessive.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Powell Street BART station, Union Square and Macys are all within roughly a 5 minute walk. Lots of decent restaurants and bars nearby.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Hotel was being upgraded when I stayed, it is a very busy large hotel and it does not seem to be able to cope with the large numbers of people checking in and out. I waited for over half an hour to check in and much the same to check out. Having said that the rooms were good and it is in a great location just off Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in and check out.
review.locationRemarks: Close to all the sights and shopping.

review.title: Very cheap hotel with lots of noise. small rooms
review.reviewText: the rooms and bathrooms were so small it was hard to  shower and move around.
review.negativeRemarks: bigger bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: shopping, restraunts were close

review.reviewText: Surrounding area a bit "dicey". Would not recommend walking at night.

the room was nice but since the facility is undergoing some renovations, it was miserably noisy in our room.  waking up to a jackhammer at 5am on a saturday is not enjoyable.  the walls were super thin...heard our neighbors next door, people calling down on the street for a taxi (Tower 1, 7th floor) sirens, car alarms going off in the parking structure directly across the street and about 8-10 people running down the halls at 3am.  wanted to enjoy this mini-vacay but unfortunatley the lack of sleep after a BUSY day was awful.

review.title: Spend the extra money elsewhere!
review.reviewText: Not worth the price. The room had a faint nicotine smell and stuffy. The Tower 2 elevator was out one night. Not what I expected from Hilton.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Room was very good; main issue was the impossible to operate water controls in the shower; for some reason we were given a room for someone in a wheelchair, which is fine, but the shower water mechanism required half an hour of fiddling around to get it to work. When you pay almost $500 per night this isn't good enough.

review.title: Hotel Under Renovations
review.reviewText: We stayed here two nights over the weekend following a conference. We were in a large room on the 12th floor. The hotel seems to be in a run down part of town near Union Square. At night while trying to sleep it was VERY noisy. You could hear firetrucks, drunk people on the street, etc. from outside, even though we were on the 12th floor?!? The room we were in was not yet renovated, even though we paid $250 US a night and expected it to be better. It had a musty smell, the carpets were old, the washroom very dated, and the pillows were not comfortable. Although the bed was clean, I would not return. The staff was pleasant and helpful, however for the price we paid I would have appreciated a better, quieter room.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need upgrading, and windows need replacing so that people can sleep at night. Full out conversations can be heard from people on the street.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square. Ideal for shopping, but area seems sketchy and unsafe at times.

review.title: Great location - an easy walk to Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, probably more a 3 or 3.5 star than a 4 star hotel

review.title: I've had better...
review.reviewText:
I booked my room on Expedia.  We arrived before the room was ready, and were told to come back after 3:00.  When we arrived later they did not have a room with two beds (irritating, because we tried to check in earlier).  They asked if a king bed and roll away bed would work.  Absolutely not.  They ended up upgrading us to a renovated room.  Kudos for doing the right thing.

The room was clean, but very small - with a tiny bathroom.  The window was also very small.  The beds were comfortable and clean.  However, we could not find an electrical outlet in the bathroom.  This made getting ready in the AM difficult.

Although the room was clean and the staff was nice, we felt very cramped.  I recommend spending a little extra for the Grand Hyatt.  If you're a Hilton loyalist, the Hilton in the financial district is more updated and spacious.
review.negativeRemarks: I realize that the building is old and that the space is what it is in terms of size.  However, an electrical outlet In the bathroom would be helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Tons of shopping and restaurants within walking distance.  Convenient rental car location across the street.

review.title: Very busy hotel
review.reviewText: The day we checked in, we stood in line over a 1/2 hour to get to the front desk!  I guess tour busses had just dropped off about 100+ people and it was mayhem.   The room and stay was nice, once we finally got checked in.  At checkout, the parking attendant knew nothing about the fact that my stay package through expedia included free parking, and tried to charge us $60 more to leave.  When I checked in I had asked the front desk to make sure that it was included and they had already told me it was.  So this was extremely annoying, especially after paying over $400 to stay one night.  The buffet on the 46th floor was really nice!
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to just about whatever you want to do.  We walked to the Orpheum to see Phantom, and it was less than a 10 minute walk.

review.title: Sept in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Other than conciege it was great. Conciege was totally useless!

review.title: Room was really small
review.reviewText:
The room was Newley update. Nice, but bathroom was really small. There was no water or snacks offered for the guests. The bar on the 42 floor had an amazing view and great cocktails.
I would not recommend staying at the hotel if you can afford something a little more.
review.negativeRemarks: Offer water in rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Lots to do you are in union square.

review.title: Close to Union Square & resturants, shopping etc.
review.reviewText: No water pressure in shower. Bathroom sink was awkwardly placed in vanity hard to maneuver next to toilet. Rooms were set up in long hall ways like a maze that went on forever, coming from parking garage back to lobby you get lost. Had to wait awhile for luggage to come to room, called to see where it was.
review.negativeRemarks: Having a sit down coffee cafe where you can eat a breakfast without the price of the upstairs resturant would be nice. Illy cafe was too small.
review.locationRemarks: Good location for shopping.

review.title: Perfect for stay for conference near Moscone.
review.reviewText: Lobby under construction which was bummer, but the room was comfortable and clean.  I was super impressed with the bar overlooking the city from the 43rd floor.
review.negativeRemarks: Finish construction :)
review.locationRemarks: Moscone, 1 mile to Ferry Building and Embarcadero, Union Square Shopping

review.reviewText: Clean room. Short walk to Union Square and shopping.

review.title: Hotel Staff was great,
review.reviewText: Staff excellent. My 2 Dashound Dogs Rocksey & Ginger Had more attention from Tourists & guest than a rock star. Staff was excellent. will stay again Rick & Mar
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrades from online booking to what you have to pay more for a basic view. This we did not like
review.locationRemarks: Was there for business

review.title: convenient location to transport and attractions
review.reviewText: I accidentally left my purse in the lobby and fortunately it was still there and security held it for me.  I do believe that because there is such good security out front keeping out the less desirable elements and the upscale clientele that it was safe.  I really appreciate how well everyone worked to help me through the panic.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in could be improved but I'm sure it is as you were remodeling

review.title: Nice location but terrible check-in
review.reviewText: check-in was long and staff (Juliet) who checked me in very unaccomodating and unhelpful. Reserved 3 rooms through Expedia under my account but she refused to give me the other two rooms I named for my sisters (they were in the car park waiting with kids). Then she assigned us to three different floors knowing that we have kids that play with each other. She just dismissed us even with us trying to ask more questions. Our complaints were only addressed when we talked to the manager (Yu) and complained about the whole process. Rooms were clean however and the location is superb.

review.title: Nice hotel in Union Square.
review.reviewText: The hotel was really nice.  Close to all the shops an restuarants.
Great staff, well maintained hotel and in a great location with easy walking to the Union Square are as well as the cable car boarding area for access to the Pier 39 area.

review.title: Bad very bad
review.reviewText: The room was not clean. Paid for 2 queen bed but got 2 full beds.

review.title: Central location, walking distance to everything
review.reviewText: Me and my friend booked a night here for our girls' night out/staycation and we couldn't have been happier. We were able to check in an hour earlier than check in, our room was clean & comfy, the hotel was very well kept and it felt modern & new.. It was also walking distance to everything we wanted.. Shopping, good food, bars & nightlife. On top of it all, the rate was super affordable! We will most definitely be staying here again! Thanks again Hilton Union Square!

The windows were so filthy, we could not even see out the windows.

We waited 20 minutes to get checked into the hotel.

The room had two doubles, was still over $300 and we had to pay an extra $58 for parking

review.title: Nice center location to town
review.reviewText: Our hotel was in a great location easy walking to the Embarcadero and amenities

review.title: Nice hotel, accommodating staff
review.reviewText: Very satisfied with my stay at the Hilton. The staff are very professional and accommodating. The rooms are clean. The location is convenient.

review.title: Downtown location
review.reviewText: It was really busy, a little too much going on to be relaxing and a little too big to get any personal service.  No big complaints but I would not rush back.  Staff seemed reluctant to give out wi-fi password, wanted us to pay extra which we didn't.
review.negativeRemarks: The lobby is mostly blocked off, very unappealing.  We assumed it was being renovated but unsure.

review.title: hotel in the downtown
review.reviewText: it is nice hotel in a nice location with nice employees.
review.positiveRemarks: we update to a city-view room, the room is big,and the view is impressed.
review.locationRemarks: there is a thai restaurant near hotel, the food and the price both good!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: It was a great hotel. The bar at the top of the hotel with the view of the skylight it amazing. Worth staying here

review.title: Good Hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Good hotel central position for sightseeing, tour bus stops next to hotel, cable car to Fishermans Wharf two blocks away. taxis available outside.  Walking distance to Giants AT & T ground.  Short taxi ride to Alcatraz Pier 33. Altogether an amazing experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel foyer is being renovated coffee shop had been moved
review.locationRemarks: Cable car two blocks, shopping centre Union Square two blocks along and two blocks up. Westfield shopping centre and food hall two blocks away

review.reviewText: The check-in process was quite long but everything else about this hotel was great. Great location and up to date rooms that are adequate size for SF.

review.title: Loud Party next to room all night
review.reviewText: I complained to hotel staff about a loud party next to my room that run until 4 am. They made only half hearted efforts to close it down. A nightmare stay

review.title: Excellent hotel but noisy.
review.reviewText: The hotel itself had only one problem to us. It was noisy. When lots of people gathered in the lobby or coffee area next to the lobby, they talked loud to talk over the reflected noise from the walls and floor and the noise was unbelievable. The room was excellent and the staff we worked with were super. So noise was our only problem.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was very nice. Probably the best we've had during the past few years.
review.negativeRemarks: Some way to abate the noisiness in the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great. The things we planned to do were close by to connect.

review.title: Great location but Lobby Bar & Restaurant closed!
review.reviewText:
Liked the location in Union Square.  We used the rental car location across the street to return the rent car we had picked up at the airport and used in Napa, so that was very convenient.  We walked or took taxis to various locations.  Hotel Staff was very helpful.

This is a large hotel and our room, located in Tower 3, was a long walk from the lobby.  No fridge in the room, but it did have a small coffee maker.  Room was very noisy.  We heard lots of sirens during the night and street noise during the day.  
 
The hotel was renovating the Lobby Bar and the Restaurant so both were closed during our stay in late August 2015.  The only bar available was the City Scape located on the 46th floor of Tower 1 which did not open until 5:30pm.  Beautiful view.  The only food available was a full buffet dinner.

review.title: Great location...worn out room
review.reviewText: the  location  is central  to  everything. the  room  was  old carpet  torn hallways tattered and  carper worn out. The  linens on  the bed were old the blanket was a dirty brown  color that  must have been 25 years old. I have stayed  at this hotel before and was  in  Tower 3 and the  rooms were updated. Do  not  stay in tower 1...for 425.00 a night I will not return
review.negativeRemarks: update rooms and common  areas

review.title: Nice hotel very close to everything
review.reviewText: We stayed this past weekend at the Hilton Union Square. It was pretty awesome! It was located within 2-3 blocks of all the tourist areas and very close to a trolley stop. The front desk staff and door staff were amazing and made getting help so easy. The only drawback is the room had poor ventilation in the bathroom, which left the room very steamy. But other than that we loved it and would stay here again!
Loved the location of the hotel it was in the center of everything and the staff was very helpful

review.title: Nice hotel, nice staff, nice rooms. No complaints.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed my stay here. Room was clean and spacey, temperature adjustments were quick and efficient. All I was looking for in a hotel. Would recommend!

Good location & price. Frindly staff.  Housekeeping was inconsistent. 
Bathroom doors did not close well & housekeeping staff walked in on us while in bathroom.

review.title: Convenient. Nice
review.reviewText: Relaxing, accommodating, good location, helpful staff

review.title: The good and bad
review.reviewText: This hotel is a bit overpriced and the rooms a bit tired.  The public areas, particularly the lobby are clean but you note a lot of breakdown in rooms and in public bathrooms.  The staff is helpful, and well trained.  They go out of their way to help.  The location is on the edge of the tenderloin but still okay and close to everything.  The parking is also overpriced there is a lot literally across the street for $31.50/day but the Hilton charges $60.00 a day.  The bedding etc. was clean and comfortable.  The doors have wear and tear on them as do walls and windows are filthy.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need to be updated before they get really bad, the entire facility inside could use a facelist (outside of the lobby).  Parking is overpriced.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square, AT&T Park and the Westfield Shopping Center.

review.reviewText: Good location, great gym and pool amenities. Comfortable beds and good sized rooms.

review.title: Everything we needed
review.reviewText:
For a big, busy, city hotel our experience couldn't be faulted. We had smooth and efficient support in everything from registration to the check-out process. We were given a twin room on the 19th floor of tower 3 which overlooked the open-air heated swimming pool on the 16th floor. The room was very well appointed, kept very clean throughout and the in-room coffee provided daily was excellent. I suspect we were lucky and may have been upgraded to the "HH Honours floor", as per the discrete sign in the lift lobby, but nothing was said during registration. We were also given free wifi for our stay, a small gesture but appreciated.

We chose to eat out rather than the hotel, so can't comment on the hotel restaurants. 

I would recommend the Hilton San Francisco Union Square
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel delivered all we wanted when we selected it.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is not actually on Union Square, but a block away. Try breakfast at the Pinecrest Diner (corner of Geary & Mission) on your way!

review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is great. Clean rooms. Old pipes in the bathroom make noise at night, but it wasn't too disturbing. All in all great hotel for a short visit to San Fran.

review.title: Hotel is close to the center of the city.
review.reviewText: Doormen never open the doors for the guests, very rude staff specifically a lady guard named "Moi", nobody helped us with our luggages, no free wifi connection for non-members of HHonors Hilton, guest must pay for fridge. Over rated hotel & expensive. Security is not very tight. Not recommendable.

They upgraded us supposedly for an extra $30 and the room was still tiny. Beds were uncomfortable, directions within the hotel, since hotel is enormous, were a pointing the opposite way of where the actual locations were located. House keeping just came in without knocking. Just awful.

review.title: Close to Union Square but too big
review.reviewText: Long line to check in; not enough places in hotel to dine or snack; packed with people but lacking pleasing atmosphere.  .  Elevators were temperamental.
review.positiveRemarks: room was spacious , clean and quiet

review.title: Not a great area
review.reviewText: Small hotel room with small double beds, not in a great area homeless begging outside and lots of smokers hanging around outside the entrance!?

review.title: Great hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Excellent location, outstanding staff, responsive to every question/issue in a very timely manner.
review.positiveRemarks: location, wifi setup, cleanness and friendliness
review.negativeRemarks: Should not have to pay for refrigerator in room - it is a basic service.
review.locationRemarks: close to shopping , theatre and transportation ease.

review.title: Great hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Outstanding facility and very responsive staff. Great location, close to BART and Market Street.

review.title: Good for sightseeing but lacked anything special
review.reviewText: By far the most expensive of all the hotels I used during a 3 week stay in the U.S. but overall experience did not match the cost. Check-in was in memorable, Wifi access is not provided for free, and the charge for an in-room fridge is excessive. The hotel itself was comfortable and in a good location for shopping, eating, and seeing all of the sights, and the kids really enjoyed using the pool. Would not recommend being out in late evening as local area full of beggars who were often quite hostile and intimidating.

review.title: Dirty Environment
review.reviewText: Almost cancelled but decided otherwise. Would never repeat.

review.title: awful hotel, good location
review.reviewText: hotel is in midst of construction/remodeling (this was not disclosed by expedia or hotel) and felt like residing in the basement of a convention center or airport...NO lobby area, restaurant basically inaccessible, confusing layout, sub-standard room, poor housekeeping service
review.negativeRemarks: housekeeping and room condition need improvements- wallpaper in my room was peeling, that should be repaired, bath sink was so small it rivaled the sm
review.locationRemarks: union square and theatres are close by

review.title: Nice hotel very close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Great hotel close to many attractions.  Two streets away from the cable cars and many buses.  Great shopping and multiple restaurants options.
review.negativeRemarks: Would have liked to have a fridge in the room without having to pay more.

review.title: Nice hotel in Union Square close to amenities
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nicely situated in Union Square near all amenities. Its a very busy area with lots of shopping and restaurants. Powell Street is only a couple of blocks away where you can pick up the Cable Car to the waterfront.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is clean and well kept with good size rooms. The restaurant has a beautiful view of the city.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel restaurant was too expensive despite the great view of the city
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is well located for shopping and restaurants. Cable cars close by for access to waterfront and Golden Gate easily accessible by car for Napa

review.reviewText: bathroom door lock was broken, beds and room were small and cramped
review.negativeRemarks: rooms too small, broken bathroom lock, maid came in room while we were alseep at 8 am

review.reviewText: No Wifi.  Half hour check in.  Dirty floors.  Way too dirty.  Right next to the seediest area in San Fran

review.title: Nice hotel.  Check in was horrendous due to lines
review.reviewText: The stay was fine.  Hotel staff pleasant and helpful.  Parking good and City scape view wonderful.
review.negativeRemarks: Temperature adjustment in room.  Hot and could not lower temperature below 70•
review.locationRemarks: We were there for funeral so centrally located.

review.title: Nice hotel close to public transportation
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, close to public transportation, near Union Square. A drop dead view of the Bay from the bar. Expensive food and drinks.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: This hotel is very large, but is missing lots of expected amenities.  The only restaurant is a buffet and the room service options are extremely limited, which is surprising for a hotel this size.  My room smelled like cigarette smoke, despite being a non-smoking hotel, when I checked in, but this was remedied to some extent by housekeeping coming back to spray a deodorizer around the room.  My room only had one bar of soap on the bathroom sink and no soap in the shower/tub.  The water in the shower and sink cut off every three minutes for a few seconds and would then come back on.  The cabinet where the mini-bar and refrigerator would normally be was locked closed. They also didn't bother to put in fresh rolls of toilet paper in the bathrooms when I checked in.  The only pool is outdoors and isn't heated, which is surprising given how large this hotel is and how frequently the temperature doesn't get near 80 degrees in this area.  The room was comfortable, aside from the lingering cigarette smell on the comforter and pillows, it had a large window and a nice view.
review.negativeRemarks: The restaurant and room service menu are both completely inadequate.  Maid service need to be significantly more thorough when cleaning the rooms.

review.reviewText: Great hotel, lots of amenities, friendly staff, centrally located

review.title: Good hotel for Union square shopping
review.reviewText: Typical Hilton hotel, very centrally located. Rooms fairly spacious ( we were in Tower 1) and quiet. There is a huge renovation going on in reception, so no Herb n Kitchen etc. they did tell us it was going on for another 4 months!!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location! Close to attractions, local bars and dining. Made taking Lyft and Über everywhere affordable.

review.title: Hotel stay in SF
review.reviewText: After staying at a smaller, mire personal hotel in LA, this felt very corporate and cold. We were a party of four but the room was only set up for two people so we had to keep asking for extra towels, tea/coffee regularly. The outdoor pool was regularly busy and uncomfortable to sit out at due to the weather on SF. Had s nightmare with the laundry, lost an item and overcharged the costs. This is run independently from the hotel. The hotel staff however were very good at rectifying the problem. Good location too

review.title: Ripped off by Expedia
review.reviewText: My girlfriend emailed me 250 dollar reservations for 2 nights at this hotel. When I checked out they charged me 450 per night. I said what? This should be 250 per night. They said talk to Expedia. I promise you that I will bad mouth and never ever, never ever ever again in my life use Expedia.

We expected more from the hotel considering the rates they were charging.

The room we booked wasn't available.

The carpet looked to have cigarette burns scattered all over.

Our room service of two beers took almost an hour and made us miss our dinner reservations. Then when we called to to check the status, we were told the waiter was sent up. The waiter 20 minutes later was MIA. Finally, when we called to cancel the order we didn't receive an apology for the extreme lag time.
review.positiveRemarks: From an interior design standpoint, the bathroom layout.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service.

review.title: Good business hotel not for vacation
review.reviewText: Crowded always at check in , long lines everywhere suites are really small with a queen bed tiny cramped bathroom

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: I spsnt three nights here when I was in town for the Marathon.  It is a huge, hotel, but I found the staff to be very helpful, the facilities excellent, and the location safe. My room was large, airy, and clean, and the bed comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: One has to walk around the corner to be collected by the Super Shuttle - real pain.
review.locationRemarks: Location is fine.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was a fine choice, expensive but probably on par with others in the area.  It was very crowded with a convention happening, but that may be the norm.   It was comfortable and clean.  We did not have an upgraded, renovated room, but ours was nice.
Great location close to many shops. Staff was very helpful.

review.title: Location is key to this large hotel
review.reviewText:
amenities such as lobby coffee shop wifi in lobby  as well as location make it a great locale for sightseeing out of towners

no concern with service in any category

review.title: Close to union sqyare
review.reviewText: In renovated room, but bathroom smelled even after it was cleaned again.

review.title: Good stay in SF
review.reviewText: chose this hotel for our last night in SF because we wanted to stay near Union Square. Hotel was outstanding and exceeded our needs/expectations. Only downside was location...we stayed in Nob Hill area at the beginning of our trip and enjoyed that location more...less crowded, less hectic, more payed back areA.
Room was satisfactory but our air conditioner didn't work. It was fixed later but that wasn't fun. The bell service was rude both days.

review.title: Nice location but rude staff
review.reviewText: Location was great but check in and valet parking staff not very friendly. I won't come back here.

review.title: Nice experience
review.reviewText: It was a nice experience  to be there.  The skyline  from the room and the amazing  view of San Francisco during breakfast was the Best.

review.title: Awesome hotel.
review.reviewText: Awesome. The best place, location and in downtown SF. I couldn't get any better.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-Fi in rooms for free if possible :)
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the Union square and that was the best part.

review.title: Good size room for what u pay for
review.reviewText: I stayed in a standard king size bed. It was a good deal close to union square. Felt safe sleeping there. Clean; no weird odors. Small bathroom awesome shower. Paid 2 days for parking..wish that was included :( that was the only downfall, $50 per day. But at least you can get out and in as you please.

review.title: Not befitting Hilton's Brandname
review.reviewText: Overcrowded, under manned. Perpetual long que for check in & out.. took me 30min & an hr to do so respectively. Room had no bottled water & asked to go buy myself or order & pay - a surprise to me. Other hotels wud at least place bottles there & indicate price. Corridor lite come thro door gap. Poor sound proof. Whole hotel lobby was like market place. Not worth going thro the trouble staying here.

review.title: Great city views
review.reviewText: Hotel was undergoing remodeling. We upgraded to a city view with spectacular views of the city. Would stay here again.

Great Location, great staff but the check-in process was very long. The line to check-in was wrapped around the front lobby so we checked our bags and walked around the city for a bit to come back later and check in.
Comfortable rooms, helpful & friendly staff. Great views of the city from our room! Convenient location. Construction in lobby unfortunately while we were there.

Hotel was nice, although the lobby was being renovated from the time I arrived.  Despite paying over $325 per night, Wi-Fi is not included, but it can be purchased for $20 per day, which is absurd.  There is a "business center" to do work, but it is part of the FedEx shipping area, resembles my high school library, and the Wi-Fi is still not included in the room rate.  Be careful of the breakfast buffet, unless you feel that $54 is a reasonable cost for eggs, bacon and coffee.  Like much of SF, there are no shortage of homeless people around the hotel that are not shy about begging for money/food.  The staff was very friendly, but my interactions were limited..

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Good location - central to access most things.  I left a hat in the lounge and lost property had it, no issues.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. The bar at the entrance was very friendly as were all the staff
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-fi ".......only available for free in the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: Great hotel- close to cable cars!
review.reviewText: Elena at check-in apologized for the wait and gave us free wi-fi. Beds were super comfortable!

review.title: Good hotel in the heart of the financial district.
review.reviewText: Confusing as there is an upscale Hilton directly across from the Union Plaza Hilton, which we initially tried check-in.  Streets are quite congested, along with fair number of homeless and pan handlers, so walking about is not a sense of being safe.  Otherwise, a comfortable place to stay and accommodating.  Added plus for one self-parking garage fee.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms comfortable and service good.  Self parking facility is appreciated with one fee for the stay.  AlternateHilton, valet parking only, daily cost
review.negativeRemarks: A busy hotel, check-in took about 25 minutes once we determined this was the correct Hilton.
review.locationRemarks: Location may not be in a safe-feeling area, but plenty of commercial stores nearby.  Used taxi service (quite prompt) to attend a wedding at City Hall

review.title: Would not recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is very dated, the rooms are small and the bathrooms are tiny. For the price we paid it was not worth the stay.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location.  Hotel is what you expect from a Hilton.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
No fridge in room
Breakfast extremely expensive
Parking extremely expensive
No wifi in rooms, or too expensive
Looks like a 3 stars hotel

review.title: Nice. Convenient to transportation & attractions
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice and staff courteous, especially upon our very late arrival. Room not as clean as I expected. Cost considerably more for same # of nights than spacious two room suite with 2 king beds, complimentary hot & cold breakfast, pool and many other amenities at Sonesta in Flagstaff AZ. What the market will bear, I guess.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive. Add comp b'fast. $116 for b'fast buffet for 4 was excessive. Room not vac'd (child found pills on floor.) Registered 4 guests, towels for 3
review.locationRemarks: Good location although I did have a local relative to drive us when needed and serve as tour guide. Many activities a cable car ride away.

review.title: Downtown San Fran Stay
review.reviewText:
The day we arrived everything appeared to be top notch. 
Then... things deteriorated. We were not told of what appears to be a renovation going on prior to us selecting our stay. The entire common area is blocked off in black curtain, and the Starbucks was closed! So much for the gift certs for a free breakfast for 5 days. They tried to redirect us to another restaurant or give us a "discount" at the overpriced Restaurant that was part of the hotel, but really, when you just want your morning coffee and a muffin, the walk down the street & extra money spent is just another aggravation.
Between that and us having to tell hotel staff to clean up the blood on the lobby floor (someone had cut a foot or had a bloody nose and leaked it everywhere), let's just say this was far less than what we had hoped for...and paid for.
review.positiveRemarks: The central location in downtown San Fran
review.negativeRemarks: The communication when the hotel is planning on doing major reno work.
review.locationRemarks:
- The Wharf
- Shopping
- Golden Gate Bridge
- Trolley Cars

review.title: Good hotel, although location not great.
review.reviewText: The hotel is situated a couple of blockes from Union Square, and we found the area to be a little rundown and not one to be walking in alone at night. Otherwise the hotel was good, nice clean good sized rooms, pleasant staff on reception and concierge services were helpful. The Starbucks in the lobby was good but the queue was extremely long in the mornings, it's better to go to one of the many other Starbucks' nearby. Overall pleasing stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The pleasant staff on reception and housekeeping, and the good sized clean rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: The queue Starbucks in the mornings was a bit unreasonable, especially with so many others nearby. More seating here would also be good.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is a couple of blocks from Union Square, and isn't the most desirable of locations. It is convinient for the Cable Car or Westfield Mall.

review.title: Excellent location and family friendly Hotel
review.reviewText:
We stayed for 4 nights at the Hilton in downtown SFO, the hotel is at the heart of the city with lots of restaurants and shopping options. 

The room we got was spacious and clean, the staff was extra friendly and were always eager to help. I will stay in this hotel during my next visit to SFO, thank you !
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, clean rooms and good for families
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Lots of options for dining and shopping

review.title: Nice hotel, shame about the homeless so close.
review.reviewText: Lovely place right in the heart of the city. Unfortunately the city comes with the rough people as well as the good, ruining its image. Beautiful hotel with clean rooms and quality fixtures. Very helpful staff making it a pleasant stay inside the hotel.

photos.caption: For hundreds (and hundreds and hundreds) of dollars for a night, this is my view????

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText:
We're Hilton Honors members and I have to say that this was the first experience at a Hilton that I left feeling very disappointed. I realize San Francisco is expensive, but for the exorbitant price, I would expect my view not to be a concrete wall and air conditioners. Our window (on the 8th floor) was set in some sort of trench in the building with a wall three feet away and utilities in the middle. I would think that a room like this would be highly discounted, and it really is unacceptable that I wasn't even informed that it would be sub-standard. The offered upgrade to include a balcony and Starbucks breakfast, for a hundred extra dollars, was laughable. 
At 2am a group of drunk people were literally screaming by the elevators. I went out of my room and noticed several other doors (at least three) with people sticking their heads out to see what was the problem. I went to the group of people arguing and told them that they were extremely loud and disturbing. One of them apologized and left, while the others continued arguing more quietly. I could still however hear every last word as the walls appear to be paper-thin. Between the hard bed, hot room, and noise, the night was pretty bad. 
I couldn't even discuss these issues at check-out because the lobby lines were constantly too long. They need to have more cashiers if there are going to be 10 people in line all the time. I simply didn't have a half-hour to stand in line to try to talk to someone.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby is pretty. The location is nice.
review.negativeRemarks: The check-in and out lines. The horrible view. Soundproofing, maybe?
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is near Union Square. The neighborhood to the west is extremely sketchy though.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Ballpark, Alcatraz tour is cool, plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby.

review.title: It was OK.....
review.reviewText: Okay, this hotel is in a great spot however it was let down by staff. At check in I was asked if we wanted to upgrade to get a fridge and breakfast. Thank goodness we didn't breakfast had queues of 40 people every morn. Our room was fine and had a fridge.Housekeeping was friendly.The woman on the conceigre was a shocker, grumpy,uninterested in prompting San Fran. The final straw was when we arrived we walked past doormen who did not point out not to go left.This lead to the tender lion area full of homeless people.We virtually sprinted down the road. Other hotels told guests not to go there.
review.negativeRemarks: Doormen telling guests where to go and check in staff.Happy conceigre.
review.locationRemarks: Touch and go, lots of dodgey characters.

review.title: Great location, pleasant stay.
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel is great.  It's in Union Square and walking distance to China town.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  The rooms were nice and relatively clean but our refrigerator didn't work.  Good thing we only went to our rooms to sleep.  They ran out of towels on the roof top pool the few times we went up to the pool.  It's great that they have a Starbucks in the lobby but the line gets crazy long in the morning.  

As nice as the hotel is, we noticed a few homeless people hanging out near the front entrance of the hotel.  For people not familiar with San Francisco, the city has a large population of homeless people.  You will see them almost everywhere and you have to be careful what part of town you are walking around.

In general, I was happy with my stay at the Hilton Union Square and would recommend it to anyone wanting to be near all the action.
review.locationRemarks: Gray Line tours has a stop at the hotel, shopping and China town is just a few blocks away, restaurants on every block.

review.reviewText: Nothing special.  $56 parking per night, 1 small pool, 1 small spa and not so special hotel staff.

review.title: Conveniently located -  8th floor stay
review.reviewText:
Overall a decent stay, very conveniently located hotel. The room wasn't as clean as it should be, the toilet had toilet paper in it when we checked into the room and the tub had hair in it. A random guests sock was found the next day near the bed. Friday night was extraordinarily loud, the following nights were quieter. The staff was quick to help with any need or guidance. Keep in mind there are so many rooms and so many guests. This hotel takes an entire city block.
The location is hard to beat, so close to the Bart. We never once needed a cab!

review.title: In the center
review.reviewText:
Needs update 
 AC. Unit to laud, asked the service to take care of AC noise, respond was all the rooms are the same because it's a individual unit

review.title: Good for a short Stay. Convenient to shopping.
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby could be redesigned to make it a more comfortable and enjoyable place. Today is just an area to wait for check-in/check-out.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Union Square and Market Street.

review.title: Water waster
review.reviewText: For a state and city that's suffering a drought, I was very disappointed in this hotel. Total water waste toilets and shower heads. Housekeeping was excellent, although our room stunk and everything seemed damp.  Parking and luggage handling was a nightmare. This place charges for everything too...beware. Nice location. Don't go for the pool and hot tub, they are both super small for the size of hotel. And 9pm close? Are you serious? I'll be looking for something different next time.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to Union Square and stores.
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hilton during a busy holiday yet there were no long lines checking in and checking out was easy and convenient.
The only irritating aspect was the long walk from the elevators to our rooms. Other than that, we have no complaints.

review.title: Too big for me
review.reviewText: This hotel is huge...not intimate at all, hustle and bustle everywhere. Long wait lines for Starbucks. Concierge was helpful, directing us to catch the MUNI. The first night that we were there, upon check in, one of the beds looked and felt  like it had chip crumbs on it. You could see the crumbs.  The AC unit sucked, couldn't figure out how to cool down our room.  No exhaust fan in the bathroom, that's bad. The refrigerator started making a terrible whistling noise, someone came up from maintenance and turned off. He asked of we wanted a replacement and we said no.
review.positiveRemarks: The view would have been great, without the June gloom.
review.negativeRemarks: Since we had this view it would have been nice to have 2 chairs and table, the room felt like it was missing something.
review.locationRemarks: Its a dirty city.  Lots of homeless people on nearby streets. Shopping is good, Alcatraz was great. Golden gate bridge was impressive.

review.title: Busy hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: My first interaction with staff was when we checked in and were asked if we wanted a newer room for an additional $20 a night - at $200 a night we shouldn't have felt that the room we had booked would be substandard. I was sorry I went for it because though room was modern it was cramped and located far from any elevators. Also sorry we decided to stay in Union Square and pay $58 a night for parking when we could've stayed in Nob Hill & parked for free, gotten a bigger room and taken a cab or Lyft wherever we wanted to go. The Hilton lobby seemed to be crowded day and night.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was adequate and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Offer only nice room - don't suggest people need to upgrade. Charge a reasonable amount for parking.
review.locationRemarks: Only stayed one night & didn't explore the area.

review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay here. Great location! Only downside would be lack of parking, however there is a parking garage across the street from the hotel. Just expensive!

review.title: Decent facility but absolutely horrible service
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely hard to get a hold of in all aspects for example valet, room service, front desk, and I expect more for what we paid.

review.title: Close to the Powell station.
review.reviewText:
No refrigerator !!!
 I wanted to keep cold drinking water when I stayed in the room. There was no refrigerator so really uncomfortable.
I paid $320 per night.
Hotel was clean and recently updated.  The check in staff was friendly.  The hotel was close to shopping, restaurants, and transportation.
review.locationRemarks: Street car turnaround was very close to hotel.

review.title: Great location, Nice Room
review.reviewText: I was a little worried about some of the reviews my mom had read regarding this hotel. The facilities were nice, the location was perfect and our room was nicely updated. No complaints.

review.title: Huge hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine. Rooms were clean and big compare to others in the area. Check in took forever due to size. A lots of homeless people hanging out in the lobby.

review.title: Busy , large hotel but good location.
review.reviewText: Concierge was excellent!  Axing breakfast in the restaurant.   Just a very busy bustling lobby

managementResponses.response: Thank you for your kind words. We are excited you had a great view and an overall fantastic stay. We cannot wait to see you again!

review.title: Well located hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our three-night stay here. Room was on 24th floor with partial view of bay. Would definitely stay here again.

we went to our room and didnt expect that it would be that amazing!!!
bed was so comfy, light were just perfect not to dark not to bright.
the only problem is the internet. i have to pay 20 a night for it, most hotels i stay in is free.
i mean in other hotels the rooms are ok but it pays off because of the free internet.
but for Hilton San Francisco Union Square the room were just amazing but left a lil "eh" because there was no free wifi.
i know $20 its not that much but most hotels include that one for free.
we had to turn our hotspot on so we can enjoy the night.

review.title: Hilton Stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean and staff were very helpful in providing directions. Hotel was close to transportation all over San Francisco and Oakland. Room were very clean and comfortable. Area around the hotel was a little scary do to all the homeless people walking the streets and begging for money. Restaurant location were very close to the hotel. The only bad experience we had was at the Urban Tavern we ordered fish & chips and they brought them out burnt. Next to us was a young man with an order of fish & chips and it was cooked perfectly. We told the bartender but he made a joke about and did nothing about our food. Overall we would stay again at the Hilton but not dine at Urban Tavern.
review.negativeRemarks: The food at the Urban Tavern and teach the bartenders customer service.

review.title: Surprised
review.reviewText: I booked at least 4 months in advance & requested a king bed for my husband & I. When we got there we were told there weren't any available. Seems strange since I booked significantly far in advance & it's an enormous hotel (we stayed in the 3rd tower, 19th floor, 60th room). Also called down for towels at 5pm... Never saw any towels & we checked out at noon next day. Space was clean & hotel was convenient but I was just taken aback by those 2 things that seemed like they'd be easy to accommodate.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText:
Good hotel but not up to expectations based on price and number of stars. The room doesn't have a mini bar (or any fridge), nor complimentary water and even though the tap water is good to drink in San Francisco, turning on the cold water tap sometimes gives warm water which is very disappointing given the number of stars this hotel has. You would expect at least complimentary water at a hotel like this.

Also their slogan "If you're not satisfied with your stay let us know and WE'LL MAKE IT RIGHT" sounds a bit like "We don't really wanna spend time improving our services so let us know what's wrong and we'll just improvise something for you"
review.negativeRemarks: Staff. I always have to stay in line to talk to reception, even if I'm a guest. Super expensive and not up to standard in my opinion.

review.title: Move from another hotel - last minute
review.reviewText: My husband and I ended up moving hotels to the Hilton. Most of the staff that I dealt with were very rude and unaccommodating to my needs. I booked a Jr. Suite to make sure our room was nice. In the renovated tower. For some reason they sent me to the wrong (old) tower twice. One of the rooms they even sent me to was being worked on by maintenance. I can not walk that well due to a recent accident, so this task for me was hard. The last time I waited in line to change rooms (for the third time) the staff (Jeffery) kept on rolling his eyes at me about the room and told me to come back in a few hours. I went outside and called the hotel and spoke to a manager. To find the room was ready, he was lying and I could check in at any time. This was close to 4-4;30pm, when I was trying to check in all morning. After getting the correct room and taking my luggage up I was very happy with the room. The room is crazy big, really nice, clean and new. We ended up staying there for the remainder of our trip. It was worth all the fighting with the staff at the hotel to get a new Jr Suite over the old one. I'm glad I stood my ground and fought for it. The walls were a little on the thin side, where you could hear your neighbors, but that would be the only think I would mention that was bad with the room. Everything else was great. I would definitely stay there again but make sure to be firm with the staff from the beginning.
review.negativeRemarks: Attitude of staff.
review.locationRemarks: Right by Union Square & shopping. Safe and desirable location.

review.title: Check the Sheets before you sleep
review.reviewText: I love SF, this was my 1st, and last, time staying at The Hilton. Check in was ok, considering the sheer size of this place. Got in late, ate dinner, showered and wanted to sleep. Pull the cover down off the bed and BAM! Blood stained sheets. Took them 45 mins to get me new sheets, thankfully they gave me 2 sets bc the first set also had blood. This was the beginning of the nightmare, ended up having to switch rooms entirely to a different tower, which was painless...except for having to pack all my things and haul them from Tower 3 to Tower 1. Staff was useless. I will stay at the usual resting spots - Taj Campton or St Francis - from now on.

review.title: Skyline 1 Bedroom Suite w/Parking Tower 1-Rm 3584
review.reviewText:
Awesome room with incredible views of the city and bay. (35th floor corner room facing AT&T park) If possible, ask for a corner room, high floor.
The rate that I paid for included self-parking as well as vouchers for a "Grab n Go" style breakfast at the Starbucks™ in the lobby. (1 pastry, 1 fruit, 1 beverage of your choice(ANY beverage). When I arrived, my room wasn't ready, waited about 10 minutes and was then given vouchers for the full buffet breakfast at Urban Tavern for my entire stay. Nice! One of the nicest breakfast buffets I have ever experienced from a hotel. Excellent variety. The restaurant was always busy. (Breakfast 630-1100am) Definitely a highlight of the stay.
Negatives? The self-parking structure was designed poorly. Although I was always able to find a stall (several floors up) cautiously navigating that tight narrow corridor of the structure took some time. (Parking structure is attached to Tower 3, when you walk out of the garage to your room you must walk through the room hallways of tower 3 to get to the lobby which was kinda odd)
Room cons? Coming from the Hyatt house in Emeryville, (which had a full kitchen, microwave, full size refrigerator, plates, cups, utensils, etc) this room at the Hilton only had a small refrigerator and a coffee maker. <- standard I guess. The views more than make up for that though.
Overall, the staff was awesome. Everyone I came in contact with was polite and helpful. If I ever come through SF again, I'd definitely return.

review.title: Very dated, over-crowded and over-priced
review.reviewText: Guest rooms were pretty good but communal areas of hotel with the exception of the lobby areas look like they haven't been updated since the '70s. Hotel wanted $13 for basic WiFi which considering they charge nearly $300 for a room is a complete rip off and insult to guests. There was a conference taking place during my stay so navigating through communal areas of the hotel was tricky, constantly having to weave in and out of groups of people just to get in and out of the hotel.

review.title: Convention at the Hilton
review.reviewText: I spent several nights at here while attending a convention. The room was nice, but the bed was a tad uncomfortable. I also didn't like the layout of the hotel as my room was very far from an exit and I felt like a hamster in a maze trying to get to my room.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was nice and they offered valet parking. Room service was excellent, too.

review.locationRemarks: The location is good and there are plenty of great restaurants, shops,and places to go near by. But it's SF, that's almost true where ever you stay.

review.title: This hotel should be rated a 3 star hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel should be much more comfortable. I am a 5'4" female and the pillows that they provide were the size of throw pillows and when you lay on them they seem to disinigrate. For this location and the price I paid, I expected to be more comfortable. I will not stay here again.

review.title: A Little Disappointing
review.reviewText: We traveled to the States as a family group of 7 and used Hilton Hotels in all places we stayed. This was by far the most expensive so we expected the best but after Vegas it was disappointing. No free wifi in room, 1 paper cup for 3 in one room, and 2 for 4 in the other, plus a dribbly little coffee maker, no fridge and no guest laundry to name a few things that you would expect to be better.
review.positiveRemarks: Position - close to Union Square and the excellent staff who do a great job.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix the things above - overall we spent many thousands of dollars with Hilton and felt we were short changed her
review.locationRemarks: Its near Union Square and great shopping, a good range of eating places near by, public transport is also close to the sights around the city.

review.title: Numerous issues! A/C substandard in two rooms!
review.reviewText: I stayed here because it was location for Society for American Archaeology conference. When I first arrived in the room it was warm and muggy. It felt between 76-78F. I turned the A/C on and bumped it down to 72F. I left for 4 hrs and returned. The room was still warm. Also, no tub and an extremely small bathroom. You had to move outside of the bathroom to open the shower door. The phone on the desk did not work (yes, it was plugged in) and the drawers in the dresser would not stay shut. One of the drawers was sticking out half-way. I used a package of coffee to wedge it shut so I wouldn't bang my knee on it. This is a HILTON! in SAN FRANCISCO! I finally had enough and called the front desk from the bed phone. They offered to move me to a new room and I complied; but of course it is a huge pain to move all your stuff once your settled in. I moved to second room and it had a slightly bigger bathroom and a tub (since I asked for one). However, the bathroom appeared bigger because the sink was tiny! Maybe 14" in depth? The vent in the bathroom was coated with dust and the shower had little pressure! The A/C in new room also did not cool adequately. The thermostat let you lower it to ~50 something but did not cool. I have a feeling that you cannot lower it below 70F in any of the rooms. Terrible cheap rooms! Architects trying to pack people in like sardines! Maze-like floor plan. Room # 3-1645? Are you kidding? My zip-code?
review.positiveRemarks: The only thing I liked about this hotel was the location close to Chinatown and friendly staff. Everything else sucked.
review.negativeRemarks: Hilton should stop trying to squeeze every last square foot out of space and make customers happy with standard bathroom sizes and A/C that works.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown and Union Square. Only 1 restaurant in this premium location.

Pay extra for wifi ($13 per day) room key didn't work 4 nights out of 5 and it was a long way back to reception and the breakfast facilities aren't equipped for the hotel size so expect to queue a lot

review.title: Over-rated
review.reviewText:
Staff that seem more interested in upselling you rather than checking you in to the room you've reserved here on Expedia. We arrived earlier than expected but they were not interested in letting us check in one minute earlier than 3 pm unless we upgraded. Our "reserved" room was still not ready at 2:30. Suddenly at 3, another check-in staff person found another room on a higher floor rather than our "reserved" room on the 2nd.

Our non-smoking room smelled of cigarette smoke. Not overpoweringly so, but as two non-smokers, we could smell it.

Housekeeping leaving dirty sheets in the hallway on our floor until at least late at night. They were there when we turned in, and more there first thing in the am. There was also a strand of dental floss that was in the same spot in the hallway on the carpet for 2 days. I guess the hallways aren't vacuumed very often.

The location was good, but frankly, there are so many hotels in San Francisco that I think I'd try elsewhere before returning here.
review.negativeRemarks: Include wi-fi access in the room rates. Or be a little more reasonable. Charging $12.95 per day for it seems a little extreme.
