review.title: Great hotel but unsafe parking garage
review.reviewText: I would rate the hotel staff and room cleanliness as great. Though the hotel lobby is crowded and chaotic, much like a train station, even that would not bother me. What bothered me the most was while they charge an unreasonable amount for the parking at the hotel our car was broken into, the glass was shattered and our luggage countaining laptop computer and other electronics and paperwork containing sensitive personal information and documents were stolen. The security guards just shaked their heads and stood there and kept reminding us that nothing can be done and the security cameras (two of them facing our vehicle) would not capture any evidence. Basically they were not willing to even make an attempt to review the security tapes, and I am yet to hear back from the security director of the garage about any follow up, let alone compensation for the key information and assets that were stolen. Yes we were given a voucher for breakfast buffet and a free room service (thank you Hilton). If the parking garage at hotel does not take responsibility for this, why are they charging as much as $48-$58 per night? This is unethical and unprofessional. Do the security cameras truly capture anything? Or are they there to give you a false sense of security? And this happened in broad daylight in the afternoon. Do Not Park in their garage for your personal safety as nobody will take any responsibility what so ever!!

review.title: Good hotel with easy access to Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is busy but functions well. It has three main towers and is in easy walking distance to Union Square where you can catch the trolley buses and most of the sight seeing tour buses.The hotel does a great breakfast with a vast choice but it is busy and queues are likely. Rooms are clean and the pool / Jacuzzi on the 16th floor is a must. Guest services are very helpful but the Starbucks queue is way too long.The only draw back is the lack of a Hilton Honors lounge.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean rooms, excellent breakfasts and facilities. Easy access to Powell and near all the landmarks of SF.
review.negativeRemarks: A HH lounge
review.locationRemarks: There is way too much to do and not enough space. The best thing is to try everything, it is worth every penny.

review.reviewText:
It was a nice experience staying here. Although other services are quite high but considering the location its traded off good. You can have dozons of restaurants nearby for any kind of food and drinks.
The room was comfortable for a nice night sleep.

review.title: Great experience!
review.reviewText: Celebrated our anniversary in San Francisco and we were very pleased with our room and location!!! Going back to the Hilton again!

review.title: Nice hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, very good location, only 3 minutes walk to Union Square. the only problem was the noises coming from the side rooms, the walls are not noise insulated

review.title: Expensive
review.reviewText:
I think the hotel was awesome, period. The only thing I would change is the pricing, it is quite expensive and they charge your for the internet in the room and for the computers also... internet should be free in my opinion.

Not to mention the parking lot which is the most expensive i have ever seen! it was 47 dollars per day.
Other that the price, the hotel is outstanding
review.positiveRemarks: pretty much everything! but the concierge was super nice and knowledgeable
review.negativeRemarks: The price in general
review.locationRemarks: Union square, china town, downtown, it is very near to everything.

review.reviewText: Nice hotel, expensive tough. Very clean and great location

review.title: Very nice!!
review.reviewText: Loved it! Very well located, excellent customer service.
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: Staff is not that knowledgeable when helping with tour information and transportation.

review.title: Very pleasant stay
review.reviewText: I stayed for three nights and it was one of the best hotels I stayed at in my travels inside the USA. It was clean and very professional.

review.title: San Francisco Road Trip.
review.reviewText: Family had a wonderful time. Enjoyed the stay downtown and short trips to Sonoma, Napa, and nearby tour sites.
review.positiveRemarks: Parking, Room, Baggage staffs are courteous, helpful, and hospitable.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom sink is rectangular and narrow, splashing on water without making a real mess all over is a bit challenging. An upgrade might help.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, restaurants, nearby eatery towns (China Town, Little Italy, Vietnamese, Fisherman Wharf, etc) are a few minutes walk from the hotel.

review.title: Very nice. 1 hr dry cleaning service saved my day!
review.reviewText: 1 hr dry cleaning service saved my day! People are nice. High quality gym for a hotel - had olympic squat racks and deadlift platform!
review.negativeRemarks: Needs a shoe shine service.

review.title: Ok hotel, depending on where they put you.
review.reviewText: It's an ok hotel, I stayed there years ago but paid a regular price and got a better room.  It's a good location, the public parking lot across the street was convenient, well priced and allowed ins and outs.  The room was decent but the bathroom didn't seem as clean and needs updating.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and access to public parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, Union Square a few blocks away.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
great location, close to transportation,  Union Square and Market Street. Close to the Tenderloin so just be aware. Room was comfortable and check in was very easy. Hotel staff was helpful. Would stay again. Views from the top were amazing. 

Suggest WiFi throughout the hotel.

review.title: Upscale hotel in Union Square district.
review.reviewText: Great experience. We requested an early check-in which could be guaranteed with a $25 surcharge. The hotel was able to upgrade our room in the process so it was a great deal for us.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, comfortable room, Starbucks in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom could have been cleaned more thoroughly but this is really me being picky.
review.locationRemarks: Location was near to tourist attractions and great shopping.

review.title: Not on Union Square
review.reviewText: We had a very nice stay. They upgraded our room which was quite large by downtown SF standards. They also provided us a late checkout (2pm) for an small extra charge. It is centrally located but it not on Union Square.

Beds were extremely uncomfortable.  Staff we less then helpful in changing rooms.  Water pressure!  I was awoken up about 3 times from staff radio's and loud voices in the hallway.  Banging from other rooms or staff closets constantly.

review.title: Nice location for shopping
review.reviewText: Room need more blankets as it was cold. I would have preferred a regular shower over the handicap shower as I don't have a handicap.

review.title: Area where it is located
review.reviewText: The hotel was okay. It is a bit worn, and my room, although pleasant enough, there was signs where there was not a well cleaned room. :(   Staff is pleasant enough to be sure! The area is a bit on the rough side. So, I tried to be in before it was dark.  There were several times I used a cab to go only four blocks.  The homeless seem quite aggressive. And panhandling is not what I call relaxing.  Right as I stepped out the front, the side, the garage of the hotel. I would have hoped they shooed those homeless away. I was also disappointed returning to my room in the afternoon, there were so many trays outside the doors of the rooms that had been there when I had left in the morning.  The hallway smelled as I turned from the elevator. So I was not surprised to see it was from the numerous trays.  I ordered a late dessert, and I left the tray in my room upon checking out, with a tip for leaving it in the room rather than on the floor outside like most.  I did not want a new person to be as put off as I was with the tray on the floor in the hallway.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, and the lobby area was spacious.
review.negativeRemarks: Room Service Pick Up, Cleanliness of the rooms. Remove dust bunnies from under the bed/corners. Bathroom floors cleaner and corners of the counter.
review.locationRemarks: The location is in a rough area, and I would let people know upfront. I left for the waterfront, have no interest in the nearby places.

review.reviewText: Had a great time, great room, hotel close to all sightseeing

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time at the Hilton. Rooms are bit small but to be expected with an old city like SF. Beds very comfortable. Hotel bar was fun to hang out after a day of sightseeing. Don't ventue behind Hotel - homeless people everywhere. Big problem unfortunately for SF.

review.title: OK. Location is good, but overwhelmingly huge.
review.reviewText: Long line check in. Water shut down, not so enjoyable. But location is great!
review.negativeRemarks: More personalised service and hospitality.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of great restaurant and shops.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything.
review.reviewText:
I like the hotel. 
الفندق نضيف وجيد انصح الاصدقاء بهاذا الفندق
Its good location
The hotel was in a good location for the things we wanted to do.
review.negativeRemarks: Beds were small

review.title: Nice hotel with great amenities but can get pricey
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself is very modern, clean and well maintained.  The room we were in was just renovated and appeared the furniture was new.  The room itself was small by normal standards but considering the downtown location near center of things, I think the price was fair for the room size.  Our room had a balcony with outdoor seating and a nice view of the city.  

Speaking of pricing, guests staying here need to be aware that the hotel is one of the pricier choices. Parking was $47/night for hotel guests, internet was $16.99 a night, breakfast brunch was close to $20 per person at the hotel restaurant and the vending machines sold 20 oz bottles of soda for $4. Again, given the location, I don't think the prices were above other hotels in the same downtown location.  Guests staying here though should be prepared to pay more if you want anything other than the room.

The only other thing was the hotel immediately upsold us into a better room when we got there.  It was a fair deal (the threw in the internet for free and a discount on breakfast in addition to the room upgrade) but guests should also be prepared for a sales pitch at check-in.

All-in-all thought, our stay here was very nice and I'd stay here again if in the area.

The staff are all friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Very, clean comfortable pleasant hotel with friendly staff and great service.
review.negativeRemarks: Prices!  Internet shouldn't really be $16.99 for a reasonable speed.
review.locationRemarks: A few blocks from Union Square with easy access to the Cable Cars and the F-Market line to the Castro and Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: In downtown San francisco
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Easy access to everything. Questionable area in spots. Lots of homeless and people begging for money

review.title: close to everything
review.reviewText: first time for us staying in union square. great location, close to everything.
review.positiveRemarks: easy check in process, staff was very welcoming. valet was quick.
review.negativeRemarks: would like the pool hours to be longer. After seeing the town wanted to relax but pool closed.

review.title: Horrible Service!
review.reviewText:
Horrible Service!  Room service and overpriced.
Never going back there again! Please please find other Hotel. 
Wall is paper think I could hear EVERYTHING! STILL  CHARGE FOR WIFI, which is just insulting. The parking for one day and night cost us around $120, also insulting. The restaurant provides a mediocre and over priced breakfast.

This whole hotel is a joke. Screw the hotel industry that clearly doesn't respect its customers.

review.title: Reviewing my SFO past
review.reviewText: The hotel location is good in the very busy City. This Hilton would do well to adjust the carpet colors to identify where you might find rooms.  I didn't appreciate being charged $25 for "early check-in".  Whereas the contract reads "check-in after 3p",  I thought I was doing the hotel a favor by arriving about 12 noon; especially so in that the hotel had rooms available at that time and it was a slow time at the front desk. Bad PR on their part.
review.negativeRemarks: The colors were ok but too much of the same on the entire 11th floor.
review.locationRemarks: An easy walk to Union Square.  I know the hotel had a pool but when at the hotel no reference to the pool or workout room.

review.title: Get away from routine.
review.reviewText: It was really nice hotel and near to shopping stores. I will stay again.

review.title: Weekender
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice was a pretty good location.  However, the distance from the reservation desk and the room seemed like a 4 block walk within the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The only problem that I had was walking to and from the room.  I am 66 years old and not in the best shape.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was located close by a Starbucks, Walgreens, H&M, Macy's, Union Square.  Too many stores to remember them all.

review.reviewText: I didn't spend much time in my room as I was there for a conference.

review.title: Disappointing for cost
review.reviewText:
I'm a frequent business traveler to SF and Union Square.  I stayed for four nights.
* Front desk was chronically under staffed.  There was typically only one or two people handling all guests, and occasionally one or both would disappear.
* No free WiFi, even in common areas.  I understand that Hilton likes to upcharge on this, but without WiFi the lobby is less convenient than finding a local coffee shop
* The room was nicely updated but the hallway carpet was very dated
* The shower was lukewarm, and occasionally hot water came out of the cold water faucet tap
* Very good fitness center
Not a bad stay, but I expected more for the price.
review.positiveRemarks:
* Room was updated
* Good fitness center
* Great location
review.negativeRemarks:
* Better staffing at front desk
* Free WiFi in common areas
review.locationRemarks: Union Square - a wonderful spot with lots to do.

review.title: San Fran......they can do better
review.reviewText: The room was not ready upon arrival, the turn down service was terrible. I order champagne being that it was a birthday celebration needless to say it never arrived. The room numbers are off and hard to find. The best thing about this hotel is the location

review.title: facilities
review.reviewText: Rooms are to far from elevator. You can not control the AC
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location

review.title: Downtown hotel, very good experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was very central, and there was a mix up with our room, but the staff were very accommodating and helpful. Amazing views of the city from the spacious room balcony too.
It was a good experience, close to union square, and prices wise it was very affordable

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: Great downtown location. Very close to shopping, food, bars, nightclubs, etc... Great views off rooms with balcony.

review.title: Meh, Clean but could have gone better.
review.reviewText: Woke up the morning after our night stay only to find out the shower knob was broken. They asked if we'd like to shower in a different room, but by that time we were already checking out.

review.title: New Years Vacation in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We stayed at Hilton San Franciso Union Square hotel from Dic. 31, 2014 until January 4, 2015.  I booked it through Expedia.  My daughter left $400 in her purse and she was robbed.  At night when she checked her money was missing, immediately contacted security.  They did a check up in our suite and told her to contact the hotels offices in the lobby.  She did that twice with no results and she we left the hotel they told her to call back in a couple of weeks.  She did the call from Guatemala and finally after insisting 4 or 5 long distance calls they told her her case was denied.  She really was robbed at this hotel and no one helped.
Ana Lucrecia Garcia
Guatemala

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: We stayed here for an event in the city, one night.  The price might seem high, but when compared to same priced hotels near the wharf this hotel stands head and shoulders over those.  We had a pool view room with a patio, good sized room, very clean, loved the shower / bathroom area.  Nice to sit on patio with morning coffee.  For the most part the hotel staff was friendly, but when we checked in the front desk clerk was quite rude.  We did not eat here or visit the bar but it looked nice.  Short walk to Union Square where you can enjoy all the shops & eateries in that area.  I also appreciated the hotel staff checking room keys upon our late night reentry.  Keeps the riff faff out of the hotel.

review.title: Because it is a Hilton, it doesn't mean it's good!
review.reviewText: Our room was in the third tower, 12th floor so it was a shlep to get to there. There was a huge tarp hanging in the hallway, it had fallen a bit from whatever construction they were doing on the ceiling. Dirty glasses were lining the hallway as we walked to our room and they were still there 24 hours later. The room temp didn't work so it was always hot even if I turned the temp down to 68. We just slept there and the location was good but for what I paid, combined airfare and hotel, for a weekend, it was expensive and so not worth it. I will rethink using Expedia ever again. I should have had a better room and our flight, well, middle seat, last row of plane and last boarding group both ways. Need I say more?
Had a gorgeous view of San Francisco.  It was close to shopping but further from the Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: NOT VERY GOOD LOCATION AND BAD FACILITIES
review.reviewText:
It‘s a little far from Union Square, and the hotel do not have much entertainment.
The bed is really uncomfortable! I have to awake several times when sleeping on that bed!
Every time I got up I felt tired.
The room is small.
review.locationRemarks: nothing to do.

review.title: A regular hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel rooms are quite old looking. My room was extremely noisy. All the elevators sounds were in the room. We have complained and received 25%discount on the price. Extra charge for wifi. I will prefer to try some other hotel, next time when I visit San Francisco .
review.negativeRemarks: Room decoration, voice insulation,
review.locationRemarks: Location seems to be ok.

review.title: Save your money and don't stay here!
review.reviewText: We booked two nights here for a getaway weekend. It started in the parking garage when they told us there were spots on the top floor. After driving around and waiting almost an hour, we finally got into valet. The parking is a complete nightmare. In addition, I had to call concierge at 3am regarding a large party next to us, which was not resolved. The thermostat in the room didn't work as well. Upon departure, we explained our troubles to the front desk, with no assistance from them. By far my worst hotel experience. I will never stay at a Hilton again.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Housekeeping was excellent; I requested morning and evening service and was promptly accommodated. Concierge staff is one of the finest I've ever encountered... The staff answered all questions without even having to look it up. Front door staff was very helpful, too.
review.locationRemarks: It's extremely convenient to Union Square; there are two, 24-hour diners across the street, and it's in the heart of the city.

review.reviewText: Our stay was pleasant. The location of the hotel was excellent and close to all major shopping and BART.
Good location but rooms were old and small. The Rooms didn't look like anything we saw on the pictures. We had to asked to move Rooms.

review.title: Watch out for fees!
review.reviewText:
Room price didn't include parking, breakfast, or internet.   I wish I had known.

Room was $179 / day
Overall, the cost of the room could add to $320  (I cut back on internet and food to save money).

Approximate numbers:
Parking $53/day
Internet  $12 or $17/day (for high speed)
Other taxes and fees $30/day
Breakfast (e.g. eggs, toast, sausage) Could be as much as $40 if via room service  (including the delivery fee, pre-calculatd gratuity, tip, taxes, etc).
If you need a bottle of pop from the machine:   $4 each.

Rooms are clean but small.  Decor is stylish but you can tell where they went cheap.  Sink was a tiny oval turned sideways, next to the mirror, with no counter space.  When washing my face, water dripped on the floor (even when my head was right up against the mirror). The bathroom had an ikea-like pair of doors.  Due to space issues, had to actually open/close them each time I wanted to go inside.  

They ran out of parking spots / oversold the ramp, so I had to use valet parking (which they provided without additional cost).  I prefer parking my own car.   

Overall, it's the Microsoft of hotels.  Looks and smells like an office; it's clean, predictable, but with hidden costs, awkward facilities, and a need for security hovering around constantly.
review.negativeRemarks:
They need to provide a price list in the description.
Security was too visible; Rent-a-cops would stand around in the hallways, just watching people.
review.locationRemarks: This part of Union Square is next to the Tenderloin, and there's a *lot* of homeless people and panhandlers nearby. But it seemed safe.

review.title: Nice hotel close by everything.
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice and clean. It was close to my work place too which was a plus. Felt safe since there was a lot of police around at night.  There are a lot of bums in San Fran so once sun down hits the bums just flood the streets.

review.title: Nice hotel, but the neighborhood could use work.
review.reviewText:
Once we drove into the valet parking, everything was fine.  The neighborhood itself was pretty bad.  Lots of obvious drug use on the streets, lots of homeless crowds.  Traffic sucked around the hotel. . .

But, the room was nice, very clean.  The water pressure in the shower wasn't good, but it was wet.

I don't drink coffee, but the line at Starbucks in the morning was crazy.  If you're in SF, you should be able to walk a couple of blocks and get a good cup.
review.positiveRemarks: It's a Hilton, so for the most part, the hotel itself was great.  Nice room.  Great bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure in the shower.
review.locationRemarks: Don't know.  Didn't do anything local.  Was there on business up in Marin, but my wife wanted to stay downtown.

review.title: Hotel close to everything in Union Square
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Overcrowded lobby. Great room and accommodations.
Great! We loved it, close to everything. Nice gym!

review.title: Great location- thats about it.
review.reviewText:
I expected more from Hilton. Tiny dated rooms and bathrooms, rude staff, 0 flexability or perks. The best thing going for this place is the location of the hotel and the $35 overnight parking station across the road. Don't park in Hilton- they'll charge you $60 a night- even if you are a guest for multiple nights. 
Staff at reception were very rude at check in and check out. For the money you pay you should at least get a friendly face.
It was a great hotel, really clean and great customer service. I would definitely stay there again. Recommend it, I enjoyed my stay.

review.title: Great Location at Union Square
review.reviewText: Great Location.   Deceiving room upgrade program, watch out for the up sale.

review.title: Don't stay here
review.reviewText: Bad experience, they were rude too. Ice machine was broken, and we called down to get ice they gave us one and then said they would have to charge us for another. It was ridiculous.

review.title: Old hotel in a convenient area
review.reviewText: It's an okay branded hotel, prefer Mariott but easy to return my rental car which is opposite Hilton.  The receptionist offered us a queen bed for extra $30/night, wifi for extra dollar so ended very expensive per night.  Wouldnt stay here if not because the parking mentioned above.

review.title: I would recommend
review.reviewText: Staff very friendly, convenient location... park across the street in the garage, it's cheaper... room should have been cleaner.  I would however, stay again.
I requested, early check IN and should be good view. They charged $25/ early check IN. Room with not very good location.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleaning lady did good job to clean the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service.

review.title: nice weekend gateaway
review.reviewText: it was a very nice weekend in San Francisco. The hotel is great, clean and the staff is wonderful.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: great location and easy access to the main city attractions

review.reviewText: Outdated, relatively dirty hotel. Not really at Hilton standards.

review.title: Nice location.
review.reviewText: Was nothing special at all. But a good location, and helpful staff.
The hotel was very nice, convenient, and comfortable. The room was too small and had a lot of street noise. That was the only bummer.

review.title: Parking is pricy.
review.reviewText: Great hotel. But of a dangerous area and parking is pricy.

review.title: Not a very good stay
review.reviewText: Room was dirty, staff was rude.  When I brought to their attention that the room had to be cleaned again as well as a noise issue, I had to press for them to just apologize let alone fix it.

Excellent hotel, room was clean and the view of the city was okay--not exceptional, but its a city.  We were on the 12th floor, maybe go higher up for a total view of the city.  The top floor shows there is a bar or place for drinks, however it is only for private party's to reserve for the night? That is what the front desk told us.  The concierge desk directed us to the best restaurants, and night clubs within walking distance.  The bartender of the hotel was very helpful in directions to public transportation to Fisherman's Wharf and getting around the city in general with public transportation.  If you like Starbucks, they are in the lobby, lines form early in the morning. FYI: step outside the doors, go right one block and there is another Starbucks!
Hotel needs to update their plugs in rooms and put filters on their bathroom water faucets the water splashes everywhere

review.title: On the Tenderloin borde
review.reviewText: Neighborhood scary and dangerous.  Hotel on the low end of Hilton quality

A group of us stayed at the Hilton so that we could go and see Beach Blanket Babylon. Upon arrival I found the staff to be helpful and friendly. I stayed is a spectacular suite on the 41st floor which h I found to be very clean and neat. I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Central.Easy to walk.
review.reviewText: Staff welcoming and helpful.. Room was very quiet and clean. Needed some outside window cleaning.Very convenient.

review.title: Nice/ Older hotel, good location.
review.reviewText: Hotel in good location, few blocks walk from Union square. Lots of homeless people in the area. Hotel room was satisfactory, no bar fridge. Shower over bath with an old worn out shower head that didn't move so was frustrating. Also no free wifi- very disappointing as Hostel down the road for $20p/n provides free. Overall good stay and would recommend to couples, wouldn't recommend area with small children.

review.title: Everything is not in a NAME!
review.reviewText:
I was shown my room and it smelled of mold and mildew .. they gave me another room .. just didn't feel safe in a huge grocery style hotel .. too many people and not cordial .. had to wait in line for taxis for over an hour!!! 
 Really disappointing .. I checked out after one night and found an amazing hotel which was not as large altho' large but very accomadating !!
review.negativeRemarks: It's to large and the lines for a taxi and even to talk to a concierge was ridiculous !!!!

review.reviewText: Didn't feel for what I paid for the room it was worth it.
Disappointed there was no fridge in our room.  When I inquired, I was told there is a $15 surcharge to get a fridge.  Don't Super 8 Motels even have fridges?

review.title: Clean hotel, friendly and helpful staff
review.reviewText: The Hilton SF has everything including restaurants, workout gym, shops and other various services. It is situated in the heart of San Francisco making getting anywhere in the city relatively easy. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly.  The hotel itself and the room was very clean, spacious and offered everything we needed.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, it's pretty good.
review.locationRemarks: It's in Union Square which offers lot's of high end shopping.

review.reviewText: Easy in & out - elevators got packed though. Came for a local running event - good location & reasonable price.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice Hilton - facilities are clean and well kept as we expect for Hilton.
review.negativeRemarks: staff is a tich snooty. the location is good walking distance to everything, but the proximity to the tenderloin makes it uncomfortable
review.locationRemarks: Union Square shopping and restaurants - easy cab rides to other city neighborhoods

review.title: Needs an update but close to everything
review.reviewText:
The front desk staff were not very courteous unlike other Hilton's my family has stayed at before. We've stayed previously at Hilton Carlsbad twice (new and really nice. Staff was great). Double Tree in Mission Valley great as well. Housekeeping and the bell men were great at this Hilton in Union Square. 
The room needs updating asap. It was noisy as well every few minutes it sounded like something was rolling/tumbling up stairs. We left a day earlier and moved to another hotel next door.

review.title: Good location, but not your typical Hilton
review.reviewText: The room was small, check-in slow, and cleanliness was not as expected. There are huge numbers of people in and around this hotel, and from servicing the room, general hotel upkeep, reception, starbucks, concierge etc, there are just not enough staff to accommodate. Good location however.
review.negativeRemarks: Adopt typical Hilton service. I expected a much better room
review.locationRemarks: Excellent with lots of options as expected in Union Square

review.title: Great location. Fantastic health club
review.reviewText: Overall great experience  The heated outdoor pool and Jacuzzi was fantastic and the room service was very prompt and courteous. I would definitely return

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments. I am very sorry to hear about your disappointing stay in San Francisco. We apologize for the level of service you received from our team. We will be sure to share your feedback with our Guest Services manager to ensure this does not happen again in the future. We hope to get the chance to make it up to you soon.

review.title: Terrible choice
review.reviewText: This was the worst hotel on our 4 week holiday in the US. We stayed for 3 nights and would not recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco. The doormen ignored us every time, including while my wife struggled with 3 bags, the additional fees are ridiculous (such as $60/day for parking) and the rooms were furnished last century.

review.title: good hotel, but walls are so thin,
review.reviewText:
hotel staff at the front desk were helpful and friendly. Overall a nice hotel to stay in.
However the walls in the room were so thin you could hear conversations going on in the corridor.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for sharing your review with us. We are glad that you received great service from our team. We apologize that your room felt outdated and noisy. We invite you back to stay in our newly renovated Skyline Bay View rooms to experience the modern look and feel we are moving towards. We appreciate your comments and hope to welcome you back soon.

review.title: Hotel Staff is great - but poor location
review.reviewText:
We stayed here from December 26 - January 3. The hotel staff is great and will help you with anything you need. The overall room was dated and the location is horrible in terms of noise and the surrounding areas. It's a great location for shopping but if you want a good nights sleep you won't get it. There is constant alarms and beeping going on around you. There is a parking garage next door that is extremely noisy. Also, and this is at no fault to the Hilton but there are so many homeless people around the Hilton that it detracts from it and makes you feel somewhat unsafe going out at night. 

Our bed had some stains on it and that was disgusting and the pillows were extremely uncomfortable.

review.title: Severely Overrated.
review.reviewText:
This is an old, outdated hotel that hides behind the Hilton name.

The service level is extremely poor and effectively non existent.

Some staff members need to stop hiding behind their badge, get some customer service and display some sort of attention and service to their customers.

When we arrived with 2 teenage children and 4 suitcases of luggage given we were holidaying in the U.S. for 4 weeks, the doorman and staff provided absolutely no service in assisting us with our bags, preferring to stand by and watch us unload these room the back of the car.

The next time we were leaving the hotel, the head doorman couldn't even open the door as he was pre-occupied texting on his phone.

Simple questions when checking in we're treated with rudeness and disinterest and when asking for a umbrella 2 days later when it was raining, we're greeted with a blunt " we don't have any left".
review.positiveRemarks:
The location is OK. Not much else to get excited about.

The gym is OK.
review.negativeRemarks: Providing some basic customer service and stop inking they are elite because the hotel carries the Hilton name would be a start.

It's a not-so-great neighborhood although close to Union square a couple good restaurants.  The lobby was crazy busy all the time and check in took forever even though there were only a couple people in line.  Parking was expensive and wifi was extra.  But my biggest complaint was the room smelled funny and there was no real comforter on the bed.  I froze the first night and had to crank up the heat for warmth while sleeping.

review.title: Hilton Onion Square -
review.reviewText:
I choose to stay at Hilton Branded hotels with my family- there is a level of predictability that comes whether we have stayed in Sydney, throughout Asia and the US. They won't be the cheapest- but the beds are always comfortable, bathrooms clean with a pool or family space.  Given we had just come from Hilton San Diego- this was a very disappointing, and uncomfortable 3 days in San Fransisco. 
First of all, we arrive at the hotel through the back entrance after Google directed us through the tenderloin district= Smell+ fear+ filth. When we arrived, no hello help or welcome. Just stand there and watch us try to figure it out. Then checking in was long... The concierge possibly got the same training. When asked for ideas on how to see the city, and whether they could make recommendations for we got a very snappy "What tour bus?" When we described the several hop on/ off tours outside the hotel door.."Just get on a red one- they are all red anyway."  
The cleaning was appalling.  I wiped down the bathroom on our arrival before use -showers need bleach; on day 2 we arrived to find a whole hallway with their rubbish outside their doors at 5.30pm, when cleaning starts at 8.30am (and they won't knock).  Essentially Tower 3,  Level 8 is still stuck in the 1970's complete with carpet stains, peeling wall paper and damp smell to match. 
Watch out if you need to go out the front door-  be prepared for more homeless begging/ abusing you while the hotel staff look on
review.positiveRemarks: The San Fran Ginger Bread display in the vhotelk lobby
review.negativeRemarks: Attitude. We have a poor view of San Fran because of the hotel staff attitude- unhelpful and poor work quality across all areas.
review.locationRemarks: Big Bus Tours stop off outside the hotel were a great, and an easy way for a family to see the city- just don't tell the concierge!

review.title: Terrible service, dirty, noisy and lack of 4 stars
review.reviewText: The employee are lazy. You call and they pass you around....before you get to anyone.  Once you talked to someone they act as if they are doing you a favor when in fact...your hotel sucks.  The ice machine in our floor is broken the 1st day...got to the next floor broken too. I reported the issue..they told me they will fix it.  2nd day broken still...I called to ask...no one is taking responsibility.  This lady in the front  said I will not charge you for someone to deliver ice.  Is she crazy or what?  She make it sound that she is doing me a favor, when in fact the service suck.  Of course, two hours later...no ice I have to call again and again the employee has an attitude.  I can't believed the representation of this Hilton.  We are HHonors for years...and I am very disappointed with this hotel.  I will never stay in this Hilton again. I will never recommend it to anyone.  The management should be embarrass  to call this 4 stars.  It's a shame to call this Hilton.  I will further make reviews in other site to make sure they would not used this hotel.  I am sadden by this and the management should address thus issue.

This was my second stay at this hotel and it was just as satisfying as the first. The room was very nice and clean. Check in was easy. The hotel is located right in the heart of the City, so it is easy to walk to everything.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to everything.
review.reviewText:
The Pros: Clean and comfortable hotel, near a lot of the places we wanted to visit. Closed to some very excellent breakfast places and Union Square, shopping, etc.

The Cons: Not so nice of a neighborhood, long wait to check in and out. They need more people at the front desk. I waited almost 40 minutes to check into hotel. Definitely not acceptable.
review.negativeRemarks: More front desk help.

review.title: Tired hotel, in need of renovation
review.reviewText: This is a typical conference hotel, lots of room nights, in need or renovations and generally not what I would expect from a Hilton.

review.title: Average Hotel (Avoid staying here)
review.reviewText: As some one who travels for work and spends 75% of my time in a hotel, this hotel is one to avoid.  The room that we had was extremely disappointing, smelly, and dumpy.  Better can be had all around Union Square.  The staff was very disappointing as well.  Beyond the Concierge desk, no staff person was very helpful. When I asked for directions, the staff person just walked off.  I will avoid staying at this hotel in my future visits to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve the room quality

review.title: Wont go back to Hilton Union Square in SF again
review.reviewText:
Very disappointing two night stay.
First, I was standing in the Honors line waiting for someone behind the desk to check me in. One of the non-Honors staff was not busy and even though he looked at me, he did not call me over. Another non-Honors person got into that line and he called her over yet I stood in line waiting for the one person who was checking in Honors guests.
Next, my room was very small. There was hardly enough room for me to move between my bed and furniture against the far wall.  The bathroom was also very small and the back of the toilet was right up against the counter where all my toiletries were placed. 
Finally, the view outside of my window was a wall. Yes, I come to SF and all I can see from my room is a wall.
Not the way an Honors guest should be treated.

review.title: 3 nights in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I took 2 rooms in Tower 1 with city views, 1 on floor 26, 1 on floor 36. Both had balconies as well. We had nice weather, watched a yellow moon come up right between two distant buildings, made the view that much more special.
review.positiveRemarks: Very confortable bed, all the luxury we needed without being over the top. Nice staff!
review.negativeRemarks: Everthing cold on the breakfast buffet: scrambled eggs, french toast(mush), sausage, bacon, home fries (more much). They didn't charge, I'd rather hot

review.title: Huge convention hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Was there for a conference (which had over 5000 attendees). This hotel has large meeting spaces and can handle large groups.  The hotel is not cheap, but in that area nothing is.  Good location, very good staff, walking distance to Union square, lots of shops and restaurants.  But also close to a lot of dubious areas so need care when walking.  Rooms were comfortable if undistinguished.  Not much or a restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant, decor.

review.title: Mammoth if you feel like one
review.reviewText: The hotel is very convenient for a conference that is organized in its extensive facilities. The downside is that tends to be overcrowded, with lines for check in and check out and a limited attention span of the staff for any individual customer. The breakfast is substandard and the rooms are average, except that the windows are so dirty and the view so sad (onto an interior yard where some guests are trying to enjoy themselves in a tiny pool, for all rooms to see) that the overall room-feel is substandard. The parking fee is through the roof and easily doubled the cost of my rental car, with cheaper independent garages nearby. Because I stayed at this hotel only for the first two nights of a conference and then moved to one with the same nightly rate on Nob Hill, I have to say that there was just no comparison and the Hilton pales into insignificance in every dimension (breakfast, exorbitant Internet connection fees, view, comfort, ...).  Overall, in a place like San Francisco, there are a lot of better places to stay unless one really values the hhonors points and the no-surprise experience.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is convenient, though only about two blocks from a very poor area where homeless line the street in the morning hours.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast quality, clean rooms, staffing of front desk.
review.locationRemarks: Union square area, lots of shopping, ... public transport and taxis are easily accessible.

review.title: Great location to Union Square!

The rooms were kind of small but overall the stay was very nice.

The neighborhood was sketchy and I wouldn't have gone walking at night to look for another place nearby to eat. Plan on using taxis.

disappointed that the hotel would only give us a 1 hr later checkout and for a $25 charge, we decided to decline.

review.title: Hilton October
review.reviewText:
Put us up in a newly renovated room.  Nicely appointed, but a couple of quirks.  Shower controls on wall opposite from the actual shower head, very narrow sink with faucet on left hand side (to better fit within the smaller bathroom space), no real dresser, just some drawers placed just above floor level.  Nice, though, that TV is mounted on a separate panel to minimize noise intrusion to the adjacent room and good array of outlets.  

Hotel is large and always lots of people sitting or milling about the lobby.  A bit challenging sometimes to navigate when folks are standing around.  Staff was very helpful and nice, though.
review.locationRemarks: Nicely located, near to Union Square, but not directly on it.

review.locationRemarks: In the middle of most things anyone would want; restaurants, bars, shopping, transport (including the cable cars).

review.reviewText: Nice hotel good gym facility. Very business convention oriented
the hotel is reasonably nice, if dated.  the neighborhood is pretty seedy - to call this a Union Square hotel is misleading.

review.title: Relaxing
review.reviewText: Great would recommend it . Close to alot of the attractions.

review.title: Hotel now not in the nicest location.
review.reviewText:
Tried to check in early but told room wasn't ready, but for an additional $25 I could get a room immediately. REALLY. No room to check in but for $25 there a room. 

Location of the hotel was less than desirable.  Didn't really feel comfortable.
Overall a great experience, would stay here again.

review.title: My key didn't work
review.reviewText: Seems that the normal key swipe method of swipe, then push handle down wasn't correct for our room. Security had to come and did key swipe and lift handle UP. Makes no sense at all. We were in a group with 6 other couples. None of them had a similar problem.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was nice. Lines for check-in were incredibly long and slow.
review.negativeRemarks: Check-in speed.
review.locationRemarks: Nice central location. Problem with "less fortunate people" wandering in.

review.title: In desperate need of a refurb... And v noisy.
review.reviewText: Very tired room. Stayed near the lift shaft and it sounded like someone was doing a drum solo whenever the lift went past. Terrible noiseproofing and as a result didn't get much sleep. Worst room service burger I've had in the US (and I've had a few...)
review.negativeRemarks: Decor, noiseproofing, catering. Staff were great in fairness.

review.title: Nice big hotel, close to Union Square and Trolley
review.reviewText: The Union Square Hilton is a very large building. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfy. There is a Starbucks, restaurant/bar and a gift shop all inside the hotel. We were able to walk a few blocks to catch either the trolley or bus.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Union Square, trolley stop, and restaurants/bars. Back side of hotel borders the Tenderloin District, which can be a little scary

review.title: Nice hotel, convenient location.
review.reviewText: This rather a large hotel and the loby area can get crowded. It you are in town for business this is a great hotel. But if you are vacationing, you may want  to go for smaller and cozier properties. Btw there is no pool.

review.title: Great place, helpful staff.
review.reviewText: We stayed two nights and enjoyed the hotel. Room was very comfortable and clean. Concierge staff were very knowlegable and helpful in suggesting a great restaurant for Cioppino. Best ever experience at the Tadich Grille. We would definitely reccomend this hotel. Read the negative comments of other guests and could not agree at all.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were great at there jobs.
review.locationRemarks: Close enough to all the things we wanted to see in San Francisco.

review.title: What a Fantastic Hotel!
review.reviewText: This is a fantastic hotel! Our first time in San Francisco! The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to Union Square, Shopping centers, the cable car and the hop on hop off bus location. Modern and clean rooms with very comfortable beds. The hotel staff were all very friendly and happy to help. This really made our first time in San Francisco a stand out! Hilton Hotels always live up to the expectation and deliver every time!

review.title: Don't stay here.
review.reviewText: Parking cost is terribly expensive. Front desk staffs are rude and not helpful. Room is noisy.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: We stayed in the standard double room - 11th floor - tower 1. Room was basic, clean and comfortable. Only one issue during our week long stay with housekeeping - bathroom had been done but bedroom area had not been touched at 8 pm. Clean bedding sitting on chair, garbage can in the middle of the room and no coffee left. A call to housekeeping and this was dealt with very promptly. The concierge were very helpful in booking tours and giving directions. The Hilton had hired a SF police officer to keep tabs on the front of the building to ensure guests were not bothered by the homeless which we appreciated. Sad that Starbucks closed at 6pm. We did not patronize the restaurant except 2 quick morning bites. We reviewed the menu posted and it was not to our liking and prices were very high.
review.locationRemarks: Numerous diners and restaurants within a short walking distance.

review.title: Terrible Service over priced
review.reviewText: I stayed 4 nights here as my conference was very close to Hilton. The hotel is very old, there was no fridge in the room, pool was closed for maintenance. They charge you for about 500 dollars a night and in comparison  it seemed like a 3 star hotel. Never ever recommend Hilton to anybody.

review.title: San francisco hotelincitycentre
review.reviewText: Did not have a in house restuarant but good choices close by.the stay was 2nights to break our journey  the room was fine .
review.negativeRemarks: A restuarant and better cafe thanl lobby STarbucks
review.locationRemarks: Union square close by with many shops and easy to plug into tours

review.title: Nice big hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Clean, neat and spacious room. Close to Union sq and Powell st Bart. Very big hotel with standard amenities. Great for tourists and business people for attending conferences and so forth.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and spacious room and free wifi. Wifi was fast. Price was reasonable given the average prices of nearby hotels.

review.title: Great hotel! friendly and helpful staff.
review.reviewText:
Perfect location, near shopping, car and bicycle rentals, trolley terminal, restaurants, chinatown etc  
Helpful staff and comfortable rooms.  For me the down side is that they charge for the internet in rooms....Who does that anymore????
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, Starbuck within the building!!!, the staff and of course de comfort of the room.
review.negativeRemarks: At that rate, they should provide free internet!!!!
review.locationRemarks: Located near Union Square (great for shopping and restaurants)

review.title: A little disappointing
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a good location and close to one of the cable car lines which is useful for getting around and seeing the city.  However, on arriving at the hotel I had been allocated the wrong room.  Although the hotel staff were accommodating and offered me a new room I had to wait outside the new room for almost half an hour, not ideal after travelling for almost 24 hours to get there.  The room itself looked good and had a window out to the pool, however, the cleanliness wasn't up to the standard I would have expected of a Hilton hotel - after dropping my phone on the ground I found a large clump of hair (not mine) which wasn't the most pleasant experience.  I may have just been unlucky.

review.title: Nice hotel, good position
review.reviewText: Hotel in handy, central position. Room was big, clean and comfortable despite not being in the refurbished tower. The hotel was very big so not for someone looking for an intimate stay! But a bargain booked through expedia sale.

review.title: Good position
review.reviewText: Glad I paid more for the upgrade but room and bathroom were pretty small. Overall we only slept in the room mostly out

review.title: Nice hotel, excellent location.
review.reviewText: All the facilities are charge apart like wi-fi and frigobar

review.title: Quite average for the money you pay
review.reviewText: Booked a king size non-smoking room. The front desk guy gave us a smoking room. Had to deal with changing the rooms and going to a different tower with our two suit cases. The front desk couldn't send someone to move our luggage. The bathroom was very small. And for 250$ a night you'd expect at least two complementary bottles of water like all Sheraton hotels but nope! Beat to explore other options in the area.

review.title: nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText:
it was only for a few days, but overall stay was pleasant.
the only drawback compare to years ago, you need to be careful regarding the bill: you might get overcharged and you need to let them know. otherwise you will be paying for their services twice.  This is the new era of doing business I guess.
review.negativeRemarks: windows!! US law prohibits to open windows in such buildings but still you need some fresh air going into those rooms.
review.locationRemarks: union square and hilton are located in the perfect spot!! you can go anywhere: by foot, trolley, car, and so forth

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Stayed for three nights at this hotel. Good location as was near to the shops and restaurants. Have stayed in better hotels. Got talked into upgrading as apparently we didn't have a great room. Was very busy as this hotel is by a lot of corporate businesses so had to queue most mornings for a table for breakfast. Would I go back? No. Think I would have preferred to stay in the port area. An awful lot of homeless outside the hotel who kept asking us for money.  Was clean though. Was just an average hotel.
Stayed here one night prior to running a race the next morning.
review.positiveRemarks: For a SF hotel, the room was a decent size.  The location was good.
review.negativeRemarks: The room seemed a bit outdated.

review.title: Decent hotel. In rather a dodgy area
review.reviewText: Our most expensive hotel on our california road trip. Pity it had the least facilities. Hotel wanted a rip off $12.95 a day for wi fi. This should be free !!!! Most people didn t pay this and congegated in the lobby yo use the complimentary. Like a cattle market. Be prepared to be hassled by beggars walking to and from the hotel. Queue for in house starbucks was generally crazy ,subway closeby was better value. joined restaurant bar overpriced. Concierge were very helpful and knowledgeable

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Located near all the shopping areas and close to transport.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of places to dine out.

review.title: Expensive for what you get.
review.reviewText: Hotel ok ,but not worth money.. Car parkinfg fee ridiculous $160 for a 2 night stay.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: No free WIFI in the room; only in the lobby.... so have to read email in public. Bathroom is too small, toilet up against the wall and it is impossible to use the small sink without getting everything wet.  The pool and hot tub was good.
review.negativeRemarks: FREE WIFI IN ROOM. GIVE ME A REAL BATHROOM
review.locationRemarks: Close to great breakfast places and shopping

review.reviewText: Great location for any activity. Very comfortable rooms and friendly staff.

review.title: Very disappointed with the Hilton
review.reviewText: 6 night stay. We were looking forward to staying at the Hilton. The foyer when you walk in look's great. Our room had dirty marks on the walls, a lot of mould on the inside of the bathroom basin. We had paper cups in the room for coffee.....really @ the Hilton.... Room wasn't serviced every day. Service on check in/out very average.

review.title: Big hotel very close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: This is a big hotel. Upon check in, we were offered a bigger room with two queen beds. Beds were very comfortable. We had a partial view of the city. The location is very convenient to shopping, transportation and dining. However, with the price, WiFi should be offered free to all guests. Gold and premium members are offered WiFi in their rooms.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Hotel was very central; close to restaurants, shopping and transit. I didn't care for the Tavern/Restaurant on site, thought it could have more atmosphere, but that was my only disappointment.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were a fair size and the concierge was very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The tavern/restaurant.  Lacked atmosphere, was not appealing to stop there either for breakfast (lined up) or after dinner for a drink.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square and shopping is very close.  A long walk along Market to the Ferry building; but a nice walk.  The Cable car terminal is very close

review.title: Okay hotel, convenient location.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff woke us up every morning during the Labour Day long weekend for housekeeping. 7:30 is not an acceptable time to be housekeeping on a long weekend. In fact I'd say anything before 9 is unreasonable.

review.title: Hilton with your average motel comfort
review.reviewText:
We stayed here for Labor Day weekend. We knew it would be crowded so prepared for that. We also read online that some of the rooms have been renovated in recent years where others are a bit outdated, so we kept this in mind as well.

We took the BART from SFO to Powell Station which is a 5 minute walk away from the hotel. We arrived early morning so were able to store our luggages until check-in time and explore the city. When we came back to check in we were pleasantly surprised with the short check in line. The people working at the front desk were helpful and nice.

When we got to our room we were disappointed. It was more outdated than expected. It felt like a cheap motel room. The door didn't fit well in the frame what resulted in cracks on the bottom and side that aren't supposed to be there (peek through size) what was uncomfortable. This made the noise level was pretty high. Kids playing in the hallway at 7am, and the cleaning crew at 8am sounded like they were standing right next to the bed. 

The bathroom was really small, didn't have a lock, cracks in the door as well, and no ventilation system. The 2nd day of our stay our toilet wouldn't stop flushing. We went to the front desk and they weren't able to give us another room, but would send someone to fix it. When we got back to the room at night the toilet wouldn't flush anymore. This meant a night of discomfort.

You would be better of staying at a cheap hotel because you get the same quality for less money.
review.negativeRemarks: Update rooms in tower 1, noise level, value for money
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is on walking distance from BART and Bus Stations, Chinatown, Union Square, and many stores.

review.title: Nice hotel and staff horrible
review.reviewText: Everything was great Except being woken up to house cleaning walking into my room at 8:15 am to clean my room. Check out was not till 12 and I felt that was very rude! This was my little getaway and had to be woken up early was very disappointing. Then house cleaning came back at 10:30 am, again don't understand why they kept coming to my room before check out. Having someone enter my room while being asleep is unexpected and unprofessional of the hotel staff.

review.title: great service
review.reviewText: great service and staff!  better than 5 star hotels we have stayed at.

review.title: Great location decent hotel
review.reviewText: This is a pretty nice Hilton.  It's rather outdated (still use regular show rods instead of the curved), but it's clean and the staff is nice and the location is great.
review.negativeRemarks: The plumbing is really loud (showers, toilets flushing) and really needs a makeover to make it more current.
review.locationRemarks: Union square has everything you need.

review.title: Only for conventioneers
review.reviewText: Not a hotel for families or even tourists.  Definitely geared towards the business traveler or conventioneer, which is fine, but not the role we were in.  No kids menu for room service (had to ask--they had stuff--over $150 later for a family of four, for almost inedible food).  Not particularly welcoming or accommodating for kids.  Just a blah hotel with little personality in an OK location.
review.negativeRemarks: Service was adequate at best. Lobby overcrowded and loud.  Rooms just OK
review.locationRemarks: Great for downtown, for business meetings especially.  Not great for tourists.

review.title: Good location  room a little bit outdated
review.reviewText: Hotel is conveniently located, but the neighborhood is also also a little sketchy. Lot of homeless people
review.negativeRemarks: Update the furniture
review.locationRemarks: Close to Market street, right in the heart of Union Square

review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect for our SF stay.  The location was great and the hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating if we needed anything.  The rooms are very nice and roomy.

review.title: Toilet was not cleaned and there was a huge mess.
review.reviewText: It took us 30 mins to check in.  Once we got to our room after a long trip the toilet was not cleaned with a really vile mess left inside. The hotel did respond quickly and got us into another room but the bathroom did not look like it was throughly cleaned.  Breakfast was very difficult to find or even find a place to sit.  There was not a waiting list and you just had to stand around until a table became available.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness, efficiency

review.title: Very good hotel in the heart of the city.
review.reviewText: The parking cost is too high so I parked across the street at 35usd per day. The jacuzzi was very nice. The dining room was very crowded but the stuff and the food were very good.
review.negativeRemarks: A bigger dining room for breakfast . More workers at the reception will improve to shorter the line and make the check inn more comfortable.

review.title: Great visit, great location
review.reviewText: Great stay at the hilton union square, check in was quick and easy, facilities were excellent (pool, gym, concierge) location was excellent for shopping, restaurants and bars. Easy acces to cable cars & busses to Fishermans wharf.

review.title: Nice hotel but very busy
review.reviewText: We arrived at this hotel on Monday 4th Aug to 8 Aug. it looks very impressive but is on. Very busy road. Some traffic can be heard from rooms. Plenty of elevators. The bedroom was roomy and nicely furnished with large telly, iron and board. Bathroom was clean. With fresh towels everyday. Has a Starbucks inside lobby  and bar and resteraunt called Urban Tavern. We decided to eat  at local places, all in all I enjoyed my stay here. Only down side it was very busy with conferences so lots of queuing.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms, the cleanliness and it was central to what we wanted.... Shopping!
review.negativeRemarks: I think some rooms could be updated, ours did have some wallpaper hanging off which wasn't. Nice and the curtains could do with being changed.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was near Union Square, very central for shopping but if you wanted to go sightseeing it was very handy for taxi cabs.

review.title: First time staying at a "Hilton" and the last.
review.reviewText: Some of the other hotel chains put the "Hilton" to shame.  Granted this Hilton is an older hotel, but the room sure needed updating.  The bathroom was dirty under the sink area with years of dirt build up.  The toilet ran all day and night.  The tub had seen it's day and the taps leaked.  So compare this to some of the less expensive hotels that cost a fraction of the cost and I'll stay at a Marriott any day.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: It was convenient for all my tours that I booked.  Drop up and off at the door.

review.title: Hôtel well located close to union square
review.reviewText: No free wifi, the parking is more than expensive. There is no fridge in the room.  The hotel is noisy, house keeping knocks the door early on the morning. I expected  better amenities from this kind of hotel.

review.title: Great hotel, shame about the desk staff.....
review.reviewText: All very good but really let down by poor desk staff.  Waiters, waitresses and cleaners all very nice.  Desk staff - we dealt with three were ignorant, didn't want to help and didn't know what to do...
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk
review.locationRemarks: Too much to write.  Right in the heart of the city and what a city!

review.reviewText: Very good, the  price was very high, and for a weekend, it was very crowded.

review.title: Overpriced
review.reviewText: The room was clean and good amenities, but the room was very small and had no view.  For ＄400 per night I though it was not acceptable. It's a gigantic hotel and the reception area was always full of people, it was understaffed to cater for a large number of people.

review.title: Massive, expensive, no-charm hotel
review.reviewText: I had a good time, but the lobby feels really crowded and the place has no charm. The location is good, but watch out in which direction you head at night. You may find yourself in the Tenderloin, surrounded by mental patients on the loose.

review.title: Close to everything but no free wifi in-room
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very well, walking distance to shopping, chinatown, etc.

Our room was in tower 3. It was small and the decor is old not like the ones in the pictures. On the other hand, it was very clean. Rooms in tower 1 looks more modern and similar to the pictures.

In-room internet is NOT free which is a big down for me. You can get free internet in the hotel lobby.

review.title: Very busy hotel!
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the hotel on a sightseeing trip for 4 nights. The location of the hotel for anyone wanting to explore the city is fantastic. A five minute walk to Union square. The hotel itself was very busy, the reception area was huge and had hundreds of people milling around. Looks as though there's a lot of conferences and the like going on. The room was ok, a bit dated but fine for what we needed as we only used it to sleep.
Internet was a nightmare. Couldn't get it in the room, and very slow in the reception area. Had to pay more for a room upgrade to get access.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, ideal for anyone visiting the city
review.negativeRemarks:
INTERNET ACCESS! 
Rooms could do with updating

review.title: Hilton Union Square San Francisco NOT RECOMMENDED!
review.reviewText: The Concierge was extremely unfriendly and not very helpful.  They continued to give us incorrect information.  Overall experience was less than satisfactory and I would not recommend this hotel.  Hilton always advertises themselves as the most friendly of hotels....well definitely not at Union Square in San Francisco!
review.negativeRemarks: Staff could be more friendly and especially the Concierge who should be required to attend customer service 101 classes!
review.locationRemarks: Good location to Union Square for shopping and dining.

review.title: Close to shopping and museums.
review.reviewText: I liked the hotel very much.  We had a very nice room.  You could tell the decode was a little dated.  However the hotel was clean.  The room was large.  We had two queen beds and a seating area.  I travelled for a class and took my two teenage daughters.  We shopped, went to museums and had a great time.  The urban tavern had great food.   We liked the fresh fruits and vegetables.  We enjoyed the pool and the work-out facilities.  I did not find the check-in or out crowded at all but perhaps we came and left at the right times.  We ate at 6 a.m. every morning so there were no lines.  We had a fabulous time and found the staff to be very helpful.  Great place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, nice for the price, close to everything for teenagers.
review.negativeRemarks: The decor was a little dated but it is San Francisco so everything is expensive.  I felt we got a lot of value for our money.
review.locationRemarks: We shopped at Neiman Marcus and other wonderful stores and enjoyed it.  We walked to the Asian museum of art.  We took the Uberx to other museums.

review.title: DON'T purchase the Continental Breakfast option
review.reviewText:
This is an expensive hotel but average in price for Union Square.  I had the option to book the continental breakfast option for 2 when there were 4 of us staying, so I did.  Bad idea.  That breakfast option was a certificate to the Starbucks in the lobby - - 1 beverage, 1 pastry, 1 banana - - that was it - - for $30 extra/night!! 
Our room was upgraded (Tower 2) but the hotel in general and throughout the meeting rooms especially could use some work.
Just be aware when you book, you can buy those same items from the Starbucks in the lobby for half the price without purchasing the "breakfast upgrade".

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Location is prefect. Close to all the shops and restaurants. So close to the Bart station. Overall amazing stay

review.title: Convenience At Its Finest
review.reviewText: Overall, I was very impressed with the Hilton Union Square. The location is incredibly central to everywhere I needed to go -- you're right next to Union Square, a short walk to the Financial District, and pretty much a quick cab ride to anywhere else in the city. I was staying in one of the urban contemporary rooms on the HHonors floor and it was lovely -- incredibly clean, simple design, and very quiet even though I was right on O'Farrell. I'm not sure I'd stay here on a romantic getaway, but for a business trip, it was the perfect fit.
review.positiveRemarks:
- Clean & simple room 
- Incredibly friendly & accomidating staff
- Hotel restaurant, Urban Tavern, had great food and awesome drinks
review.negativeRemarks: Signage to get to all of the different areas could be a bit more pronounced. It's such a large hotel w/ various towers that it's easy to get lost.
review.locationRemarks: Great location -- union square is two blocks away, financial district is a short walk, and everything else is pretty much a short cab drive away!

review.title: right downtown
review.reviewText: great location but not easy to navigate around town.  lobby too crowded, loud and lots of loiterers.  long lines at the front desk, starbucks and breakfast buffett.  not a place for families.

review.title: Hotel is ok, shame about the lobby!
review.reviewText: On the whole the hotel is quite good in regards to the bedroom, as the bed was very comfortable! What let it down is the lobby! More like being at a train station as there are many conferences being held there & star bucks! I've never seen such a big queue! You can only get wifi in the lobby, other Hiltons I have stayed at you get it in the room! The location of the hotel was good, but if I'd return I'd choose another hotel which was less busy.

review.title: Check bill before leaving
review.reviewText:
This hotel puts a hold of minimum $200 on your card to cover room incidentals , not advertised though.
When you check out, please make sure they release this bond, otherwise you wait weeks and many phone calls to get your money back into your account
The hotel close to everything.  Homeless next to hotel

review.title: Over crowded, small rooms , not value for money
review.reviewText:
Facilities not sufficient for size of hotel, long queues for breakfast and reception. We booked two rooms which were small and dated, not value for money plus car dented in the hotel car park. 
Not great experience and not in line with expectations of a Hilton.
review.negativeRemarks: Modernisation
review.locationRemarks: Short walk from Main Street

review.title: Convenient location to China town
review.reviewText:
Stayed in a modern room.   Good location though and nice facilities.  Breakfast seemed over priced so we ate out at another location closeby. Easy walk to China town. Lots of good restaurants within walking distance! 
Did not like that there was no lock on the bathroom door or a fan in the bathroom.  Also would have liked a microwave for the price we paid for the room.  Chose to park in city parking right across the street.  About $15.00 a day cheaper than what the Hilton was charging for parking.
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: In Union square so lots of shopping and lots of good eateries! Easy walking distance to China town.  On the cable car and BART route.

review.reviewText: Busy, lobby is crowded,  but overall very nice hotel

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Amazing staff, clean, and comfortable room. The hotel is close to attractions, restaurants, and bars. Check in and check out process was super easy. The staff was very knowledgeable and friendly.

review.title: good location - BAD rooms
review.reviewText: Hi - I just stayed at the Hilton Hotel Union Square in San Fran for a week. The location was great, close to everything. The rooms however, were a different story. You can tell that they have recently remodeled floors. Well the designer for the bathroom should be fired! The sink was so narrow and close to the edge, when washing my face or hands I ended up with more water on my toes then in the sink. The shower, toilet and open area in front of the sink were so close together that it was awkward to get ready in the morning. Trying to blow dry my hair, I either hit the glass shower door or the toilet with my elbows. There is no counter space in the bathroom, unless you wanted your toiletries against the toilet tank, which in my opinion is unsanitary. The electric plugs were also in a bad location for the bathroom, once plugged in to the outlet (which is deep into a small wooden shelf) you had no place to set your blow dryer or curling iron. Unless you have an extra-long cord you would have to hold it or place it in the sink.  If you are staying there for a day or two and have plans all over the city then you might be okay with the location. If you are there on business and need to be work ready for 6 days in a row choose another hotel…
review.positiveRemarks: The location and Starbucks (expect to pay $2 more per drink)
review.negativeRemarks: The Bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is right in the middle of great shopping and dining. Basically in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf and the Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: Very short stay
review.reviewText:
Handicap room - bathroom flooded when we showered
Rest of room ok
Nice view from 25th floor
We were there for a total of 14 hours
review.locationRemarks:
Difficult to park and parking very expensive
Not too far from pier

review.title: Big hotel in middle of town
review.reviewText: Huge pub that runs 24/7 with queues for breakfast that have to be seen to be believed.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a great location.  The room was comfortable.  The free Starbucks breakfast was nice.  Could not give five stars because we lugged six bags from taxi, propping open door for each other, to checkin to room with no assistance.   Same at check out.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Nice hotel just wished my room is facing the city not a wall.

review.title: Nice experience
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Close to food, shopping, and transportation.  I didn't like that I saw trash in the hallway, but other that the hotel was clean.  I also felt that the food prices were too high.  It was like $22 for eggs.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked that it was clean and close to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: The food prices for room service are too high.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to food and transportation and a 2 mile walk to Fisherman's Wharf, if you like walking

review.title: Easy to get around in town
review.reviewText: Definitely would stay there again easy to get everywhere to places!

review.title: Very expensive with very poor facilities
review.reviewText:
Extremely disappointing stay. No free wi-fi, no refrigerator in the room. The AC in the room was not working. Very bad service. No complimentary breakfast and to top it all had to pay $50 for the parking !!! 

Totally not worth the money.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve the amenities.

review.title: Worst Hotel Ever
review.reviewText: Everyone has a terrible attitude in the front desk, the rooms are like being in a box, the parking lot is ridiculous expensive for 2 nights we paid $107.  When I called the front desk trying to get a better room, they told me i had to pay more and that since I booked through Expedia they couldn't help much because it is not the preferred option to book this hotel, so why having it on this site.....Expedia i think this is something you guys must watch.  The only thing about this hotel was breakfast it was good, but since they couldn't have something good, they had the same exact breakfast the following day, nothing changed, so i'm wondering if those are the leftovers.  TERRIBLE HOTEL I DON'T RECOMMEND IT AT ALL THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EXPERIENCE!
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING

review.title: Nice hotel near the center of action.
review.reviewText: The hotel is the largest Hilton in San Francisco. It was close to the BART and all buses. Union Square was right around the corner.

review.title: GOOD CENTRAL HOTEL
review.reviewText:
HOTEL WAS VERY VERY BUSY AT ALL TIMES CHECK IN WAS QUICK AND EFFICIENT.OUR ROOM WAS VERY NICE ALTHOUGH THE VIEW WAS JUST ANOTHER OUTSIDE WALL BUT WE DID HAVE THE CHEAPER ROOMS! WE HAD A LOVELY COFFEE MAKER AND A BIG BATHROOM AND COMFORTABLE BEDS
THE HOTEL HAD A LOVELY SMALL BUT ADEQUATE SWIMMING POOL WITH PLENTY OF SUN BEDS GREAT AFTER A DAYS SIGHT SEEING
THE HOTEL WAS VERY CENTRAL AND THE SIGHTSEEING BUS STOPS OUTSIDE!
WOULD STAY AGAIN GOOD VALUE

review.title: Good overall
review.reviewText:
A nice hotel albeit in a dodgy area.

It was disappointing that having paid over £200 per night that the hotel wanted to charge extra for wifi. In this day and age this should be free for al guests.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location nice pool area nice rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi
review.locationRemarks: Near to Tenderloin which is a dodgy area but apart from that its a really good location and close to shops and transport links and bars and restaurant

review.reviewText: Room was really small for the price.Also he upgraded so we could use wifi  for 40 more dollars.  Didn't realize as soon as I walked in we could use it for free.
Hotel was huge and very crowded with business people while we were there on vacation.  work out room and starbucks on site were packed.
review.positiveRemarks: good location near San francisco Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: room size is small.  One bellman was really nice, another was rude.  Housekeeping was sitting in our room talking on the phone when we arrived.

review.title: Large central hotel
review.reviewText: Centrally located hotel but very large and impersonal - most staff v good but had 1 bad experience with the reception which was disappointing given the cost and supposed focus on customer service
review.negativeRemarks: Pool disappointing - one particular poor customer service
review.locationRemarks: Good local restaurants - but need to book

review.title: This hotel is too big!
