review.reviewText: Very hard to get personilized service. Concierge seem anoyed when we did not like the choice of restaurants he was presenting us and that we wanted to discuss it some more. There is a line-up for everything...

review.title: Not what I had expected out of a Hilton property
review.reviewText: Bad customer service. Rooms not cleaned completely, only beds were done and dirty glasses left in the room. Had to make several requests to send extra coffee creamer - which never came. Even the property is not as nice as a typical Hilton. Seems a bit run down with low customer service

review.title: Decent hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Much smaller than you'd expect from a standard Hilton. The rooms are dated and the view isn't spectacular, but it is nicer than most in the area. The lobby looks nice and there is a Starbucks. Close to Moscone and Union Square shopping. Beware the expensive parking.

review.title: Communist Block lives in San Francisco
review.reviewText: i expected the Hilton to be a plush postive hoilday experience set amidst one of the worlds beautiful cities, The Hotel lobby reminds one of a busy railway station complete with starbucks. the corridors upstairs reminded me of a 1960's east german apartment block, very drab and dark, almost sinister. The pool area reminded me of a high security prison yard. The sink in the room (1860) was tiny and looked like it came from a motor home (not a winnebago) there were two electrical sockets hanging loose from the wall, one of which was next to the sink.
review.negativeRemarks: fix the electrics, put in a regular sized sink, decorate in lighter colours to elevate the gloominess
review.locationRemarks: central to city ideal for tourists/business people

review.title: Overpriced....
review.reviewText: I know this is San Francisco but this was overpriced.  A bottle of water was $4 from the vending machine and wi-fi was $12.95 per device per day.  Parking was about $50 per day.  Overall, it just really added up for a room that was hardly big enough for 2 adults and 2 small children.  :(
Nice hotel, good restaurant, friendly staff. Bed a bit on the stuff side.

Hotel was massive had over 2000 rooms. I prefer the older rooms has they were much bigger then the newly renovated ones and the condition of those rooms where still good. Location of the hotel was excellent

review.title: Old Hotel in Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is over 50 years old and looks it. The Lobby is something out of a 1950s movie, dingy looking, very noisy, poor Customer Service. The room appeared to be upgraded, painted and new carpet but the bathroom is very old fashioned. Parking id $54.67 a day. REALLY!!!!!! Not a great value for what you pay.
review.positiveRemarks: It is located near the Train Station and is in a safe neighborhood.
review.negativeRemarks: The pricing of everything, room, parking, a medium size Starbucks Coffee is $4.50, just coffee.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Train Station and Cable Cars.

review.reviewText: Great hotel just a bit to close to the tenderloin!
Right in the heart of the city, close to transportation and attractions. Large hotel, but not too big that you get lost.

review.title: Stopover on our way home to winter!
review.reviewText: An uneventful 2 night stay. No issues. Lobby was a bit congested due to so many conferences on at the same time and staff seemed a bit flustered at times
review.negativeRemarks: Room decor is a bit tired
review.locationRemarks: Handy to everything

review.title: Nice hotel, strange location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and what you would expect from a Hilton. But it backed right on to an area called "the tenderloin" which is a less than desirable area. View from my room was of people sleeping on the street.

review.title: bad hotel
review.reviewText: very noisy.next room smoking all night with their door open.in the morning contraction above our room for two hours.

review.title: Hotel was ok. Location was great, but the room ok.
review.reviewText: Location was great, room had mold in the bathroom, rather off putting.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean bathrooms better.
review.locationRemarks: Close to a lot of the sites.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Central to most things, excellent beds very comfortable one big problem for us was there was no fridge or minibar snacks etc no options for discount on the breakfast buffet

review.title: Beautiful hotel in the perfect place
review.reviewText: If you want to be in the geo'center of San Francisco, this is the place to be.
review.positiveRemarks: It´s location, it is clean and spacious and modern rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: A minibar fridge inside the room.
review.locationRemarks: It is located at Union Square, lots of restaurants, shoppings, theathers, bars and things to do.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location especially if you wish to use the sightseeing buses. Restaurants are close by though better on Ellis street than union square. There is a lot of poverty close to the hotel however you do not feel hassled and it appears to be around all of the hotels and main restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Tower 1 halls need a refurb, though they are very clean.
review.locationRemarks: Lori's diner is a must for breakfast, literally 2 min walk om Mason Street

review.title: Always a comfortable stay
review.reviewText:
Huge hotel wich losts a bit of personal touch
Good location
Comfortable bed
In room wifi non existent but the lobby works well and is free as you can see as it always has stacks of people in it
Book Alcatraz befor you arrive !!!
The price through Expidia was the reason we booked here and weren't disappointed
All round good
review.negativeRemarks: In room wifi Why do they lock the fridge? As if any one is going to pay them $15 ha !

review.title: Holiday in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Everything was exceptional, from the comfort of my room to the hotel staff.

The location was convenient and view by the pool was very relaxing.

review.title: Great hotel for Bay to Breakers.
review.reviewText:
This is a VERY large hotel, which normally freaks me out. In the case of this Hilton however, I definitely felt some personal service going on. It's about 1.5 miles from the starting line of Bay to Breakers. That plus the price were our deciding factors.

Upon arrival, I was early and left my bags at the bell desk. They were taken care of until my room was ready - and it was ready 6 hours before check in. I was booked into tower 2, but asked to be put in 3 on the same floor as my friends were. They were able to accommodate with no problem.

I added my mom's name and a friends name to the room after I'd arrived. Everyone was able to get their keys at the front desk without a problem (which has been mucked up a few times at other hotels in my past experiences).

There is a Starbucks which opens at 6am inside the lobby, which is incredibly convenient. They will use your mobile app for payment.

The room was clean and comfortable - our room had no opening window, which is a bit of a downside. The a/c was pumping the whole time with no problem. Not sure if any of the rooms have working windows, but I would definitely ask for one if I booked again.

The hotel pool area is clean and pretty cute. Pool was a nice temp on a windy, slightly chilly day.

I would definitely stay here again, even if it wasn't for Bay to Breakers. Terrific Union Square location, just out of the super-heavy foot traffic.
review.negativeRemarks: Opening windows in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square - shopping, good restaurants.

review.title: Nice hotel, but too busy
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. The lines were very busy when waiting for service. Had to change rooms because of an add on to our reservation. Did this with plenty of time to adjust, but Hilton wouldn't let us stay in the one room.

review.title: Good hotel, but small rooms
review.reviewText: While the hotel was nice, professional staff, clean room, very comfortable beds, we were disappointed in the overall small dimension of the room and especially the very compact bathroom. For the price, a very small space to live in for a few days.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of the room.
review.locationRemarks: Central to downtown shopping.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: This was a GREAT HOTEL I will definitely stay here again. Loved it.

review.title: Great place to stay. Close to everything.
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff, great rooms, and close to everything.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is near by. Great location.

review.title: nice bay view and city view.
review.reviewText: the carpark is too expensive. The hotel check out system is very good.

review.title: Excellent location and so close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Very convenient - close by Union Square and Market Street Shops.

review.title: Nice hotel right in the heart of Union Square.
review.reviewText: I love the location of the hotel. It is within walking to Union Square and all the shops and restaurants around it. Clean room, helpful staff - it was a very pleasant experience.
review.negativeRemarks: None.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, easting and sightseeing.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is close enough to Union Square for easy access. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was pretty small but clean and comfortable. It looked like it had recently been updated.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the comfortable beds
review.negativeRemarks: The price of parking and making it clear that valet and self parking is around the back of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, trolley, and lots of shopping opportunities.

review.title: Great Location; Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful with extending our stay. Gym was beautiful
review.negativeRemarks: Vending machine prices were outrageous: $4 for a bottled water
review.locationRemarks: Water views, Alcatraz, Muir Woods, AT&T Park

review.title: great location!
review.reviewText: great location! walking distance to many restaurants, shopping, and clubs/bars!

review.title: Most comfortable beds!
review.reviewText: Huge conference crowd. We had breakfast in the room and spent $100.00 for coffee, a bowl of cereal, a yogurt parfait & 2 oatmeal!

review.title: Disappointed, and a let down for the Hilton brand.
review.reviewText:
Very poor experience, 1 hour to check in.
Not on Union Square, a block away and felt misled.
Old room, way to far from lobby.
Poor service.
Missed tour bus due to lack of signage and poor service.

Prefer Sheraton chain. Next stop Westin.
review.positiveRemarks: Not much - prefer Sheraton family of hotel now.
review.negativeRemarks: Dated hotel - needs a refurb. Staff also need some further Client Service training.
review.locationRemarks: Too far to union square,

review.reviewText: We had a great time! The view was great from our room and enjoyed our experience with the hotel.

review.title: Pleasant hotel,
review.reviewText: enjoyed our short stay but there was no decent indoor dining - the only one was quite poor menu not great

review.title: Hotel area
review.reviewText: Area surrounding the Hotel looks like a demilitarized zone.

review.title: Nice hotel accessible to major spots
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable, clean, and with plenty of natural light. Very pleasant staff. My only criticism, a very busy lobby area. Everything else was fantastic.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was perfect for my purpose.
review.negativeRemarks: The lobby area -too busy, too large.
review.locationRemarks: Eating, shopping, sightseeing, theater, pubs, music, public transportation.

review.title: Phone costs
review.reviewText: I am a Hilton Gold honors member but was charged so much for an international call from my room I could have flown back to the UK. Not good at all.

review.title: Great location near Union Square
review.reviewText: Clean renovated room, amiable staff, hassle free valet parking service, quick internet on all rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of rooms
review.locationRemarks: Union square shopping, great restaurants in neigborhood, San Francisco Landmarks within walking distance.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Security should try to keep homeless from hotel guests. Heard a lot of complaints.

review.title: Good location, Great View
review.reviewText: Great location in the heart of San Francisco only 15 minute walk to Pier 39 at Fisherman's Wharf. Worth a upgrade too.

review.title: Bad experience
review.reviewText: When we arrived the person standing at the door didn't help us, he told us he was going to call the bell hooper but it didn't happen we waited around 30 minutes, so I when in and told the receptionist and finally he called somebody. Then we went to the room everything was clean. But in the morning me and my uncle had a rash all over our bodies. I don't know if it was fleas or bud begs. Finally when we were trying to leave we asked the same man "leo" to get us a taxi to the airport, he told us that from the hotel there was no taxis to the airport and that we would have to ride on the hotel van that charges 75, in that moment a taxi arrived an I asked the taxi driver if he could take to the airport he told us off course, then Leo told us ok I will charge you 65 and I said no thank you. The taxi charged us 45. That's a bad hotel the want to rip you off and for 249 a night

review.title: Freindly staff
review.reviewText: The rooms are very clean. (new construction). Great views of the city and with in two blocks of union square. Public parking across the street.

review.title: not what i expected
review.reviewText: when we arrived the frontdesk told us that we were going to be in different floors i was with my children i reacted then i was told to upgrade my room so that we will be in the same floor an additional 100$ was charged. but the hotel is situated in a safe place even the police goes inside the hotel from time to time

review.title: Short stay at the Hilton
review.reviewText:
I was looking forward to staying at the Hilton and had a certain expectation for a 5 star property. My planned six night stay was cut to two nights after no sleep on night 1 due to a unexpected constant droning sound in my room. I was 'upgraded' to an alternative room for the remainder of my stay only to have an air conditoning unit that sounded like an old red rattler train (even after amintenance had been to fix it) and directly near the lift well with lifts constantly goingup and down all night. I checked out the next day with the help fo the wonderful support team at Expedia who neotiated for a full refund for the remainder of my booking - thank you so much Angelie and Expedia.
I think that the hotel is much too big to offer proper 5 star service.
review.positiveRemarks: Originally i liked the location but after no sleep for two nights I was no impressed,
review.negativeRemarks: Not sure that there is much they can do as the property is large and has to cater for loads of people but I wouldnt say that it was a 5 star property
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is close to Union Squre, the shopping district, the Powell street cable car and F1 line down to Fishermans Wharf

review.title: Large hotel in a good position for exploring
review.reviewText: Close to all transport. Able to walk to union square and fishermans wharf

review.title: Great Hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful experience at the Hilton San Francisco Union Square hotel. Everything about our stay was excellent. Check in and check out was easy. Our room was really comfortable. We had sufficient outlets to charge our IPhone, IPad and Kindles. The bathroom shower was superb. The location was ideal for our sightseeing activities. Would go back to stay there in a heartbeat.

review.title: Nice hotel within walking distance to Moscone
review.reviewText: The Hilton was a nice hotel within walking distance to the Moscone Center where a conference was being held - so that convenience was a big plus. The staff was friendly and checkin/check out was pretty painless. I didn't have a car so I can't speak to the parking situation, but taxis were always available if needed right outside the building.
review.negativeRemarks: It's 2014, free internet in the hotel room should be a staple at any hotel. I find it slightly ridiculous to have to pay $12/day for in room internet

review.title: Good value, downtown……close to Union Square
review.reviewText: You either want a rating or an essay….make up your mind

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice. Were able to check in early (10 am) at a nominal fee of $25.We found a few pieces of broken glass on the bathroom floor, staff came to clean it within 15 minutes. They let us have a very late check out free of charge. On our last day, the bath tub handle broke off. It's a bit of an older hotel but still nice and clean. Was a bit surprised at all of the little charges for WiFi and received parcels. I've been to nice hotels where this is all part of the service and hospitality. BUT the location is fantastic, walking distance to shopping on Market street, Financial District, China Town, Ferry Building and if you're feeling adventurous, even Fisherman's Warf.

review.title: Big and Busy
review.reviewText: A very large hotel and very busy, even chaotic. People everywhere. It was difficult to walk across the lobby. The staff was adequately pleasant, but not genuinely so. SF is known for great hotels. I have stayed in some. This is not a great hotel, but it is in a great location, close to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: It was not a smooth operation and needed more hospitality staff.
review.locationRemarks: It was in the heart of San Francisco, surrounded by many of the city's attractions and public transportation.

review.title: Tis a Ship I Say
review.reviewText: The rooms are narrow like a cabin on a ship. Takes 5 minutes to get hot water to flow on 17th floor with weak water pressure. There was a Conference hosted at the hotel so we couldnt even get a coffee without waiting forever in the lobby. There is no way this Hilton should be a 4 star hotel. Go to the Nikko Hotel next door and skip Grand Central Station-Hilton
review.negativeRemarks: This hotel should be a 3 star and cost 100-150 USD at best. Fix the hot water and pressure to start.
review.locationRemarks: good location near Union Square

review.title: I enjoyed my stay at the Hilton in Union Square.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and clean. My room was great. There was a lot of restaurants and shops in the area. The parking garage was nice too. I would recommend this hotel and stay again.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of restaurants and plenty of shops.

review.title: At a stone throw from Union Square!
review.reviewText: Although the hotel doesn't look as new as it once was, it still looks very elegant and distinguished. But don't be misguided by its looks, it is even more functional than good looking. Whether you're visiting San Francisco as tourist or for business, Hilton at Union Square is a great choice.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff makes (sometimes) a little mess outside the hotel. It gets a bit uncomfortable to walk out and try to get a cab
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for shopping and dinning. Also, a great base for your business trip

review.title: Good stay with family
review.reviewText: Late check in(around 11:00 p.m.) was smooth with no waiting time. Room was compact but comfortable. The temperature of hot water keep high during 4 persons taking bath and shower. Doormen suggested us to borrow umbrella when we were going outside without them. It was very helpful because it was whole rain day. We would like to come back to this hotel if any chance.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to main attraction in S.F. downtown.
review.negativeRemarks: Free WiFi to be available at the room.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText:
Poor water pressure in the shower.
Great location

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: The hotel was easily accessible to public transportation and close enough to walk to Fisherman's Wharf. However, if you took a wrong turn, the neighborhood was pretty sketchy. Overall, it was a good hotel.

review.title: Great hotel with a great location
review.reviewText: There are tons of rooms here and it is in a great location.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: nice stay, location is excellent, clean room, will recommend to friend.
review.negativeRemarks: I do not like the bathroom layout, expecially the toilet bowl
review.locationRemarks: shopping

review.title: Weekend in SFO
review.reviewText:
Everything was what you would expect of a Hilton - which is good overall. Unfortunately, a neighboring room decided to have a party at 3:30AM. Called the hotel operator at 3:50 to notify security. No one showed up so I called Security directly at 4:10 and a guard arrived at 4:30. Once they showed up everything got very quiet very quickly. Can't blame Hilton for the idiots next door, but the response time could be improved. On another similar note, our room backed up to the housekeeping storage room. Not a bad thing until housekeeping showed up Sunday morning and started moving their large linen carts. They banged them against the wall that was our headboard which cut off any chance of sleeping in due to the late night partiers. Talked with the housekeeping staff and they immediately stopped and apologized.

I'd go there again - just might ask for a room away from housekeeping and idiots...
review.positiveRemarks: Linens, restroom cleanliness and newness of rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Abandon rooms that have a view of the HVAC equipment (i.e. Tower 3, tenth floor, room 30). If we'd spent more time in the room, I'd ask to move
review.locationRemarks: Farmers market on Saturday!!!!!!

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: We stayed on a Saturday night. The room next to use had a huge party in their room and in the hall from 2am til 4am. I finally called the hotel desk at 4am and security was on their way already. I know it is not the hotels fault, but feel they could have handled it sooner. The walls are super thin.

review.title: Snotty Staff
review.reviewText: I was really disappointed with my experience at the Hilton this past weekend. I usually stay at the Hyatt Regency, but was meeting a friend who was here on business and decided to stay at the same hotel she was at. The staff seemed so put out that any of us were there. I am always very friendly and pretty easy going, knowing that it isn't easy for people in the service industry, but even as a guest making no demands, I felt they were looking down on us. My disappointment was such that I will not be returning to this hotel anytime soon. There are plenty of excellent options in the city and I prefer to have people who at least pretend they're happy to check me into my room. I would recommend the Hyatt, Le Meridien, or the W to anyone looking for a place to stay over this Hilton.
review.positiveRemarks: The valet staff were wonderful and fast. The saltwater pool was lovely and warm. A full service Starbucks is always a welcome sight for me!
review.negativeRemarks: The attitude of the staff. As a whole, they were unpleasant.
review.locationRemarks: It's right at Union Square. If you want to shop or visit Chinatown, this is a good central location for it.

review.title: Convenient near union square.
review.reviewText: I have stayed here 2 times in the past 6 months. It is a nice property, good size rooms, convenient location.
review.negativeRemarks: More staff/machines at Starbucks. Line always long during peek times.
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks from union Square.

review.title: Good experience.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel conveniently located in Union Square, close to lots of restaurants and shopping. Great amenities. Clean and comfortable room. Nice heated outdoor pool and jacuzzi.

review.title: Very close to tenderloin. Wish I knew.
review.reviewText:
This hotel was a stones throw away from the notorious Tenderloin, which is the bum area. They have lots of soup kitchens there we heard and so all the homeless people are here. It was kind of a good and bad thing. If you turn right out of the hotel, you are close to Union Square. But if you turn left you're in tenderloin. Everyone told us not to walk around this area at night. I wish I knew how close it was! I think I would have stayed somewhere else. The good thing was we were close to the cable car and muni buses to hop on to go around the city. I guess you can't really avoid the homeless problem in San Francisco!

The hotel had a nice pool and a hot tub. Only one hot tub though so it for quite busy in the evenings. I wish the pool and hot tub were open later. They are open from 5am-9pm.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to Union Square and Chinatown.
review.reviewText: Walking distance to Union Square, Market street, Boutique Stores, Chinatown, good food around the block. You do not need to rent a car. Transportation to Airport excellent provided by the Hotel at reasonable price -$40 dlls. Breakfast or Dinner at Lori's vintage restaurant. 20 minutes to the airport. Union square you can eat at the Cheese Factory cake, Best burgers, Pizza. Tours stop by the Hotel or go to Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: Service, room, customer service helps you to get tours, rooms are large for four people, 2 queens beds, with pillows.
review.negativeRemarks: I wanted to call Service room to get a blanket, phone was dead.
review.locationRemarks: You can go anywhere from here, Chinatown is 10 minutes walking, Union Square is 4 blocks, you can take F route to the Embarcadero.

review.title: Nice hotel near union square
review.reviewText: Affordable hotel near union square, the cable cars, and the heart of town. Rooms were nice but still affordable. WiFi is a bit of a joke as both the basic ($13 a day) and premium service ($17 a day) were too slow to do anything.

review.title: What A Great Birthday Memories
review.reviewText: I asked the hotel to help me celebrate my husband 40th surprise birthday trip. We arrived to the room and there's a champagne, with chocolates strawberries and card that said happy birthday to him. He was very surprised and extremely happy. Thanks so much hilton for a great service! Outstanding!

review.title: Very nice.
review.reviewText: Great experience. Great staff. Quiet atmosphere. I'm finished with this evaluation. Stop asking for more information.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I would recommend. Nice location noce room size and amenities

review.title: Nice Hotel and a great location
review.reviewText:
The Hotel and amenities were great. We upgraded our room when we arrived to a suite, which was huge!! The location is great too, very close to Union Square and the cable car stops.
I read lots of comments that it was noisy, but I couldn't hear a thing.
The staff were also lovely and helpful. Would definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the size of the rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe free wifi, it's a bit expensive although it is free in the lobby
review.locationRemarks: Cable car stops are close and very easy to get to Chinatown and Fishermans Wharf. Close to shopping and heaps of restaurants.

review.title: Weekend Trip
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Close to everything. They have a super shuttle every 20 mins so I didn't even need to make reservations for a ride to SFO. Close to Tenderloin though so be careful to map your visits around town.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Great location and great service. Starbucks inside and concierge was beyond helpful!

review.title: Next time Raddison @ fishermans warf
review.reviewText: The hotel and room were fine, but $54 dollars to park in the hotel parking structure overnight is outrageous.

review.title: Not a great area...
review.reviewText: It was a bad move for me to book the hotel through Expedia . We booked two nights at the hilton in San Fran and we were not happy with them at all. We immediately tried to cancel the second night, but because we prepaid through expedia, we were not able to, so we just lost $250. Next time I'll book directly through the hotel. They charge too much for wifi and $59 a night for parking. Those numbers should be shown up front

review.title: Good stay except..
review.reviewText: The room was great, we had late nites with meetings and house cleaning is knocking on your door at 8:30 in the morning to clean your room!! Check out isn't till noon...

review.title: It is a very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: I enjoyed the stay. The check in and out were very easy and the staffs at the desk were all very nice. The room was clean and quiet. It was rather surprising, though, the overnight parking per nite was $46 each night. I supoise that is the giubg rate for San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the center of downtown shopping and good restaurants. 6 easy walking to Moscone Center where many trade shows are conducted.

review.title: Falling Behind the Times
review.reviewText: One of Hitlon's older hotels that they are not investing in. You are paying only for location. Hotel is straight out of the 1980s. Old beds, old furniture, old bathrooms, old food, old smells and old service.
review.negativeRemarks: See above.
review.locationRemarks: Meh.

review.title: Great hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: I recently stayed at the Union Square Hilton Hotel in San Francisco this past weekend with my friend. We came to visit San Francisco as a small weekend getaway from school and work. We arrived on Friday afternoon around 2pm and was able to check in early rather than 3pm. I booked a one bedroom with a King bed. When we got up to the room, it was clean and pretty cozy. The view was pleasant as we were able to see cars and people passing. When checking out the room, I realized that the bathroom door hinge was broken and there was a piece missing where the lock was supposed to be. I did not think it was that big of a deal so I did not bother calling it in. My friend and I left for dinner around 5pm. By the time we got back to the hotel, it was already around 10pm and we decided to watch some TV. I noticed that the channels were staticy and jumpy (as in the pictures would freeze and skip every time). This got annoying and we thought it would go away after awhile. About 20 minutes has passed and it kept on freezing on every channel so I decided to call the front desk for some assistance. Even though it was close to midnight, they were able to send a technician up to try and fix the problem. The technician came within 10 minutes and he said the connection was bad and someone can come in the morning to fix it. He was able to adjust the wiring so that the problem was fixed. He felt bad and gave us 2 complimentary full breakfast vouchers. Overall, a great hotel with great service.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the friendly staff and modern feel. I always loved staying at Hilton Hotels as they are luxurious and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms should be checked more often to make sure everything is in tact and not broken. For example, restroom door lock and TV (bad connection).
review.locationRemarks: Since this hotel is right in Union Square, everything you can imagine is within walking distance. I was able to eat and shop all on foot.

review.title: After All it is San Francisco
review.reviewText: Did two nights this time in the SF Hilton Union Square. This is my second time in this hotel and may be my last. Don't get me wrong, it is a very nice hotel, just off Union Square, but the rooms are small even after paying $40 per night for an upgraded room. What the $40 got me was a WIFI connection which I could have purchased for $16.95. Most hotels offer it for nothing but this is San Francisco. The staff was great and check-in and check-out was easy and expedient. . The room was the same size and configuration as the basic room on my earlier stay. The room was very clean, plainly appointed with a very comfortable bed. The bath was very small with the basin partially over the tank of the toilet. The shower was nice and fairly large with nice towels. Parking was $52 dollars per night plus tax which actually brings it to almost $60. Once again don't get me wrong, after all it is San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Reasonable WIFI rates

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Everything are very clean and conformable but the Parking is too expensive and the area its a little danger.
review.negativeRemarks: Low parking prices.
review.locationRemarks: Close of Market street, cable car station, union square...

review.title: bad begining..
review.reviewText:
first of all, when we wanted to check-in, they coldnt find my rez.that i did via from you.although i showed my confirmation mail from you, they said after i made rez. they sold the rooms by mistake.then me and my family (with my 4 years old son) had to wait to find room in front
of reception.
secondly, no mini bar in room, when i ask they bring a mini bar for 15 dollars, which is so weird ,plugged a mini bar like a 2 star ugly room.this is not my first experience in Hilton. but as a downtown hotel with this price,having no internet,andminibar was suprising me.
i will complain this rez. problem in tripadvisor too. what happened to my rez., is not my deal, it is between you and Hilton,as a guest i am not supposed to wait there after a long trip with kid.
review.locationRemarks: location is nice.

review.title: 2 night Family City Break
review.reviewText: After a long journey, the check in staff were not very welcoming, but the concierge were helpful and funny. The only thing about the room was that one of the bed sheets was ripped, it was at the bottom and I didn't mention it.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is fantastic. Mostly friendly staff.
review.locationRemarks: We didn't know where to go for breakfast and was discussing it on the way out when one of the security guards overheard us and told us to go round the

review.title: Nice hotel it would be nice if it include WiFi
review.reviewText: Hotel nice and clean close to everything I would recommend for friends to stay there

review.title: Not 4 star quality
review.reviewText: Very Tired. Needs an update. Dirty walls and carpet. Ripped bed skirt. View of parking garage. Lobby is dirty. More of a three star hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The Urban Bar next door. That was new. Starbucks in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: OVERHALL THE ENTIRE HOTEL, new decor, new carpets, Paint., Decor.....
review.locationRemarks: A little to close to the Tenderloin Section of the city. Lots of homeless people asking for money.

review.title: Perfect spot in union square
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton. The room was clean and nice. During the night we experienced some disturbing machinery kind of noise and discovered it was coming from the central air. We had to turn off our central air to stop the noise. Some of the channels from the television was not working and kept saying no signal throughout the whole weekend we have stayed. I would have given them a perfect score if they would fix some of the stuff in the hotel/rooms

review.title: Nice hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel it's in walking distance of everything . The staff is very nice and the rooms are clean

review.title: Located in a great area near Union Square
review.reviewText: The lobby is nice our room was horrible. Looked like a motel room. I understand it's a old building but it doesn't have to look old. Pillows so lumpy had to not use them and it was so noisy had to use ear plugs. Noise from hotel not the outside.

review.title: good service
review.reviewText:
although a breif stay ( 2 days ) , it was a pretty pleasant stay , only thing I paid $ 54.00 for breakfast .
I ordered salmon , coffee and orange juice and the bill was $ 54.00., A LITTLE PRICY FOR BREAKFAST !!!!
review.positiveRemarks: decent environmnet , although the lobby looked like a train station
review.negativeRemarks: get rid of the people haning around in the lobby
review.locationRemarks: convenient for shopping and eating out

review.title: Convenient to downtown, within walking distance t
review.reviewText: Some confusion about continental breakfast . We paid for our coffee at Starbucks .

review.title: Great hotel w/in walking distance of Union Square
review.reviewText: Had a great weekend for my wife's 50th. Upgraded our room for free.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Moscone
review.reviewText: Conveniently located next to Moscone as well as Union Square Park. Great food in the vicinity as well as shopping.
review.positiveRemarks: They had a good deal, where a $25 donation to the American Heart Association allowed me to access wi-fi for free for 6 days on unlimited devices :)
review.negativeRemarks: $13 for wi-fi per night per gadget is ridiculous.

review.title: Union Square Hilton
review.reviewText: The best thing is the staff. This hotel is ALWAYS crowded with conventions but the staff are always very helpful. Great location - walking distance to my office and good restaurants/shopping.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square a few blocks away with access to the cable cars.

review.title: excellent
review.reviewText: 

review.title: Overpriced second class hotel
review.reviewText:
Pro:
Staff were really lovely.
Location
Easy fast checkout
Comfy beds

Con:
NO FREE WIFI. Ridiculous. Must be a gold hhonors member (stay 15+nights in Hilton's/year). It needs to be included. Enough said.
Shoddy coffee/tea setup, cheap paper cups.
No fridge in room.
No robes.
Front desk didn't have earplugs (!!!) which were necessary for our room, located adjacent to noisy lifts.

review.title: Good location. Aging a little.
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a good spot. Staff were friendly and helpful. Our room had a great view. But, we could hear the wind whistling through the night. The AC fan was not loud enough to drown it out. Probably time for maintenance on the window seals. Overall, it was a good place to stay.

review.title: Good location. Good price. Very clean.
review.reviewText: Easy to get to. Close to everything I needed. Friendly staff. Clean room. Very nice room and bathroom. Good workout room. Nice pool.
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks from Union Square, Trolly.

review.title: Star Rating is misleading
review.reviewText:
This was the first time I booked through Expedia and I was disappointed with the hotel. I feel like it should not be in a 4 stars category, it belongs in a 3 stars.

The hotel did not provide the basic necessities like glasses or bathrobe, broken hair dryer, shower's faucet was not working right (can't control the water temperature). The room overall is out dated, sink is cracked, need remodel for sure. The hotel should be checking to make sure that everything is in working condition before putting guest into it.

Expressed the unhappiness at check out time with staff and she didn't seem to care, very disappointed with The Hilton and will not stay here again or book with Expedia again.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide the bare necessities so the guests don't have to ask for them. Check the room to make sure everything is in working order.

review.title: Friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Was able to check in early. Was able to upgrafe to 2 queen size beds.

review.title: Good but not great
review.reviewText: Our room was dusty under things and we had cool showers
review.positiveRemarks: Good price.. liked the starbucks in the lobby
review.locationRemarks: Great location.. close to shopping and good restaurants

review.title: In the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great stay, courteous and helpful staff from the minute you arrive. Nothing is a problem for them.

review.title: Good location, no fridge/bottle water in room.
review.reviewText: We stayed for a weekend, the location was good, close to the Bart station, we were on the 27th floor so the view was nice. However there was no fridge/bottle water in room which I think is not usual for a nice hotel at this price.

review.title: Nice hotel in great location
review.reviewText: It'a a nice hotel in a really great location. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable. View was pretty decent. Hotel staff was very nice. My only two complaints were that the zip checkout didn't work and we ended up having to go to the desk anyway, and the overnight parking is very expensive, not that that's completely unexpected in the area, just a little higher than I would have liked.

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: It was perfect..we go to SF once a year for our anniversary and we will always stay at the Hilton from now on.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was nice and cozy!
review.negativeRemarks: NA
review.locationRemarks: It's the city...your just a cab ride away from anything.

review.title: Great location, central to many activities....
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, everything was great
review.locationRemarks: The trolley car was near by, the Warf, park, shopping, and food.

review.title: very convenient location
review.reviewText:
The stay was fine due to the convenience to go everywhere within walking distance.

But its is very noisy at night when we are trying to sleep. The rooms are not sound proof. I can hear other rooms taking showers, flushing toilets, screaming and laughing. It is hard to get a peaceful sleep.Can also hear police cars sirens on the street from the 12th floor.
review.negativeRemarks: sound proof rooms and windows
review.locationRemarks: lots of shopping and restaurants

review.title: good experience
review.reviewText: 2 blocks from Union Square, clean room, bathroom a little small.
Overcharged for the room
review.negativeRemarks: Better guest treatment Wifi in rooms

review.title: Old Building, Poorly Maintained Room, Bad Service
review.reviewText:
I found out that one of the 2 bed side lamps was not working, so I told a bellboy about it. He said he'd send an engineer right away. The engineer never showed up. Next morning, I told a housekeeper on a hallway about the same exact thing, she said she'd talk to the engineer. I wanted to make sure that the bulb of the lamp was to be replaced, so I left a message next to tips on bed, "please replace the bed side lamps's bulb". The bulb was never replaced. The memo was left on the side, but tips were taken.
Rooms are so old that I could hear my neighbors, elevator operating, people shutting their doors. There was a bath tub which didn't hold water right, so I couldn't soak my body in it after a long day of walking.
Someone started party middle of the night, and it was LOUD. It took security over an hour to take care of the situation.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing. I always liked Hilton. I have stayed at Hilton in many different cities and countries, but This Hilton gives a bad name to other Hiltons.
review.negativeRemarks: Building, Rooms, People who work there. They should all be improved if they want to keep their customers come back.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great. It's near union square.

review.title: You get back every penny you pay for!
review.reviewText: If you want to be in the heart of the bustling San Fran city, with great food at your door step and a great nightlife scene around you, in the comfort of a great room, and are happy to pay for it, this place is for you. The staff are HELPFUL and when I say that I mean - help you get an idea of how to get around, tour bookings, transportation, general queries, check-ins etc - you name it, and they will do it!! Will be staying here if I ever visit again!

review.title: Corridors all a bit dated and needing upgrade!
review.reviewText: A good hotel in central location - unfortunately the hotel is close to the area where the homeless hang out ( in sizeable numbers) - and although not troublesome they are highly vocal all night!
review.positiveRemarks: OK - paying for wifi in room means the lobby is full of people tapping away like zombies!
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi in the bedrooms - it's 2014 for goodness sake!
review.locationRemarks: See first comment

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very polite and friendly staff, quiet and clean room

review.title: Nice. Close to mall
review.reviewText: It was nice

review.title: Very good situated
review.reviewText:
It was great,staff was excellent.
The hotel needs a laundry and the rooms are to small for a family of 4 (they should not rent a room like that for a family of 4 ) and the parking is to expensive for 6 days I paid $. 322.00
review.positiveRemarks: Nice, very good breakfast, feels safe, excellent service every where front desk, restaurant etc.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms are to small for a family of 4 and a laundry
review.locationRemarks: Good, but you have to go in the city.

review.title: Holiday getaway

review.title: Great Location... Great Place...
review.reviewText:
The Staff! The Staff! The Staff!

I stay at the Hilton SF 3x a year for the past decade and always have the best experience. Get a suite and all is amazing! Views... Views... Views!

review.title: Very old
review.reviewText: This place is run down needs a renovation.

review.title: Close to shops
review.reviewText: Hotel was close to the shops. In the bathroom, it would have been nice to have face cloths. Also found the shower to be very strong.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Close to Stores and Union Square. Parking is $53 dollars @ the hotel so I will recommend parking somewhere else.

review.title: Reasonable Hotel
review.reviewText: There are other nicer hotels in this area; this facility just 'shows' its age in decor, construction. Convenient location however.

review.title: Small and uncomfortable
review.reviewText: Room was very small and bathroom was even smaller. We would open the room door to hit the bathroom door. I think a Maid came in and said nothing to us while we were watching TV. Luckily the door had the hinge on and when I opened it. There was no one in sight. No view to speak of. Cramped and walls looked dirty. Bed sheets looked old and moth eaten. Internet was expensive when it was said wifi included meant a charge.

review.title: Hotel not as advertised
review.reviewText: The hotel info says free wi fi. It is 12.95 a day. The free wi fi is only in the lobby. Hotel staff were not friendly. Hotel was located in the tenderloin, the worst part of San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Be honest with there website. Get a friendly staff.

review.title: Incredible Views, excellent staff and facilities
review.reviewText: We upgraded to a room on the 34th floor. The panoramic views of the city and bay were incredible. The balcony actually opened right out so it was lovely to get the breeze. The staff were really lovely and helpful. The place was very busy when were were there. Starbucks in the main lobby is a nice touch… and of course it's very close to tourist attractions in the middle of the city. Great!

review.title: Good location, but needs renovatio n
review.reviewText: 2 blocks from union square, so good location. Hotel hallways, pool, facilites, room were a bit out dated n needed a renovation. Paid for a 4 star room but was pretty small, no mini fridge or space to relax. Have stayed in SF before at the Westin in financial district n the hotel n room was much better but i wanted a location closer to union square this time. Its an ok hotel but wouldnt stay there again for the price ($229.00/night, 12/24 to 12/28) tues to sat.

review.title: Close to Union Square and shopping.
review.reviewText: We had a very nice experience. We went to see a matinee and then to Zingari restaraunt around the corner.
review.positiveRemarks: The parking lot was great and reasonable for San Francisco. Starbucks in the lobby!
review.negativeRemarks: The adjoining resttaraunt was the only food option--pricey and crowded for a Saturday night.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Theater District, many very good restaraunts within walking distance.

review.title: Close to shopping
review.reviewText: Shower curtain was drity not enough towels given clean lady kept walking in our room very early in the morning.

review.title: great hotel
review.positiveRemarks: free cont breakfast but it would be better if in restaurant
Hotel was nice, really friendly and helpful staff, great gym facilities and comfy beds. Would recommend!
review.negativeRemarks: Only minor issue- cleaners came quite late in the day and we were already back in our room by the time they got there.
review.locationRemarks: Great central location, many attractions in walking distance and buses are easy to catch.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was helpful and professional. Room was clean and spacious. Exercise room was excellent. Definitely recommend hotel for the price.

review.title: Stones throw from union square
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice as you would expect from Hilton. The location was great, very close to the action of Union Square. Was a little let down by the cleanliness of the room specifically the sheets had a few stains. Having said that I would still go back.

review.title: Strange. They gave us the smallest room in hotek
review.reviewText: We have stayed here many times and like the central location. Our room was tiny and the bathroom was a few ft from the bed. So if one got up and turned in the bath light, it definitely woke the other

review.title: Nice Hotel...right near all the shopping
review.reviewText: I have stayed here several times. Always very professional and clean. Location is right near all the shopping. Not super expensive.

review.title: Good location for a family vacation
review.reviewText:
We stayed at Hilton Union Square 3 nights for a short San Francisco vacation. It is only a few blocks away from the Union Square shopping area, and about 15 min walk to Chinatown.

As for the hotel itself, it meets my expectation of a Hilton. It couldn't go wrong by staying at a Hilton.
review.locationRemarks: - Huge pepper & salt crab at R&G Lounge in Chinatown. Ask concierge to make reservation. - Huge Macy's. It even has a separate Macy's for Men.

review.positiveRemarks: I liked the Christmas décor in the lobby. Also, the staff was very nice and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Bath room door lock. Starbucks to stay open a little later at night.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square, Westfield shopping, ice skating, cable cars and restaurants. .

review.title: We were in SF for a concert.
review.reviewText:
When we arrived there was a long line of people checking in. Apparently this was a big shopping weekend before Christmas and there was a function going on where everyone was dressed up as Santa.
The line moved along fairly quickly and the staff was pleasant. Unfortunate for us, the parking gaage was full so we had to find an alternate garage. We did and it was just across the street.
review.positiveRemarks: It was centrally located, it was clean and it was very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: My husband did not have any hot water for a shower.
review.locationRemarks: We went to a concert which was walking distance.

review.title: Nice loby...standard clean roon. Nothing fancy
Merry Christmas to you too, Hilton.
review.reviewText: Christmas time in San Francisco is busy. Yeah, we get it. But I don't need the valet of the Hilton telling me that the parking lot is full and our guess to where to park is as good as his. Or that it's the million dollar question because that's rude. When I checked in they didn't have the King Bed Suite I reserved but instead I got 2 doubles. We were told we got an updated room but when we checked in it looked like the room had seen better days. And you didn't fool me, Hilton. I can tell you cheaped out of the beds because they were not comfortable. Lastly, the up and down channel changer on the remote was broken. Probably would not stay at this hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds were not as comfortable as other Hiltons I've stayed in. The valet crew were extremely rude.

review.title: Busy Holiday weekend
review.reviewText: I am a Gold status Hilton honors and I was put in a room that did not even have a mini bar, no glasses for water or cups for the coffee. The check in line was so long and the next morning breakfast had a huge line as well so I ended up just leaving.

Very convenient to restaurants and shopping. We took the cable car from near the hotel to Fisherman's Wharf. Very easy to do. Wish we knew about the parking situation before arriving at the hotel. We stopped at the front door thinking someone would take care of our luggage and car, but were told to make 2 rights and go into the parking garage.
review.negativeRemarks: Notification about parking situation before arriving at hotel. More places to eat in the hotel.

review.title: Minimalism to the max
review.reviewText: Our junior suite was on the 19th floor. No problem: there are lots of elevators and they are speedy! The name "junior suite" brought to mind something other that the starkly bare room we were assigned. To say that the décor was minimalist is not overstating the Spartan furnishings. Everything we needed was there: 1 king bed, 2 easy chairs, a desk with chair, a TV on a credenza, and 4 lamps. And an even more minimal bathroom. Sitting on the toilet in the junior suite meant that your shoulder touched the wall while your head touched the towel rack. On the other hand, the room was more than large enough. What there was plenty of was noise: very noisy elevators and very noisy guests. We also had an excellent view of the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is very close to Union Square.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to Fisherman's Wharf through Chinatown.

review.title: Nice location, but...
review.reviewText: The hotel stay was comfortable and very conveniently located to the Union Square area, but the stay did not include breakfast and the buffet breakfast was either $23 or $29 each and it did not include airport shuttle bus, although a town car was available for a price. I would stay there again but would look for a better deal that included at least a continental breakfast and airport shuttle.
review.negativeRemarks: include breakfast and airport shuttle
review.locationRemarks: Within 3 blocks of the Powell St Cable Car stop, BART and Market St bus lines. Great Location. Lots of shopping along Market St. Lots of food, too.

review.title: Bad hotel
review.reviewText: I thought that Hilton was amazing but wasn't a good hotel. Be careful and check all your options before buy an room.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was awful
review.locationRemarks: The location is good but you can find a good hotel there too.

review.title: Nice stay in SF
review.reviewText: The only that I disliked was the poor bathroom door. It did not stay open and would always slam shut. Otherwise, great hotel.

review.title: Close to union square
review.reviewText: I was here for a conference and the hotel was nice. Chinatown was about a 15 minute walk, union square and Bart station were about 5 minute walks. The only thing I might say is that the bathroom was really small, but fine for one person.
A very pleasant and reasonably priced hotel stay. I'm sure we'll stay for next the Thanksgiving holiday.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed and pillows. The lobby and bar area is pleasant and attractive
review.negativeRemarks: We didn't have any drinking glasses in the room though we didn't ask for any
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was convenient to everything for Black Friday shopping

review.reviewText: pleasant. Cleaning staff was noisy in the morning but otherwise quite pleasant.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: It's was overall a really nice stay

review.title: Nice, clean hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hilton for one night to explore the city. It was centrally located for what we wanted to accomplish. Steps away from Union Square and the cable cars and close enough to everything else. We felt safe and secure and didn't have any issues with noise. The front desk check in was quick, easy and the staff was friendly and welcoming. The lobby is busy, as we would expect in the city. The room was nice and comfortable and we slept well on the beds. If you get cold when you sleep, you might want to call and ask for a blanket (or turn the temp up in your room) but we were comfortable. The water pressure in the shower was awesome. We had everything we needed for a quick stay. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone. We were in tower 2, 14th floor. View not great but we were just there to sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything and cable cars will get you to where you need to go.

review.negativeRemarks: Bed was a little hard. Lobby is kind of crowded, but maybe that's a success indicator.
review.locationRemarks: Great location close to Union Square.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel met or exceeded all of my expectations. Breakfast included with my room was excellent.

The only issue I encountered was that the room got cold at night and there was no extra blankets to be found.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Very small rooms, just enough space for 3 large bags, and 3 people, bathroom very compact we stayed for 1 night and it was ok have stayed in better.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Double Decker hop on hop off, Cheese Cake Factory, Taxi ride down to the Wharfs

review.title: Short San Fran Trip
review.reviewText: Booked last minute. This was the cheapest "nice" hotel still available. This is a huge complex. The rooms weren't nearly as nice as the photos on the website. Perhaps there are newer towers and my expedia discounted room only got me into an older room? The staff was pleasant, lobby bar was delicious. great location, close to Bart, Union Square and everything we wanted to do was within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: rooms need an update. outdated

review.title: Excellent Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText: I found a great deal for this hotel on Expedia, and on a whim, I booked a weekend stay. Hotel is a short walk from Union Square, Macy's, great shopping, and great eating! The bed is super comfy, but the bathroom in a standard room is pretty basic. Otherwise, I probably would have given the Union Square Hilton 5 stars.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom
review.locationRemarks: It's super close to Union Square. There are theaters, incredible restaurants, some of the best shopping in the world, and the sights of San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel and staff
review.reviewText: My wife and I love the hotel. The room was very nice and roomy. It also might have had the most comfortable bed for a hotel. The only knock on this hotel is that it is very close to some sketchy streets.

review.title: 1 night to avoid driving
review.reviewText: I hate union square, but live in the city, and had friends staying the weekend with me, rather than having to get a cab all the way back out to ocean view i decided to get a room here, no on had to drive and we didn't spend tons of money on cabs. the room was just what i needed when i needed it. Still hate all those tourists though. Naan and curry across the street open till 4am was a big selling point.

review.title: Weekend in SF
review.reviewText: Good hotel in a convenient location
review.positiveRemarks: Location and service was very good
review.locationRemarks: Anybody who knows San francicso knows this location is very central.

review.title: CLOSE TO RESTUARANTS
review.reviewText: ROOM LACKED: ACCESSIBLE AND ADEQUATE NUMBER OF ELECTRICAL OUTLETS, CLOSET HANGERS NOT LONG ENOUGH, BATHROOM LACKED SHELF SPACE FOR TOILET ARTICLES, NO COAT HANGER ON BATHROOM DOOR, A TABLE FOR BREAKFAST TRAY, TWO CHAIRS, A PHONE THAT WORKS, HVAC THAT WORKS.
review.positiveRemarks: THE DECOR, THE LOBBY, THE ELEGANCE, THE LOBBY STAFF

review.title: Great Location - heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: Excellent location, walking distance to restaurants, mall, cable car...Older hotel but well maintained. More of a business hotel than leisure. Great room service.
review.positiveRemarks: Prompt and efficient room service, great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Front Office Staff were slow and inefficient.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of Union Square. Close to public transportation, easy commute to fisherman's wharf!

review.title: Nice but overpriced.
review.reviewText: The hotel room was nice. The view from the tower was amazing. The major downside to the stay was the ridiculous charge to park. The lobby was very packed and noisy.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Staff were very pleasant. The location was excellent.

review.title: misc
review.reviewText:
- room service hrs are limited, only until 10:30pm
- room service selection is poor, food quality terrible
- housekeeping loves to say NO, no slippers, no scotch tape, no...
- elevators don't require room key - big security issue
- no business center from the hotel, only fedex, and they're not 24 hours

review.title: Very nice close to the center! :) Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Great service! Great hotel! A bit on the expensive side if you consider that the parking is almost 50 dollars.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: The Hilton Union Square in SF is beautiful at first sight. Every single member of the staff treated us with the utmost courtesy and kindness. I was consistently impressed by the service and quality of my experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Offer water bottles in room.
review.locationRemarks: Right in Union Square.

review.title: Great location, needs MAJOR upgrade.
review.reviewText: Between three couples traveling together we had the worst room by far. The room was severely decrepit with no hot water at all from the sink, the shower walls were cracked, and the carpet and bedding were from the 80's. location is great.

review.title: Great rooms interconnecting for families
review.reviewText: Great Hotel-really central to everything. Front desk staff always helpful. House keeping great. Rooms brilliant and interconnecting for our family.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to centre of city, all staff extremely helpful
review.negativeRemarks: No great service

review.title: Try Anywhere Else for the Price
review.reviewText: For the price they charge for rooms you would expect a lot better conditions of rooms and facilities.

review.title: Really comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. The Starbucks was great to have in the morning. They are polite and quick. It was also nice to have Tower Tours in the hotel. We were able to book our tours with them.
review.negativeRemarks: Have the Wi-Fi in the rooms
review.locationRemarks: In the middle of Union Square, where there is lots of shopping.

review.title: Good location-No complaints
review.reviewText: Front desk was a bit understaffed, so check in took a while. Great location, nice bar on property, great concierge staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in

review.title: Fabulous Views of San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 3 nights, our room was spacious with a lovely view across the city. Hotel staff were very polite and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Free internet access in rooms. Breakfast should come with the room rate and an area provided. Queuing for a takeaway Starbucks each morning, not good
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square

review.title: Hilton union square
review.reviewText: Very nice lobby. Great place to sit and have a coffee. Hotel was in a great and convenient location
review.positiveRemarks: Great updates to Urban contemporary room Room overlooked pool and we didn't hear any street traffic or noise.
review.negativeRemarks: cleaning staff needs to properly clean shower floors I felt like it needed a good dose of bleach! shower door design caused water to leak out

review.title: VERY NICE HOTEL , CLOSE TO UNION SQUARE
review.reviewText:
ALL IS NEAR, BIG, CLEAN, NICE HOTEL.
VALET PARKING IS EXPENSIVE.
NOT FREE WI-FI AT THE ROOM

review.title: I loved it
review.reviewText: It was really amazing and I loved more because it's next to Union Square

review.title: Good location for shopping and transit.
review.reviewText: I stayed in a renovated room which was quiet, clean and pleasant. No complaints.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great location. The rooms were nice and beds comfortable.

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: Jonah at the transportation desk got me a last minute rental car when it looked like there were no cars available. He saved the day for me!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I usually stay in small, boutique hotels when I travel. However, this trip to San Francisco, none were available. So, this hotel serves about 2,000 people which is somewhat overwhelming. It's more like a city than a hotel. But I was comfortable, the room was very quiet, large with a large bathroom. I slept like a baby, due to the comfortable bed, darkness and quiet. A Starbucks is in the lobby, which made breakfast easy. Overall my experience was very good, but I'll return to a smaller hotel on my next trip to SF.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to Chinatown and Fisherman's wharf (if you can do a 3 mile walk). Being in Union Square has great advantages. Shopping!

review.title: Décor stuck in the 70s
review.reviewText: I was disappointed in the décor of the hotel. I was also worried when we were told not to walk in a certain direction behind the hotel as it is a very dangerous neighbourhood. Otherwise, the bed was very comfortable. Not sure about having a toilet in the middle of the sleeping area.
review.negativeRemarks: Décor
review.locationRemarks: Union Square and cable car stop is very close by. We did walk to Fisherman's Wharf, but you could also catch a cab there if you needed to.

review.title: Convenient location.
review.reviewText: Convenient location just a few blocks from Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Unable to extend stay 1 night at the same rate.
review.locationRemarks: Good location just a few blocks from Union square.

review.title: Overnighter before flying home to the UK.
review.reviewText: Great room for our last night in SF, staff very helpful and Starbucks in the lobby!

review.title: Convenient to the cable cars!
review.reviewText: Very pleasant and comfortable hotel! Staff nice and helpful and rooms were clean and quiet!

review.title: Good central location for trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was in perfect location, 2 minutes walk from Union Square and numerous shops, restaurants and diners and also a pickup point for all the bus tours, and handy too for the Powell Street cable car down to Fisherman's Wharf. Hotel is enormous, but I found staff helpful and courteous, all areas were clean and well maintained generally. My room had a good view of downtown, only gripe would be no bath-would've been nice after a tiring day sightseeing, and the bathroom sink was quite badly cracked. I was offered the chance to upgrade to a better room for $20 per night but felt quite satisfied with what I was given, especially as most time was spent out of the hotel anyway. I didn't use the hotel for breakfast but the queues every morning would have put me off. All in all a very enjoyable stay...

review.title: Like a Vegas hotel factory
review.reviewText:
First room we checked into had a really lovely view. Too bad they forgot to clean the bathroom, which had hair all over the floor, and that the phone didn't work at all (no dial tone) and that the handle for the window broke off when I tried to open it for fresh air. We quickly checked out of that one and ended up in Tower 3, which has renovated rooms - nice - but which are extremely small and ours had no view even though we paid for a skyline view. Then, our "continental breakfast" entitled us to certificates for a drink, pastry and whole fruit at the Starbucks in the lobby, which had a line at least 40 people deep each and every time we went past it. They must have 10,000 people staying in the hotel at any given time, and this is their idea of a free breakfast? To upgrade to the real continental breakfast in the restaurant was $10 each, which (cost-wise) wasn't bad for the food (quite good), but was ridiculous when you are told that you get breakfast with your rate.
I would never, ever stay here again. It's a run of the mill factory hotel, no nice touches for $300/night, way too touristy, ugh. I could go on and on. Blech!
review.negativeRemarks: everything.
review.locationRemarks: If you love touristy, this is the place for you.

review.title: hilton san fran
review.reviewText:
the staff were great they let us check into the hotel earlier than check in at around 11am which was very kind as we wanted to drop our bags off so we could go sightseeing. After that I wuld not saying anything else was great about our stay, the bathroom and toilet were dirty and had urine and pubic hair all over the floor and toilet bowl which was really off putting, there was hairs also in the hand wash basin.

The bed was comfortable but the overall room was dusty and not cleaned well.

I was dissapointed if this was reflective of the hilton brand and would not stay here again in the city, although the location to union sq was good
review.negativeRemarks: cleaning standards
review.locationRemarks: glod city centre location nr union sq although one street behind hotel was tenderlion the worst area in town

review.title: A nice and beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: It was a very nice stay. The bed was a bit hard for my tastes, but that is probably just me. The room was clean and well appointed. the staff was very helpful. The concierge helped me with directions to several places. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there agian or recommend someone else stay there.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, well appointed and a great staff
review.locationRemarks: There are a lot of things nearby. Union Square with shopping and several tours to enjoy. I highly recommend the Magic Bus tour. A lot of fun!

review.title: Weekend get away.
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in the heart of San Fran. It was easy(after a hour wiat) to catch the cable cars or bus to anywhere in city. I have to say the HOMELESS population is out of control around this area and my wife wasnt always comfortable as we walked around at night. But the inside and around the hotel there was no issue. Even the Starbucks located on premisis seemed to have a long line of 30 but the wait was never more than 5 mins (amazing).
review.positiveRemarks: Centrally located to everything. Great staff and fast!
review.negativeRemarks: The cost of parking is twice anyone else. I found there was a garage across the street an wished i would have parked there for half the price.
review.locationRemarks: Cable cars close. Be prepaired to wait. All neigborhoods available from this system.

review.title: Hotel close to shopping and rental car services
review.reviewText: Very clean and quiet room with view overlooking the city. Convenient to public transportation within walking distance. No real need for renting a vehicle.

review.title: Close to Bart station and muni station
review.reviewText: Room was small and cluttered with furniture. Could barely get along side of bed. Remote didn't work, and MP3 player hardly functioned. Expensive room for little amenities. No wifi unless you want to sit in lobby or pay 50 extra dollars.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location to utilize public transportation. Close to a lot of shops and restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: The room needs some work, and accessories in room should be checked before use.
review.locationRemarks: Huge union square mall is near bye, along with cable care, muni station, and Bart station.

review.title: SF hotel
review.reviewText: Convenient location, can walk to a lot of places easily from the hotel.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Pleasant stay, everyone we came into contact with treated us very well and were very knowledgeable.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for sightseeing and shopping

review.title: Convenient to Union Square
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at this Hilton. As it was our first time in the city we were offered an upgrade to enjoy the city views. Was well worth it. We were also given vouchers for complimentary breakfast at the Starbucks in the lobby (we also had the opportunity to pay just $10 each extra for full breakfast), and free Internet for the room which was very useful.
review.locationRemarks: Location convenient to Union Square. Easy walking to public transport, shopping, and restaurants.

review.title: Great hotel. Very close to Union Square.
review.reviewText:
The most lively lobby I've ever been in- beats NYC! Pool was great and the gentleman
Who cleans it did an Excellent job!
review.negativeRemarks: Hallways decor is a little outdated.
review.locationRemarks: Cable cars, union square, close to the buses- great location!

review.title: Great Location, friendly staff
review.reviewText: The hotel backs onto a not so nice area but as long as you know which way to turn when you leave your hotel it is actually in a fantastic space for shopping, access to cable cars and bus and a short walk to the water.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, friendly staff, big rooms, comfy beds, lovely linen
review.negativeRemarks: Check in lines could be shorter
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to union square and shopping + public transport.

review.title: Central hotel
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel, good services, close to cable cars and easy public transportation about town and to the wharf area. Walking is also easy to Union Square, Chinatown. Options of Starbucks and a restaurant, both in the lobby, make for easy breakfast options on site.
review.positiveRemarks: Am a Hilton Honors member so I earn credits. Comfortable and convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: Had to request replacement of a light burned out before our arrival, but everything else was fine.
review.locationRemarks: The whole city is easy to access!

review.title: Nice hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: The Hotel was very clean and had a welcoming entrance and lobby. Our room was located on the 34th floor and had an amazing view. The decor in the room was a bit bland and outdated but the room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is located very close to Union Square and short walking distance from bus, BART, trolleys, and cable cars.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the view of the city from our room on the 34th floor of tower 1.
review.negativeRemarks: The decor in the rooms could be updated. (Shower curtain hooks, pictures, head boards)
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz, Golden Gate Bridge, Sausalito, Muir Woods, Pier 39, Haight and Ashbury, Golden Gate Park, tours galore

review.title: Nice Hotel, downtown, close to Bus + Cable car
review.reviewText: Excellent, no odor in the room always smelt fresh.

review.title: Very convinient
review.reviewText: Enjoyable and comfortable. It's in the downtown area very near to the beach.

review.title: Non smoking room didn't smell like it
review.reviewText: We reserved a king bed non smoking room and got a room with a queen bed that smelled like a smoking room. The overall feel of the hotel was that of a college dorm. The area around the hotel is scary.

review.title: disappointing stay
review.reviewText:
was very disappointed with hotel
very old hotel
small rooms
old, wet & mouldy smell
breakfast OK
location is ok but next street was full of homeless people
review.negativeRemarks: full reimbursement of rooms & facilities might help

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: First time in San Francisco and I had the best hotel experience ever :) love the hotel and the staff

review.title: Starting place for San fransisco / california tour
review.reviewText:
Staff were helpful and location good. Problems with fire alarm unfortunate for one night but generally a positive experience.

Gym was very impressive and pool a pleasant surprise.

Family of four shared twin queen bed room with no problems. Recommend as a good location for Powell street cable car

review.title: Nice hotel and in a great location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Great location and easy to get to all transportation systems.

review.title: Hotel is seen to be old, but it nice to stay !
review.reviewText: Hotel is near to the shopping center and food center and also convenience with walking to go and round at the town. Good place but room are old .

review.title: Convenient close to shopping.
review.reviewText: The Hilton is a pleasant hotel, it's convenient location makes it a great place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Some rooms are outdated
review.locationRemarks: Great location for dinning and shopping

review.title: Good location, but overall just OK
review.reviewText: This was our second and probably the last stay at this hotel – very busy and noisy, good location, but lobby feels like the airport. We had terrible neighbors; they arrived around 1 AM drunk and were trying to wake up somebody inside to open the door. Some strange noise (like wind?!?) was present during the night, the ice machine was next to our room, maybe the noise was coming from there. Other than that, location is good and hotel is ok, but not worth the money.

review.title: city hotel
review.reviewText: Local area a little rough Hotel fine for city break
review.negativeRemarks: Area

review.title: OK for a short stay
review.reviewText:
Nice clean room, comfortalbe beds but lacking a mini fridge which is a good idea for long distance travellers.

Hotel reception a bit disappointing, reminded me of a train station except it had enormous ,too low hanging, chandeliers. No separate dining room to breakfast/lunch room and no separate bar. Internet facilities good but very expensive.

Food expensive. Swimming pool a bit draughty but I guess that could depend on the weather as it is outside.
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable beds and helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: No mini fridge. Not enough main rooms and reception too impersonal - more like a railway station
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location near Union Square

review.title: No complaints
review.reviewText: There are places to stay in SF with more character but location is convenient, rates are reasonable and facilities are good.
review.negativeRemarks: it's a bit of a maze - you might get lost

review.title: Nice locations,all restaurants in walking distance
review.reviewText: Centrally located in Union Square with all restaurants etc. nearby. And Lobby is always crowded due to Starbucks coffee in the lobby makes you feel you are in break of a business conference. Overall it's nice hotel
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location

review.title: expensive breakfast
review.reviewText: Central location, great for shopping and lots of restaurants, don't eat breakfast at the hotel $$$$$$.
review.negativeRemarks: price for breakfast
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Great hotel in excellent location.
