review.reviewText: Friendly and efficient staff .well equipped gym .Clean and well maintained outdoor pool.Highly recommended.

review.title: Not the best experience, but good location
review.reviewText: The best thing about this hotel is the location for access to shopping, although at night time do take care as it's not the safest. We were on our honeymoon and upon check in were told they didn't have a King room for us (as booked) so were offered a room with two roll away beds. After we politely declined it took sometime for a room to be found and we were eventually placed in what was the noisiest room we have ever stayed in - right by the lift and you could hear conversations word for word. Overall our experience wasn't great, but the rooms were clean and location good for what we wanted.
review.negativeRemarks: Most of the front desk staff we encountered were rather rude.
review.locationRemarks: Great spot

review.title: Hotel with great access to public transportation
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel couldn't be any better. Within minutes of walking you're in the middle of Union Square as well as various modes of transportation can be approached easily. Staff was mainly friendly and helpful with a few exceptions.
Though I certainly would have expected the hotel to have free wifi in all rooms the only way to connect to the Internet is bringing your device down to the lobby.
review.positiveRemarks: Starbucks in hotel lobby is very convenient for fast breakfasts. Concierges provide all kinds of information needed and are very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi in all rooms. Rooms could be a little bit cleaner.
review.locationRemarks: Best location! Various car rental companies across the street. Lori's Diner (good for any meal) just seconds away. Hop on bus stops right behind hotel

review.title: NICE HOTEL, WELL LOCATED, CROWDED
review.reviewText:
NICE HOTEL, WELL LOCATED, I FELT A LITTLE BIT INSECURE, TOO MANY PEOPLE IN THE HOTEL THAT YOU DONT KNOW IF THEY ARE GUEST OR NOT.
ROOMS A LITTLE BIT SMALL BUT CONFORTABLE.
review.negativeRemarks: SECURITY

review.title: Hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: The biggest issue I have with my stay was the fact that the walls were paper-thin. Anytime the person next door used their sink or shower, it sounded like the water pipes were practically in my room. Plus, anytime someone walked down the hall and whistled or had a conversation, it was fairly loud. So you could imagine how annoying it was when a group of people walked down the hall – all talking at once.

review.title: Closer but old
review.reviewText: All the staff were helpful , and energetic . But for a four star hotel , the carpet and the decor are old .
review.negativeRemarks: Outside fixtures example carpet in the hallway

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was close and convienent to lots of shopping and restaurants; however, the rooms were disappointing. They were dated and didn't look like the rooms pictured online as I expected. The first housekeeping service we had didn't change the sheets when cleaning the room as there was a drink stain that was still on the sheets when we pulled down the covers. I had to call and ask them to send someone to change the sheets. I am not likely to stay again.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Very good location. The smoking section was really bad. The hallway was so smelly I had to cover my nose . There were cigarette butts outside our window
review.negativeRemarks: Clean up the smoking section.
review.locationRemarks: Bars restaurants, stores right outside the hotel

review.title: Hotel was convenientlylocated.
review.reviewText: Concierge staff very helpful. All staff was helpful. Close to rest. and transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: There was no safety bar in the shower. This is very important. Should be in every shower in every hotel.

review.title: Pictures on the website of the rooms are deceiving
review.reviewText: When booking this hotel I went to their website outside of Expedia to browse more pictures of the rooms. Needless to say...the picture of the room I booked was a far cry from the room itself. The carpets were stained, the furniture had burn marks in them not to mention the sofa and chairs were very uncomfortable and it looked like someone had squished bugs on the walls. When I questioned the reception about the room on the website vs the room we got I was told that those rooms weren't "done" yet. So in other words; they are renovating them. I didn't see any proof of renovations going on but just be aware that the room you are booking off of their website may not be the room you get when you arrive.

review.title: Very nice experience
review.reviewText: Very clean, Friendly and knowledgable. They got me tickets to see Alcatraz when everyone was sold out.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi
review.locationRemarks: Right downtown. Easy to get around.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: It didnt provide internet, you have to purchase it and in most hotels it comes with your room...

review.title: Union Square Hilton
review.reviewText: Front desk staff very friendly!!! Room very clean - also in a great walking location for Union Square and the surrounding area.

review.title: Great stay at Hilton Union Square
review.reviewText: Hilton Union Square was a nice stay. I found accommodations adequate and everything to be in tip top shape. My only disappointment and recommendation would be to have improved shower heads, and cheaper parking rates. $47 for self park, and $52 for valet is not well advertised and was an unwelcome surprise to my bill. Lastly, get your bearings inside as the maze of towers, elevators, and hallways can be very confusing. Overall my experience was good and I would come there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower heads. Parking rates. Less confusing hallways and building structure.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping,dining

review.title: Great place to see all the sites for sisters check
review.reviewText: We stayed 5 nights and use the hotel as a base for the sleeping. Tried so many nearby restaurants for breakfast and lunch. Room and staff were perfect for the getaway. Could walk or get a taxi to anywhere we needed. Used the trolleys/cable cars/bart/subway/buses all over the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Nearby to public transport/big and roomy/good reputation

review.title: Hilton union square July 2013
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in an very convenient location. Room was clean and comfortable and free wi fi in the hotel lobby worked well. Only potential downside is that the hotel is very large and it can be a long way from your room to the lobby.

Overall I would recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean rooms,quiet,good climate control and bathrooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Long walk from reception to room. some surrounding streets can be slightly unsafe if you walk only a short distance in the wrong direction.
review.locationRemarks: Good central location excellent for shopping and access to public transport.

review.title: Ok hotel
review.reviewText: We rent a Jr Suite, we did not have refrigerator plus we could hear Everything from hallways.
review.negativeRemarks: Union square, shopping and good restaurants

review.title: Hilton Union Square
review.reviewText: Room is clean, bed is very comfortable. Great thing this is the first hotel I see using the brand name bathroom set from Pete Thomas Roth, 5* for that! Crowded in the lobby since there're other shops, starbucks inside the lobby hotel. However that turns into convenience for us since it's quick to grab a bite before we head out in the morning.
review.positiveRemarks: Brand name bathroom set Pete Thomas Roth.
review.negativeRemarks: Nicer towels.

review.title: Small rooms
review.reviewText: Short stay. Staff friendly helpful hotel is beautiful and very busy.
review.positiveRemarks: the location is very good , staff was very helpful and pleasant
review.negativeRemarks: smallest room I have ever seen with the smallest bed. On the 7th floor and the outside noise was extreme.
review.locationRemarks: great location and convenient

review.title: Convenient to Union Square
review.reviewText: The location is great if you want/need to be close to Union Square. However, unless your primary reason to be in S.F. is for shopping or to be close to the Financial District, I see no reason to stay at this hotel. It is a large, expensive, characterless downtown hotel. I wouldn't stay there again. I'd rather be in Fisherman's Wharf or closer to Golden Gate Park.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need to be spruced up.
review.locationRemarks: Great if you want to shop or need to be close to the Financial District. Otherwise, no reason to be at this location.

review.title: SFO Hilton - Bettah than expected!
review.reviewText: After reading some of the reviews of the SFO Hilton Union Square, I was a little concerned about the service level & room condition. However, upon arrival the staff was exceptional, quick check-in, and we were placed in a room that was recently remodeled. Wow, it was GREAT! The location was just a few blocks from Union Square and the hotel lacked nothing. Even complimentary coffee in each room. Yes, the lobby was very busy but the Hilton always had enough staff on hand to take care of the crowds and there was plenty of room and chairs to use the free wi-fi in the lobby area. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others visiting SFO.
review.positiveRemarks: The remodeled rooms - very nice! Ask for a room in Tower 3.
review.negativeRemarks: Yes. Have the other Towers remodeled to look just as nice as Tower 3. They were great!
review.locationRemarks: I would stay away from walking down Taylor street as many homeless pack in for the night in this area. We never felt unsafe, however.

review.title: Hotel room not as described
review.reviewText: I was told this room was a Urban Contemporary room, it was a room that was not updated. I paid a lot of money for 2 rooms that were outdated. Maybe that is why they have me extra "Starbucks vouchers". Once our room was given to us, we entered and there was dirty towels by the window, we asked for the room to be cleaned and blankets switched. All I was given was towels at my door, no knock just opened the door to leave and they were outside on the floor. Never staying here ever again.
review.negativeRemarks: Be given a room as described, if not get refunded.
review.locationRemarks: It is in San Francisco on union square.

review.title: Nice Stay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, said they gave us an upgrade, but if that was an upgrade would have hated to see a standard room. There was a huge ball of lent in the a/c vent in the bathroom. Over all a nice stay and Staff was very friendly.

review.title: good location but cold and unfriendly hotel
review.reviewText:
staff not friendly
the rooms are large and quiet but no fridge in the room even in the junior suite,

you have to pay for the wifi in the room for each device you use.
room service noisy early even on we.
review.positiveRemarks: large and quiet rooms good location
review.negativeRemarks: service quality room quality ( AC noisy, the blankets are very cheap, no fridge) wifi not free even in the junior suite parking rates
review.locationRemarks: near union square, very good location to visit San Francisco

review.title: Great convenient downtown location
review.reviewText: Very convenient to numerous SF attractions with easy access to public transportation and walking distance to shops, restaurant, a mall, lounges/sports bars, ballpark etc. Concierge desk was especially helpful to choose restaurants, providing directions to various area attractions.
review.positiveRemarks: Liked the central, downtown location and the overall condition and atmosphere of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Improved directions/signs to garage access to/from our room and lobby floors.
review.locationRemarks: Great access via public transportation to lots of shops, lounges/bars, local and area - wide attractions!

review.title: Hotel was centrally located
review.reviewText: Best feature besides the staff, Starbucks, Valet and comfy beds, oh & the view was how central the hotel was to all our adventures. In the morning we visited the Disney Museum, back to Union Square for a little shopping & dinner, then on to A T & T Park for the Giants vs Padres game. Great staff, we would recommend and come back to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was clean, quiet & the beds and linens were clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: The only improvement I could think of ... as I entered the hotel with bags it would have been nice if there were a ramp for rolling bags
review.locationRemarks: Just a few blocks from Union Square & great shopping and restaurants

review.title: Great Location, nice service
review.reviewText:
We stayed one night for my husband running race, the place is good, the room was very small for a family of 4 but it was just for a night, it was a busy weekend in SF so it was crowded but OK.
My kids loved it
review.positiveRemarks: Location and Hilton service is great
review.negativeRemarks: Check in/out people was confused where to stand in the line and I assume someone was on training when I asked for help they told me to wait.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, close to public transportation, good restaurants, great

review.title: Good Location but Lower Expection
review.reviewText:
The room is smaller than I thought. No shower gel in the bathroom. In my
LA stay, they have it. The condition is old there. But the location is good for those who'd like to shop or take the cable car.

review.title: Great front desk staff
review.reviewText: Great front desk staff. I booked a city view room including breakfast on expedia. I booked quite late thus a steep price. I arrived at the hotel, and checked in. Later, when I got to my room, I realize that I did not get my breakfast coupon, so I went back to the front desk. On their system, my room is supposed to be a normal room without a view on a lower level and no breakfast. I showed the staff my expedia reservation, indicating my room type and includes breakfast coupon. Though on their system it indicates no breakfast and a different room type, the staff gave me the benefit of the doubt and upgraded my room. If I've stayed in the first room, I would have totally think I paid too much for the hotel. Overall, great staff that cares!

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Always a pleasant stay, great staff, good location.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Good hotel in a perfect location for access to union square and the nearby cable car.
review.negativeRemarks: frosted glass sliding door for the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Good location – very close to union square

review.title: Outrageous Prices
review.reviewText:
I would not recommend this hotel. I felt the customer service was poor for the hotel price. The location is conveniently close to the financial district for business meetings but I felt the hotel was taking advantage of business travelers and businesses with outrageous prices. $14 for a bottled water (room service) and $40 for a basic chicken dinner from the downstairs restaurant. Also, everytime I called downstairs for anything else they were not helpful.
I have informed my company that I do not recommend this hotel for other employees.

review.title: Great hotel for family and business
review.reviewText:
I have to say that the quality in every way was superb. There was one staff member that was not as pleasant as everyone else, but I want to chalk that up to someone having a bad day and not necessarily indicative of how that person is all the time.

With the expedia package the price was reasonable and the hotel was central to all our needs. The rooms were spacious and very clean. I had a room with 2 double beds and we did not feel we were in eachother's way at all. Very spacious.
review.positiveRemarks: The spacious room and central location to Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: The starbucks inside the hotel is understaffed. Early morning there was a huge line of people yet only 2 people working, management needs to add peopl
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, close to everything.

review.title: Good hotel, just don't turn left.
review.reviewText:
Nice Hotel, location had good points and bad points.
Close to union square was a good, some nice bars nearby, shops etc.
Only issue was if you turn left out of the hotel. Was quite a dodgey area, lots of homeless outside the front of the hotel begging at all times.

Other than that recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: The beggers
review.locationRemarks: Turn right out of the hotel for a 5 minute walk to union square. Don't turn left.

review.title: No free wifi in 2013?
review.reviewText:
I was very disappointed that a hotel of this calibre could not offer free wifi to all of its rooms. What's worse is the COST of wifi. $17 per day or $40 for 3 days??? You've got to be kidding me! This wouldn't be so bad if you didn't consider the already high price per room.

Other than this, everything else met or exceeded expectations. The staff is friendly and helpful and the hotel is spotless.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive wifi
review.locationRemarks: Close to pretty much everything you need in downtown SF.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: very nice hotel - rooms and bathroom quite small - great having a starbucks in lobby - great location

review.title: SFO Hilton
review.reviewText: Stayed at older tower. Kind of old and needs to be updated. For the amount you pay 200 plus a night...other hotels in area are a better deal
review.negativeRemarks: Old

review.title: Nice Hotel for the Location
review.reviewText: It is a Good Hotel and Nice Location for SFO puling carts
review.locationRemarks: You can see Downtown, You can visit powel street and take a Trolley to Hyde st and then drive around Lombard Street and very good location

review.title: Nice for Family travelers
review.reviewText: Stepped on an open safety pin left behind from the vacuum from prior guests. Had to call security one evening 3:00a.m. Overly noisey neighbors . Woke up whole family. Was taken care of right away. Overall an enjoyable 4 day stay. It's good thing I printed out my reservation confirmation did not match with hotel reservation listing. Staff corrected all to match my reservation. Could have been ugly being it was a holiday weekend and hotels booked solid.
review.negativeRemarks: Thought valet Parking expensive
review.locationRemarks: Union station San Francisco Ca

review.title: Not what I thought it would be.
review.reviewText: We were put in a room that doesn't look that it has been remodeled. There was hair on the toilet seat, tub didn't drain, and the water pressure was just as bad.Though the lobby may have looked very nice, I wasn't impress with the room we stayed in. To top it off, when asked where to go no-one of their staffed bothered to inform us of skid row directly behind and around the hotel. Bums outside in front, doing drug right out on the streets, fights happening, smelled like urine all around; I felt unsafe walking near the hotel. San Francisco is a beautifully city and I will return just not to the Hilton.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was pleasant and lobby looked nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of the room, have complimentary or for purchase water bottles in the rooms, fix the drains, water pressure, and double pain windows.
review.locationRemarks: There is a lot of activities just a short taxi drive away from the hotel "Just don't walk".

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: Great location for our first visit to San Francisco. The staff was friendly and helpful. The Tower 3 rooms were recently renovated. We didn't quite care for the smoked glass pocket door on the bathroom. It didn't slide closed all the way. other than that - beds are comfortable and the rooms are good sized with good sound-proofing. We will definitely stay there on a return visit.
review.negativeRemarks: pocket door on the bathroom did not slide closed all the way
review.locationRemarks: easy access to all forms of public transportation- the way to go in San Francisco

review.title: hotel was just ok
review.reviewText: the room was very small. the bathroom was very small. no mini bar. a little hard to find your room because of signage and long hallways. very large impersonal areas in hotel, very conventiony. beds were very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: room was small
review.locationRemarks: close to union square, restaurants, bars, and clubs

review.title: Great hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Excellent overall. Will Recommend to all who plan to go to SF
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Efficient
review.reviewText: The Hotel staff were very welcoming, efficient and friendly. There was clear communication with signage to direct the customers. The concierge were very helpful providing guidance to access the Cable Car to travel to Fisherman's Wharf and arranging a corporate taxi to the airport for my departure.
review.positiveRemarks: An excellent restaurant with helpful staff made a single female traveller feel safe late in the evening.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of shelving in the bathroom to place toilet bag.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location to access the start of the Cable car and Union Square.

review.title: Nice Hotel in the Middle of the Action
review.reviewText: The Hilton was doing a major transition from one large meeting to another when I arrived (I was attending neither). Despite the volume, they had the right amount of staff to get us all registered and on our respective ways. The lobby was a hub of activity every time I walked through. Great energy! Not the most unique ambiance or style, but a very decent hotel in one of the greatest cities in the world.

review.title: good location good for bussines
review.reviewText: good location, we have prblem with the room tower 3, 7 floor have a litle windows, we move a floor 18 much better
review.negativeRemarks: look like old, to much people in the hotel
review.locationRemarks: good

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Hotel is from walking distance to great shopping and dinning!
review.negativeRemarks: Noise level

review.title: Convenient hotel in SF
review.reviewText: It was nice but the cleanliness was an issue for me. The room that we had was dirty specifically the bathroom. It has marks of red spots on the floor and the doors and windows have dirt on it.
review.positiveRemarks: Its big and close to everything. It has Starbucks.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness.
review.locationRemarks: Great. A lot of things close to the hotel.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText:
Location is near the ghetto, can feel unsafe.
Nice view but windy and noisy building - can hear creaking in walls and roof when windy.
Starbucks in lobby handy but close early.
Good gym
Overall needs a good facelift.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs an overall facelift.
review.locationRemarks: Felt more unsafe than other areas. Near the ghetto end of town. Ideal for conference ppl - they seemed to be majority of people at the hotel.

review.title: Needs better service at front desk
review.reviewText: the staff weren't overly helpful at the front desk
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-Fire is usually free in most countries. $12.95 a night is excessive.
review.locationRemarks: Central

review.title: In the heart of San Francisco!
review.reviewText:
The hotel was amazing and staff was very friendly and always available to answer questions. We were even able to get a late check out on the last day of our stay. Alice checked us in and was so sweet and engaging. Our room had an amazing view of the Golden Gate Bridge, thanks to her!
Thank you!

review.title: Dirty bedding
review.reviewText:
When I pulled the covers back on the bed I noticed that the inside of the comforter was stained. Fortunately I was in a two bed room and the second bed was acceptable. When I went to check out in the morning the person behind the counter didn't want to hear my comments - it was busy and he blew me off.

There are many hotel choices in SF and I'll choose a different hotel next time. The Hilton Union Square wasn't worth the price paid.
review.negativeRemarks: Service and housekeeping.

review.title: bad service!!
review.reviewText: Bad service! I won't go back any more! They don't care about customer?the only thing they care about its money!!

review.title: Expected better service from a Hilton
review.reviewText:
I checked in late and was tired, On the way up to my room I walked past a huge pile of dirty sheets on the floor in front of one room. Thought it seemed distasteful but housekeeping might be cleaning the room, odd hour though. When I went out early the next morning the pile was still there. Bad impression one.

Later that night I was woken up by a really loud vibration in the wall of my bathroom, Thought it was someone in the adjacent room. lasted about 4-5 minutes, called front desk to have it checked. Sound came back three times before an engineer came up and told me, (he was very nice BTW), it was the ice machine compressor next to my room. I found it hard to believe no one had ever complained about it before. He unplugged it to stop it from happening again. Bad impression two.

Because of that, I was given two breakfast coupons which I ended up not being able to use because by the time I came down to have breakfast the restaurant was closed. Disappointment three

Lastly I needed to check flights for just a few minutes on my laptop but was told Internet was $12.50 or so. (because I'm not an Honor's member) I was irritated because lesser hotels give access for free and when I said that to the front desk girl I was replied to with a snotty "not this one". I Hate being nickel and dimed or up sold constantly.

When I went to check out and discuss some of my concerns with a manager the line was so long because there was only one person handling checkouts.
review.positiveRemarks: My room was very nicely remodeled, just my style. Modern and stylish.
review.negativeRemarks: Service, caring and concern.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco Union Square area. Central to downtown SF, lots to do. shopping, museums.

review.title: Very nice place to stay. I loved it
review.reviewText: we liked everything except for one interaction with an employee.
review.negativeRemarks: price of water in the room and one interaction i had with an empoyee.
review.locationRemarks: walked around.

review.title: Too small, too expensive
review.reviewText: For a high rent hotel, the rooms were too small; the meeting rooms too cold and charging $15 a night for internet is simply robbery. And I had a supposedly recently renovated room. Could barely turn around without bumping into a wall or door. Virtually no storage space (e.g., drawers). Other than that, had a great time.
review.positiveRemarks: The cleaning staff were quite good and responsive to requests. Refrigeration was nice to have. The hotel recycles (bag in room) - a first for me.
review.negativeRemarks: Aside from redesigning the interior, and not extorting customers for internet; nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown San Francisco, enough said.

review.title: Pretty Average - Lobby was more chaos than a zoo!
review.reviewText: Price was way too expensive for what we got. The lobby looked like a zoo with the amonut of people accessing wifi. If the provided free wifi in the rooms it would look nowhere near as bad. Rooms were very outdated.
review.positiveRemarks: Gym was large and good quality
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms were outdated and small. Location was poor. No free wifi in rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Pretty average.

review.title: Central Location.
review.reviewText: Excellent view. My room was on the 47th floor over looking to Golden Gate. Really nice. Overal nice big hotel with real professional and friendly staff. Central Location easy access to everything.
review.locationRemarks: Central. Easy access to everything

review.title: Traveling for leisure, felt like business
review.reviewText: It is a monstrosity of a hotel. Very crowded and noisy lobby. Starbucks unable to handle volume of customers. Rooms are long walks away, and noisy from both internal and external sources. Room was small but clean and well appointed.
review.negativeRemarks: Crowded lobby, long distance to rooms from lobby
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Hilton Union Square Review
review.reviewText:
Hotel room was small but nice and clean. Hotel lobby was very busy with business travelers.
In the morning, requested extra towels and a shaving kit that took 45-60 minutes to arrive.
Hotel restaurant was very nice with a great staff.

review.title: Great for Family and Business stay
review.reviewText:
Really great location. Minutes from the cable car turnaround on Powell, shopping. Within walking of BART, Cable car, and electric trolleys. Took the F line electric trolley all the way to the wharf area, Ferry Bldg and ate our way through the shops, then walked up to Pier 39, and took the 1945 era F line electric trolley back and walked to the Hotel. Starbucks in the lobby awesome. Knowledgeable Concierge. Huge Gym, with weights and machines. Try the Oriental Pearl for dinner in Chinatown, amazing food. This was a recommendation by hotel concierge. Use your room key to get into after hours Kinkos biz center, that was useful to me.
Great stay. Thanks.
review.positiveRemarks: Starbucks in lobby and knowledgeable staff
review.negativeRemarks: That I had to leave
review.locationRemarks: Location is a great City location, busy but not crazy busy like Manhattan. Amazing food within walking diatance or a Cable car ride.

review.title: All The Basics
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, huge hotel, expensive parking but overall has all you might need in SF. A couple blocks to great shopping but watch coming out of Valet on the one way street through the Tenderloin District.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet Price
review.locationRemarks: Union Square 1 block out your door

review.title: Good for Business Travelers
review.reviewText: Good hotel. Extremely big. Right in the heart of Union Square. Not great if you're expecting a more personalized stay. Probably best for business travelers.

review.title: Good vacation hotel......
review.reviewText:
We picked this hotel because the rates were reasonable and it was in the area where we wanted to be. The hotel was close (walking distance) to lots of things including the cable cars, A.T.&T Park, and lots of restaurants. The concierge and other staff were very helpful with a couple of tourists.

For me, it's the small things like waiting for elevators that get aggravating, but we had no problems and this was with a huge convention going on during our stay. The lobby was a little crowded most times because of the convention but we don't hang out in lobbies. If you have a car, you can pretty much park it outside of your room door as the parking lot spans the height of the building. We had rented a motorcycle and they only charged us half the price for parking which we thought was very reasonable.

Th only real complaint was the bathroom in our room. It was very small and there was almost no counter space to hold toiletries. The sink was tiny, making it difficult to shave without making a mess.

Overall experience was great though. I recommend it highly and will use it again.

review.title: Holiday
review.reviewText: The staff at the concierge were excellent. Thank you.

review.title: Designed for the business crowd, not families.
review.reviewText:
My family and I found what seemed to be a good deal for a couple of nights on our road trip. First, the parking is not included in the pricing and is not readily visible when you are looking at the hotel costs so $53 per day with tax was a little shocking on arrival and the man at the check-in desk was visibly annoyed at our surprise. He rudely told us we could park across the street at another garage. I was glad he shared the info but it was a really uncomfortable situation. The rest of the staff wasn't much better. When we asked where the pool was the man we asked pointed but said nothing. When I asked a follow-up question, he stared at me blankly and and then pointed again. I don't love feeling like an inconvenience or awkward.
I was disappointed in our hotel stay.
I say it is best for business stays because I have never seen a lobby so full of business suits. It is not family friendly and I really think they purposely designed it that way which is fine but let people know before they book a room there.
review.negativeRemarks: the people who worked there
review.locationRemarks: It is located near Union Square and Cable cars.

review.title: parent review
review.reviewText: Overall, it was very pleasant the stay at this hotel. Restaurant the tavern needs improvement like the menu needs more choices, atmosphere perhaps and pr need also improvement. People were very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: noise thin walls. staff need to use a lower tone
review.locationRemarks: too busy but again close to main attractions

review.title: Only ok, tiny rooms
review.reviewText: The rooms are very small. The hotel is large and room was extremely far from the elevator. I hated wasting so much time walking back and forth. The bathroom doors are paper thin so in the middle of the night everything wakes you up. The bed was not a king when we requested that. The location of the hotel is decent. Easy to walk to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of the room and tiny windows. Room was so far from the elevator
review.locationRemarks: Pretty good.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Good clean hotel, very close walking distance to Union Square shopping. Major car rental companies directly across the road which is handy if needed. But don't turn left out of the hotel. The hotel appears to be on the edge of where aesthetically,the town takes a turn for the worse

review.title: Nice, clean and quiet... just how I like it.
review.reviewText: Room was nice and modern. The only issue I had was the small hallway where the closet and bathroom are. Other than that, everyone was courteous, the room was great.

review.title: Not bad at all
review.reviewText: Good location. There was nothing particularly bad about it. Nothing impressive either, but very nice decent clean hotel with good service and friendly stuff. For the price we paid - more then I was expecting
review.positiveRemarks: Definitely location. 1 minute was from union square in the very center of all the fun night life

review.title: Recommend tower 3
review.reviewText: Modern room very comfortable ! Bed was awsome! Nice view and was very clean! Will stay here now for all my trips to San Francisco! Especially for giants games

review.title: Great for family trip!
review.reviewText:
Second day we didn't get bath mat for bath room. So we called house keeping for bring bath mat. We were waiting about 1 hour, finally a guy showed up our room with 5 match packs.
We don't know why? So we used regular towel for bath mat.

review.title: Nice big chain hotel in great location.
review.reviewText: Nice location one block off of Union Square Park. Very clean and well kept property. Accomodating staff. The only drawback is the Starbucks in the lobby is overcrowded with long lines.
review.negativeRemarks: Limited hotel dining options.
review.locationRemarks: One block from Union Square.

review.title: No breakfast.
review.reviewText: The only downside to my hotel experience is that they didn't provide breakfast which is something I am used to with other hotels, and its a comfort.

review.title: Dirty room
review.reviewText: The room was not properly cleaned, and there were two used shower caps left in the bathroom..
review.negativeRemarks: Poorly-cleaned room
review.locationRemarks: Ｉntoxicated persons were around the hotel even in the daytime.

review.title: Nice hotel and location
review.reviewText: My partner had a Conference at this Hotel. We were there for a week. At the checkin, we were offerred to upgrade our room with breakfast and wifi included ($60 /night). Our room had a balcony with a view on the bay and sunrise every morning. It was gorgeous. Our room was in tower 1 and it was a bit old but clean. Colleagues who were in tower 3 had a more recent room but not the same view. The hotel is located near everything (Powell street with the cable cars, Bart station, Market street with stores and several bus lines, restaurants). There was a good choice of varied restaurants within a walking distance.

review.title: Fun Week In San Fran
review.reviewText: Great hotel in busy location. Great location for waking, catching the cable cars, and shopping. Rooms nice and clean. The hotel is quite large so some mornings crowds in the reception area. Overall a good place to stay, I would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Too many people
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Hilton at Union Square March 2013
review.reviewText: Stayed for 5 nights during a pleasure trip to SF. Hotel is located in the downtown area with lots of restaurants, bars and shopping within easy walking distance. Staff was very helpful during our stay, and provided great information about where to eat and tours. The hotel is busy, lots of convention traffic, and may be better suited for couples and adult groups, although I saw some folks with the young kids. Nice health club, but the hotel restaurant is just average, in my opinion. But it doesn't matter, because there are about a thousand other places to eat just outside the door. There is also an in-house Starbucks for a quick breakfast. I'd recommend the Hilton at Union Square to just about anybody.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Actually about 2-3 blocks from Union Square, and right on the edge of the Tenderloin district of SF.

review.title: Had a Blast
review.reviewText: Hotel's location is great for walking around Union Square and then hopijng on the Cable Car to get around as well. Great City
review.positiveRemarks: Location, clean rooms and friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: No problems
review.locationRemarks: Heart of Union Square

review.title: Not a pleasant experience
review.reviewText: No warm welcome/ gesture from hotel staff. Bathroom ammeties not readily available, and need to call house keeping. Took an hour to get them to the room.

review.title: A pleasant stay
review.reviewText: The only complaint we had was that the walls seemed to be too thin in our part of the hotel, so we heard the kids in the room next door quite a few times. Apart from that the staff was most helpful when we needed them. Overall quite a pleasant stay.

review.title: Good place.
review.reviewText: I like the location and staff there, and it's clean.

review.title: Star ratings in disguise
review.reviewText: Definitely not a four star hotel - I used to get much comfortable rooms in Courtyard. We upgraded to City view + Breakfast + WiFi. Internet was not working - I talked with ATT and got a ticket number, still had to fight with Front desk for partial refund.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff, Beds

review.title: Very nice and memorable hotel.
review.reviewText: Nice teller, very helpful and recommended us to upgrade so we get the free internet and discount on breakfast :)
review.positiveRemarks: being at Down town and close to everything, Nice staff and excellent room.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet accessibility

review.title: "Great place to stay"
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel for all ranges of people, the staff was very knowledgable of the city as to where and where not to go. The location is great, right by the fashion district and transportation. I would recommend for anybody questioning on staying at the Hilton in downtown.

review.title: Great service, small rooms
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very tuned in to give excellent customer service, from the front desk to the hotel maids. What made this stay not as wonderful as we would have liked is that the room was very small! The rooms are compact to try to fit it all in. For the price-point, I would expect more space.The breakfast buffet is excellent, as is the rest of the food at The Urban Tavern, attached to the hotel. The location is ideal for walking around Downtown San Francisco. You could bring your family here, but this hotel seems better suited for business travelers.

review.title: Good location, careless room selection
review.reviewText: Great location, but I came in late and they gave me a room next to the elevators which is fine, but when i got up in the morning, and went to get a cup of coffee, I walked back to my room, and noticed I was in the middle of the meeting room floor. Not acceptable! Lucky I had an early flight, as they had their door open literally 15ft away, and had a full meeting going on. Noisy and annoying. Disappointing.

review.title: Is just ok , ok?
review.reviewText: We arrived late at night due to flight delays. We drove in from SFO using our GPS and I was thankful for packing it with me although I regretted not bringing Dirty Harry with me to make me feel safer in that meighborhood at night. We parked at the front to register.There is no service at the front , no bellhops, no valet service which is inconvenient when travelling with 3 kids and a lot of luggage. The two security/police officers at the front just sit there and get a kick out of watching you unload. The staff is very nice and provide the best service they can.but that only goes so far. In my next trip to SFO I will be staying elsewhere.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is noisy , you can hear everyting from the adjacent room, the decor/rugs are quite dated ( very 70's).
review.locationRemarks: The location is convenient but the neighborhood at night is quite suspect bordering on ghetto.

review.title: Great Place To Stay, but Pricey
review.reviewText: Great location. Friendly and helpful staff. Beautiful view from the 37th floor of tower 1. Nice health club. Complimentary breakfast at Starbucks was helpful on the wallet, but at $280 for 1 night, quite a pricey stay...

review.title: Busy busy busy
review.reviewText: SO busy ALL the time... Crazy lineups everywhere. The lobby is busy at all hours of the day. Great location though. Room was really small, the bathroom was like a closet but we walked just about everywhere and that was nice. All the staff was really helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom was the size of a closet. It even had closet like doors.
review.locationRemarks: Really good location. Walked everywhere, took the public transit from the airport.

review.title: meeting trip
review.reviewText: I was expecting a better room and restroom condition. It is obvious that is not kept on continuos maintenance. Otherwise, lobby and amenities are in great shape. i was on business trip, ballroom and meeting room are well managed by staff and logistic.
review.locationRemarks: close to cable car and powell street

review.title: Good location, very comfortable.
review.reviewText:
Very pleasant stay at a recent business convention. Meeting space is huge and comfortable. Rooms a clean and comfortable with the usual amenities, with the exception of an expensive internet connection. This seems to be the standard in the US. They could really learn a lesson from European hotels and offer free or inexpensive internet hookup! Also, when I paid for the room's internet connection, I couldn't access it from the meeting rooms. Bathrooms are small.

Overall though I had a really pleasant stay. Great restaurants within walking distance made this a fantastic experience.

review.title: good hotel with bad internet
review.reviewText: It was good and convenient because it has the ballroom were i was attending the conference. the problem is in it's location. it just didn't feel safe walking around in that area! and another major problem within the hotel they don't offer free wifi (apart from the lobby) i thought they offer "free" wifi in the room when i booked the hotel! but when i went there the wifi was limited to guests with coupons or guests with hilton honors membership! everyone else can use the "free" wifi in the lobby! however even if you purchase the wifi in th room its too slow and keeps disconnecting.
review.positiveRemarks: close to the harbor (20 min walk in Market st) and close to shopping mall "Westfield".
review.negativeRemarks: internet
review.locationRemarks: didn't feel safe in the neighborhood. try not to walk alone at night!

review.title: Poor value for money, and terrible internet access
review.reviewText: If you could get this hotel at half their usual rate, then it would be an OK deal. But the overall experience is that of an overly large corporate conference hotel, with cold corporate service, and some annoying touches (like a leaking bathroom ceiling). You are paying for a lot of business facilities that you probably won't use. My main gripe would be that you have to pay for internet access in the room (I had to select a special rate for 'free' wifi, which was about 12 bucks a night more), but the wifi connectivity (or bandwidth) is not able to support the number of people using it, so you are constantly losing your internet connection. Constantly having to sign in through complex splash pages is also a pian. Smaller hotels handle internet access so much better. (Internet access was better in the lobby, but in a hotel this size you don't want to have to go down to the lobby every time the internet drops off in your room.) The "breakfast", included free, was just a voucher to use at the Starbucks in the lobby, where everyone else in the hotel is also lining up (about 20 people in line most mornings). If this was the Holiday Inn it would be OK, but you are paying about double that rate. It should be possible to find a better experience for a lower rate.
review.negativeRemarks: The terrible internet connectivity. When you're paying this much, you deserve wifi that just works.
review.locationRemarks: The location is good for the BART and the Muni, but if you are tourist you could look elsewhere, since this is bordering on the Tenderloin.

review.title: Surprisingly quite corner room
review.reviewText: Love the quiet room I the corner; but not impressed with the size of the bathroom. It was a size of a shoe box...

review.title: Great place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean, room was modern and up to date and very well laid out. Hotel overall in great condition and staff were all friendly. Location is great for seeing the city.

review.title: Understaffed check in counter
review.reviewText: The worst check in I have ever encountered. I had to wait over ten minutes maybe more before I could reach the counter and I was first in line. At one point I didn't think there was even any staff manning the regular counter except for those lucky Hilton Honors clients. No apology, nothing.

review.title: Guaranteed great time
review.reviewText:
Hoteliers were so kind that they helped me out!
They offered Japanese interpreter for me and he helped me out contacting insurance company when I needed to call insurance company for claiming my robbing.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom's door because it was not usual.

review.title: great service
review.reviewText: great experience, very comfortable, clean and elegant

review.title: Good Hottel, very close to downtown.
review.reviewText: Good reception inmediatly, godd service, the room clean fast, in general very good attention.

review.title: hilton on o'farrell
review.reviewText: slightly older hotel but comfortable, clean, and convenient nonetheless..

review.title: Ok Hotel
review.reviewText:
Room was not what was shown on the website.

Room was not very clean, not at all what I expected from 4 star hotel.
We were there for New Years, so timing would be an issue.

Ice machine was broke and it took a day to get nonfeather pillows.
review.negativeRemarks: No on-site restaurant, just a Starbucks coffee too small for the demand.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: my trip
review.reviewText:
the pictures for the reservation shows the renovated area that is only 30 % of the hotel
therefore you have to be lucky to have one of this rooms
the regular rooms are old and old fashion,,carpet clean but old
Also never told before the arriving that parking cost 52 dollars a day ,,,, amost 50% of the room ,,, this is ridiculous
review.negativeRemarks: old

review.title: Bad experience
review.reviewText: First night we experienced broken closet door. After complaint we were giving another room. The toilet flushers broke in the second room. This Hilton is not what you would like to stay.

review.title: GREAT HOTEL FOR EVERY ONE
review.reviewText: A GOOD HOTEL, I DO NOT LOVE THE UNION SQUERE AREA BUT IT WAS A GOOD HOTEL. BUT IF YOU ARE HAVING DINNER AT THE PIER AND YOUR HOTEL IN UNION SQUERE IN NEW YER'S EVE FORGERET IT IMPOSIBLE TO FIND A CAB.
review.positiveRemarks: the room was confi, the beds good.

review.title: Good Location .... But nothing more
review.reviewText: Location is very good, but the price paid is high for what you get. Rooms are small, specially the bathrooms.

review.title: nice stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was perfect for our stay in San Francisco. It was in the center of everything and easily accessible when it came to public transportation. The concierge was especially helpful with helping us plan our day and suggesting things to do/places to eat. Our room, in the renovated tower, was nice and comfortable. The only problem was the tabletops were a bit dusty and didn't seem to get cleaned from day to day. The main lobby was a great place to regroup, always bustling and the main place because of the free wifi. Overall, would recommend this hotel for a stay in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: busy lobby, borders a not so great area

review.title: Great Hotel in Central area of downtown SF!
review.reviewText: only negative was the slow check-in process. Rooms were great, open, beautiful lobby with a Starbucks IN the hotel!

The 2 whom I had interactions with at the front desk during checking in and out process need to loose the attitudes, be a little more helpful and smile more.

review.title: Hotel with a great attitude!
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a terrific location in San Francisco. Best of all, they have the most pleasant staff around...always there with a smile, personal greeting and they seem to love their jobs. The people are just wonderful here...you will NOT be disappointed.

review.title: Family of 4 (mom, dad & 2 boy (13 & 10)
review.reviewText:
Family of four. Kids are 13 and 10. The reception area was very festive and got us in the holiday spirit. Our boys loved checking out the machine in one of the lobby hallways that sold unique items where you could click on an electronic keypad to see price etc. Likewise I thought having a flat screen TV displayed in a public area showing flights in/out of SFO very innovative. There is a Starbucks right in the reception area and plenty of areas to grab a seat and have a quiet conversation (good place for an interview in the hotel lobby!) or simply people watch.

We had two double beds. We are used to bigger bed so found it a little confining. However the pillows and mattress more than made up for this inconvenience. Our kids swam in the very adequate outdoor heated pool and had a great time. It was dark however with no lighting which seemed strange. There was a nice hot-tub too.

This hotel is very central to Union Square, to view the tree, do some ice-skating, shop at Westfield mall, check-out Chinatown or visit one of the many surrounding restaurants to eat. Our choice was Foleys which is a block from the hotel. Also, it's just a bus-ride to Japantown or Fishermans Wharf. If you do your homework, you can see a lot by staying at this location. We had fun and will revisit.

review.title: Lovely hotel near Union Square & transportation
review.reviewText: What a lovely hotel! We've stayed in many Union Square hotels over the years and the Hilton was one of the best for the price. Happened to get a great deal for the weekend. Great location and very pretty and clean inside. Staff was friendly and accomodating. Room was just fine. Clean and roomy, (unless you get a suite, hotel rooms seem to getting smaller by the minute) housekeeping was good, nice bathroom with plenty of counter space which can be a problem in hotels. But the bathtub plug wouldn't stay closed so my evening hot bath didn't happen - shower was ok - OH! and the hot/cold dial was reversed! Hope no body gets burned on THAT! But over all, we'd stay there again in a minute.
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby Christmas decor and a Starbucks INSIDE.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom tub plug wouldn't hold water.
review.locationRemarks: Location was good - near everything Union Square and on a clean, safe street. Some of these hotels are on side streets that are creepy at night.

review.title: close to union square
review.reviewText: Location was real good,two or three blocks from union square. The staff and the hotel was everything that you could have asked for. The parking like most places in San Francisco was very high, but public parking accross the street was $13.00 less than valet or self park in the Hotels lot. Would stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: parking

review.title: Great hotel - so clean and new.....
review.reviewText:
Amazing, only good.
Great for everybody.
Amazing location too.

review.title: Perfect city location
review.reviewText: Room was ready when we arrived in the city; lobby can be quite chaotic but the room location was very quiet. Bathroom tiny but well appointed. Overall a very pleasant, albeit short, stay.

review.title: good for a short stay in downtown
review.reviewText: This is a convention center with massive number of rooms. Depending on which tower and.floor your room is, the results could vary greatly. Overall nice stay, was in a Hilton honors level room which was as good as some 5 star hotels that I have stayed in. There is a Starbucks.and.free WiFi in the lobby which is nice. Location of this hotel is good. 5 minute wall to all of the high end shopping in union square. Beware of proximity to the tenderloin district though, very off putting with homeless people, obviously drugged up and drunk folks all over the place. Other than that, highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great tourist and family location
review.reviewText: The room was a little small for 3 people, but we made it work. The bathroom was large and had enough space for all our stuff, so that was nice. The walls seem a bit thin, so we could hear people opening the sliding door above/below us and also people in the halls, but nothing we couldn't handle. The hotel is in a good location for tourists that want to see the city for the first time, just a little close to a grimy neighborhood. For someone in their mid 20s like me, I would have preferred one of the more "hip" neighborhoods.
review.negativeRemarks: room space
review.locationRemarks: see above

review.title: Wireless is not free!
review.reviewText: It is outrageous that with the high hotel rates of this Hilton that in-room wireless is not free. The daily wireless charge was $12.95. I will never stay at a hilton again.

review.title: Great Pool but Dark Room and Small Sink
review.reviewText: Room is poorly lit. There is no overhead lighting and fixtures near bed and desk are dim. Bathroom sink is narrow (no depth) and difficult to use for shaving and washing your face. Nice view over pool when you are on 15, 16, or 17 floor. A great pool and facilities for exercise.
review.negativeRemarks: Dark room, small sink
review.locationRemarks: Convenient for Union Station & Moscone

review.title: Great centralized location!

review.title: Overall nice hotel. Close to everything.
review.reviewText:
My family and I stayed here over Thanksgiving Weekend. I liked that the check-in line was practically non-existent especially that the lobby was busy and full of people (in a good way). The hotel has 3 towers. Tower #3 is the only tower that got renovated, so when you're checking in make sure you get a room in tower 3. The other two towers are old and tired with 80's decor taste (>_>). (you have to give your best sad-puppy-face in order for the clerk to "double-check" if any of the tower 3 rooms are available after he's told you that they're all sold out)
The rooms are pretty tiny compared to ,say, Vegas hotels but it's not horrible. We were a family of 5 and we were ok. Just don't stay in too long or else you're gonna start taking out your claustrophobia on each other. The room was clean and tidy with the usual/basic amenities (it was missing q-tips though and i know a few people that care about that). There was a working mini-fridge that you can use at liberty. The beds weren't the most comfortable, especially the pillows. the pillows were a little too soft and "mushy" for my liking.
We had Thanksgiving dinner at The Urban Tavern (hotel's restaurant) and it was pretty good. No complaints there. It was a set menu so I didn't get to try their regular menu.
Another plus is that there's a Starbucks in the lobby. Something about seeing Starbucks there, anywhere, was comforting. (expect long lines in the morning)
Staff was nice and prompt.
Parking fee. straight robbery.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee
review.locationRemarks: Location was great. 10 minutes away from all tourist locations. A lot of stores within walking distance. A pub that looked fun next door to the hotel.

review.title: Smelled musky, ok, but thought it would be better
review.reviewText:
Smelled musky.
No free Internet.
Great location.
Staff was very good, came in during cleaning, they insisted on checking my card. Felt good that the staff did that.

review.title: Business Travelers
review.reviewText: I booked a visit there for my 20th wedding anniversary. We stayed in a very nice remodeled room in Tower 3. However, this hotel has undergone a major overhaul and has gotten rid of the shops they use to have as well as the hotel restaurant. There is a new restaurant called Urban Tavern that is swanky and good, but I was looking for a place with a good Sunday brunch. Also, the new rooms are smaller, the older rooms were larger and had floor to ceiling windows. It appears that they cater more to business travelers than couples or families.

review.title: Couple trip to SF
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hilton during Thanksgiving weekend. We had booked through Expedia and then called in to the hotel to request the renovated (new room). They granted it immediately. On the day of our reservations, we checked in slightly early (around 2pm) and within a couple minutes, we had our keys. Service was fast. We got the highest floor to the hotel and the room was indeed new and very clean. Everything was great! Nice view, nice utilities, comfortable bed, long sofa, a couple streets to union square, easy access to shopping and taxi, etc. My only call outs are that the sink was super tiny (felt like I was using the bathroom in the airplane), parking was $$$, and that wireless internet was an additional cost. They did however have a much cheaper in-n-out parking across the street and free internet in the lobby. So it all worked out! Will recommend.

review.title: pretty decent
review.reviewText: In a nice location, the hotel and the room service is very decent too. We lived in tower 1, kinda like an old small tower, room is small and the bathroom is like a 3 stars hotel. But the price is fair enough.

review.title: Good Hotel. Bad 'Net Connectivity. Bipolar Shower.
review.reviewText:
Here's the thing about hotels; when they do everything right, they don't get the credit due for smooth service. However when things go wrong...

So my basic comment is that most of the hotel is in good shape. The gym is really well stocked and the hotel is in a good location.

On the other hand...
- I could not get reliable hot water for my shower. Sometimes it would go from hot to lukewarm back to hot. They probably need to replace the water heaters.
- Internet connectivity was a pain. The user acceptance UI was a chore to work through and my access often was dropped in the middle of something. The hotel also tried to charge me double for the same timeframe.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet Connectivity

review.title: Business meeting

I heard the elevator noise going up an down, The shower head did not work properly at all. I guess you get what you pay for. I would have chosen a different option if the deal I was getting meant a sub-standard room.

review.title: Don't Get Lost in the Lobby
review.reviewText: The Hilton is clearly a businessman's hotel. It is not for families looking for a quieter environment. Its cavernous lobby looked like Grand Central Station while we were there (the Oracle convention was in town): always crowded, always loud. We tried the coffee shop to escape the noise, and left. It was just as loud.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk and concierge staff was unfailingly polite and helpful–when you could get in front of one.

review.title: Not up to Hilton's usual standards.

Therefore a $12 daily charge for wi-fi and plates left outside rooms for 24 hours is unacceptable. Also the attached bar/restaurant was also sub-standard, in a city with some serious competition! Just walk a block and find a lot better!
Location was great, lots of local amenities but this particular Hilton was well below the expected standard for this brand.
Disappointing.
