review.locationRemarks: Perfect! Close to Bart system and trolleys! Perfect for the shopper, lots of stores!

review.title: Great stay, would recommend
review.reviewText: Great stay and a GREAT location. This hotel was very nice and convenient to public transit to get around the city. Shopping and restaurants all around. Also decently priced parking in the garage across the street. My only problem was with the noise. We could hear every little noise in the hallway, including talking, doors closing, etc.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, comfy bed, clean, nice staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy
review.locationRemarks: Awesome location. Right by Union Square and lots of shopping and eateries.

review.title: not good place to stay and not hospitable
review.reviewText: they are not helpful, luck of glass in room and bath tab is clog i call them for 3 times . their accommedation is not good.
review.negativeRemarks: the lobby is okay
review.locationRemarks: the location is okay

review.title: Good time, look forward to doing it again.
review.reviewText: My fiance and I stayed over the Labor Day weekend. The room was nice and clean. The only thing I did notice is that the elevator lobby smelled like trash, not sure why. I did like that we got certificates for Starbucks located within the hotel which gave us any drink, pastry item and fruit all for FREE everyday we stayed. That's definitely a plus. The hotel is located in Union Sqaure which is a very upbeat area, full of life, and action mostly every night. We were able to walk from Chinatown to our hotel, with many restaurants and shops along the way.
review.negativeRemarks: Smelly lobby
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located to many shops, restaurants, nightlife & etc. Chinatown is within walking distance

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: Restroom was a little small. Did not like the fact that there was no lock on restroom door; it's a slide door. Other than that, everything else was ok.
review.locationRemarks: Location was good; walking distance to all the shops on Union Square.

review.title: Awesome location! Very clean hotel!
review.reviewText: LOVED the location! Right in the SMACK of Union Square. The only con was that the walls were really thin. So we could hear all the conversations of the other patrons, as they walked down the halls.
review.negativeRemarks: thin walls

review.title: Great hotel in downtown san francisco
review.reviewText: We got a standard room and it was a nice size for san francisco area and the money we paid. Restrooms were nice and upgraded but kinda small in size. Staff and the roomkeepers were attentive.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking cost
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to shopping and dining areas

review.title: Beautiful views, comfortable rooms
review.reviewText: This was a wonderful experience. The staff was friendly and welcoming. The hotel was clean and the room was very comfortable. The view from the balcony was amazing. All in all it was a great experience and I will definitely book here on my next trips!
review.positiveRemarks: Balcony views, comfy beds, friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: Good location central to union square area and shopping

review.title: Find a public parking before booking this hotel.
review.reviewText:
Hall ways were not that clean.
Parking is very expensive at this hotel and generally speaking at SF.

review.title: Black Mold
review.reviewText: There was an abundance of black mold in the bathroom and the toilet ran 2 nights in a row, despite calling maintenance. I always stay at this hotel when I go to San Francisco, though I hadn't been in serveral years and was very disappointed by this room.
review.locationRemarks: You can't ask for a better location.

review.title: Awesome hotel for a cheap price
review.reviewText: Really nice people, excellent service, really convenient spot of the city.
review.negativeRemarks: free wifi is provided in the lobby but not the rooms
review.locationRemarks: Super convenient

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel. The only thing was uncomfortable was the room size. Other then that It was great hotel to stay:)
review.negativeRemarks: room space
review.locationRemarks: great location, close to everything

review.title: Couples will love the quality and affordability.
review.reviewText: The room was spacious and comfortable. An empty beer bottle was located outside the elevator for the duration of our weekend stay, but otherwise, we were impressed with the quality and friendliness of our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: price of breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Perfect! In the heart of San Francisco!

review.title: lovely hotel
review.reviewText: great location! beautiful hotel, friendly staff, very clean rooms. only downfall would be the very crowded and busy lobby...

review.title: Don't Valet your car here!
review.reviewText: The parking garage is outrageous $59.00/day for valet is robbery!
review.negativeRemarks: Rusty water coming out when you start the shower

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. My wife and I were booked for a room with a queen bed. When we arrived, the hotel staff notified us if wanted to check in at that moment which was before the check-in time they only had half a suite available with the cityscape view. The only disadvantage was the beds. They only had roll away beds. He told us we can go take a look it and see if we liked it. If we didnt like it then he'll make sure our original room was ready for us at the scheduled check-in time and he also offered free Wi-Fi for the entire stay. The suite was fantastic. It had a great view of ocean, golden gate bridge and bay bridge. We had 3 roll away beds, so the bed would seem exceptionally bigger than a king size bed, huge bathroom, living room and a kitchen area with a sink and refrigerator. The hotel is also in a great location, right in the heart of San Francisco. The mall, transportation options and great restaurants are right around the corner. In all, great room, great staff, great city and Great hotel. I will stay at this Hilton again when visiting San Francisco.

review.title: Great location & clean. Save $ by book in advance!
review.reviewText: We bought our 2 double rooms through Expedia months in advance. I called the Hilton & the answering service wasn't very helpful. They could not see my confirmation nor add a roll away bed. No one in my party could check us in early. I got early check in. They had to do room adjustments. But the rooms were gorgeous!!! Parking is expensive but the lot across the street was full. It would have been $32 instead of $53 for 24hr. In tower 1, before riding elevator, not a cleanly odor in that lobby (smell of garbage). However, view amazing, 32floor tower 1! Nice lobby. Safe hotel at 1:30am, they only let in people with their room keys.
review.positiveRemarks: The balcony & front desk being flexible with check in & rooms!
review.negativeRemarks: The garbage smell in that tower 1 first floor & the confirmation hotline, could not see reservation bc we bought 3rd party.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for walking distance to restaurants, union square, and clubs. But never going down Ellis Street, so dirty & unsafe.

review.title: Check into another hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at another Union Square hotel the nights before and we were very disappointed with the Hilton. The room was okay, the wallpaper was peeling at the seam and our view was top of a garage parking lot across the street. Which I would recommend to park your car and save a few dollars instead of parking at the hotel. We noticed there were tags from the previous guest left in the drawer and fingerprints on the closet mirrors. The lamp shades were tilted and needed to be straighten. It is located at the outskirts of Union Square right next to a iffy area of the Tenderloin. If you make a wrong turn you will see where the drug addicts live.
review.negativeRemarks: Peeling wallpaper and messy room.
review.locationRemarks: Outskirts of Union Square across from the Tenderloin.

review.title: Not recommended for a family.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and pretty. However I would not recommend this one to a family with children. The only restaurant in the hotel is a restaurant/bar with a limited menu. The room had no refrigerator or microwave. There was not a snack or pop machine on the floors. The only place to buy drinks was in the gift shop or a very expensive coffee shop. There was a pool. The in room coffee pot was not working properly. The area does not have many restaurants either, so walking to eat was difficult. It was close to the cable car line. We did have a good view , paid extra for this.
review.negativeRemarks: eating not convenient.
review.locationRemarks: few restaurants in the area unless you walk several blocks.

review.title: Great central location with good connections
review.reviewText: Room decor is dated, otherwise no complaints had a very comfortable stay with family. Great location very central.

review.title: Dangerous neighborhood. Poor Service.
review.reviewText: Geared for business conventions. Crowded. Poor level of attention. Computers down causing need to wait in very, very long check-in lines multiple times - a challenge with children.Feel like cattle being herded. Once checked-in, forget about any service- impossible to reach under-staffed concierage. Entrance side of hotel busy all the time so feel safe. Went to coffee shop behind hotel to get a snackn for children - place robbed while there. Vagarents everywhere. Multiple Cab drivers and police told us hotel is in a unsafe area- never walk around at night and never walk to sides or back of hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Poor Service. Massive - lost finding room. Unfriendly staff- focus on hosting large business conventions only.
review.locationRemarks: Dangerours Neighborhood - sides and back of hotel must stay away from.

review.title: Dissappointing
review.reviewText:
I had a reservation for three rooms and the first night they could only give us two rooms on the same floor, the third room was on the seventh floor and it was really small, nothing like the pictures. There was almost no space between one of the beds and the wall. It was considerably smaller than the other rooms.

On the other hand, we were surprised that only in the lobby you have free internet, if you are not a Hilton Honors member you have to pay to have internet in your room.

If you turn the bathroom light on at night, it lights up all the room.
review.negativeRemarks: The room.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Disappointed by Hilton
review.reviewText: We failed to realize that the wi-fi was not free. I have rarely stayed at a hotel without free wi-fi and with three teens we really needed it. When we complained about this oversight, there was no response from the front desk staff. It wasn't until we decided to upgrade our room and a very frank conversation with the front desk staff that she finally comped us the wi-fi. I felt like it was American Airlines all over again, nickel and diming us with "extras". I also couldn't understand why a hotel chain as big as Hilton doesn't routinely offer its patrons free wi-fi except in the lobby. Now I understand why the lobby was always so full.
review.negativeRemarks: No free wi-fi
review.locationRemarks: Union Square - perfect location

review.title: Very pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Incredible view with a balcony this was a very pleasant hotel stay. Rooms were very clean as I would expect. The only issue was very lengthy lines at check in took almost 30 minutes to check in.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco union square

review.title: Great Family Experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was very big but it was still very comfortable . It was near Union Square and close to shopping ! We went to the Giants game and had to take a cab but it was still a very nice experience . Would stay there again !
review.negativeRemarks: Window was kind of small .
review.locationRemarks: Centralized area , felt like we were close to many shops and restraunts .

review.title: Great!!!
review.reviewText: just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!just Great!!

review.title: Above Average hotel
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was nice and clean. Our room was very quiet. But the room was very small which was hard for a family of four. And the bathroom had no lock on it. Families should know that Union Square is a very busy, densely populated area. There were vagrants begging on the streets everywhere. My children got quite an education about life walking the streets down there.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet room, fairly clean, fairly comfortable beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Located in a busy, urban environment. Small room, No lock bathroom door.
review.locationRemarks: Busy, busy environment. Close to lots of things. Lots of bums everywhere.

review.title: Fine to sleep in, nothing special
review.reviewText:
Inexpensive option in an expensive town.
Pros: Large room, comfortable bedding, very clean, two blocks from union square
Cons: Noisy/busy lobby with long check-in lines, long walk from elevator, no bath tub, loud shower drain, low water pressure, strange room set-up (TV 15 feet from end of bed), noisy (because window sash has ventilation strips in it allowing noise and wind from outside to be heard), right on border of poor area (lots of homeless)

Did the job for five nights while in town for conference. But nothing special - would stay elsewhere if I visited again.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Too big for us! The lobby seemed like Grand Central Station! Very good location in the city. Easy walking to many attractions and stores.

review.title: San Francisco - I love you.
review.reviewText: The hotel is very well situated - close enough to Union Square which is an easy walk away. It is also just distant enough to be away from the excess noise of the square and the cable cars. It is also very close to the Geary and Curran theatres and to many art galleries.
review.negativeRemarks: The traffic pattern in the lobby - the Starbucks location is not helpful.
review.locationRemarks: See above comments.

review.title: Meh
review.reviewText: We were surprised that there was no minibar in the room. Also there was lack of attention to detail such as refreshing our coffee implements and clean drinking glasses. An ok hotel but not A huge amount to write home about.
review.positiveRemarks: Good location near union square and Powell street station
review.negativeRemarks: No minibar!

review.title: Dissapointed HHonors member
review.reviewText: As a HHonors member I was looking forward to a good experience. Unfortuately that did not happen. Rooms still were not clean when we arrived at 6 PM. The check in process was lengthy since there was not an appropriate room. The room was only partially cleaned and prepared for new guests, long hairs all over bathroom, no glasses, noisy cramped room on 10th floor of 3rd tower. Did receive free WiFi as member, but there was no information given on HHonors benefits, again disappointing. Honors desk staff were not very helpful the next morning, asked we return to hotel after 1PM so we could look together for another room, unfortunately I was there on business, so could not return until the evening. We ended up staying in the cramped, poorly set up room with a view of the garage across the street and no where to sit. Also I requested a room closer to the elevators for seniors in our party, we were placed at the back of tower with long hallways, adding to our dissapointing stay. I wrote my concerns to Hilton, but have not received a reply.
review.positiveRemarks: location is good, especially if you are in the mood for good food and geat shopping. Staff were polite, when fulfilling requests.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was cramped and there was no where to sit except on the bed. Room was not clean and we had to call daily for glasses, coffee cups, toilet paper.
review.locationRemarks: Good central location, easy walk to many locations and public transport. Ample parking.

review.title: Pleasant stay.
review.reviewText: Hotel is clean and room was comfortable. Great location for San Francisco. Walking distance to transportation and Chinatown. If you're in good shape you could walk to most places in the city. We walked from Fisherman's Wharf and Little Italy twice and walked to the crooked part of Lombard street. There is a Walgreens located a couple of blocks away and we bought water, milk, and snacks and kept them in the mini-fridge located in our room. First morning a breaker blew and the lights in the bathroom went out but it was fixed, without anyone having to enter our room, within a short time.
review.negativeRemarks: Room is compact.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. If you want to be near the tourist area of Fisherman's Wharf it might be best to stay closer to the Wharf.

review.title: Great location to stay in SF
review.reviewText:
Even the hotel having a lot of rooms, they somehow make everything work perfect.

The place is perfect, we could walk everywhere.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: A MUST
review.reviewText: We arrived after midnight, and the staff were super awesome to us. We wanted to go out and explpored the nighlife They inform us to all the awesome place within walking distance. Love the location. Couldnt ask for a better place to stay at.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
The main hotel was well maintained however, the room and corridors were a little out dated. The room was also very small and we chose the medium size room too.

A great location though. Tour buses stop out side the street on Mason Street. Great location for walking into Union Square. Didn't spend much time in the hotel we were always out and about doing things in San Fran.

Parking is a little expensive only $6 for valet parking. But, very helpful valet guys.
review.negativeRemarks: Old, run-down and expensive valet
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Not bad for the price...
review.reviewText:
We were the grandparents on this family vacation and the hotel was secondary to seeing the sights of San Francisco. So we felt the accommodations were adequate but not a place you would want to hangout at. The lobby was overflowing with conventioneers when we arrived and it was a little hectic at check-in, but the staff was very pleasant and helpful. Didn't try the bar and restaurant but liked having Starbucks there. Parking garage was tight space-wise, and very expensive. If you don't mind walking or using public transportation, you can leave the car at home and get to most of the highlights that way.
I would stay there again as the price was good. I recommend it as long as you aren't expecting a "luxury" experience. if you have children, there is nothing there specifically for them.The rooms do not have refrigerators.
review.positiveRemarks: Very good value for the price. Starbucks is in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Though well maintained, it's old. Missed the make-up mirror in the bathroom. The toilets are water-savers. Parking fee is high; spaces are tight!
review.locationRemarks: Great central location to shopping and most public transportation. Get a Muni-pass from the Visitors Center in Union Square within walking distance.

review.title: Nice Hilton
review.reviewText: Nice hotel good location. Restaurant for breakfast was good. As with all hotels in SF parking cost is outrageous.

review.title: Room too small for family.
review.reviewText: Hotel too sprawling for my taste. Newly refurbished room in Tower 3 was small for 2 adults and 2 children. Small storage/hanging space and tiny bathroom surfaces. Otherwise very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Size. Outdoor swimming pool...too chilly to sit and watch children swim.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for sightseeing, which we were doing.

review.title: Not a bad place.. good for family, kind of crowded
review.reviewText:
I have rated the hotel "4" based upon the questions asked. I guess I would recommend it but it's a tough question. For those people who are not "picky" I would say... yes. For those individuals who want something more modern and spunky, I would say ... no.

I was at the Palomar Hotel just last month for a weekend fun trip (no kids) and it was perfect. Great location, great atmosphere, nice room and not crowded.

This weekend was intended to be more family oriented. Yes, the hotel was clean and the staff was nice. It just didn't have the "spunk" I would have preferred. Kinda boring atmosphere.

If you're just looking for a place to stay.. then I'd stay here. If you want some place that is more personable w/o the crowds, I would recommend some other hotel.

review.title: Decent Place, Little Pricey
review.reviewText: Nice place, but for the price, less than expected. The Fairmont is a lot nicer and not much more expensive. On the other end, there are smaller hotels in the vicinity that are just as nice and less expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: Centrally located, lively place, Starbucks in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: For the price, the room was not that great
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located, close to shops, restaurants, etc...

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel and nice location. Pool was very nice for family.I would stay here again.

review.title: In city hotel
review.reviewText: Our stay was OK. Typical city hotel. Close to Union Square and activities.
review.negativeRemarks: Too crowded
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything

review.title: San Francisco Experience
review.reviewText: The hotel staff from registration, concierge, housekeeping, parking were friendly and helpful except for one Asian lady at the Tour section. I am surprised that Starbucks closes early especially if you want an early evening latte/frap. Overall, the hotel location was convenient to shop or eat.
review.negativeRemarks: Room somewhat small.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for shopping/eating.

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Quiet, comfortable and close to shopping, cable cars, transit and restaurants.

review.title: Stay somewhere
review.reviewText:
We prefer to stay at Hiltons but our most recent stay at this hotel was very disappointing. Our bathroom ceiling was peeling from MOLD!!! Their staff apologized for the inconvenience and transferred us to another room with a great view. Unfortunately there was still another disappointment: The shower handle broke off!
The pros of this hotel is that they have a friendly staff and great location near Union Square shopping.

review.title: Good for People Watching
review.reviewText: The Hilton Union Square lobby is kind of exciting--like Grand Central Station. There were throngs of people and a winding check-in line--maybe because we were there on a Friday. But the line went fairly quickly, and it's fun to people watch. The place is immense. We were in Tower 1. There was a sewer smell on the way to the elevators. Not sure they can do anything about that. Our room was just okay. The restaurant did not feel inviting.
review.negativeRemarks: The sewer smell as you walk to the Tower 1 elevators. The restaurant was not inviting.
review.locationRemarks: Not applicable.

review.title: GREAT HOTEL FOR FUN VACATIONS.
review.reviewText:
THIS HOTEL HAVE AN EXCELLENT UBICATION

NICE HOTEL, EXCELLENT LOCATION NEAR FROM MANY ATRACTIONS, ONLY ONE BLOCK FROM UNION SQUARE AND TWO BLOCKS OF CABLE CAR STATION.
OVERALL EXCELLENT HOTEL.
review.locationRemarks: EXCELLENT LOCATION

review.title: Horrible Service and treatment
review.reviewText: After not letting me cancel my reservation due to policies they tried to make me stay in a suite with no bed and only a pull out couch or a smoking room when I requested non-smoking because they were oversold. The customer survice was horrible and I will not be staying here again

review.title: Its the Tenderloin NOT Union Square
review.reviewText:
I stayed with family so the lack of upkeep didn't offend as much.
Also - this hotel is practically in the Tenderloin NOT Union Square, which is unfair to tourists.
review.positiveRemarks: The Size of it - we were able to check in an hour early
review.negativeRemarks: The size of it - things go unnoticed or unkempt here due to its massive size
review.locationRemarks: It's in the Tenderloin NOT Union Square, which is unfair to tourists

review.title: Good For Family
review.reviewText:
Good Location, Close to the union Square and Shopping Centers
the rooms are too small and old

review.title: will not stay here again
review.reviewText:
area around room was to noisy and parking was over priced so will never stay at this hotel
again

review.title: It is what it is.
review.reviewText: The bed are way too soft. Ended up with a painful back.
review.negativeRemarks: Crowded lobby, soft bed
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: Good for a business traveler
review.reviewText: Check-in takes too long. Location is alright depending on what you want. The car rentals are right across, but one side is not the best part of town. gym is great. Restaurants are alright. The Starbucks inside the hotel shuts down at 6pm.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing real significant
review.locationRemarks: Not the greatest!

review.title: Overall a good experience
review.reviewText: The hotel is located on the fringe of a "not so good" neiborhood. The conceirge advised us not to stroll to far to the Southwest because it is not such a great area. Ohterwise it was a pleasant experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Activity in the Lobby- very lively!
review.negativeRemarks: The feeling that we were at the edge almost in a bad area.
review.locationRemarks: Overall very pleasing.

review.title: A Wonderful place to stay
review.reviewText: Very safe, clean and beautiful! Swimming pool is nice but it would be much appreciated if there's an indoor one...
review.positiveRemarks: Close to area where I want to visit and I feel safe.
review.negativeRemarks: No indoor swimming pool. What if it's too cold.
review.locationRemarks: I like the location, coz I'm close to those the heart of san francisco.

review.title: Noisy No Sleep
review.reviewText: NOISY, Naan Curry Rest across the street (across from our room), is open 24hrs, around 8pm the music, screaming & street dancing started, SO loud our windows vibrated, didn't quit until 4am, otherwise a very pleasant stay. I would definately request to not be anywhere near the vacinity of that restaurant. Very unfortunate considering how much we paid for the one night.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, look of the room, enjoyed the linens & complimentary toiletries.
review.negativeRemarks: Very noisy outside of our room, kids & myself couldn't sleep, got lost trying to find our way out to the parking garage from the 7th floor, no signage

review.title: Felt secure bringing grandson here
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was great. Our room location was near a service area and we did experience some noise/drillling. Since we were out and about, not bad. Location is excellent for getting to transportation/variety of restaurants. Staff was very friendly and helpful. My daughter needed to print a confimation page and had a hot spot on her phone and could send to any wireless printer. She was more than willing to pay for the printing but had to pay $5 for a minimum of 10 minutes of their internet and $1 for the copy.Room was comfortable,clean and cleaning staff was also very pleasant. Would not hesitate to stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise near room

review.title: Not worth it!
review.reviewText: This hotel is more about convenient location than comfort. We were on a family vacation so thought this would be the place for us. The room had been halfway cleaned when we got there, the beds were made and the towels were fresh but there was a small frig of half eaten food and drinks. We called the front desk so they brought us new coffee refills in a bag and locked the frig...? The frig doesn't come free with the room, but for an up charge u can use the frig! Then, the wifi that's offered free isn't free in your room (that's an up charge of 13$) it's only free in the lobby. Really Hilton!? Which is a busy lobby at all times. We will try to find another place next time.
review.negativeRemarks: No free wifi
review.locationRemarks: Trolley near by

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: For the money, the room was sparse with little amenities. The bathroom size was a joke. There was room for only one and that wasn't even enough room. Silly

review.title: Awesome for first timers to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Our first time at this hotel and check in was easy and staff was very helpful. Our room on the 33rd floor in first tower was awesome with tremendous very of the city. A tad disappointed in the price of the breakfast....$18 for two cups of so so coffee and a glass of tomato juice...BUT, overall it was a get stay.
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast prices

review.title: Great location to all the modes of transportation.
review.reviewText: Beautiful, lively lobby. The room was a welcome site after a long day of walking the many hills of San Fran.

review.title: pleasing room
review.reviewText: the room was very clean. we didnot have a microwave or ref. we could not keep drinks cold. should have microwave and ref. in every room for the price.
review.locationRemarks: perfect location to walk everywhere

review.title: Don't think we'd stay again
review.reviewText:
Our first room on the 9th floor of tower three was very disappointing. The wall paper was peeling from the walls around the window, the carpets were stained (big stains), and the desk chair was dirty. We requested to be moved right away and were told that we could not until the next day as there were no rooms available. (They continued checking guests in all night long so I found that hard to believe :)) If this happens to you I recommend that you go down and talk to someone in person rather than on the phone as you get better service and I believe that we would have been moved the same night if I had done that.

The next room we had was on the 19th (highest) floor overlooking the pool area. The room was in better condition that the first one. The bathrooms are very small though and the shower had very low water pressure.

The location is good if you are interested in shopping, however, I think I would choose to stay closer to fisherman's wharf next time.

I was actually shocked at the number of homeless people in the area. Very sad.....

The line at Starbucks is quite long in the morning, but it moves really quickly so I would just wait in that line rather than go down the street.

The pool is heated but it closes very early at 9 o'clock. Also, there seemed to be a lack of towels every time we did try to go down.

Overall, I wasn't too pleased with my experience here. I expected a lot more from a Hilton and was disappointed. Definitely not a four star hotel experience.
review.negativeRemarks: staff, pool closes too early
review.locationRemarks: good for shopping if that's your thing

review.reviewText:
The sheets with holds , the room very dirty. the services terrible.
unpolite people.

i want my money back
review.negativeRemarks: service
review.locationRemarks: unfriendly terry customer service

review.title: Fantastic stay!
review.reviewText: What a fantastic stay! The rooms are clean and modern.The the staff are polite and helpful, and the security that shows up late at night keep the troublemakers and riffraff out.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Overall experiencewas good. Area around hotel could be tough if you go the wrong way. staff very friendly and yours are easy to book.
review.negativeRemarks: Area for Ice
review.locationRemarks: Looked bad at first but area is close to everything

review.title: Tiny but nice foyer
review.reviewText:
Arriving into the foyer you are confronted by 6 massive chandeliers. The foyer and lifts are very grand but that's about all. Check in took nearly an hour and the line only seemed to get busier, it was frustrating to see baggage staff stand around and not help to move the check in line along. There 3 different towers all with different elevators. However when waiting at your tower only specific lifts can take you to specific levels. This can make it hard trying to get elevator. Once you have managed to pass the elevators you are confronted by a very cold and long hallway. Unfortunately for us our room was the last room on that level right next to the ice machine. Once in our room you shuffle into a tiny tiny room that has only standing area apart from the beds. Being three of us with suitcases we had to move furniture around to make all our bags accessible. However in doing so we where unable to get around one bed and had to move a chair in between the two beds. This is how small the room was for 3 ppl imagine if there was 4.
Onthe positive side the staff where all very friendly and nice and helped us out with all our needs even when we required a doctor. Thankyou staff members hopefully the Hilton will put up the money required to match the decor to the service.
review.negativeRemarks: Tiny rooms
review.locationRemarks: Great location walking distance to trains cable cars shops and food stores

review.title: good value!
review.reviewText: good hotel in a good location, clean quiet rooms, comfortable beds.
review.negativeRemarks: none

review.title: ok

review.negativeRemarks: bed

review.title: Perfect Downtown Hotel
review.reviewText:
It was a very special weekend, my boyfriend & I were celebrating my birthday in SF.
I was thrilled with the kindness & understanding of the front desk agent / representative ( during check-in ) and the location & tower of our beautiful hotel room #3-1920 ( it was everything I wished for ).
We look forward to staying with you again very soon.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect Downtown Location

review.title: Is this hotel family friendly?
review.reviewText: Hotel was really nice but the service definitely let them down. Check in was great however every time we had a question, concierge were not very willing to help. At one stage 3 men were talking, arguing about who serves us.... Very poor. Room with 2 double beds was small & with our kids who were both over 6 the room was not suitable. Having come from Sydney & travelled 3 other states b4 San fransico, we had 4 large luggage bags which we had to store on the balcony as we couldn't get stuff in & out of them due to space.
review.negativeRemarks: Service poor for a 4.5 star hotel
review.locationRemarks: Good

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: would have been nice to have more drawer space besides the small night stand. The bathroom was very small and no where to put toiletries
review.negativeRemarks: room was small
review.locationRemarks: perfect. It was so close to the muni, cable cars and bart!!

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Great location to/from various sites and events. Transportation to most venues a plus. Easy to obtain info on events and area features.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: a personal experience
review.reviewText:
This was my first time in San Francisco and my first time booking a room on Expedia. The hotel staff was very accommodating, especially since we arrived hours before check in and luckily there was a room available ; albeit it was intended for a handicapped guest, the room was fine. Expedia was also very up to date with many emails on my itinerary. One thing I wish had been mentioned in the hotel information is that free parking is NOT included with your booking so expect to pay a pretty penny for parking.
This hotel is very popular so if you want quick service for anything do NOT go on a weekend. Other than that, I'd stay here again and book through Expedia again.
Happy travels!
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking

review.title: Great place, good location
review.reviewText: Great place, city view rooms offer great view of San Fran.

review.title: HUGE Hotel
review.reviewText:
Having Hilton name doesn't mean it's 4/5 star hotel by any means. It's a solid 3 maybe 3/12 star hotel.

This hotel is quite large, 3 towers, and there were tons of people staying there the week I was. The rooms are smaller that I anticipated and both of my rooms had really bad views.

The walk to my room was REALLY long, it took me about 5-8 minutes to get to the elevator.
The line to check in and out was really long and I had to wait longer than I would have liked.

Overall I didn't really enjoy my stay but for the price it was a good deal. It was a little too big and overcrowded and I would rather stay at another smaller hotel in Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Long walk to the rooms and not enough staff working at the front desk
review.locationRemarks: Good location in the Union Square area

review.title: Great time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Customer Server at the front desk is not friendly, or over the phone...the reservatons clerk on the phone were very rude!
review.negativeRemarks: The customer service, and the high price of the parking.
review.locationRemarks: Location was good

review.title: SFO weekend
review.reviewText: Good location. Room was a long way from elevator. 100 rooms per floor! So going to lobby every time you need wifi is a pain !! How about in room wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi access. Breakfast area just fair.
review.locationRemarks: Very good for walking to most things we wanted.

review.title: Hilton for Pride
review.reviewText:
centrally located close to everything, very reasonable price and room service was more than accomodating to me and my party! would strongly consider staying here again and trying to get a discounted price through expedia!
Thank you Hilton for a great stay!

review.title: Park elsewhere!
review.reviewText: I know another company operates parking but, $53 bucks? Very clean. A little noisy when people walk by my room as well as hearing soneone's door slam. Other than those 3 little things. No problem
review.negativeRemarks: Parking

review.title: No complaints at all.
review.reviewText: Wow...comfortable rooms with great beds, looked and smelled fresh and clean. Had been staying at less expensive places during our vacation and it was so wonderful to be in such a beautiful place. In-house parking handy but expensive ($50!!). Location great.
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable beds with plenty of pillows
review.negativeRemarks: expensive parking rates
review.locationRemarks: location right on Union Square. so fun!

review.title: Pride SF
review.reviewText: was able to check in early. very accommodating. friendly staff.
review.locationRemarks: perfect. short walk to the shops.

review.title: crapy customer service
review.reviewText: Parking way too over priced! The staff was not on the same page at all when ig came down yo pricing on parking! As soon as we got in the hotel it was dirty in the bathroom ...like seriously ...#gross.customer service was just plain rude

review.title: Tearin' up the toilet!
review.reviewText: Pride weekend. Rooms throughout the city were pretty much full. The best deal and being 4 stars. So I had to jump on it like it was HOT! Handsome gentlman at the front desk had no issues of adding two more guests to the two reserved. There are only 4 complaints. 1. The air circulator in the bathroom didn't work. I figured that out after I tore up the toilet and my partner happened to step in. Usually if you leave the light on the fan still circulates, LOL. 2. I suggest you park across the street in O'farrell garage. They have a 24 hour parking fee of $31 plus tax, Hilton parking came out to be around $55 after local tax. 3. You have to pay for WiFi unless you're a member, what ever that means. And 4. Local channels were all info-mercials.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking fee. It should have been free or discounted for guest. No toilet fan. Local channel were infomercials and you have to pay for WiFi.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square.

review.title: Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: Good hotel, convenient location. Services were quite good.. almost... until after check out. We realized that we have left something in the room and required to get back in again to retrieve. We contacted the Concierge, and wait for them at the room for 15 min.. ... asked again and waited... took almost 30 min. for the security to meet us at the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Service can be slow. At check out we left something in the room and required security to open the door. It took the almost 30 min. with 2 reminders.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location. Would recommend this hotel and location.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms were a little small

review.title: Terrible smell in Tower 2
review.reviewText: My room was in Tower 2. There was a terrible medicinal or chemical smell in the room. I advised the hotel staff but thought the smell would subside and left the windows open all night. The smell continued on day two and the front desk staff provided me with a "free breakfast" for the inconvenience. But the smell was HORRIBLE. On day three they sent up an ozone machine. Unfortunately the smell never subsided despite open windows for three days I contacted a manager, and asked him to please identify the source of the odor and to tell me what caused the smell and after a long conversation I convinced him to spend 10 minutes to check it out. He sent the floor manager and called me back after I had checked out, He said all the rooms in Tower 2 smell like that - and that is why they are renovating Tower 2 - it is just old he said and the smell in my room was not worse than any others .I asked him if the hotel had complaints from any other guests if the rooms all smelled this way. When he said "no" I was quite surprised , If that is the case it is unlikely that they all smell that way, He said he would make sure I got a room in Tower 3 if I visited again - or a room to my liking.
review.negativeRemarks: Terrible smell in the room and no change of rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Good location - close to public transportation and shoppin

review.title: Hotel comment
review.reviewText: Overall staff were very helpful although we did have one man at the concierge desk that could have been more helpful and pleasing.
review.locationRemarks: Location was excellent for shopping, close to Union Square and Westfield mall.

review.title: Clean safe hotel with thin walls

review.title: Great Stay

review.title: Overall OK!

Good experience, easy to access, the staff was helpful and nice.
They have a good bar on the lobby level. Parking is a little bit expensive but again is San Francisco...

review.title: super service.

review.positiveRemarks: very quiet room despite having the pool outside the back door.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing

review.title: Positive recommendation
review.reviewText: Great location to the public transportation system. Our City View Deluxe King was great. Pleasing five night stay.
review.positiveRemarks: City view, service and comfortable bed
review.negativeRemarks: No shuttle to the AirTran
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is centralized.

review.title: Two Nights in San Fran
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a great central location of the Union Square neighborhood. The rooms are comfortable, clean, and reasonably priced for the SF market. The only real downside to this hotel is that because the hotel has a conference center, during the week the hotel may have a conference/trade show or more and its too busy for vacationing travelers. This impacts the wait at the elevator and to the starbucks coffee shop and restaurant, checkin/checkout, taxi's and other similar services. To the credit of the Starbucks employees, they kept an efficient operation and a constant line of 20 more people moving and down to about a 10 minute wait to order and get your drink. There is a starbucks a couple blocks so it could take the same amount of time to walk there and back so its still convenient to get the coffee at the hotel.

So if you are okay with this slight inconvenience, then the hotel is just fine.
review.negativeRemarks: CoventionTraffic

review.title: Good visit to Hilton Union Square
review.reviewText: Parking is a problem if you have a car. Everything else is top notch.
review.negativeRemarks: parking is very expensive
review.locationRemarks: close to everything

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with convenient location if you're spending only couple of days. It is short walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown and many other places. There is a Walgreens closeby. Starbucks in the lobby and also next door. Small, local and affordable breakfast places around the corner if you don't want to spend all your money at the Hotel's breakfast. We wanted to drive along CA coast so rented a car. Couple of rent-a car places right across from the hotel. Parking at hotel itself is about $50 a day but there's a parking garage literally across from the hotel and it is $32 day. Lobby was nice and I was expecting delays at my check-in per previous reviews, but it only took 3 minutes to check in. Overall nice hotel. When you exit the hotel, do not go left, but go right instead. Left is close to not so good neighborhoods, especially at night we saw many homeless people sleeping on the street from our room which was facing that side.
review.negativeRemarks: had to ask for extra room cleaning upon arrival- found almonds, etc on the floor
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Union Square and Chinatown

review.title: overall great, except for the internet policy
review.reviewText: overall, our stay was great. the only negative is that, you have to buy internet separately for all your devices and laptops.

review.title: Cleanand cconfortable.

review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom way too small.
review.locationRemarks: Centralized and within walking distance of many activities. Easy access to public transit.

review.title: $60.00 parking for the night.
review.reviewText:
It's to big for my liking and very noisy.
Next time I would pick a smaller hotel.
The worst part was that we have to pay $60.00 for parking.
review.negativeRemarks: $60 parking

review.title: Food stinks
review.reviewText: at in the restaurant and it was the worst hamburger I have ever had!

review.title: Good for the money
review.reviewText: I had a pleasant stay overall...close to union square and major hot spots in the city but it was hard to find a cab in forn tof the hotel on a Saturday night which was kind of surprising!!!

review.title: Fantastic views
review.reviewText: Although one of the largest hotels, it didn't feel impersonal. It was worth paying extra for a tower room with great views of the city and bay and the complimetary the Internet access in the room was very convenient. Continental breakfast was served in the Starbucks in the main foyer with an option to upgrade. The location was ideal for shops and transport connections. I would certainly recommend for first time visitors.
review.positiveRemarks: View from the room, day or night
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great location for shops and tours (in house agent for tours - pick up point also)

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: The overall experience was great. The room was very clean and the view of the city was amazing. The restaurant was perfect for lunch. The staff was very helpful with directions and which streets to avoid. The only downfall was the noise coming through our windows from the wind outside. When we came back to our room from dinner, it sounded like the poltergeist :)

review.title: Good hotel & very Good Location
review.reviewText: The accomodations were comfortable and the staff were very pleasant. I truly like the location because it is in the heart of union square and walking distance to all. I plan on staying there again my next visit.
review.locationRemarks: Very good location, close to all.

review.title: Hilton San Fran
review.reviewText: Overall a very comfortable and relaxing stay. Trustworthy and safe.

review.title: Ok hotel but no parking
review.reviewText:
The hotel was everything you would expect from a Hilton hotel. The only drawback is the parking. The hotel's parking rates were significantly higher than neighboring third party parking garages when really, it should be the opposite.

Expect to come down whenever a guest comes in during the evening hours because they require a room key to enter the premises.

review.title: Great Hotel in Union Square

Customer Service was very pleasant.
Free WiFi in the lobby.

review.title: good enough for what you need

review.negativeRemarks: charge for internet

review.title: Near and great rate
review.reviewText: We spend six nights, the hotel is at steps from Union square, cable car, restaurants and Moscone Convention Center. We had a room at tower number 3, in front of the elevators and it was a little bit noisy. The hotel is in a good condition, is huge. We would like to come back.

photos.caption: In Room view of AT&T Park at night from the 41 Floor on Tower 1

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful view of the City and Bay when staying in a Bay facing Tower. Staff is extremely nice and caring. The lobby was amazing, I loved that there was a Starbucks located within the Hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking would be my least favorite part, but since it is San Francisco you should already be away of the prices for parking.
review.locationRemarks: Just a block away from shopping stores and restaurants.

review.title: Shame they don't warn you the pool was closed.
review.reviewText:
I was expecting to use the hotel pool and there was no warning that it was closed for renovation. Even the elevator did not explain why it would not go to the floor where the pool was located. Kept on pushing the button to no avail and then finally a cleaner said that it was closed.

Great location. Be warned that the hotel parking garage is $50 for overnight. I'm used to Boston rates and I thought they were up there - I guess San Francisco is a whole other ball game! I am sure there are cheaper places close by, I just wasn't thinking when we rolled in...
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of warning the pool was closed
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: We stayed there for two nights during a sightseeing trip. The hotel is ideally located, minutes from the cable car and from Union Square. Expect solid quality in rooms and service, nothing outstanding. We got a good deal via Expedia, making Hilton an outstanding value for money.
review.negativeRemarks: long wait for registration
review.locationRemarks: ideally located near Union Square

review.title: No Free WIFI
review.reviewText: The hotel does not provide a free wifi service. Instead, you have to pay 12-13 dollars for 24 hours. The interestingly disappointing fact is that they charge wired and wireless network separately. I had to pay twice in order to use my laptop using their wired and wireless network for the same night of usage. This was disappointing. Except that I was satisfied.
review.negativeRemarks: No free WIFI service

review.title: Would choose to stay here again
review.reviewText: Was a great hotel. The concierge were amazing at directing us to plays to eat and where to go out at night...ken was the best!

review.title: Unprofessional front desk Elizabeth
review.reviewText: Front desk person Elizabeth was very rude and unprofessional! She need some training or your hotel will lose lots of customers.

review.title: nickel and dime
review.reviewText: On the edge of a shady area so that explains the abundance of security guards roaming around the hotel. They nickel and dime you for everything (they removed the mini bar/fridge) so they can charge you 15 bucks a day for using a fridge. They also charge 13 bucks a day for Internet. That is crazy. Will never stay here again.

review.title: stunning views but room could have been better
review.reviewText: Stunning view from our room but the toilet needed fixing. This took repeated visits to the front desk to sort-finally being fixed on our last night. Room had some other minor defects too. Did have our breakfasts upgraded to the full buffet which was very tasty.
review.negativeRemarks: problems took a long time to sort
review.locationRemarks: great for union square

review.title: Nice hotel that needs some modernization
review.reviewText: The hotel is located around 3 blocks from the BART station and centrally located to most of the tourist hot spots in San Francisco. I stayed in a double and the room was a little smaller than I expected but had sufficient space. The rooms were nicely decorated and had a good use of space including a big screen TV. The hallways were a bit dated but there was constant construction throughout the hotel so they may be working on that already. The lobby offered free wifi which I think attracted a lot of people in the lobby that probably were not guests of the hotel. I'm not sure if that was the goal of the hotel but there were ample security guards in the lobby including a police officer outside at night. The immediate area outside the hotel was questionable, although a trendy area, it had its share of rift raft as well. I felt safe in the hotel and during week days the area is bustling with tourists and locals coming to and from work. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and would recommend it to others.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms had nice bathrooms and large screen TV...
review.negativeRemarks: Very crowded lobby
review.locationRemarks: Location is trendy but has its share of rift raft

review.title: Excellent Value central hotel
review.reviewText: A very comfortable and clean hotel in excellent location two minutes walk from Union Square feeling very safe when walking around the area at night. We have just completed a 4 night stay with our two girls. We had booked a room with two queen beds and requested a rollaway bed also. Upon arrival they upgraded us free of charge to a room with two king size beds so that the girls could share comfortably, meaning we did not have to pay for a rollaway. The door staff were exceptionally helpful also and arranged excellent value car transport to the airport for us on the final day (cheaper than taking the BART). There are plenty of varied eating options close to the hotel including take outs if you wish to eat in your room. This was an excellent value hotel and friendly despite it huge size and we will definately use it again.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean hotel and very helpful friendly staff, good size rooms
review.locationRemarks: Safe and Central Location close to Union Square

review.title: Ok.
review.reviewText: There was construction going on that went late and started again early in the morning! So annoying! Couldn't sleep in!

review.title: Awesome staff, great location!
review.reviewText: The very small sink made it very difficult to shave especially without making a mess. Perhaps a no-fog mirror in the shower would help.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff is wonderful especially in The Urban Tavern restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom sink
review.locationRemarks: Great location, especially for someone who likes to walk places.

review.title: psrking
review.reviewText: The parking is really expensive. I like the information center because they guide me to everywhere in San Francisco. Also, I like the security
review.negativeRemarks: No refrgrater
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Thumbs up
review.reviewText: Hotel is very close for various activities. Clean rooms and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: none

review.title: One night stay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in a good location. Room was a little outdated.

review.title: Ready to go back....
review.reviewText: I was at the Hilton Union Square for 6 nights of business travel and then I extended for three nights of fun. Staff and room were great. Ready to go back!

review.title: one complaint. . .
review.reviewText: It's 2012. A very good hotel should have free wireless.

review.title: automatic upgrade
review.reviewText: It was great. I was given an upgrade to a balcony view of the city for being an honors program member without asking. They were very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: expensive parking
review.locationRemarks: perfectly situated.

review.title: Just as it should be
review.reviewText: I visit this hotel often, I have enjoyed the great service and quality of the product.

review.title: Fine
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel just within the better part of San Francisco
review.locationRemarks: Beyond the block, heading away from the centre, the locality gets less pleasant

review.title: Great weekend experience.
review.reviewText: I stayed in this hotel for a one night birthday party in San Francisco. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful answering our questions and helping us obtain items we have forgotten to pack. The location is great - Union Square - so there's lots to do, plenty of great shopping, and lots of taxis if you need to go somewhere too far away to walk.

review.title: Stay somewhere else!
review.reviewText: There was dried snot on the shower curtain. One of the lifts kept getting stuck (once with people in it!). The wi-fi is only available in the lobby & is really slow. The staff were rude. When I complained about the lift, they told me that I could use a different set of lifts, and when I complained about the wi-fi, they said that the problem simply did not exist. We tried to catch a taxi from outside the hotel but noticed that most of the cabs kept driving by. I walked up the street about 30 metres & was able to hail a cab there - the driver told us that the bellboy demanded a fee from every cab driver so most did not stop there (only hotel that does this in San Fran apparently). The Starbucks in the lobby is small, understaffed & open limited hours. The associated bar & restaurant is okay quality with a high price tag. My room was opposite the corporate office & every day from 9-5pm I heard high heeled shoes clip-clopping along the floors. Housekeeping woke you up at around 8 am every day! (even New Years Day). Hated it. Will avoid Hilton hotels based on this experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Dried snot on the shower curtain, hopeless wi-fi, faulty lift, early-bird housekeeping staff
review.locationRemarks: Not central enough to justify the price & quality of the hotel

review.title: Meeting rooms at guest rooms
review.reviewText:
Overall the hotel is good. But, I checked in late at night, got a room at the tower. At 5:00 am noise from the next door room made me understand that it is not a guest room, but a meeting room which was busy every day from 5:00 AM preparations, till 6:00 PM
They should have told me this at check-in. It is a joining room.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, good lobby! Rooms are spacious and equipped.
review.negativeRemarks: Next door meeting room at guest floors make a lot of noise very early in the morning
review.locationRemarks: Great location, great view from the tower.

review.title: Great but dissapointed
review.reviewText: the hotel location was great. i had a great stay. when i checked into the room, the top drawer of the dresser was broken. i called guest services and they sent a repair man within 15 minutes. since it was late, he tried to fix the drawer but was not able to. he said he would send a repairman the next morning at 9:00. he compensated me with a $20 gift card to starbucks. the next morning the repairman came at the promised time and fixed the drawer. the hotel was great but i was dissapointed that the pool was closed due to renovation, the minibar was discontinued a few days before i got there, and the cityscape view on the 46th was closed due to renovation. other than that everyything else went smooth and i would defintely stay there again
review.positiveRemarks: location, friendly staff, amenities and the concierge was very helpful
review.negativeRemarks: the discontinued minibar- i wanted to use the refigerator to keep my own drinks cold. the closed pool & cityscape view that were under construction
review.locationRemarks: great location, just a few blocks from union square and all public transportation

review.title: Pleasant Overall
review.reviewText: Great staff and service! The only problem is the rooms; thin walls makes it easy to hear across rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: noise coming from other rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great in downtown union square.

review.title: Great Place to Stay!
review.reviewText:
Great Hotel. Friendly people working there and VERY accomdating. Excellent Service.
Easy to walk to Sites and Downtown area. easy to catch cabs or other transportation to all areas of the city which are very close.

review.title: huge disappointment
review.reviewText: unmarked (and therefore unexpected) $50+ for self-parking, no fridge in the room, no breakfast, no free WiFi, and the neighborhood was sketchy. staff was rude and curt when we asked about the amenities we have come to expect in even the smallest, chapest hotels. bedding was bad - one skinny blanket between two sheets. we expected a LOT more for what we paid. the only nice thing about this hotel was the lobby.

review.title: WARM GREETINGS, SECURE, EXCELLENT MANAGEMENT
review.reviewText: The staff was very pleasant, including warmly greeting guests regularly with joy,and you felt very welcome as a guest at this excellent hotel. The hotel was extremely clean and constantly maintained by the staff. Nothing was a problem for the staff, and they always accomodated your specific needs. For example, we needed a refrigerator and they put one in the room.The hotel is extremely well run.The management team of this hotel must have a great deal of experience and personal dedication to running a first rate hotel. It takes constant hard work to operate a hotel like this, and the management team's effort shows in the memorable experience the guest will have after staying at this hotel. The hotel was also constantly monitored by in house security, and it is comforting to know their security is excellent in a big city like San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Probably the best run hotel I ever stayed in.
review.negativeRemarks: My least favorite thing was that I had to leave, because the vacation ended.
review.locationRemarks: Awesome location. It is quiet and you do not hear the cable cars all the time as you do when you stay closer to Union Square.

review.title: Good with reservations
review.reviewText:
The Room was just fine, especially the view of SF.
Parking complicated ( 8 floors up) and vastly overpriced. $ 47 + Tax for selfparking is just outrageous.

review.title: Comfortable & Great Location
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was wonderful! Close to shops and dining. The room was comfortable and we had a great view of downtown. We traveled with another family and our kids and everyone was comfortable and had a great time. The staff was extremely nice and met all our needs.
review.locationRemarks: Awesome

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText:
Very helpful staff, spacious room with great comfort

Breakfast is awesome
review.positiveRemarks: Service, quality of room and he breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Prime for centre of San Franciso

review.title: OK...but not fabulous

The cable TV was down so no TV. The shower didn't spray and was luke warm.

review.title: san francisco hilton
review.reviewText:
very helpful staff and the room attendants were very polite . the hotel room was
very clean and the view of the city was spectatular . we got back to the hotel very late
one night and the young man at the front desk actully gave me a bottle of water .
review.negativeRemarks: not enough cabs
review.locationRemarks: fabulous location

review.title: Unhappy
review.reviewText:
I couldn't understand the person at the front desk, and it took more than an hour to get my internet set up just because of miscommunication.

When I first got in the room there was hair in the shower, water spots on the toilet and sink.

At no point during my stay did I have hot water in the shower. Never, morning or evening. Come on, seriously, no hot water at all?

review.title: over rated and noisy
review.reviewText: ok, the valet people where more nicer then the rest of the the hotel staff. the concierge gave us wrong directions that lost us 45mins from our destination. then i can hear our neighbor taking a shower, then at 2am i heard our neighbor using the restroom doing #1. our room was located near the elavater and we would hear every time it was being used. room number 2-1601. the hotel was located in walking distance of union square and the mall. it was over priced for what we experience....o ya the buffet sucks. the waiter that serves you water was rude. our actually waiter showed up 20minutes after we choose the buffet, but he did give us a discount so that was cool. i can say i've been to alot of hotels and paid less and had a way better experience. i love san francisco, however i would choose another hotel to stay in. i really hope this review helps you...
review.locationRemarks:
cako-cupcake place on o"farrel
ryoko-sushi bar-taylor/post
normstrom-spa-market/powell
49ers game-use the buses on sutter/sansome, you can buy tickets for the buses right there.
wine tasting on tyler/powell, between the ryoko sushi bar. its in the alley. the young lady was awesome with helping me choose the type of wine i like..

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText:
Disappointing that the windows of the Smoking room could not be opened or even Slightly Cracked and there was no possible way to filter out the smoke. Next time I will be getting a Non-Smoking Room.

Terrible filtering of the Cigarette smoke. I drove back to Los Angeles 7Hrs Coughing Sick and a Burned Throat. because of Zero Filtration from the Cigarette Smoke.

review.title: Loved the location
review.reviewText: It should not cost extra for paying guests to use the wireless internet
review.locationRemarks: Union square. Lots of fun and easy access to transportation

review.title: It's Alright
review.reviewText:
This is a great hotel. Only complaint would be that the walls are a bit thin and we had some teenagers or early college-aged people slamming doors way into the middle of the night (3 a.m.). We could hear everything. Also, could hear other people's conversations from the room next door.

Location is awesome though and the hotel IS nice.

review.title: Wonderful People, Not So Wonderful Room Conditions
review.reviewText: The people at all aspects of the hotel were extremely kind and helpful. The room itself was old, and the bedding was extremely old and worn. Seems like Mr. Hilton should invest in some upgrades!

review.title: It's ok.
review.reviewText: The hotel does the job; assuming the price is right... In my opinion; not worth much more than a benjamin/night. The room was small, they overbooked and didnt have the king bed I reserved.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square; there is a lot going on there + served directly by BART.

review.title: Quick trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: I have always had good experiences at Hilton hotels and this was no exception. The hotel was crowded, but in a good, hustle-bustle way that was energizing. Great location of course. Highly recomend getting a "city view" room on an upper floor for a great view. Rooms and bathrooms were a bit small, so if there are more than two people it could get cozy!
review.locationRemarks: Just about any are great.

review.title: the carpet is dirty
review.reviewText: the carpet is dirty

review.title: not a< Hilton>
review.reviewText: no one helped with luggage,the valet personal were very rude,we parked our own car and the charge is a lot ....... not disclosed when you book the hotel.room old and dirty ,bathroom old ,water running.the hallways noisy and full of drunk people .not one security guard around to help.unlesss you have business at this hotel stay away!

review.title: Excellent and very accomodating customer service
review.reviewText:
We decided to go to San Fransisco for the weekend and the Hilton seemed like a solid place to book a room on the fly. We left from Los Angeles late Friday evening and did a few things along the way before showing up at the hotel around noon. We asked if we could check in early as we were so tired and had no sleep yet. Without a second thought they went ahead and checked us in. It was very nice and considerate of them to do that. After a nap and a bit of freshening up we went down to the concierge for any site seeing tips and they had great suggestions. We ended the night drinking at a nearby pub and watching all the interesting costumes that passed by (it was holloween weekend).
The room was very clean and appeared to be newly remodeled, however, the size of the room seemed a bit small for 4 people. Parking was not included with the booking, but my understanding is that all hotels around that area charge for parking. Regardless I would definitely go back because of the excellent and very accomodating customer service we recieved. That is definitely something that's hard to come by these days.
I hope this review helps.
review.locationRemarks:
Union Square for shopping
Chinatown and Japantown for cheaper shopping
Fisherman's Wharf, Coit tower, Lombard St., for the standard tourist spots
Anywhere walking distance from the Hilton for some good food

review.title: Fantastic Experience
review.reviewText: Everything was top notch and would stay there again, again and again during my next trip to SF for business or pleasure

review.title: Would not recommend, would not return
review.reviewText:
If you are looking for a conference type hotel, this is your place.
The entry was unkept, dirty front doors at all times and the room was dated and very very small. I will say that the gym was alright.
Not knowing SF hotels that well and now having been there I would not recommend this hotel if you want a real SF experience. The Lobby feels like you are at a conference or seminar with odd types of chairs just haphazardly placed.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. There was easy access to the cable cars and buses and we were able to take the subway (BART) from the airport with a short walk to the hotel. They were very helpful in getting us signed up for tours and answering all of our questions. Lots of great places to eat close to the hotel as well.

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: good experience except for the smelly carpets through out the hotel

review.title: Well satisfied
review.reviewText: We were well satisfied with our stay--the culmination of a two week trip that took us up the Pacific Coast. The central location was convenient for our forays out in the foggy, wet weather that couldn't dampen our spirits. We owe your concierge, Kyle, our greatest thanks for his recommendations and directions. Dinner at "Le Colonial ' was a highlight during our first night's stay. From acknowledging this French- Vietnamese restaurant, to how to get to "Tony's" for Neopolitan pizza, to where to buy freshly ground coffee to take home to our kids, Kyle was spot on.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Good location, good service. comfortable

review.title: GREAT HOTEL
review.reviewText: MOST COMFORTABLE BED I EVER SLEPT IN

review.title: I would go back
review.reviewText:
I would go back to this hotel. the hotel is within walking of all kinds of services,
restaurants, Union Square itself, the Wharf with all it's shops. The staff were very good and helpful. The only two drawbacks were the restuaran//bar and the size of the hotel. The bar was too small and not very well organized to maximize ambience and coziness. Too loud and hard to hear a person next to you talking. The staff were very helpful. Otherwise I enjoyed my stay there very much.

review.title: Great SF pad
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. No, it's not brand new, and yes, it's SF so the rooms are reasonably small but great overall. Close to BART and the cable car. Would stay there again without a doubt.

review.title: Good place if you want to be in DownTown
look forward to next visit
review.reviewText: well located to accomplish everything you want

review.title: Good hotel choice.
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the hotel and our room. The location for our needs was excellent and the restaurant was very good also.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Our room was RIGHT across the street from a busy car rental garage and was the LOUDEST stay due to constant car alarms from open till close. It was sufficient, but I was not too thrilled about the cost of the rooms and what we got.

review.title: Too much noise
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine, although the room was small and the bathroom was tiny. The location is convenient, but the problem was noise. Some idiot woke me at 2 a.m. trying to use his key card to open the wrong room (mine), and noisy people chattering in the next room a 4 a.m.

review.title: Very comfy, quiet stay
review.reviewText: I've been to SF 7 or 8 times and have stayed here twice and liked it both times. Beds are super comfy, rooms are surprisingly quiet, staff is nice and helpful. The hotel is conveniently located near Union Square and only a couple of blocks from BART. The price is sort of mid-range so if you'd rather pay a few extra bucks rather than sacrifice comfort, I highly recommend it. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: San Francisco's Landmark Hotel
review.reviewText: The location is excellent. The free WiFi at the lobby was very good.

review.title: Hit the spot.
review.reviewText: Did what we needed it to do. Nice place in a great town.

review.title: Awful hotel and service and location
review.reviewText:
1. Rooms are stinking, non-smoking rooms are stinking, the couch in the room is so dirty you don't wanna sit
2. Lobby is like a train station!
3. The included Continental Breakfast is FAKE! There is a Starbucks in the lobby and they give you a coupon for 1 drink 1 fruit 1 pastry and there is a line of 25 minutes to get that. That is not a breakfast! Hilton should immediately change this Starbucks thing!
4. When you go out of the hotel, there are so many homeless people on the street you can not imagine, we were there with 3 children of ages 5-7-9 and we were afraid of going out for a walk.
5. Hotel Parking is 45 dollars a day!!!
5. 3 blocks from the hotel is shopping district

review.title: Eh
review.reviewText: For the price we paid, I would expect a much nicer place. Bed was rock hard, comforter was thin, decor was dated.

review.title: Enjoyed the stay in San Francisco Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was lovely and everyone was very helpful. The buffet we had for breakfast was amazing. I highly recommend it. It was easy to walk to all the big department stores, shops and China Town. We found wonderful restaurants nearby as well. It was easy to book tours from the hotel and we could print out our boarding passes right there for our flight home. Only 2 things I would change. Our room only had double beds which can be a bit cosy and it is right next to a rougher neighbourhood. Just watch where you walk. Overall great bang for you buck! I would definitely book at a Hilton again.

review.title: Below average
review.reviewText: Overpriced...does not warrant 4stars

review.title: 25th Anniversary
review.reviewText: Great Time.

review.title: I wanna go back to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hilton Union Square is the best place to stay because it's near the cable car station and Bart station, restaurant and pick up place for the tour bus.If ever we will go back to SF I will stay there again.

review.title: Great Hotel, Fantastic Location
review.reviewText:
Lovely hotel with great facilities, I was in Tower 3 on the 16th floor overlooking the pool. On check in the receptionist was going to upgrade me to a room with a better view but I prefered to stay near the pool.
The location is spot on, minutes from the cable-car turntable & all the top shops.
The only thing I was diappointed with was the breakfast - with the number of guests (the hotel covers an entire city block) if you're not there early it can be a bit of a wait for mediocre food. I'd recommend skipping the breakfast option & going to a cafe instead. Otherwise a great choice.

review.title: Good choice and convenient location
review.reviewText: Everything is good there. Close to different San Francisco different attractions. The room is a bit small.

review.title: Great location but working on roof
review.reviewText: Large hotel but with great service. An amazing breakfast buffet with attentive waiters. But they were working on the roof of Tower 3 so noise between 9 and 5 during the week on floor 18.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Good location not far from city center. Clean & comfortable rooms.

review.title: hail Hilton!
review.reviewText: Great welcome at the front desk. Concierge service was very helpful. room comfortable and clean. Great location to cable cars, trains, busses, very good restaurants.

review.title: Awsome
review.reviewText: If I was to go back to SF I would use this hotel. I would not park a car there $52 a night.I used a garage across the street much cheaper. $35 a night.

review.title: Great hotel near the cable cars
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Beautiful pool and spa and a great breakfast. What was a bit disappointing was the fact that the wireless connection was not free. At the overnight rate that we pay, I think we should get free wireless. Also, when leaving the hotel, turn right on O'Farrell instead of left. To your left is a neighborhood you don't want to walk through. To your right is okay though...

review.title: Factory
review.reviewText: too many people

review.title: Hilton Stay
review.reviewText: I had to go to a class held at the Hilton. I tried to book through the hotel for the discounted rooms, but since the rate wasn't available for the night before my class, only the nights of, they would not let me book the lower rate and would only charge me the going rate. I asked if I could make two reservations, one for the night before at the going rate and the next two at the discounted class rate....no dice they would not work with me. Therefore, I booked through expedia. I would not stay there again. It was nice and I gave a good rating for expedia members, but I will find other solutions in the future.

review.title: In the center of Union Square Amenities
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay at the San Francisco Union Square Hilton. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean, though a bit dated. Great restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Swam daily in the heated pool!

review.title: would stay again
