review.reviewText: Overall great stay. Good location, good service. Only con was line for complimentary breakfast and the Construction on the roof which was ocationally loud. Fun hotel!

review.title: Excellent location and Hotel
review.reviewText:
Excellent location and Hotel. Close to many of the great museums and city sights. Very responsive service when I had a special request.

Also, parking close by at a cheaper rate than offered by the Hotel.

review.title: Can't wait till next year
review.reviewText: The hotel had great service, and a great location. What a bonus having a Starbucks right in the hotel lobbey. I loved the fact that the windows open in the room to let in fresh air in. I think the wifi in the room should however be free, as it is free in the hotel lobby. There is also not a proper ventaliation system in the bathroom, no fan or window.

review.title: Perfect Location!
review.reviewText: I have to say, we were hesitant to use Expedia...our first time! We were also a little nervous about booking the hotel online since we had never been to the area, but everything turned out perfect! We were so impressed with the hotel location. For the price, you can't beat it. Within a very short walk to BART, the trolleys, Union Square, and tour buses to take you around the whole city. The rooms were teeny and the view wasn't wonderful, but hey. It's a central city hotel, so what could we expect. Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. We'd definitely stay here again!

review.title: Can`t help, it`s San Francisco in vacation season.
review.reviewText:
Can`t help, vacation season at San Francisco, too expensive, old crew hotel.
Location is the best part, but not sure it`s worth it.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby is constantly buzzing with people but check in was smooth. The room with 2 double beds was a little crammed and not as well maintained as should be. One table lamp shade was falling apart and there was some peelings on the walls. and bathroom door. There is a mini bar maintained at room temperature so it was useless as a fridge. Breakfast was better than most offered in other hotels because of the varieties, and service was excellent.

review.title: The price was right
review.reviewText: Service was good. The rooms aren't brand new but well equipped. Loved the HD TV and Starbucks in the lobby. First impression of the neighborhood wasn't good especially at night. However, it is close by downtown & Union Square (3 mins walk). There are car rentals right across the street and many dinners & breakfast eateries. The price was right for the hotel. I would recommend to stay.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The lobby and concierge desk was WAY too crowded because it is serving 3 towers of hotel rooms. The hotel rooms itself is also TOO small. There are three of us, my 10 year-old son, my husband and myself. It felt like we couldn't move in the room. Also, if you had the bathroom door open, you couldn't also open the hotel room door. There is just not enough room for more than one person in the room. We had high hopes for the Hilton, but definitely were NOT impressed! Will not stay there again for the money we paid.

review.title: Recommended!!
review.reviewText:
Great location. Quality Hotel. Fabulous breakfast buffet.
Paying the extra for a city view is probably worth it, as there are quite a few rooms with no view (on the inside of the hotel on lower floors).
Great to have aircon, which so many of the boutique hotels around Union Square are lacking.
Would recommend without hesitation.

review.title: I'll Stay Here Again
review.reviewText: A great place to stay, close to shopping and very close to our mainstays of Starbucks and Walgreens. Hint: If the line at Starbucks in the hotel is too long, there is a Starbucks in the hotel next store and one just down the block.with no lines at all! Hotel parking was easy.

review.title: Decent hotel, sketchy location
review.reviewText: Decent hotel, sketchy location

review.title: Satisfied
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Do not bring a car to SFO. Parking $50/day at hotel and around $35-40/day everywhere in town. Public transportation very good in the city. Car not required. Wide variety of shopping and eating in the vicinity. Rooms somewhat small with oversized furniture. Bed was double not queen size. Good service overall.

review.title: Quality hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, good location and comfortable rooms. Only minus was the small pool and Jacuzzi. The hotel has more than 1900 rooms, so the Jacuzzi was often full when we tried to go to the pool deck.

review.title: Pleasant Experience
review.reviewText: Had a great experience with this hotel. Attending a conference that was in the hotel with approximately 1500 attendees and the service was still exceptional.

review.title: Staying in S.F.
review.reviewText: Couldn't go wrong for the price. A trustworthy brand in a sea of unknown hotels. The room was small compared to other Hilton hotels I've stayed at, but there is not much room in S.F. as it is. It's a great location, close to the BART & MUNI station, shopping, food.....would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Great location and service, rooms very clean and comfortable, extremely close to Union Square, shops, transport services, restaurants, definetely I´ll be back.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We had two days business trip, first time in San Francisco, in the hotel the room we've got was occupied already and they gave us another one, complimentary updated. There have been some plumber problems like clogged sink and low pressure in shower but over all it was good.

review.title: Great Hotel Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Very close to union square, trolley and downtown attractions. Room was smaller than anticipated, neighborhood on the otherside of the hotel was still a little transitional "the tenderloin" but overall good stay, and very close to shopping & restaurants, would stay here again and recommend.

review.title: Hilton Union Square
review.reviewText: This Hilton is located in the heart of Union Square and is a couple of blocks from the BART station. Macy's is nearby, and high end shopping is just a couple of blocks north, while a standard Westfield mall is to the east on Market Street. You can catch a cable car pretty close to the hotel on Powell Street, and there's a bunch of car rental places across the street. The hotel has a full service restaurant, a Starbucks, and a Kinko's within the lobby. The rooms are OK, but the walls are pretty thin. Also, be aware that to the west of the hotel is the Tenderloin district (i.e. skid row).

review.title: Nice hotel, head towards Union Square
review.reviewText: The Hilton San Francisco Union Square was a very nice hotel, but there were a fair share of panhandlers milling around out front. It would not prevent me from staying there again, but the panhandlers are pretty aggressive compared to other cities I have stayed in (NYC, Boston, Baltimore, Las Vegas). Great city to visit, none the less!

review.title: Just a name these days
review.reviewText:
The Hilton name used to be associated with luxury which is why I was so excited when I got a room for the price I did, but it looks like Hilton has dropped the luxury persona a little and started to pursue the budget and mid range customers.

The room was clean and had all the standard amenities. Nothing really fancy just a normal hotel room in a huge hotel. (The thing takes up a whole city block.) We did have a French balcony overlooking the pool area which was nice.

My only complaint was that the sound insulation in the room was terrible. Sound from the adjacent rooms travelled through the vent system and somebody talking in the hallway prompted me to check the door a couple times because it sounded like I left it open. Placing a towel in the door jam seemed to help.

All-in-all the hotel worked for what we needed it for. If nothing else, the location made up for a few inconviencies.

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine, very expensive. We asked for additional blankets and they arrived dirty and unfolded. Gross.

review.title: NIce, but not impressed
review.reviewText: Service was very good and room was clean,just minor carpet stains in room and bad ones in hall ways.

review.title: Hilton Hotel at Union Square San Francisco
review.reviewText: The room was actually designed for wheelchair access, so it was large and comfortable. Unfortunately, the air conditioner did not work properly and maintenance had to come to the room to fix it at 10:30 at night.

review.title: Great, central location...family friendly....very very busy...sometimes too busy!
review.reviewText:
Overall, we were satisfied with our stay. Located a couple of blocks from Union Square. We only stayed one night during our 8 night trip to the SF area. The rooms were nice, clean, quite comfortable overall. This is a very LARGE hotel. Because of their amenities, they frequently hold rather large conferences, many at a time. If you don't mind the dense crowds and carrying your own luggage (because of the bellhops are extremely busy), this is the place for you. These types of hotels cater to large business groups rather than families on holiday, at least that is what i experienced.

We stayed the first 3 nights in the Financial District in a newer and smaller boutique hotel and would much prefer that ambiance versus the Hilton.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Top notch Hotel and service. Will definately stay here on our next trip to SF. Only complaint was the price of the mediocre breakfast buffet. But with Dotties True Blue Diner just around the corner, not a problem. The pool on the 16th floor terrace was really great too.

review.title: Fine choice if you do not care about money
review.reviewText: Good location, small swimingpool.

review.title: Would recommend
review.reviewText: Highly recommend. Employees were extremely customer service oriented, very polite and helpful.

review.title: Hilton Union Square has undergone some changes
review.reviewText: I almost always stay at this hotel when I visit SF. The rooms have been upgraded, but this time I was put in the smallest room I've ever had. The bathroom was particularly small. They did bring me a fridge and waived the fee when I called the front desk to complain. I still love the location, being close to BART and MUNI, but the area immediately to the west (left) of the lobby entrance is to be avoided. There used to be several restaraunts at this hotel, including Cityscape on the 46th floor, but they are now all closed. Now there is only Urban Tavern, which is very overpriced, and a Starbucks in the lobby, which is also overpriced. It's better to walk to the Starbucks on the next block.

review.title: Not a bad choice but needs some improvement
review.reviewText: Great area! Parking is too expensive. Starbucks was too crowded. Breakfast wasn't the best.

review.title: So far so good
review.reviewText:
Good location just right near by freeway exit.
M & KFC fast food next door.
Quiet and comfort.
Smell of kitchen not so good.

review.title: Within walking distance
review.reviewText: Very nice, clean and affordable hotel. Within walking distance of AT&T Park, the Warf, and the Alcatraz Tours. Would recommend to anyone

review.title: Great service and location
review.reviewText: We were very happy with the service at this hotel. Plus it was a great location. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful.

review.title: Ideal for shopping and sightseeing
review.reviewText: The location close to Union Square is ideal for shopping, sightseeing and any activities in downtown SF. The rooms are rather small but o.k. Some of the rooms need an upgrade and we had to change the room twice: First we got a smoking room instead of non-smoking and then one with a great view but an untight window - not ideal on the 15th floor! The personal and esp. the waiters were all very friendly and the breakfast buffet was great.

review.title: Hilton - Union Square, San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine. Good location and clean. Had problems with the shower and waited over 1/2 hour for maintenance come to repair.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: Got room at reduced rate, would never have paid full price for the room. No refrigerator. Not at all what I expected from the opulence of the lobby. Room was a disappointment. Parking was expensive, but adequate. Would not return to this hotel.

review.title: 3 Star Wanna Be
review.reviewText:
We read other reviews and were excited to stay at this hotel for our visit to San Francisco. We are very disappointed.
When we arrived we found ourselves in a single queen room when we thought we were getting a King Size bed. We were told that it isn't guarenteed and that it is subject to availability although our reservations were well in advance of the trip.
Additionally the package that we booked SEEMED like a great deal. The hotel has omited one large detail from their description. If you rent a car or bring a vehicle expect to pay excessive parking charges to the tune of 51.20/night! Yes per night! Mind you that the rate is actually 46.00 or so but then the hotel adds in their additional fees plus there is a 25% city sales tax which is not mentioned.

The bathroom in our room was so small that it was difficult for one person much less two to get ready to go out for the day. The rooms are tiny and I do mean that in a very literal sense.
Also, when we arrived to the room we noticed that a coffee maker was missing. We requested that we get one brought up, this actually took two phone calls and six hours to get done.
Location is difficult to get to.
The neighborhood not even one block to the west is VERY rough. I don't recommend that anyone goes walking in this direction at night regardless of size, gender or size of the group you are in. Local police are paid to stand outside of the hotel at night to ensure the safety of the guest. Overall impression 3 Star wannabe

review.title: Not the Hilton you would expect.
review.reviewText: Great location. Right downtown, easy access to cable cars, buses, Bart. Some what noisy. Not the Hilton you would expect. More like a 3 star. No fridge in room. Hotel on fringe of sketcky area, but we were fine. Lots of great restaurants in area.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Situated in the heart of city, it's close in proximity to the Union Square, Cable Car Terminal, BART station, and tram lines. They provide free WiFi access in their lobby.

review.title: Good Place to Stay
review.reviewText: The overall experience was great. I did find my original room to small. I upgraded to a bigger room with no problem. The upgrade was perfect. The hotel location was perfect given this was my first trip to San Francisco. We were in the middle of everything.

review.title: When trying to stay downtown, not a better place.
review.reviewText: I was really surprised when I saw the nightly rate for the hilton. When considering your in downtown SF its not bad at all. (coming from someone who has been here for several years). The room was spacious and comfortable. Most of the hotels in SF are in a crappy location or all the way in north beach. Saves on taxi fare.

review.title: Summer Conference in SF
review.reviewText: Great week in SF Hilton Union Square. Hotel was great. Great restaurants all around: Italian, French, sandwiches. Weather was cooperative; access to BART and Muni also great.

review.title: Great Front Desk Experience
review.reviewText:
This is an older, but well maintained hotel. Great, great location, central to many activities and tourist attractions. However, I don't understand Frendh doors on bathrooms.

Emmy was wonderful when I checked in at midnight (3:00 am my time). She helped me with a reservation problem. I had been working and traveling for about 21 hours. It was wonderful to have such friendly and helpful service. Brian, the manager on duty, was helpful as well. Clearing up the problem made my stay there worry free.

Concierge service was great, very helpful with tour details, dining.

review.title: Fabulous
review.reviewText: Yes the Hotels famous bed really are amazing...like floating on clouds and i have yet to ever find better pillows the theres. The pool is awsome, rooms immaculate, lobby exciting, vibrant and busy with all kinds of guests and its in the heart of all things. EXCELLENT!!!!

review.title: "Can't wait to come back"
review.reviewText: Can't wait to come back!!

review.title: very impressed
review.reviewText: Linen was fabulous. My daughter felt like she was "sleeping on a cloud". Staff was more than helpful. Great location close to shopping, china town, and public transportation. Would go back without a doubt. Pool open til 9pm. expensive items in the frig.

review.title: SF
review.reviewText: Nice, big, clean, centrallly located Hilton, reasonably priced. The only problem is that the Tenderloin, which is effectively a ghetto type area, is adjacent to where the hotel is and one must be careful to stay away from that at night.

review.title: San Francisco Stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was convenient and a great central location to see the major sites of San Francisco. A few blocks away from Union Square and lots of shopping and dining choices. Close to cable car, F line and Bart stops which meant we didn't need a car to get around the city. We felt safe walking the city even at night. There's also a Starbucks in the lobby and a great workout facility. I wasn't impressed with the hotel restaurant; the breakfast buffet was over priced and the food was cold. Overall, a great experience.

review.title: Everything good except..
review.reviewText: No Free Wireless Internet in your room. Wireless Internet allowed in the lobby. But Hey, time to give it all for free in each room. Otherwise, a splendid place to stay..

review.title: Nice place...convenient!
review.reviewText: Very nice place and good location. Clean and quiet...housekeeping so polite and courteous!

review.title: Pleasant Union Sq. stay
review.reviewText:
Had a great stay, no complaints. helpful, clean, nice hotel. comfy bed and nice shower.

had some noisey neighbors late at night, called front desk and problem was resolved in 15 minutes.

review.title: Parking
review.reviewText: The only issue that I had with staying at the Union Street Hilton was the parking. When I made the reservation, it said that parking was available. It should have been very clear that you have to PAY for the parking and that it is $56 a day - which is absolutely ridiculous. You are paying to stay at a nicer hotel and parking isn't included?!?! The Hilton needs to be up front about the parking on future reservations. Luckily I found a parking garage a block away that was only $20 a day.

review.title: Hilton in Union Square
review.reviewText:
We arrived at the hotel about 4 hours prior to check in time, but we were immediately given access to our room. The hotel was very clean, and the staff was polite, friendly and efficient.

The room had a small mini bar in it, but the prices of the contents were absolutely ridiculous. I can't believe anyone would ever actually purchase anything from the mini bar due to their prices, but having a small frig in the room was convenient.

Having never been to San Francisco before, we found the location of the hotel to be great. Very close to cable cars and buses, lots of restaurants and stores within walking distance, and near the SF Museum of Modern Art.

We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

review.title: I've missed my flight, they did not save my room !
review.reviewText: I paid for 2 nights, I missed my flight to San Francisco. Next day, my room was not available.

review.title: Thin walls
review.reviewText:
Had some drunk girls come home to the room beside us at 3am and woke us. It sounded like they were in our room we could hear every tiny bit of the conversation of the 6+ girls. Called reception and it took 15min for them to go to the room to do something and the girls still didnt stop.

Spoke to reception in the morning and they didnt care at all what happened - told us "well it is a hotel". Gave a bad taste to our stay.

review.title: Good Property
review.reviewText: Comfortable and convenient !

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The lobby is beautiful. I love the fact that they have a Starbuck's. The restaurant menu could be better. And the rooms could have nicer decore. But for the price it was a nice clean hotel. Very convinient!

review.title: Fun in San Fran
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice. Would highly recommend.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText:
The staff, from bellhops to check-in clerks to maids were probably the most helpful and friendly I have ever come across. Everyone always took a moment to help, and it felt genuine. While tips were certainly accepted, it never felt like a condition precedent to quality service.

The only drawback was that close to the street (15th floor overlooking Mason Street) remained loud almost all night with revelers and sirens, and the building was not particularly soundproof.

review.title: Not bad but wouldn't return
review.reviewText:
The rooms were nice but small. They did have some of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in for a hotel. The neighborhood was really really bad! Lots of transients, we witnessed drug deals within a block of the hotel and drunken vomiting people within a block. Also lots of beggers right outside the hotel. The staff was very helpful but expect to add $50 per a night to your hotel room because that is how much it costs to park at the hotel.

Overall I wouldn't recommend staying here mostly because of the neighborhood.

review.title: Pretty good
review.reviewText: Very nice, but very large hotel

review.title: San Francisco Hotels
review.reviewText: We didn't get to enjoy the hotel as much as we wanted to. We took the Amtrak train from Santa Barbara. Because of a train/truck accident, our 9 hour train ride turned into a 16 hour train ride. We didn't arrive to our hotel room until 8:00 a.m., the morning we were to leave San Fran. They were nice enough to let us check out a couple of hours late so that we could at least rest for a few hours. Be careful of the hotel "contracted" shuttle service. They charged us $51 to go to the airport. They made several stops along the way to try to pick up other passengers. It would have been better to take a taxi!

review.title: could be better
review.reviewText: Great view, great location, bed was probably 20 years old and needed replaced. Paid ahead for Starbucks breakfast that turned out to be an overcharge for a muffin, apple, and coffee. I would probably try one of the other hotels in the area next time.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the heart of everything. Great local eateries and close to several modes of transportation. Staff was friendly, though long-winded at times. Starbucks on site is a nice touch. Ample lobby seating for coffe and conversation and a good, though expensive, restaurant on site.

review.title: It was great.
review.reviewText:
The location was really good. Room is small and the beds are not really good....clean but old beds.
but the price was reasonable.....
it was good choice to stay in San Francisco...

review.title: SF good value
review.reviewText: For a big hotel, it met my expectations. I thought there was going to be long lines checking in on a Friday, but there wasn't. It's close to BART and Muni to get around. Use BART from SFO. I didn't need a car. There were extra charges for stuff, like there are at other big hotels, so that didn't surprise me (I just don't use them except I opened a bottled water and learned later it was $7; I just drank tap water after that and it was fine.) Overall I like it. The Urban Tavern is a nice place to grab a drink and something to eat, but there's lots of places to do that. The bartenders friendly and informative. I'll stay again. It was a good value.

review.title: GOOD HOTEL
review.reviewText:
THE HOTEL IS WELL LOCATED BUT IS EXTREMELY BUSY AT ALL TIMES.
THE LOBBY IS ALWAYS PACKED AND THERE IS NOT ENOUGH PLACE TO SIT AND USE YOUR LAB TOP IN THE LOBBY. IT WOULD BE MUCH BETTER IF INTERNET WAS FREE SO THAT ONE COULD USE IT IN THE ROOM.
CONSIDERING THIS IS A BUSINESS HOTEL ONE WOULD THINK IT WOULD BE FREE.

review.title: Nice hotel, convenient location
review.reviewText: The hotel is very conveniently located. Great Irish pub, Foley's, next block down with excellent food. Walking distance to every department store you can think of, Chinatown, and North Beach. Fisherman's Wharf is approx. 2 1/2 miles away. Trolley and buses conveniently located as well as taxis. With all the great restaurants around, we didn't eat at the hotel. Rooms were a little small but the bed was very comfortable.

review.title: Not impresed
review.reviewText: Reasonable accommodation let down by very poor service and quality/value of dining

review.title: Hilton San Francisco Union Square
review.reviewText: Hilton San Francisco Union Square is in the best location,

review.title: great hotel, can't wait to return & enjoy comfort.
review.reviewText: loved hotel, staff is great. near great restaurants

review.title: Nice but pricey
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Great concierge. Mediocre restaurant.

review.title: Fine hotel with a great location!
review.reviewText: Hotel served it's purpose and was in a great location to several hot night spots. Drunk walking distance! Parking is crazy expensive...do anything but park there and it will be cheaper!

review.title: Centrally Located
review.reviewText: Nice hotel centrally located in the downtown area. Staff was incredibly friendly. The Starbucks Continental breakfast is great, just get down there early or you'll be waiting in a very long line.

review.title: Not Impressed. I was disappointed considering 4 stars.
review.reviewText: Not a bad hotel, but I wouldn't give it a four star rating. The furnishings and general ambience didn't measure up (rather dated), and calling its location "Union Square" is a stretch -- it really borders on the Tenderloin. However, the service was good and my room was clean.

review.title: As advertosed
review.reviewText: Central to just about everything. Good room. Concierge very helpful. Parking at $55 a day is a bit much considering it's $30 right across the street, but other than that, great stay for the money.

review.title: Cramped and Expensive
review.reviewText:
The hotel is not on the cheap side and advertises as on the union square. But it is really several blocks away so be careful to check the map and make sure you know where it is exactly. Also at different times of the day the neighborhood surrounding the hotel can look a bit iffy, it made me not feel comfortable walking around after dark, which was the reason I wanted to pay for a hotel at the town center.
The interiors were nice and clean, and the lobby very impressive. However I did not stay in the lobby so the room was the most important thing for me. And the room is so cramped I couldn't turn around without hitting something. Also the WIFI was extra even though everywhere else including Airport and Starbucks and most other hotels offer it for free. Given the room price is not cheap this left me disappointed.

The staff was generally polite but when I answered the stay was "so so" to their question of whether I enjoyed it, they didn't bother looking at me or ask further.

review.title: Nice hotel, but the extra costs were ridiculous
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this hotel many times, and do enjoy the hotel. Having said that, we did not enjoy the $50 a night parking, the $15 a day internet access, and the $30 room service for a plate of cookies and milk... I would suggest that you don't bring a car, don't use the internet, and go to the grocery store for some food. Other than that, the service is great, the place is very clean, and there is a Starbucks in the lobby.

review.title: Superb centrally located hotel for downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The location near Union Square is ideal for easy access to the major tourist parts of San Francisco. I was walking distance from Macey's Cheese Cake Factory, major shops, Westfield shopping centre, the cable cars ( trams), underground ( Bart station) and much more.
The other hotel plus points was the gym, helpful staff and free wifi in the lobby area. The only downside was the steeply priced breakfast which was not the best I have experienced.
I will certainly be looking to book this hotel again, the next time I am in San Francisco.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: There are various towers at this location. I have not stayed at this tower before. The room looked smaller, the furniture and bedspread looked more worn and drab. I really didn't mind, but given a preference I would rather stay at the new upgraded rooms.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Plenty of staff to help us. Very busy hotel. Beds and pillows real comfy. Our only confusion was not know what driveway to enter for parking. Took wrong one of course and had to schelp all our stuff. Closest driveway offers valet service. We were able to walk to great shopping even late in the day without any worries.
Will definitely stay here again.

review.title: SF hilton downtown
review.reviewText: good convention hotel, easy to walk to downtown

review.title: Not completely satisfied.
review.reviewText:
First time I used the "choose a 4-5 star," without knowing the name of the property. I am not sure if I'll use that feature again. It was a good rate, but I'd rather pay the extra for something much better.
Although it was a Hilton, it wasn't the best Hilton by any means.
With so many wonderful hotels in San Francisco, I most definitely will not stay at that property again.

review.title: INTERNET RIP OFF
review.reviewText: EXTRA CHARGE FOR INTERNET IS WRONG

review.title: Very satisfied with stay
review.reviewText: In San Francisco for travel for an entire week. Was expecting a single king/queen room however was given a room with two double beds without the option of choosing. Otherwise the hotel was very nice. Free wifi in the lobby was speedy. Hotel had an upbeat pace. Restaurant/bar hit the spot. Rooms were clean and modern-looking. Bathrooms were ok. Good location. No issues at checkout. Overall very pleased with my stay.

review.title: Very well located! Everithing is around...
review.reviewText:
You get everything close to this hotel. Sightseeing, shopping, museums. I also recommend the restaurant! It's delicious!
Good rate.

review.title: Hilton San Francisco Union Square J'adore!
review.reviewText: My french aunt came to visit me for the first time in California and asked me to organize a 3 days trip to San Francisco.The hotel,i knew was important to her so i decided on the Hilton,you can never go wrong with the Hilton.We got an incredible room on the 29th floor with a magnificient view of the city,the beds were so comfortable,every one was so nice to us.Staying at the Hilton ,right in the heart of San Francisco was the highlight of her trip.

review.title: Egg-flation!
review.reviewText: Attended for a conference. Hotel was fine in all respects, meeting the needs of the typically business traveler. HOWEVER, $23 for an omelet did same outrageous! I mean, hey; it's not NYC! Other than that, would recommend.

review.title: great deal
review.reviewText: great deal, comparable hotels much higher , good service, breakfast at Starbuck's in the lobby included

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Everyone was accommodating, beds were Very comfortable, shower was terrific...lots of water pressure.

review.title: Wonderful Christmas in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I booked 2 rooms and when we checked in one of the rooms had a bad odour but Hilton quickly upgraded that room to the tower with a view. Both rooms were comfortable, neat, tidy, always kept clean by the cleaning staff. One room had a bath tub and one only a shower. The cleaning staff could be a little over zealous knocking to clean frequently before we were out in the morning. The front desk and concierge were extremely helpful. The fitness center was very good and well used by the patrons. Don't take anything out of the mini-bar to keep your own stuff cold as Hilton will charge for the stuff removed. A separate fridge for the stay is only $15. The Hilton is a short walk from Union Square, the trolleys, buses, subway. Hilton charges for Internet, but a Starbucks is a block away. This is a great location and a comfortable hotel and we would gladly return.

review.title: Good.
review.reviewText: Good service.

review.title: Over-Rated Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is located very close to one of the unsafe neighborhoods of San Francisco. The area surrounding the hotel was full of rundown shops and restaurants. If you are driving be prepared to pay a lot for parking as the hotel charged close to 40.00 to park your car. In fact we felt that the hotel nickeled and dimed us for everything. I love San Francisco but next time I would stay in one of the boutique hotels.

review.title: Lovely hotel, but a block from the Tenderloin
review.reviewText:
First of all, you need to be aware that the Hilton is between Union Square and the Tenderloin. Yeah, it's just a short walk to great restaurants and shopping, but it's also a short walk to the "undesireable" part of town. You WILL be panhandled if you stay here. You might see people using the sidewalk as a bathroom as well.

If you're okay with that, and you can get a good room rate, the Hilton is a great place to stay. It's three blocks from the Warfield as well if you're a concert-goer - just don't walk down Taylor, take Mason. Heh.

The desk people were excellent - friendly and efficient. We checked in quickly and headed to our room.

BEWARE OF THE ROOMS NEXT TO THE ELEVATORS! That was what we got and we had to keep the TV on to drown out the sound of the elevator. I wish they would have told us this beforehand.

Otherwise, the room was small but nice. Gorgeous tiny bathroom, nice comfy bed. The window slider opened to let you enjoy the air and pool view.

Starbucks in the lobby, as well as lots of seating if you're waiting. The hotel security was pretty good at chasing off the homeless/panhandlers.

If it wasn't for the room next to the elevators, it would have been a perfect hotel experience.

review.title: Nice but queen room too small for 10 day stay.
review.reviewText: It is a nice hotel but our queen room was smaller than expected when we arrived. My BF is 6ft 4 so the bed was way too small for him. The next day we changed rooms and were upgraded to a king for no charge. After that we had no problems and hotel is in a great location. If you like indian food there is a great place across the street called Naan N Curry..it has an awesome buffet.

review.title: It was awesome
review.reviewText: The Hilton was awesome, and was located in the perfect area for us.

review.title: Very good hotel for price room and location
review.reviewText:
Great location room and rate for this time of year. close to all shopping ,cable cars and the downtown core. Breakfast was another deal by itself; a small glass of OJ is $5!! Do not drink it unless it is included with your buffet. Our a la carte meal for 2 was $52!!! and that was just breakfast. Lori's Diner around the corner is a brighter place and for half the amount you get a great breakfast.
So stay in the hotel and eat elsewhere; the city is a treasure trove of international food.

review.title: Looking forward to next year
review.reviewText: Love your special prices for the holiday and the opportunity to get ajoining rooms for my family! Only wish the parking fees were "on special" as well.
review.userLocation: South Carolina..we are moving to Washington State

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: I went with my daughter and my mother. We all were comfortable and really enjoyed the hotel. The rooms were clean, the elevators ran quickly, the staff was great. Highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: It's a nice hotel and for the price you can't beat it. I wouldn't rate it as a 4 star hotel. We stayed in Tower 2 which needs to be updated but the room was comfortable and clean. The BART line runs close buy so if you're not getting a rental car skip the cab and take it for $8.10 instead. Walking distance to everything in Union Square and close to all the trolley and street car routes. It's at the very edge of an area known as the Tenderloin. If you walk out the hotel doors and head to the right it's close to all the shopping and restaurants. If you walk out the hotel doors and head to the left it's the sketchy area of town with street walkers and more.

review.title: Could be better.....
review.reviewText:
The hotel was at a good location, walking distance to Union Square, restaurants and shops. The channels on tv that are offered are not a good selection and if you want to watch a movie in your room be ready to pay $16+ which is clearly an outrages price. Also, plan on paying $25 extra per night if you need a small roll away bed. We had a party of 2 adults & 2 kids and my kids are boy/girl and big age difference so they did not want to sleep on the same bed. When I called house keeping to ask for a roll away bed for our room the man on the phone said "it will be $25 per night for the roll a way bed, is that OK?" Are you kidding me? all hotels we have stayed at the roll away bed is free so be sure to ask before you pay for your reservation. Ughhhh that was not good and it upset me because for that extra $50 I could have gone to a nicer hotel. in the same area.
They have a Starbucks in the lobby so that was a plus but just be ready to wait in a long, long, long line. Room service was good but for 3 people it will cost you over $100 and I am talking BLT sandwiches, fries, a piece of pie and a couple of sodas. We stayed at this hotel during mid December so it rained and the hotel was packed. The rooms are very small and our view was crap, not a nice view at all. Only a few blocks from the hotel is the Terderloin...very bad area so be careful where you walk around and note to self, lots of druggies and homeless up a few streets from the hotel.

review.title: Hilton SF
review.reviewText: it was really busy being close to xmas, but the hotel was very nice. Everything you would expect and a great location. Parking was pricey at $50/night but there was a sign where you can park across the street for $30. It is was great value for the money overall.

review.title: Great hotel at reasonable price!
review.reviewText:
Was impressed with this hotel. Only stayed for 2 nights but room was clean and as expected. Check in and out was a breeze. They even let us check in 3 hours early which was appreciated.

Lots of great shopping and restaurants nearby. When you exit the hotel things get a little shady if you go left instead of right, but nothing too bad.

Town car to the airport was cheaper than cabs were quoting us and there was no wait at all.

Only complaint was that the gift shop was the only place in the hotel we could find that had cold drinks and even though it was supposedly open until 11 both nights it was closed at 9ish when we got back to the hotel.

Would recommend Union Square Hilton to anyone going to San Fran.

review.title: Great central location
review.reviewText: Great central location for shopping and restaurants; best to use public parking across the street from hotel to save some money; ask the front desk for the name of the little lane/street close by with European outdoor cafes/bistros.

review.title: the nicest service people anywhere
review.reviewText: From the check in people at the front desk to the maids and the waitpersons,everyone was as friendly and helpful as could be. An especially friendly atmosphere made us feel right at home.

review.title: Hilton Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location near Union Square shopping, restaraunts.

review.title: Nice, but.....
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in great area of the City. Made the mistake of going weekend after Thanksgiving. Long line checking in and only 3 attendants at Reservation Desk. I had two rooms reserved. One was good size and overlooked the pool 3 floors down, but the walls were like paper. Need I say more! Both were on the top floor but I was disappointed in the decor. The second room was okay but extremely small and somewhat outdated. You had to enter the bathroom sideways. Bed very comfortable! Parking garage at hotel very expensive but normal for City.

review.title: wifi is too expensive
review.reviewText: wifi is too expensive. maybe next I can use 4G.

review.title: Prettyy good impression
review.reviewText: Fairly well located, with spacious room and very good attention, despite being a huge hotel.

review.title: Good location, satisfactory hotel
review.reviewText: Not very clean, but overall it was ok for the price.

review.title: Excellent Location-good service: Strongly recommended.
review.reviewText: Overall, good Hotel.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Perfect

review.title: It wus ok .
review.reviewText: Parking wus very high a day - did'nt known until I have to pay.

review.title: Great value and good location
review.reviewText: We always visit San Francisco around the Christmas holidays and decided to go a little earlier this year. We could not get into the hotel at which we usually stay (Westin St. Francis) so decided to try the Hilton. Located just a couple of blocks off Union Square, this hotel is in a good if not great location. The hotel itself is pretty huge; the lobby area is very large and it seemed as if there was at least one convention at the hotel. The guest room was a little on the small side, but overall a pretty good value considering the price. The room was very clean, the bed linens were good and the beds were comfortable. Good large TV too- large flat screen. The shower /bathroom was great and the quality of the bath products good. Although our preferred choice remains the Westin St. Francis due to the location and the quality of the hotel, I was not disappointed with the Hilton and would stay there again if my first choice was not available.

review.title: San Fran...
review.reviewText: The hotel was really nice. The only concern on might have is that it is near the Tenderloin area. Although it was not an issue for us others might feel uncomfortable .

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Everyone was extremely helpful and friendly. It was in a great location so we could walk to shopping and restaurants. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Location of the hotel is very convenient. Everything in the hotel was perfect exept that the pool close at 9pm and the room service at midnight. But the location was just great, close from every transportation and at the center of San Francisco!

review.title: Don't get a room next to housekeeping
review.reviewText: Very large hotel...three towers. Everything was great except my room was right next to housekeeping, which is extremely loud beginning at approximately 7AM. Seriously it sounded like they were going to come through the wall. The hotel did provide free breakfast for both days of my stay as compensation. The hotel was booked so they were unable to change me to another room. Otherwise all was good, but be sure to tell them at check-in not to put you next to housekeeping.

review.title: I would recommend if there was not a college football on that weekend.
review.reviewText:
I would like to review the airline!
I booked an Air Canada flight and paid the extra. Then when we get to the airport it was on United flight. So I had to pay to check a bag.
One of the reasons we purchased Air Canada was their inflight entertainment system. The United had not entertainment system at all. I know the flight was not especially long but we paid a lot for those tickets and it was not worth it at all.

review.title: Not impressed, ripped off at check in!
review.reviewText: Paid a decent amount of money for the hotel, was asked if i would like to upgrade to a room with a view and a better breakfast, I did as I was there with my girlfriend. Paid a substantial amount for the upgrade only to receive a room that did not have a spectacular view as promised and a starbucks breakfast. make sure to check out every detail for the upgrade first!

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText:
There was no Internet service in the room. The problem remained for 4 nights while every other little hotel had a working internet
The room cleanliness was suboptimal for 4 stars hotel

review.title: surprisingly shabby room
review.reviewText:
check in went smoothly, the room was tiny. the bathroom door was falling off the hinge. windows allowed quite a bity of noise from the busy street below.
overall, good location, but the rooms ned some TLC. would probably not stay there again.

review.title: It's 2010 - Hilton SFO Needs an Upgrade
review.reviewText: This hotel is supposedly a 4 or 5 star San Francisco hotel, and it charges for it. However, the decor and rooms are so outdated, they still have 1980s style wallpaper all over. Moreover, INTERNET service was down the whole time I stayed there. They had to open a ballroom to provide WiFi, and even that was very very poor service ---- didn't work well at all, and no internet service in the rooms. THIS IS 2010 Hilton ------ Time for major upgrades.

review.title: Convenient for the business traveler
review.reviewText: This hotel's got everything a business traveler would want...comfortable, spacious rooms...good gym...decent restaurant...Starbucks and a full-service Fed Ex Center in the lobby...and 3 blocks from the subways. What it doesn't have: efficient service and the staff is overwhelmed (lines 8-10 people deep almost everywhere). Hotel's going through some rough times I guess...the once-fabulous top floor restaurant is no longer operating and the once-luxurious spa is closed. That said, a good stay...when will Hilton get on the free internet bandwagon?

review.title: Huge hotel but great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is enormous and had a full lobby every time I was in the lobby during our short stay. The hotel itself is beautiful. Our room was small, clean, and very comfortable. If any Hilton personnel reads this review, I would love to know where they get the pillows. They were heavenly! I've wished for one each night since our stay. The location couldn't be beat. Two blocks away from Powell, great shopping, and the cable car line. We got a great deal on Expedia for this hotel and our flight for a quick anniversary getaway for a couple of tired parents!

review.title: Nice and no problems
review.reviewText: This hotel is huge, will 3 towers; so, it can be a bit of a walk to your room. The room was very small, but otherwise comfortable and clean. The bed was a bit hard, but that is not an unusual complaint for me to have. Nothing extra is included in the regular room price; coffee in the morning is either in your room or bought at the Starbucks in the lobby. It was located in a central location with easy access to many essentials of SF.

review.title: Good place to crash in SF
review.reviewText: Great place, one thing that I thought was missing was a free shuttle service to the airport like other hiltons have.

review.title: Perfect.
review.reviewText: Great staff, clean rooms and great location.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel in a convenient location near Union Sq. Rooms were clean and staff friendly. I enjoyed my sty there and would stay there again.

review.title: Had a pleasant stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was centrally located which made a lot of things easily accessible. Many days we did not need the rental car because we could walk or take public transportation. The weather was beautiful. There were stores and restaurants within walking distance. The streets were always bustling with people, so you didn't have to worry about walking at night. It was a wonderful experience.

review.title: Perfect located
review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfortable, located in the center, the personnel was very helpfull, especially in advising restaurants. They did the early checking for us which helped a lot. The check in machines for the flights were also very good idea of the hotel.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was ok but the food was overpriced and the rooms were small.

review.title: Excellent......Looking forward to returning
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to everything we needed. Just a short walk to the subway or above ground transit. Staff was very cordial and we were extremely satisfied with their prompt cleaning of the room.

review.title: Clean and basic, convenient location, staff could be more welcoming though.
review.reviewText: When we finally found our room ( the layout of the different towers and many, many elevators), it was very clean and comfortable. The room was very small and the views are crummy since it is downtown and amongst the buildings, but the bed was so comfortable! Liked the amenities, should have ice machine on every floor, though. Really, really need a phone book in the room. We wanted to find late night food, had to go to the lobby and ask for phone book that took a long time to find. We were only staying the one night to see a baseball game so location was perfect (easy to find to and from freeway) and was just what a mom and two kids needed. Nothing fancy, just clean and comfortable. The front desk agent who checked us in could have been more welcoming. Considering how late we checked in and how tired we all looked, she didn't really seem to care. She made sure to finish her conversation with her colleague before turning her attention to us. Efficient and cold service.

review.title: Good hotel but eat elsewhere
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were friendly and the hotel room was very pleasant. The only negative was the buffet breakfast, where most of the fare was bland and unappetizing. We would recommend seeking breakfast elsewhere.

review.title: Showing my wife where I lived in the late 90's
review.reviewText: We arrived in San Francisco and got to the hotel and checked in in less than an hour. We caught a shuttle in and were the second stop. Check in took all of 5 minutes. Was very impressed with the hotel. Very updated and had airconditioning. The room is exactly what is shown on expedia and on Hilton's web site. Two blocks away from the cable car line from union square. Plenty of shopping and restaurants to visit. Here are some tips and suggestions for enjoying your stay. Buy a muni multi day passport. It in good for Cable cars, Street cars, Buses, and the train within the city. This will keep you from having to always pull out you wallet. You can buy these on Powell and market. We bought the three day. One way on the cable car alone is $5 each person. You do the math. Macy's and Westfield mall have food courts in the basement levels. Plenty of choices. I ate at Wolfgang Pucks express in Macy's and had the best meatloaf sandwich ever. There is this place called Tommy's Joint thhat has been in the same location for a long, long time. Outstaning hand carved sandwiches on sourdough bread. They are on the corner of Van ness and Geary. The decore is great to look at and a great bar. Try it. Sad to say the homeless problem is still big in SF. But the Hotel has plenty of security that they don't bother you. Last on O'farrell walking back to the hotel from powell, you will find a cupecake place calle Cako. You can't miss it the wndow is lined with cupcakes. Try one!! You won't regret it

review.title: A hotel to stay at
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. Dissatisfied with the charge with using the gym, also the charges to use the mini bar are ridiculous. $7.00 for a chocolate bar. They weren't even made out of gold.. Outradious. Otherwise the room was clean. Maid service was great. Clean towels. bathroom clean.

review.title: “Centralized location to get around!”
review.reviewText:
We stayed at this hotel for 4 days and though the room was smaller than what you would expect for the Hilton, this is of course San Francisco where it seems every available space is being utilized and space seems to be a premium. The bed however was very comfortable as that is my main concern! I saw where someone says in their review that the room was outdated but this is an older hotel- we had at least a flat screen tv as someone mention that they didn't have one then :). Check in lobby is very busy as everyone says as its very huge but no problem getting checked in. The view i had was across the next adjacent hotel but thats ok with me as i wasn't planning in the room a lot. I saw where someone said the fee for the internet was 15 bucks but it actually 12.95 bucks when i was here per 24 hr period. There is a newer Hilton couple of blocks away on Geary (in the vicinity of CHinatown if you want to go there or be more centralized like i was in FInancial). Overall was a good stay and would stay here again. It get chilly to cold here depending on the day and when the fog comes in from the Bay- check your weather forecast to make sure in case you need a light jacket/sweater.

Plan Price Tax Duration during my stay then was that will give you an idea of what to expect:
Hourly Standard Internet Access ? $5.95 $0.00 1 Hour
Daily Standard Internet $12.95 $0.00 24 Hour

review.title: Just Another Hilton
review.reviewText: Overall, hotel is what you would expect for a Hilton Brand and a San Francisco Downtown hotel. Nice large lobby that welcomes you in. Parking always a challenge in any city, especially SF. You are going to pay a premium( about $50 US) to park your car, whether it is self park or valet. The rooms were basic rooms. They were clean and presentable, but you could tell it has aged due to use, if that makes sense. Our shower head leaked so water pressure was affected. Some of the water still came out of the faucet instead of the shower head even if you pulled up on the knob all the way. Location is central to most attractions. We were able to comfortably walk to the Moscone cenetr for our meeting. Plenty of shopping, restaurants, bars, and coffee shops within walking distance. Staff was well trained on customer service but seemed to be indifferent to us as guests. They were nice enough but did not display any wow factor, at least that weekend. The value for our stay was good; nice hotel in SF close to all for a great price. We were pleased overall.

review.title: Reasonable price; good service.
review.reviewText:
Cons: Bed was awfully small to be called a "Queen." Bathroom sink much too small for faucet style.

Pros: Great location for walking and public transit. Excellent local food options in non-obvious places. Room value was good due to discounted price. Service was very good.

review.title: One of the best places to stay in San Francisco. Outstanding service and staff.
review.reviewText: If you are looking for all of the amenties, then you need to stay at the Hilton Downtown - it is a super nice hotel and we were treated with the best service and care that you could imagine. All of the staff were very accomodating and were more than willing to answer our questions, give us directions, and coordinate our tours as well. Super nice experience for my wife and I. Would definitely recommned this hotel to our family and friends.

review.title: Had SOOO Much Fun!!!
review.reviewText: Had SOOO Much Fun!!!

review.title: very close to shopping area
review.reviewText:
Close to shopping areas - Union Sq
close to tram to Hyde Pier and Fisherman's Wharf
30 minutes from airport
close to financial district
very good heated pool

review.title: 15 th wedding anniversary
review.reviewText: i have always loved san fransisco and union square is right smack dab in the middle of all the action. all we had to do was step out the front door and everything was within walking, cablecar or taxi distance. great views of the city from our room too

review.title: great location, excellent concierge services, extremely small room
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, great location, and extremely helpful concierge. However, the room was so very small we were tripping over each other.

review.title: Relaxing Labor Day weekend at the Hilton
review.reviewText: My wife and I had a relaxing and pleasant Labor Day weekend at the Hilton Union Square as the room and service at the Hilton was very good. Our checkin at the front desk went smoothly and the clerk was very helpful. He was able to move us to one of the hotel's renovated floors (14th on tower 3) although we gave up the city view provided by our originally assigned room on the 18th floor. The twin queen beds were very comfortable for my wife and I who travel to San Francisco at least twice a year from Hawaii for extended weekends. The location of the Hilton at Union Square is very important as it needs to be central, safe and convenient as we only need to rent a car to drive outside the city.

review.title: Not so much
review.reviewText:
The Hilton San Francisco Union Square is a very large, modern hotel a very short distance (about 1 block) from Union Square. It borders on the edge of the Tenderloin. The location of the hotel makes it convenient to walk to dinner or shopping in the Union Square area. That is about all I can say is good about the hotel.

The negatives? We were awakened every morning at 7:50am by a housekeeper asking when she could begin cleaning our room. We left our room by 8:30am each morning, but upon returning at 4:00pm our first day, she was just finishing up, and the second day she had not made it to the room at all.

The parking garage at the hotel is horrendously expensive. Travelers driving to San Francisco to stay at the hotel will want to check the parking rates ahead of time. They are ridiculous, even for city parking.

The rooms are small, and the room given to us had a ratty old carpet with many areas imperfectly treated for stains. The bathroom was small and substandard for a hotel which bills itself as a luxury property.

We will not be staying at the Hilton on our future trips to S.F.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel, good service but a little bit noise.

review.title: Will return!!!!
review.reviewText: Super room.

review.title: GOOD VACATION.
review.reviewText: AIR CONDITIONING COULD HAVE BEEN BETTER.

review.title: Best spot to stay off Market st in San Francisco
review.reviewText: What a lovely hotel. The location was great. For San Francisco overnight parking was cheap and just across the street. Just a great "see the city alive" walk to Market Street for all the cool shopping and minutes away from Fisherman Warf and Pier 39. I play to return.

review.title: Very good hotel at a very reasonable price.
review.reviewText: This was the best value I have received in several visits to San Francisco.

review.title: Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText: Our hotel stay was very satisfying. The hotel location was perfect, close to shops and transportation such as Bart, Street Cars, Cable Cars. Chinatown was close enough that we walked! We requested service by the second night due to knocking noises coming from our wall which turned out to be tower creek... (wind) so we were moved to another tower and had a very comfortable stay from that point on. The hotel was very quick to our response. Will stay here again!

review.title: Good location, tight space
review.reviewText: Great location as this hotel is close to the cable cars and the Muni. However, surrounding neighborhood is a bit shady, and the room itself is VERY cramped. But, if you are not in the room much, it doesn't really matter.

review.title: Great stay in the heart of SF
review.reviewText: This was a very nice hotel in the heart of SF. Very convenient to Union Square, the theater district, great shopping and BART. The restaurant Urban Tavern is in the hotel and has excellent food. Front desk staff was very friendly as well as the guys in guest services. I would stay there again

review.title: San Francisco Union Square Hilton
review.reviewText: Good Service. I recommend it!

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Check in/out was effortless; rooms very clean; perfect location. Great place for breakfast is Dottie's True Blue Cafe, approx 2 blocks away on Jones St ... opens @ 7:30 am - small restaurant, long lines so get there early! If driving, suggest you park in surrounding lots/structures other than hotel - much cheaper!

review.title: Great hotel, awesome location!
review.reviewText:
It's my second time at this hotel. I absolutely love the location, plus the hotel itself is very nice, the standard room is quite big, and the bed and the pillows are very comfortable.
Personnel at front desk is very friendly, plus there's a Starbuck's shop right inside the hotel!
I would definetely go back and always recommend this hotel!!

review.title: Nice Hotel - Nice Location
review.reviewText:
Almost everything met our high expectations. Really nice hotel. Great location.

Our only difficulty was at check-in when front desk clerk suddenly disappeared for over 10 minutes without telling me why she needed to leave. It turned out that she was attempting to assist with my request to have our two rooms in close proximity. My 70 year-old mother struggled to stand there during this clerk's disappearance. I then got scolded by the valet for leaving my car so long at the curb. Nice.

review.title: SF trip
review.reviewText: We loved the hotel and our trip to San Franciso. The only complaint we had is that the walls are extremely thin and we heard people all night long in the halls, in the room next door and people talking on the street below.

review.title: Great Location and Value
review.reviewText: I was dismayed at the cost of overnight parking at the Hotel. However, the staff were kind enough to point me to a parking structure across the street that charges a third of the hotel rates.

review.title: Going to San Francisco? Stay Here!!
review.reviewText:
The hotel was more than I expected. The hotel staff, Desk Clerks, Concierge and
cleaning staff were excellent. We had two rooms, both with two queen beds. The rooms are a bit small, but otherwise comfortable. The bathrooms were clean and the showers had plenty of water pressure and hot water. Would recommend that they install fans in the bathrooms.
Would highly recommend the San Francisco Hilton to any traveler.

review.title: decent price and stay
review.reviewText: I like embassy suite hilton hotels better

review.title: Average value, below average service
review.reviewText: Counter service at check in was slow and indifferent. The parking checkout was totally inefficient & slow backing up traffic in parking garage - unsat for parking that costs about $50/day! Room was small for the price and type of hotel with few amenities. Best thing about the hotel was the location near Union Square and lots of shopping and restaurants. Won't be going back to this one!

review.title: Perfect place to stay
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel....great fitness center....centrally located. Hotel a little hard to get to because of the one-way streets. The front of the Hotel is on O'Farrell street so that is where we went first. The self-parking garage is on the back side of the hotel, on another one-way street. I guess I just felt that it should have been marked better, since we had already spent a significant amout of time just trying to negotiated the one-way streets.

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText:
Although the service is excelent and the staff are very professional this hotel has 3 downsides to me: first, the rooms are a bit on the small side. I understand this is San Francisco, but my room here was smaller than one at a lower quality chain I stayed at last month. And it wouldn't kill them to put a lock in the bathroom door.
Second, altough it is conveniently located near Union Square you MUST take a right towards it when leaving the hotel. The left is a completely different world, one you might not be too comfortable in, specially after sundown.
The third thing is that they charge ridiculous prices for everything other than the room (parking, wifi, minibar, etc.). If you want to make a fair calculation of the price, take the nightly fee and add 50 dollars for parking, 15 for wifi - and 7 dollars if you take a bottle of water (water!) from the minibar, which at least in my room, wasn't even cold. You might want to add breakfast to that, too. Or just go with one of the lower end chains which include free breakfast, free wifi and 25 dollar parking. And you can get a bottle of *cold* water from a vending machine right there for about 2 dollars.
I happened to be unlucky enough to catch a picket line in the main entrance to the hotel for 2/3 of my stay. I have to say, though, the in-room coffee is just awesome.

review.title: Every thing there was ecpensive including parking ,and snacks
review.reviewText: The hotel was not what I ecpected. The breackfast was not very big, the parking was 50$ a night, and there were a lot of mean people in the area.But it had great service and, it was very clean.

review.title: Terrible stay, treated poorly, bad neighbourhood
review.reviewText: we stayed here recently for a long weekend, checked in, everything looked great, (hotel could still use some upgrades, but we weren't hanging out in it all day), room was immaculately clean. our issues were that to the left of the hotel there is the area the locals call "the tenderloin". it is a seedy, drug and hooker filled area, that is dangerous to walk in at night. we found this out by walking through it by mistake one night and then our cab driver the next night informed us of the dangers. second the beds are not comfortable at all, feels like a sheet of plywood, your constantly tossing and turning all night. third, you can hear the neighbours alarm clock, their phone ring, them talking to each other, the cleaning ladies polishing the floor above etc. every little sound you can hear all day and all night. to say the least we had very little sleep. i decided to call in 2 days later to tell them our feedback and we were not treated well, " you must be sensitive" " noone else has called to complain, our hotel is fully booked" not things a person would like to hear when calling down to speak to the front desk. my boyfriend and i usually don't complain, but after a couple night of no sleep we decided to voice our concerns with the room and hotel. if you to stay in the union square area to book closer to union square. it's still a 10 minute walk to get to the square through a mob of homeless people and at night it's sketchy. overall not what i expected from a hilton.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: No Complaints, a wonderful hotel!

review.title: They Charge For Everything!
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself is nice with great banquet facilities, but unless you are there for a conference you will never see these. The rooms are average and somewhat on the small side. The pool is heated, which is necessary because of the constant cold San Francisco weather, even in the summer. The restaurant is also good, but overpriced for what you get. There are nicer and more reasonably priced restaurants in the surrounding area.

The one thing I was not pleased with was there was an extra "fee" for everything. From the exercise equipment to internet use, they charge not only a few dollars, but QUITE a few dollars. We were charged $25 a day for a roll-a-way bed, something that was not disclosed. I was also shocked to find that there is no free Internet, which I would expect at a hotel of this caliber. Internet was another $13 a day. Thank goodness we didn't have a car - that would've been another whopping $51 a day for parking! The rate seemed like a good deal when we booked, but they nickel-and-dime you on everything else that most hotels offer for free or a nominal fee, not the outrageous fees this one charges.

review.title: Room with a View
review.reviewText: Staff was excellent. Room was wonderful. Paid extra for a view and was happy that we did. Will stay there again.

review.title: Its alright but shows sign of aging.
review.reviewText: The hotel is starting to age which you can tell by the carpet and the room fixtures and bathroom. Overall its Ok.

review.title: Don't stay here!
review.reviewText: Good location, but very low quality hotel with poor service. There are plenty of nicer places to stay in SF for the same money. For example, the Westin St. Francis is much nicer.

review.title: Fantastic hotel
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel. We had a city view room and the view was great, especially at night. Hotel is beautiful, very clean and elegant. The room was immaculate and everything worked as expected. Concierge gave great local restaurant recommendations. Hotel is in a nice part of town and close to trolleys, theater, Union Square and China Town. Entire hotel staff was professional, courterous and very helpful. I'd love to go back there.

review.title: Will be back sor sure
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very well located, close to everything.
The staff was very friendly and helpful.
The room was a bit small but very comfortable and homy.
I would recommend this hotel anytime.

review.title: Overnight
review.reviewText: Great place to stay. Central to Union Square, shopping and theater.

review.title: Great SF location
review.reviewText: This hotel is huge! But what isn't in San Francisco. Very nice and helpful hotel personnel. However, expect lines and lots of people. Very convenient - within walking distance of almost everything. Parking was pretty pricey, so leave your car behind if you can.

review.title: room was¨nt what I expect
review.reviewText: room and the bathroom was very small .

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel. Location was great. Near a bus line so it was easy to walk two blocks and jump on a bus to go to Fisherman's Wharf area. Hotel was very clean, spacious and just all around nice.

review.title: Good location - Great breakfast!
review.reviewText: Great location - just a few blocks from Union Square and of course you can walk just about anywhere (although a few streets over was sort of sketchy). We were only in for one night. We had booked a room for ourselves and one for our daughter - both were ready when we arrived ahead of the check-in time. Front desk personnel were friendly and the rooms were clean, nicely decorated (I think redone) and stocked with the necessary coffee, tea, etc. The bed was comfortable and there were plenty of towels. When booking we opted for the special that included the breakfast at the Urban Tavern next door - a trendy place with a truly amazing breakfast buffet. The baked Greek Yogurt shots were yummy! Eggs, bacon, salads, potstickers and much more. If it wasn't in a package we wouldn't have had the buffet - it's expensive. Self-parking was only $5.00 less than valet and the prices are not posted as far as I could see so be sure to ask. It is a bit confusing in San Francisco traffic because there is not a lot of loading-zone parking in front of the hotel if you want to off-load before parking, and you have to go around the block to access the garage. But once you are parked the garage is accessible from tower 3 which was great. We would stay here again.

review.title: Ideal hotel choice
review.reviewText:
The Hilton is very conveniently located close to Union Square and the cable cars and MUNI transport hub at Powell Street.
The hotel is very clean and well kept. Staff are courteous and friendly. There are also security guards on patrol in the lobby, so overall we felt safe.
The rooms are a good size and very reasonably priced.

It is an ideal base for exploring the city.

review.title: Excellent and large hotel.
review.reviewText: Overall a good hotel - very large and excellent facilities. You could even check in to yuor flight at a special terminal that they had. Too many homeless people around the building though.

review.title: Travels with Mom
review.reviewText: I took my elderly mother to a conference in San Francisco, we loved our visit. This hotel is centrally located and the staff was very helpful. They were very acommadting of Mom's walker.

review.title: Best in town according to price
review.reviewText: We stayed at Hilton Hotel San Francisco during our CA visit between June 27-30, 2010. The room we stayed was not so big but it was enough for 2 adult and 10 year of boy. We stayed at 3rd tower and parking lot just a door away from our room. The location is supper. you have several alternatives for accomodations and shoping.

review.title: SF HIlton
review.reviewText: Wonderful customer service in a fabulous location.

review.title: Typical good Hilton service
review.reviewText: Everyone at the hotel was very courteous and professional. We had exactly the room type I had requested, although the view was of the rooms across the courtyard. But overall we have no complaints and enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Pleasant
review.reviewText:
The hotel overall was pleasant. The rooms could have been a little bigger as we were 4 in the room. Not far from the main street and close to Chinatown.
Good location.

review.title: So delighted.
review.reviewText: These people strive to maintain their high standard. My only worry had to do with a noise from the air conditioner unit. Gave notice at the front desk in the morning, when I got back the noise was gone. Found a note from housekeeping. They had changed the whole unit just to spare me my discomfort.

review.title: Very convenient location. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful.
review.reviewText: The hotel is very conveniently located near Union Square but the lobby is always full of people and a bit noisy. Room interior looks a bit old and the shower head need to be replaced.

review.title: Would recommend and would definitely go back
review.reviewText:
We were really satisfied with the Hilton Union Square, the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is conveniently located downtown and is walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and shopping downtown.

One recommendation, do not buy your coffee or tea at the Starbucks at the Hilton, we found out not all Starbucks are the same. The coffee and tea at the Starbucks in the Hotel Nikko, one block from the Hilton cost at least a buck less and there's no line up. Exit from the lobby door and make a right and head one block to Hotel Nikko's Starbuck.

review.title: Best location to get around the town from-- cable car, bus, rental car, you name it!
review.reviewText: Pool was under repair so not able to use. The CityScapes restauant talked about on website was a bit misleading. It is for reservation use only for parties. Never saw the lobby bar unless it was the Urban Tavern which is near the lobby but not in it. Best thing the pizza delivery place near by. Pizza and salad was delicious.

review.title: Excellent Stay
review.reviewText: Wish the pool would have been open, but had a great stay!

review.title: Left my heart in San Fran
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. It was located right in the heart of union square within walking distance to great shopping, dining and nightlife. I would stay here again if I wanted to be in the heart of San Fran.

review.title: Excellent service and really well communicated
review.reviewText: San Francisco is a different experience compare with other US cities... one of the places to know per sure

review.title: Fun time!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton. So much to see and do in San Francisco!

review.title: A Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I loved San Francisco, and the Hilton hotel was great. The location is right next to a ton of shopping, and it is a close walk to Chinatown and even Fisherman's Wharf. My only suggestion is to avoid the in-hotel Starbucks, as they charge much more than the one just outside of the hotel.

review.title: Average Hotel
review.reviewText: The location is not too bad but not great, the rooms are clean, the staff is good. It's a Hilton... I still think it's a pity not to offer a breakfast!! The StarBucks in the hotel i s always crowded. I would recommend it though, it's my second stay in a year.

review.title: Staying Again
review.reviewText: This hotel was nice and clean. It was located in a great spot

review.title: convenient location....clean.....friendly, helpful staff
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and located in a convenient place. Could use some cosmetic upgrades, but was a good place to stay.

review.title: Disappointing San Francisco
review.reviewText: I've always enjoyed going to San Francisco: it has character, wonderful dining, so much culture...BUT The homeless, who are everywhere are SO AGGRESSIVE, it makes for an annoying visit.

review.title: Great View
review.reviewText: Beautiful Hotel. Service was adequate, nothing extraordinary. Room was fabulous with gorgeous view of golden gate bridge and downtown. Very comfy bed and great water pressure in the shower. Complimentary Hotel breakfast thru Starbucks was wonderful, but the attached restaurant was overpriced for greasy food. If needed, go to the liquor store to the left of the hotel (as you exit ). The other one across the street has outrageous prices!

review.title: Great location. Excellent rate
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located a few blocks from Union Square in downtown SF. Service and premises are very good. Although there are a couple of stations around the lobby where flight check-in and boarding passes can be printed, complimentary WiFi is certainly missed. Overall, it was a great stay.

review.title: Near Powell Station & Trams to the Wharf!!
review.reviewText: Check-in was quick and we had a beautiful room that was beyond our expectations. Location was Fantastic just three min to Powell Street the main area for shopping and hopping on the tram to fisherman's wharf. Great shoppin in the area!

review.title: Fine, but overpriced
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine, but I don't think that it was worth the nightly fee - even in San Fran. The room was on the small side, the pool was closed while I was visiting, and that wasn't made clear when I booked the room. It was one of the reasons that we stayed at the Hilton rather than somewhere else. The gift store was small and never open, so we had to leave the hotel just to buy a reasonably priced bottle of water. It was nice to have a Starbucks and the hotel bar right in the lobby and the staff were all very nice and pleasant.

review.title: Good value and location for shopping weekend
review.reviewText: This was a girls weekend, the beds were very comfy,maids excellent and helpful. Close to a corner store with fruit, beer ,wine,and munchies.Starbucks in lobby a plus. Concierge was not that friendly but the one on Saturday was much better.Shopping was at your doorstep. would recommend and stay again.Very clean and not noisy.

review.title: " Not worth the money"
review.reviewText: SAME AS THE ABOVE.

review.title: Nice place
