review.reviewText: Great location and decent price. Would go back.

review.title: Comfortable and convenient, but parking fee is a downside
review.reviewText: The Hilton Union Square was conveniently located within walking distance of great shopping and dining. One of the drawbacks of the hotel is the $52.00 per night parking fee. Fortunately due to the package that we had our parking was included. Otherwise, our stay was very enjoyable, and the hotel overall is a very nice, quality hotel.

review.title: In the heart of San Francisco.
review.reviewText: It was in a central location and staff were extremely helpful. The best thing about the hotel was how comfortable the bed was! Our check-out time was extended which was perfect. It made out journey home easier. I good return to the Hilton on Union Square.

review.title: It´s confortable but there´s some problems
review.reviewText:
It was really good. Everthing are fine. The only problem was the breakfast. It´s a quite expensive.
There´s no wi-fi signal avaliable. You have to use cable to connect. The cellphone signal was bad as well.

review.title: Perfect from Start to Finish
review.reviewText: I knew I wanted 4-star, and I knew I wanted Union Square. After those two qualifiers, I simply selected the best price from the choices I had. The room was absolutely perfect and spotless, and was beautifully cleaned every day. The beds had 4 different sizes and densities of pillows, so everyone could find their favorite. Either we had very quiet neighbors, or the walls are great, but we never heard any noise. Our room had it's own thermostat, so cold air was available instantly. One of the male concierge's was a bit of a snoot one morning when I asked for some help, but the rest of the entire staff from doormen to security to room cleaners could not have been nicer or friendlier! Location was great, just a couple blocks from Union Square. We could walk to Chinatown and the Embarcadero (we are good walkers) but if you prefer riding, the buses and taxis are plentiful. Just two blocks from the cable cars and the hop-on-hop off buses (which I highly recommend if you are trying to figure out where you really want to spend your time). I would DEFINITELY return to this hotel.

review.title: Exceptional
review.reviewText: The experience at the Hilton Union Square was terrific. The staff was very compliant and diligent. Rooms were very clean, safe - there was a security guard who checks room keys (after hours). Would come back again for a third time, as this was my second stay.

review.title: We will go back....we had a wonderful stay.
review.reviewText: For those folks that are not sure where to stay in San Francisco and want to be in the heart of everything a tourist wants to see...this is the place. Very clean and the service was perfect!

review.title: Very nice with some reservations
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very convenient to public transit, however the downtown area of San Francisco where it is located is loaded with homeless and I am guessing prostitution. Some very sad-looking people sleeping/wandering in the area as you walk around. I never felt unsafe, however.
The hotel itself is an older building that has been well-kept up. The rooms are a little small, but fine for 1 or 2 people. Service staff at the hotel was incredibly helpful. Only complaint is that for the prices Hilton charges they should offer free in-room internet services. Even Holiday Express offers free internet.

review.title: Good and Bad
review.reviewText:
Dropped my husband off with the luggage. He got no assistance from the door man. Not even to assist him by opening the door.
However, the concierge desk was very helpful and pleasant.
We booked a city view room with a 27' flat screen tv. We got the back side of the hotel and no flat screen.
The room was cleaned and the bed comfortable. The wind was blowing and made a howling noise in the room. We didn't know what that noise was initially.
It was nice to have a Starbucks in the lobby. Also lots of restaurant near the hotel and very close to the shopping area and the trolley.

review.title: Perfect Hotel for travelers of all type and kind.
review.reviewText:
Perect location, good size room, comfortable beds, Great package price with Expedia. All stages of the Expedia process was perfect and the Hilton did not dissappoint. I read the reviews before I went and they were right on. This is a Great Hotel in a greater SF community - Union Square, theatre, dining, garden walking (check out "Stairway Walks in San Francisco" for a very interesting and active travel in SF), and more.

Best choice, with one caveate, it is a big hotel with lots of people (confernce, business, and social activity). So, this may not be for you if you are looking for small, quaint, or quiet. We enjoyed the livienest of the lobby. security was present and the energy was positive and productive. When in our room, it was quiet, quaint, and also what we were looking for. Note. it is a different vibe than the "W Hotel" vibe.

Right match, you'll be pleased, very pleased.

review.title: Don't fall for the "room upgrade" argument
review.reviewText:
Overall the hotel was beautiful, the staff very polite and professional, and the experience was fantastic.

I was not happy with the hotel restaurant. It was over priced and the wait staff was not very attentive. I would definitely not recommend eating in the restaurant, especially for breakfast.

I was also very upset with the room "upgrade" that really wasn't an upgrade at all.

review.title: Comfortable stay with a great view.
review.reviewText:
What a great stay we had!!!!! Everything was very clean and comfortable. We will certainly stay at this hotel again if our travels take us back to San Francisco. Thanks for the great deal Expedia.

The Davis Family
Williamstown, PA

review.title: Would not book hotel again
review.reviewText: The Hotel indicateds it is at Union Square but is actually a few blocks off which makes a difference in surroundings. If you want a huge conference hotel, run of the mill rooms and mediocre surroundings, it might be fine but would not stay there on vacation.

review.title: Our First Choice
review.reviewText: We spent an awesome four days in San Francisco at the Hilton on Union Square. We could walk to EXCELLENT shopping and restaurants. The cable car turnaround was just around the corner. We had very easy access to the trolley line, as well. The hotel was beautiful; rooms were clean and spacious and comfortable. The pool and surrounding area was clean. The staff was very helpful and the concierge was very knowledgeable. You could easily get around without a vehicle. We appreciated the kiosks in the lobby where we could print out our boarding passes before our flight.

review.title: Would definitely return.
review.reviewText: The attentiveness of the employees made this establishment stand out.

review.title: Will come back again
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and the service was great. From checking in to any assistance was neeed. The location was great to shopping and resturants. Will stay again!

review.title: Expect to return it again
review.reviewText: very good

review.title: Hilton Union Square
review.reviewText: The service at the hotel's restaurant Urban Tavern is terrible. Two nights in a row the wait staff and bartenders took forever to acknowledge me. The food was rushed and terrible. The kitchen closes early. Waiter did not recommend another place to eat after 10. He instead had an attitude and rushed me out of the facility. I was offered a comp breakfast that I was then charged $75 for. The property itself is pretty old with a musty smell. It's also very crowded. The walls are not sound proof. If you're considering this hotel for its location- ok. But it's certainly not the best of Hilton's properties. There are other great hotels in the same area.

review.title: VERY GOOD HOTEL!!!!
review.reviewText:
SAN FRANCISCO!!!! EXCELENT PLACE TO VISIT!!!!
HILTON UNION SQUARE EXCELENT LOCATION, SERVICE AND INSTALATIONS!!!!

review.title: Warmest welcome in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I spent three wonderful days at the Hilton Union Square. From the moment we arrived, we were traeted like the most treasured and special guests and this lasted throughtout our stay. The policy of the Hilton is 10 out of 10 in 2010 and we unhesitatingly gave them a high ten on every score.
Our room was elegant and spacious- two large doubles, and enough closet space for 2 shoppers.
We got terrific advice on shopping, sights, ferries, museums-you name it- not only from the concierge , but in his momentary absence from other staffers.
tHE LOCATION IS CENTRAL, THOUGH IT IS ON THE VERY EDGE OF THE REDDISH-LIGHT AREA- HOWEVER WE WERE OUT AND ABOUT AT ALL HOURS AND HAD NO PROBLEMS.
iN SHORT, WE LOVED THE HOTEL AND MOST OF ALL ITS FRIENDLY AND EFFICIENT STAFF. tHEY MADE OUR HOLIDAY
sO DEFINITELY 10 OUT OF 10

review.title: Great Hotel for Chilly San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I loved the hotel. Everything was very cozy & luxurious. The hotel is conveniently located in the downtown area of San Francisco. Great shopping!!!

The only thing I didn't like about the hotel was the parking. It was $51 a night!

review.title: Unsatisfied83
review.reviewText: This is the second time we've stayed at this Hilton. The first time the experience was fine until I got home and realized they had charge me twice for parking. After some hassel we got the charge removed. So we decided to give it another try. We had requested a room with double beds, and when we checked in they informed us they only had a room with a king bed left. Luckily we were willing to share a bed, but not what I had payed for in advance.I will not be staying here again.

review.title: Great stay in Union Square Area...
Perfect SFO Accomodations !!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, great location, room was very nice and I love the crabtee and evelyn ammenities in the room. Check in and out is a breeze. Service was excellent. One pointer on parking, there is a parking garage about one or two blocks away that only charges $20 a day. much cheaper than parking at the hotel. Oh...the pillows are EXCEPTIONAL !!!! LIKE SLEEPING ON A CLOUD!

review.title: Noisy , Brown Tap Water and Poor Public Relations
review.reviewText:
We brought our bags up and the room and bathroom seemed clean although small.
When we returned to the room that night after spending the day at Lake Merritt, I went to take a shower. This was 9:30pm.
The water was BROWN! and letting it run did not improve things. We called the desk and they sent up a plumber who was in our bathroom for a good half hour, changing shower heads and trying to get the water to run clearly.

We finally turned off the TV and went to bed at 11:30.

In the quiet we could both hear the elevator ( apparently the shaft ran right next to the room) quite loudly.
We discussed calling the desk, but remembered they were fully booked, and decided to try sleeping .
The noise did not stop all night and both of us had a very poor nights rest.

When we checked out, it was the same clerk who greeted me friendly.
I told her that I wish she hadn't put us in a room that she had to know was noisy and that if it was the only room, she should have told us and let us choose to go to another hotel.
She replied that she would never do that!
When we talked to the manager he was rude and noncaring.
I would never go back to such an awful experience.
The only in house restaurant was small with a limited choice of food.

review.title: A good hotel in a central location
review.reviewText: The room was nice and clean, and I was pleased to see updated fixtures in the bathroom. The hotel is conveniently located in Union Square, so it's an easy walk to all the major shops. The only 'downside' was the fact that there were (what appeared to be) numerous weddings/conventions occurring during my visit. However, since it is a Hilton, one comes to expect that.

review.title: TenderSquare
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel. We felt very safe and the staff was very helpful. I would have hoped to have free wifi since I paid $400 for my room. Hopefully this changes in the future

review.title: Hilton SF excellent, would recommend to anyone visiting the area.
review.reviewText: The staff could not have been more helpful, even gave us free internet access as we were first time guests. The Hotel is located one block from Union Square where there are plenty of shops, pubs, restaurants and all the tour buses leave from. Would highly recommend it to anyone thinking of visiting SF and would certainly stay there again should I ever return!

review.title: Huge Hotel-Great Service
review.reviewText: The entire staff at this hotel is sincerely fabulous!I am a picky traveler but found nothing negative about our comfortable and fun two night stay.

review.title: Hilton SFO Union Sq...sweet deal and location
review.reviewText: While the rooms in Tower 1 have not been updated in a while, they were clean and comfortable. I was fortunate to have a City view room which was amazing. It's unfortunate that the lounge on the top floor of the hotel was not open - it's either closed or under renovation....not sure. Overall the location was great and staff friendly.

review.title: Okay place to stay
review.reviewText: This being my first time in SF, i was not sure of the neighborhoods. This hotel was convenient to Market Street and the ORpheum Theater; however, it was a good walk to the Wharf. If this is your first time in SF, i would recommend staying closer to the Wharf, unless shooping is your thing.

review.title: Good hotel but no wifi internet.
review.reviewText:
I was under the impression that the hotel had wi-fi for the room. It does not, they charged extra for internet access and it is wired. Good thing you are in the heart of town because the room service was way to expensive to even use.

Aside from those items, everything else was stellar. The staff and the condition of the room were excellent and the location could not be beat. 2 blocks from the cable car and Union Square.

review.title: already recommended to others
review.reviewText: we were completely satisfied, could not complain about a single thing, the room was very clean and comfortable

review.title: Can't wait to get back
review.reviewText: Loved the neighborhood

review.title: What we expected.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was largely clean and well appointed. The beds were especially comfortable although perhaps a bit small. Also I figure flat screens should be default in a chain like the Hilton, but TV was far from a priority. We were in tower 3 and the walk from the Elevator to our room felt like forever. Also, the hallways while relatively clean were getting somewhat run down.

The staff were all very freindly and helpful. The conceirge service was great and a good resource for any city info. Even the security persons were uniformly friendly and always greeted. The people made us feel that our experience was good.

review.title: Wrong Bed size in room, didn't get our breakfast buffets coupons, and bar got drinks wrong
review.reviewText: I'd recommend the Hotel strickly because of it's location. No other reason.

review.title: Location, location ,location.
review.reviewText: Hotel was right in the heart of things. Staff friendly, helpful and courteous. Room was clean and spacious.

review.title: Hilton in the City
review.reviewText: Great place to stay when in the 'City' !

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Great location for sightseeing (Union Square shopping, museums) and easy transportation around the city (cable cars, BART, light rail, buses). The hotel is massive - three towers - but it didn't seem like there was else much to it; a restaurant/bar and a Starbucks on the ground floor.

It seems like they might be in the middle of a renovation, at least in the tower we stayed. Some floors were updated/modern, others like ours appeared to be quite a bit older. The room was fairly nice but very small - had a much larger room in a NYC Hilton, surprisingly.

review.title: Love the "City"!
review.reviewText: We were allowed to check in early! Which, coming in from out of town with luggage, we thought we would have to walk the streets until the room was ready at 3pm.

review.title: SF
review.reviewText: Cozy hotel by union square.

review.title: Clean, but a bit cramped
review.reviewText: Typical city hotel room where the spaciousness is minimal but the location is good. One interesting feature that was a bit of a pain was double spring loaded french type doors to the bathroom. They would slam shut hard as you entered or exited the bathroom. It got a bit annoying hearing your neighbors bathroom doors slamming through the evening.

review.title: First and last stay at a Hilton
review.reviewText:
Had to pay extra for internet connection, extra for using the gym, extra for the pool, a soda can from the mini bar was $8...
You already pay enough for the room as is, then have to pay more for every single thing...

review.title: Review
review.reviewText: Nothing Spectacular...

review.title: Nice views from the 30th floor
review.reviewText: We arrived a couple hours before check-in and were very happy the room was ready to go. That allowed us to relax a little before spending the rest of the day in SF. Rooms were a little smaller than anticipated but had agreat view.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The hotel stay was good. The staff was accomidating. The centralized position of the hotel is helpful and easy to get around to the sites and local hot spots. Checked out Ike's place and La Taquiera both off 16th St from Man vs. Food and they tasted wonderful compared to the the resteraunt in the hotel and first crush around the corner. If your lucky you can go in to Fusion(hot nightclub) but expect to pay bottle service to skip the long line.

review.title: Hilton San Fran
review.reviewText: Great hotel and good location for walking to nearby shopping at Union Square and also to China Town.

review.title: It was very gorgeous and great.
review.reviewText: it was the hotel was very clean and great. the bath tube was very pretty and nice. It was too bad that I could not get the room that I can see the view of the city but overall it was very comfortable and nice.

review.title: Wonderful family getaway
review.reviewText: We stayed for one night at the Hilton and enjoyed the comfortable beds, great hotel service and heated pool. We had Sunday brunch at the hotel, which offered a great variety of food, but was definitely overpriced given the other options in the neighborhood. The room and service was worth the cost, the food was not.

review.title: Not at its best
review.reviewText: Very disappointed in this Hilton this trip. Had to call each night x2 to get more towels: 2 adults, 2 kids & only 2 sets of towels! Extremely noisy- maid vacuuming hall & rooms with doors open at 9 on Sunday AM. Stayed in room in the other tower & it was tiny! Will only stay again if good deal & to get Hilton points; otherwise plenty of othe good picks with cheaper parking in the same area.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Hilton over Valentine's Day and President's Day weekend and it was packed...the lobby was always full of people, yet the lines for service moved very efficiently. My only complaint is the early morning "Housekeeping" knocks on my neighbor's doors that were hard to sleep through.

review.title: Sleeping in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay and would recomend the hotel to others.

review.title: Great stop
review.reviewText: Had an issue in the resturant, but the manager was all over it and took care of it. Great customer service.

review.title: Overpriced
review.reviewText: I arrived after a long flight from the UK and had to queue at least 10 minutes to check in. Wanted a glass of water before going to bed - over 10 dollars from the minibar for a bottle of water and there were no drinking utensils (glasses / cups) in the room in order to drink tap water. Internet access and breakfast v expensive too.

review.title: only one downfall
review.reviewText: Very nice, clean hotel with friendly and helpful staff. The hotel location is ideal. I only saw one downfall and that is that they did not have free wifi access. There was an extra charge for internet (plug in) service.

review.title: Sn Fco`s experience
review.reviewText: It was a gr8 holliday.. the location is fantastic.. close from every touristic location and/or transportation to it...

review.title: shopaholic
review.reviewText: Great location for Union square and Westfield mall shopping.

review.title: Everything was outstanding.
review.reviewText: The Hilton was in a great location, clean and quiet!

review.title: 4-stars? i felt it was 5-star quality
review.reviewText: my fiancee and i had a wonderful stay at the hilton union square in SF. the hotel is rated only 4 stars, but i felt it was just as good as many of the 5 star hotels in which i have stayed. the staff were courteous and extremely helpful. the room was the lap of luxury. the room service prices were easily 5-star caliber. $15 for a bagel?! wow. luckily there is a 24 hour convenience store directly across the street where you can get an entire package of bagels and cream cheese for less than $5.

review.title: Nice well equipped hotel
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel, all staff were very friendly and helpful concierge very knowledgeable and helpful.
Location is very central, great for shopping and getting around.
Powell st is a 5 minute walk from the hilton, Powell street has a BART (Bay Area Rail Transport )station that connects to many neiborhoods and SFO Int airport (for around $8 one way). Powell st also has the turn around for the cable cars that take you to different point along Fishermans Warf.
TIP
From Fishermans Warf you can get the road tram thattakes you back to Powell for around $2.0 per head.
We ate at Hard Rock and Johny Rockets both at fishermans warf (Johny Rockets was really good).
The Irish bar on Ofarrel st .
Moretons steakhouse expensive but excellent steak and worth it!
Chesecake factory - fabulous.

review.title: Great Location, Relatively spacious
review.reviewText: Great location, Relatively spacious room. The view was quite good.

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and in a good location. The cons were the room was small and the walls were thin.

review.title: Very adequate, but not "4-Star" calibre
review.reviewText: There is nothing really objectionable about this hotel; it's just about what I would expect from a Hilton. It just doesn't rise to the level of what I would expect from a 4-star establishment. Getting out of the elevator, I was immediately struck by the almost-dinginess of the hallways--not quite as well-lit as ideal, slightly cheesy carpet and wall treatments, somewhat industrial looking doors and hardware. (I was reminded of the hallways in the cruise ship from last summer). The room itself was better. It was quite OK, but not in any way "luxurious".

review.title: Convenient but underwhelmed.
review.reviewText:
While the hotel was convenient in the heart of Downtown SF, we were a bit disappointed overall. We reserved a king room but ended up with a room with two very small doubles on the 8th floor of Tower 1. Unfortunately, we looked directly at a wall that was only 3 feet away and about 30 feet high. No light from outside entered the room.
What was great was the proximity to all the shopping, Chinatown and the MUNI/BART. I would look for a different hotel in the future but wouldn't completely rule this one out.

review.title: Wonderful hotel!
review.reviewText: Outstanding service. I was offered an upgraded room upon check in without asking. Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about the surrounding area. Very convenient to ballpark, Union Square and Chinatown. Exercise facilities were great -- large room with lots of equipment. The friendly staff made the difference though.

review.title: Absolutely beautiful! I would go back in a heart beat!!!
review.reviewText: I recommend this hotel for anyone staying in San Francisco. It's location is great...just a short drive from everything you want to see. The staff was wonderful and the rooms are very nice!

review.title: fabulous location
review.reviewText: Excellent location , convenient for trolley ,metro , bus and F line tram .Has a very nice foyer , rooms are on small side but neat and clean . excellent concierge service, polite and responsive .We had continental breakfast as a courtesy from Alice (night manager ) during our stay . Special thanks to Alice and very friendly, efficient, always smiling crew of Starbucks , inside the hotel .Cannot comment on room service(expensive! ) or restaurant (seemed reasonable ) as we did not use these services .Do try the Naan Kebab place opposite hotel for late night snack, no frills but authentic Pakistani/ Indian food .At night stay on main , busy roads if walking , some unsavory characters on rather dimly lit adjoining side streets .Be prepared to have emotional guilt trip with quite a few homeless , begging, street people .Otherwise very acceptable place and enjoy !

review.title: A wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the Hilton (Union Sq) and a wonderful view from our room in the Towers. The room was spacious and the furnishings were wonderful Could have not asked for a better room experience.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText:
I felt very safe in the hotel. Loved the view and beds comfortable.
Clean and everything I needed.
Will go back next time!

review.title: Great location and good price
review.reviewText: Great location and helpful staff. Rooms were fairly average but spacious and clean. This is a huge hotel so often the staff were busy and we had to wait for general service. Close to the cable cars and the BART for SFO. Overall perfectly acceptable for the price.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service!!
review.reviewText: The title of the review says it all!! As busy as the weekend was, the hotel staff had smiles on their faces the entire time. The lobby was well lit and lively. Check in was quick and painlessand our room was very clean. All the stores and restaurants were within walking distance, making it easy to shop and find somewhere to eat.

review.title: Will go back
review.reviewText: Good guest room, a little bit old but nice and clean. Staff are very responsive and helpful.

review.title: Brilliant staff, composed in a crisis, and they really care for their guests comfort.
review.reviewText: I'm so impressed by the hotel staff. When I checked in to the hotel I had just finished thirty hours of travelling from Australia and I had been thoroughly sick for the last 20 hours. I was vomiting, dehydrated, cramping and I couldn't stop running to the bathroom. The staff at this hotel were FANTASTIC! They made check in so easy and pleasant, and they came to check on me in my room several times to make sure I was getting some sleep and didn't need an ambulance! I felt extremely cared for and safe, in spite of the fact that I was travelling alone and didn't know anyone in the city or how the health care system worked! I will definitely stay there every time I am in San Francisco.

review.title: You get what you have paid for
review.reviewText:
Given a corner room furthest away from the lift lobby, which happened to be located at the diagonal corner of the rectangular floor plan. For the price I had paid for a weekend stay, I reckoned it was alright not to have a bath as the shower served its purpose. It was a little bit odd though for a pair of closet like doors opened to the bathroom, and it was located right at the side of the bed. One sever short fall of this hotel was the lacking of sound proof. I could hear my neighbors talking vividly right outside my room, and the flushing of toilet right above me literally as I lay on my bed.
Other than these anomalies, the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. It was 2 blocks away from Union Square, where you could enjoy shopping while avoiding the noises from the crowd,trams and traffic.

review.title: Hilton - Union Square
review.reviewText: T he Hilton is a beautiful hotel just a couple of blocks from Union Square. The staff was professional from top to bottom. The concierge was especially helpful - courtesy umbrellas a nice touch. Will definitely stay again - want a view - get a postcard - If there is not a price list for the MINI BAR get one BEFORE entering the TWILIGHT ZONE - 2 Heinekins - 2 Cokes $42 - I felt like Linda Blair in the Exorcist as my head spun around. I verified the charges and they were correct. Excellent hotel - great transportation system - Go see the TUTANKAMEN exhibit at the deYoung Museum - hop on the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf - they need some lessons on keeping area clean - Hotel within walking distance of Chinatown (Great Eastern restaurant guaranteed to please) - enjoy the city - tolerate the vagrants - complain to Gavin Newsom (mayor). Go for a walk on a sunny day in Golden Gate Park.

review.title: Great location, watch for
review.reviewText:
The Hilton's location is close to Union Square, the theatre, Cable Cars and Market Street shopping. I would stay there again but be forewarned about the following: The in house Starbucks prices are significantly higher than the SB location 1 block away. The main level restaurant was also very pricey. The parking fees made up for any internet hotel booking discount. The cable car ticket line and boarding line (2 separate) were very long...nearly an hour to board. The old days of jumping on mid line seem to be gone. Ghirardelli Square is a ghost of it's former self.
Very happy with: Received two excellent restaurant recommendations: Cafe Mason, 320 Mason Street (we had breakfast...have heard good reviews for lunch and dinner) and Fino Ristorante, 624 Post St. ---excellent dinner. Drop by the Buena Vista Cafe for an Irish coffee (Hyde St., closer to Ghirardelli than Fisherman’s Wharf). There is something very magical about being in SF. You have to do a little homework not to pay top dollar, but worth the effort.

review.title: One bad night with no sleep
review.reviewText:
We had a partying people in the floor. They had 2 rooms and were slamming the doors all night long. In a moment around midnight the wall started shaking and I thought that someone has been thrown against it so I called security. Nothing changed. For the next 2 hours we were saying in our room with my husband and 6 year-old daughter unable to sleep from the noise - slamming of doors every 5 minutes, shouting, screaming and banging around the room next to us - so my husband had to call security around 2 a.m. again and tell them - or you fix this or I will go out to fix it.
We went to see the Nutcracker ballet and what was supposed to be a family night out turned into a sleepless.... nerve-racking thing.
I am not staying at that hotel again. It seems that they cannot control what is going on in the rooms. I felt like we were at a cheap bordello like the ones you see at the movies:( It would be funny if I did not spend the next day feeling sleepy. All of us were cranky and went home earlier than we planned. I am so disappointed with Hilton at 333 o`Farrel.
Our experience was terrible. We paid money to sleep in a hotel and we did not get any sleep... Do not go to this hotel if you want to sleep!

review.title: Great hotel, interesting location.
review.reviewText: Location is close to shops and restaurants, but also to Tenderloin, which means there are usually interesting characters within a few blocks of the hotel. Not the hotel's fault, but keep that in mind. Nicely appointed hotel, although we made the mistake of taking a water out of the mini bar. Even the front desk told us it was a bad idea. Rooms are small, but nicely designed. Overall, a top hotel.

review.title: Huge Hotel needs TLC and character it's just big
review.reviewText:
I booked a few rooms for our large family in this hotel during the Xmas holiday . We were given 2 keyes for each room, however only one key worked at all times, this hotel is so big by the time we got to the front desk to ask to fix this it took at least 15 minutes to get there everytime, the elevators are super busy. in another occasion we waited for over 1and a half outside the room for someone to open our door, we were told by the concierge that someone would be there to help, once he was there he went thru the whole process of asking who we were and how come we wanted the door opened and so forth it was a nightmare.
The lines to check in/out were super long, any and everything we had to do it took forever.
Next time I would go for a smaller hotel so we can have more time having fun than trying to track front desk employees.
Never Again here that's for sure!

review.title: Poor service; too noisy
review.reviewText: Comfortable beds and great location, but service was not up to Hilton standards. Location of room was so noisy that we awoke several times in the nIght thinking there were drunk noisy visitors IN OUR ROOM. Overall, very disappointing.

review.title: Hilton for the Holidays
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel and all decked out for the holidays! Absolutely gorgeous! Rooms are slightly larger than the average size room in the Union Square area. Another words, small but that's pretty typical downtown. Didn't matter though, who sits in the room for any length of time when you are in San Francisco? Very comfy beds with down filled linen. Only a few blocks from BART and cable cars. No complaints, we would definitely stay there again. Loved our visit!

review.title: Better off to find another hotel in the Union Sq. area
review.reviewText:
The hotel lobby has all the decor and warmth of a high school gymnasium.
The dinning room prices are extremely high. The Starbucks located in the lobby charges 2 1/2 times the prices of the Starbucks located 1 1/2 blocks down the street.
We had to listen to the rumble of elevators all night.
The majority of the hotel guests seem to come from the "nameless unwashed rabble" that thinks nothing of conducting loud drinking parties in the hallways at 3:00am.
I suggest you try another hotel.

review.title: Double bed please
review.reviewText: Hilton Hotel lives up to its name- it was very clean & the room was big.

review.title: Great rooms, but the charges are absurd
review.reviewText: The hotel rooms were great. The service was good. But $15.00 per person, per day to use the gym . . . $13.00 per day for internet access . . . come 'on.

review.title: Hilton at Union Square Worth Repeat Visits
review.reviewText: The Hilton staff is both professional and courteous, and access to parking and rooms was efficient. We visited during the Holiday Season, and the gingerbread village in the lobby was better than most of the nearby shopping window decor. Having a Starbucks inside the lobby was a nice touch too! The proximity to fabulous restaurants and shopping was great. We were totally accommodated and couldn't have been more comfortable. Thanks to Mayor Gavin Newsom for suggesting it to "nearby locals" as a holiday treat, as it really was. We will definitely return!

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: I heard that it's not quiet before. But for my experience. It's good enough. The location is great. Very convenient to go shopping, get to China town and Union Suqare, also, the fisherman's whalf since the cable car stop is near the hotel and it can take you there. The breakfast buffet is delicious. However, there is no free wifi available and over night parking fee is not reasonable as I expect.

review.title: a hotel with great location in San francisco
review.reviewText: Staying at the Hilton San Francisco Union Square was really pleasant. With walking distance to Union Square, shopping in San Francisco was never this convinient.

review.title: Awesome hotel with pricey fitness room
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel in good location
Beware: You have to pay for the fitness club

review.title: Excellent Accommodations in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Hilton is located in a lively, attractive, and totally enjoyable neighborhood. It is in a great location to get to know San Francisco either by foot, by taxi, or by cable car.

review.title: Great Union Square location
review.reviewText:
great, very comfortable, yet affordable stay only steps from Union Square.
Very convenient location for downtown shopping, dining, sightseeing.
Great for public transportation access (1 block from BART & cable car).
if you come by car, be prepared to pay considerably for parking.

review.title: Exceptional service
review.reviewText: A very well staffed and run hotel. At every point of contact the staff could not have been more helpful. The only drawback to this fine hotel is the immediate neighborhood which featured some intimidating either psychotic or drunken street people after dark. On one occasion I felt in danger from a large, ranting male. Perhaps this is a drawback to all hotels in the immediate Union Square neighborhood. Use care when walking after dark in this area.

review.title: Would definetely stay there again
review.reviewText: This hotel was great. We were impressed by the room and the service. Check-in was made very simple and we were able to check our bags into storage after we checked out of the hotel which allowed us to explore the rest of the city without our luggage. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were clean. My friend and I would definitely stay there again because it was also in a great location.

review.title: willstay there again
review.reviewText: My room was upgraded to a junior suite to my delight because my reservation was for 8 days. It was very comfortable and very clean specially the bathroom. The city view was beautiful. The only criticism I have is the TV which was old and rather small. If the room had a flat screen HD TV, my stay would have been more enjoyable.

review.title: Worth the Stay
review.reviewText: Very Good. Beautiful Hotel and accomodating. upon check in we inquired about getting a fridge and microwave in our room. It was only a few dollars for the fridge and micro was free. My husband loved the starbucks in the lobby!

review.title: OK Hotel Nice and central
review.reviewText: Hotel was good but had a massive ball on so had trouble getting service. Asked for extra tea for the room didn't get it and one day came back and asked them to clean the room later and they never came back. Great location, ok hotel

review.title: Will stay there but....
review.reviewText: will rather prefer the chinatown version of this hotel ... The bathrooms in this Hilton are little small and bit unconfortable

review.title: Would definitely recommend!
review.reviewText: From the first moment we stepped inside to the moment we left we found nothing but complete satisfaction with this hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly and when we found we had left our passports in a hotel safe in Las Vegas 2 nights prior, the concierges went to no end of trouble to make sure they were returned to us.This involved many phone calls and lots of waiting and explaining on the phone for them and was not the straight forward task that it should have been, thanks to the difficult staff in Las Vegas. Indeed they were patient and very understanding. This hotel has a great location and a welcoming atmosphere. The rooms were very comfortable and clean and we were very pleased with the free parking package as other hotels charged a lot per night just for parking. We would highly recommend this Hilton as great value for money.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Not facing Union Square thus less bustle and yet so close to the center of the city and a cable car station thus a perfect location. So many 24 hour shops around that you may dispense with the expensive room service.

review.title: Great Location and View of the City
review.reviewText: Not sure what room we would have gotten if we had not upgraded. We upgraded and got a room on the top floor (44th floor) and the view was incredible. Really enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Great value and very convenient to Union Square. Stayed one night day after Thanksgiving.

review.title: Simple weekend getaway
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I decided to go to San francisco for the weekend and I got a great deal online. Checking in and out was easy. Front desk was very helpful and gave us a list of popular "to-do's" in the city. Overall was very enjoyable

review.title: I would like to stay in this hotel again in the future.
review.reviewText: This hotel is very close to the shopping center and walking distance to ride the cable cars. There were many restaurants around the area. The staff that checked us in was very helpful. I would love to stay in this hotel again when I go to San Francisco in the near future.

review.title: convenient location!!
review.reviewText:
It takes only 3 minites to go Union squere on foot.
Only 2 blooks from main street.

review.title: A good stay...
review.reviewText:
The hotel is beautiful inside. The lobby is first class and the rooms are of decent size and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. We had forgot our sons toothbrush. I called down asking for one and they sent up two, with toothpaste, within ten minutes. Five minutes later I received a call making sure I got everything to my satisfaction. The same thing occured when I asked for extra towels.

The location is nice and within walking distance to the major shopping areas. It was somewhat sketchy walking at night, but there are many parts of SF that are the same way.

The only real negative was parking. It was way overpriced.

review.title: need a renovation, rooms smell bad
review.reviewText: not good

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in the ideal location if visiting San Francisco. The rooms are nice and very clean and the staff is extremely courteous. The concierge was extremely helpful and provided some great suggestions during our stay in the area. I look forward to staying at this hotel once again in the near future.

review.title: nice stay
review.reviewText: nice hotel with good location

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Not impressive for 4-Star hotel. Small closet with ironing board in middle and tiny bathroom. Lobby and front desk area converted to noisy cocktail lounge for convention.

review.title: No free internet access
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel, but does Hilton really need to charge for internet access, when every Hampton Inn provides it for free?
I did like the hotel, but wished that the big hotel chains would get with the program and supply free internet access in the rooms.
That is a reason for me not to come back.

review.title: Nice hotel, parking in pricey though
review.reviewText: I keep coming back to the Hilton because it's a very nice hotel, and for a place that is that close to Union Square, reasonably priced. The hotel parking used to be expensive and is even more expensive now. Fortunately there a a couple lots nearby with better prices, but does involve a walk into the Tenderloin.

review.title: JackieO
review.reviewText: I highly recommend this hotel, it has the ideal location and the staff is wonderful.

review.title: Business Hotel
review.reviewText: Good for Business - not for leisure or luxury. If you're a solo female traveler I don't recommend staying her. But the management was wonderful.

review.title: "Very comfy & cozy!"
review.reviewText: This was my first time at this hotel. It was very close to where I had to be, a lot of shopping, and the Bart. The lobby was really pretty. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone having business in or near Union Square.

review.title: Good option in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
All around a good option. The bathroom was very clean but a little small and inconveniently located with respect to the bed, with outward-opening doors.
Be careful walking around in the neighborhood.

review.title: Downtown San Fran Hilton is in the middle of everything!
review.reviewText: Everything met my expectations. I was right in the middle of everything, I had a blast!

review.title: Very Pleased
review.reviewText:
Comfortable bed and wonderful sheets and comforter. Great view, updated bathroom (though I thought the shower head is too low, I am 5 feet 10 and I felt like I had to crouch under it to wash my hair), water pressure not as good as home! I thought there would be more "Johnny on the Spot" door men and bellhops, but it is a big hotel and very busy. Overall, great experience, great location, good price for downtown San Fran, we will be back for sure.

Front Desk and consierge could be more informative, curious, anxious to please.

review.title: Great Accomadationa!
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean and offered excellent service .Great location!

review.title: Great location to transit facilites and sites
review.reviewText: Hotel had fantastic location right near Union Square and associated public transit services. The onsite hotel parking garage is REDICULOUSLY EXPENSIVE though at $50 per day. Having driven up from San Diego with a rental car just sitting there for 2 days was NOT worth it. There is slightly cheaper parking across the road but it fills up very quickly. We missed it both days because of our touring around town.

review.title: A great place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Conveniently located near Union Square this massive hotel is always a great place to stay. It is a short walk to many of the city's famous locales, such as, China Town, Nob Hill, Union Square, Buena Yerba Park and transportation to nearly everywhere is steps away.The restaurant at the hotel is top notch and there are hundreds of nearby dining options. My only complaint is the lack of free WiFi in the hotel. Otherwise a compliment to the Hilton Hotel chain.

review.title: Sames as all Hiltons
review.reviewText: During this trip I stayed on 3 different hotels and I liked the the Union Square Hilton the least. It has good service although a little impersonal. The Hotel decor seems stuck in 1990 but the rooms were always clean and spacious. The location couldn't be better although there were plenty of homeless people outside. This is not a Hilton-specific problem. You'll have this issue with every hotel in the Union Square district. Recommended only if you can find a good rate/promotion.

review.title: S.F. Not What It Used to Be
review.reviewText: The hotel was exactly what you would expect for a Hilton. But, we were disappointed with San Francisco in general. We encountered a number of agressive homeless people. There were vacant (even boarded up) buildings. Fisherman's Wharf was an endless series of T-shirt shops. And lastly, there were very long waits for the cable cars. On a positive note, we met a number of very friendly people ... both native and tourist.

review.title: Excellent location!
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very well located. You can visit all the city atractions without spending money in car rental. The restaurants around the hotel are very nice and they are not expensive. You have places for shopping all around the building and its very safe if you go north east. Chinatown is just 10 min walking distance and the public tranportation is just at the door of the hotel entrance.

Also, the hotel has a very nice fitness area with a very convinient schedule.

review.title: can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: nice hotel and location

review.title: Bad neigborhood
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a very bad neighborhood.

review.title: Smoking in California
review.reviewText:
Overall our stay was quite pleasant with one exception - we chose this hotel because they had smoking rooms which we reserved, however when we checked in there were none available. Since they have only 18 smoking rooms one wonders when they were reserved - two years ago? We reserved ours over a month in advance.

In any case our stay was untroubled and the prices good.

review.title: bad
review.reviewText: "plumbing issues" resulting in cold showers and toilets which repeatedly do not flush. Absolutety disgusting. Beggars and homeless people in very close vicinity do not really add to the ambience.

review.title: Excellent option
review.reviewText: Ideally located, right in the heart of Beverly Hills and equidistant (almost) to Santa Monica, West Hollywood, etc. The hotel has the charm of good times of old without renouncing to today's comforts. Definitely go for the tower rooms/suites (not the poolside cabanas).

review.title: Convenient, Affordable, Clean
review.reviewText: What more are you looking for from a hotel? It's blocks from Union Square, totally clean, and well run. It's a bit of a mob scene when a tech conference is in town, but nothing you can't handle.

review.title: Care to park your car?
review.reviewText: The primary reason we stayed at teh Hilton was the 'park your car' package - We had our car in San Sfrancisco, and we needed a hotel - in a good neighborhood - that gave us parking as part of the package deal. It was a good choice. Great restaurants in the area , close to Chinatown and Union Square, and easy to get to.

review.title: very polite and efficient help-full
review.reviewText: I had trouble getting a car rental the city was sold out.The Hilton made it happen at no extra cost.

review.title: very good hotel to enjoy - no safe in the room was the only thing I didn't like
review.reviewText: it's closed to very important places to enjoy and to public transportation

review.title: Incredible view!
review.reviewText: Best Hilton in San Francisco - my 22yr old son checked into this hotel prior to my arrival - his credit card was expired and his cell phone has been destroyed at airport security but this wonderful hotel still allowed him to check-in! In fact, he was assigned a room with the most breathtaking Bay view when he commented that he was meeting his Mom as a treat at the end of her very hectic work week! I cannot say enough about how thoughtful the Staff were and how beautiful this hotel is. I would definitely recommend this Hilton Hotel to others!

review.title: Average
review.reviewText: Hilton San Francisco Union Square has a beautiful lobby entrance. The rooms were clean, but on the small side. Did not offer good views.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Wonderful room with magnificent view of San Francisco skyline and bay. Rates were reasonable and competitive. Very friendly service and staff was extremely helpful. Great location near Union Square. Gym had everything I required and even during peak hours was easy to utilize. Will definitely stay here again when visiting San Francisco.

review.title: Great service from maintenance engineer
review.reviewText: Our faucet in the bath tub was not working. A call to the front desk produced an engineer in minutes. He was very gracious and efficient and fixed the problem within the hour. I needed a hot bath and his timely help was appreciated.

review.title: All 5's for us
review.reviewText: This hotel is centrally located and very well kept. The Expedia rate was great and we would stay there again.

review.title: Inthe HEart of SF
review.reviewText: Great for weekend getawys with great rates. Shopping, restaurants, attractions all around you.

review.title: Impressive and friendly
review.reviewText: An excellent hotel, well situated near Union Square.

review.title: One of the best in Union Square
review.reviewText: This was our first time in this hotel, because we like to try new hotels when we visit SF. The Hilton was in a great location. It was very close to Chinatown, Union Square, and surprising not too far from Coit Tower. The room was in perfect shape. Clean bathroom and linens. We stayed for two nights and were comfortable each night. I would highly recommend giving the Hilton a try.

review.title: Old hotel with dirty bathrooms
review.reviewText: Yuk. I'll never stay at a Hilton again. Though its central local is really wonderful for tourists, and the staff was quite good, the rest of our family's stay was such a disappointment. The room was tiny, probably about 250 sq. feet. max, and everything was expensive. The minibar's prices were outrageous: $7 for a 10 oz. can of pop, and even the Starbucks in the hotel charged $1 more per coffee than the Starbucks at the end of the block. The opulence of the lobby certainly didn't reach the rooms, where the carpeting was shabby and faded, and the bathrooms were so old that you could see wear and tear everywhere, especially the spots on the wall. Ugh. I never felt like anything was really clean. And the pool is small and not lit at night so that even though it's open until 9 p.m., you're swimming in pitch black after 7 p.m. A terrible, terrible disappointment from a four-star hotel that really felt more like a three-star, and not a good one at that.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Location and service

review.title: A Great Location
review.reviewText: Very nice, great location a few blocks from the bart. There is a lot of great restaurants within walking distance. A Great weekend

review.title: I would stay there again
review.reviewText: The hotel was perfectly fine. We had an early arrival. When we arrived in the room it had three twin beds (something I have never seen). They were very accomodating and immediately found a room with double beds. The tower we stayed in was apparently built in the 1960's and the hallways reflected that. The room was perfectly nice and the hotel is very conveniently located. Not fancy. But I would stay there again.

review.title: The best place to stay in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very nice

review.title: Nice hotel...very clean and comfortable...but where's the free WI-FI?
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable, although very small. I would definitely consider staying there again, however in a high-tech city and a high-end hotel, where was the free WI-FI? I've stayed at hotels in the middle of nowhere that had free wireless Internet access in each room. OK, they did have free wireless in the lobby, but that is just lame to have to trek all the way to the lobby in this enormous hotel to pull up a map, look up a restaurant review or check email. Get with the times Hilton and provide free wireless to your customers.

review.title: Disappointed by Hilton Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was very overpriced for what we received. Coffee machine was disgustingly dirty and unusable. Having to pay extra money for the internet was a joke.

review.title: Love San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel is very centrally located to Union Square, Powell St. Cable Car, Market Street Historic Street Cars and a short walk to China Town. From there you can get anywhere in the city easily while staying at an excellent hotel with all accommodations you can ask for. Definitely a must stay at hotel.

review.title: Loved the bed
review.reviewText: The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. I would have liked to take it home with me.

review.title: SErvice staff is outstanding
review.reviewText: The desk staff, valet parking, bellmen, everyone goes out of their way to be friendly and accommodating. Parking is $50 a night, but they gave us a complimentary Starbuck breakfast that offset that. Very pleasant people.

review.title: Reasonably priced and comfortable
review.reviewText: Our stay in this hotel was pleasant and comfortable. It may not be the best but it is already of a high standard. it is conveniently located near all the main attraction areas. transportation was easy around the hotel. The area was also safe. I would go back to this hotel again. Parking in hotel was expensive, so there are alternatives, which is like opposite the hotel. Car rental companies was easy, just across the hotel, all the major brands of car rental are just there. Only gripe is expensive city parking.

review.title: The Shaft - Or the room by the elevator shaft
review.reviewText: We heard the elevator go up and down all night. The creamer in the room was expired by a month. So much for the morning cup of coffee! I would look for another place. Perhaps it was the expedia deal or just bad luck, but we will not stay here again.

review.title: Motel 6 is better than Tower 3
review.reviewText: I stayed in the Hilton last year and had a fabulous experience. However, this time my room was in Tower 3 which is reminiscent of my college dorm, long hallways that time forgot! Once I got through the door I found a room that had refreshingly been updated, but when I opened my curtains I was greeted by a view of a wall. I could deal with the wall, but when I turned on the water in the bathtub I was showered with rust! So, if when you're checking in you learn you're going to be in Tower 3 kindly decline, take your money and find a Motel 6!

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights, for business and pleasure, with our 3 children. We reserved a standard room, which was a little on the small side, but still worked with the 5 of us. There was plenty of storage space so we were able to make the most of the room. The view was very nice, the room clean. Our reservations came with breakfast for 2 at the hotel buffet. At first I thought that it was going to cost us alot, since the 3 kids weren't included in the breakfast. We ate down there every morning, and every morning my kids ate free. It was a fabulous buffet too! The conceirge personnel were very friendly and the hotel staff super. I knew about the parking ahead of time from other reviews, but its still a shock when you get the bill at the end of the trip for over $200 for parking! But its a big city and with that comes high prices for parking. Overall, very nice hotel, in a great area, close to many, many things.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: Every member of the staff that we encountered was extremely friendly and helpful. Condition of the hotel was top notch, the room was very nice, the beds and pillows were very comfortable.Lots of dining choices nearby, 1 block from cable car, and close to shopping. The hotel rates 100% in our opinion and made our trip memorable along with everything else. WILL stay again!!

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: In the centre of San Fran, about an hours (hilly!) walk from Fishermans Whalf. Near Macys, Union Square and Chinatown.

review.title: average
review.reviewText: room was extremely small valet service was about high, while public garage across street was less than 55% 0f rate. no shopping or eating facilities in hotel only a Starbucks. newspaper was not there on Friday .

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The Hotel experience was Ok. but the restaurant is overpriced and the food is not the best in town. If it had better food service it would have been a perfect stay. There are many restaurants around the area that you can visit, and the concierge gave us instruction to get to the other places. Get ready to walk.

review.title: San Francisco Hilton/Union Square
review.reviewText: Absolutely perfect.100%.

review.title: Don't bother
review.reviewText: The downtown Hilton is in the part of the city that is run rampant with homeless people. The view of the city from the room was decent, but what was most evident was how the view of the rooftops of the surrounding buildings seemed to look disheveled and unkempt. The expenses are numerous for every little thing, and the rooms were fairly small for a king bed room. Every time we asked a staff member there a simple question, they would have a look of confusion and would end up directing us toward the wrong path for a resolution.

review.title: Good central location
review.reviewText: Ideally positioned for exploring down town Union Square part of SF with easy transport to rest of city / region also. Hotel extremely busy, especially reception and lobby in general, mainly corporate orientated but suited us fine for our short stay. Room was clean and adequately equipped and reasonably sized, no noise related issues. Mini bar prices ludicrously high, gave us a real laugh going over the tariff

review.title: Good enough
review.reviewText: No free WiFi, $ 15 per day!

review.title: Excellent for its location
review.reviewText: This hotel was the first time my wife and I stayed and you couldnt fault it one bit. Ita lacale was great for us every thing so close and it was easy to get cabs and buses.I would stay there again.

review.title: Good to stay
review.reviewText: Good experience, over all, above average!

review.title: San Francisco's best hotel
review.reviewText: The Hilton was the best deal for a hotel in downtown San francisco. It is located very convenient.

review.title: Very nice hotel with a good location
review.reviewText: could be included breakfast in all roon rates.

review.title: BIG!
review.reviewText: The hoptel is well sited for downtown SF. Rooms are not special, but were more than adequate and well maintained and cleaned. Staff appear very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was OUTRAGEOUSLY expensive!

review.title: Nice Stay Hilton Union Square San Francisco 333 Oferrell
review.reviewText: Was vacationing in San Francisco in August 2009 and stayed at the Hilton in Union square on O'Ferrel Street. I checked in early and they had a room open ( it was a handicap room but was actually very comfy) The Hotel was clean the staff friendly and helpful. The only issue I saw was with the homeless/street people outside the Hotel ( Epecially on Ellis street which runs along the hotels rear) You do need to be mindful of this when walking around. Hotel is near plenty of public Transportation (It is a 25 minute Bart ride from SFO Airport) and is near, Muni, cable cars and a few bus lines. I would stay there again

review.title: San Francisco was great!
review.reviewText: The Hilton, Union Square is a very nice hotel. Our room was very comfortable and clean. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The shops and cable car were about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. I would not recommend turning left when you come out of the hotel as it was a bit dodgy around that area.

review.title: Great place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful, comfortable, and the staff was great. Everyone is very nice and helpful. They even upgraded my room to a junior suite because I needed two double beds. The location is great and the door man will get you a cab if you need one. I will stay here again on my next trip to S.F.

review.title: Surrounded by crack addicts
review.reviewText: This hilton is right on the edge of the SF Tenderloin district. They do a great job of keeping the addicts away from the front doors but that's about it. After 9pm on a Sunday and they're all around the sides and parking entry. Very scary stuff and killed any sort of romantic mood for me and my wife. Also the TV was very old and had a hum to it.

review.title: We will go back.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay, the room, the view, the location was super! Close to cable cars, bart, bus lines and shopping.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located near Union Square and public transportation lines. The concierge service is excellent. We would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Room provided was not the room that saw reserved, asked for king bed but got double bed.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Just back from a 5 day stay at the hilton, the location was excellent for shopping and sightseeing only a few blocks from union square. The pool was a great added bonus.

review.title: Best Deal in San Francisco's Hotels
review.reviewText: The room I resided was quite large include the large washroom. I think in downtown San Francisco,you can not find any other hotel room like this.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: The heated pool was the best! Room very nice clean, Great location close to everything.

review.title: San Francisco treat!
review.reviewText: Normally, we wouldn't have stayed here. I would have assumed the price was out of our range. But the hotel was offering a great rate that included parking - a big deal! So we jumped on it. Loved the service at the front desk. Very helpful and efficient. Our room was smallish, but well-equipped, very comfortable, and clean. Oh, and the view! Simply amazing. At night, our room was quiet, no noise from the street or hallway. This hotel was a great value for the price.

review.title: Too many fine print charges
review.reviewText: The hotel itselt was comfortable & clean. However the parking fees were outrageous even if you are a customer of the hotel. Also, the internet use was too expensive if you consider that even McDonald's has free internet services now. I certainly will not be staying here again.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is centrally located in the downtown area and close to the railcar station points. It has a nice large lobby with lots of bustling activity. It felt very comforting to go back at night after a long day on the town. The rooms are immaculately kept as are all other parts of the hotel.

review.title: Outstanding Customer Service in San Fran
review.reviewText: We arrived late on a Saturday (I had stated at the time of making the reservation that it would be a late check in) , exhausted from our week in Alaska and a day in Seattle. The reservation I had made 'on line' was for a single room with 2 beds, upon arriving I was told that they were sold out for that type of room, given it was the weekend. I began to feel even more tired and began to wonder if I was later than I had anticipated. The upbeat, professional man at the counter must have been reading my mind, he smiled and said 'no worries', I'm putting you in a suite for the same price. I hope you have a nice stay. The hotel was very clean and centrally located. Our room was exceptional, with very comfortable beds, fantastic water pressure and plenty of towels.

review.title: Pricey parking
review.reviewText: Room and hotel interior were nice. Located adjacent to the not-so-nice part of town. Price of parking was ridiculous.

review.title: Great service in a convenient location
review.reviewText: Had a great experience at the Hilton Union Square. Conveniently located near several bus and trolley stops as well as the BART. Central location means easy access to San Francisco's diverse districts. Service was great too--comfortable atmosphere.

review.title: Good place to stay.
review.reviewText: Good place to stay. Good location and a helpful staff. We enjoyed it very much. My only complaint would be the price of parking. It was almost half the cost of our room and that wasn't even valet.

review.title: Excellent Choice
review.reviewText: Perfect in every way EXCEPT they should offer free internet! Come on this is the 21st century and even cheesy hotels do that!

review.title: Exceeds Expectations!
review.reviewText: Stayed for three nights and loved it! The location is excellent, the beds are so comfortable and the staff was so helpful! The concierge explained the BART/MUNI lines to us and the we were also helped to the shuttle to take us back to SFO. I'll admit, you may hear some street noise but it was quiet for the most part (I stayed on the 6th floor.) We didn't eat in the Tavern but used the store in the lobby to buy water and snacks. Also, the starbucks makes great coffee, but way over priced.

review.title: Superb Location!
review.reviewText: Location was easily accessible by the BART, and within walking distance to many stores and points of interest in and around Union Square. Additionally, the Hilton is a stop on one of the Hop On Hop Off tour buses! Our room, located in Tower One, was very clean, modern, and quiet. Wonderful skyline view of the city from the top floors of the hotel. Nice outdoor pool and spa. The staff was very helpful and efficient. Checkout was a breeze! Overall, a great location for the business or leisure traveler.

review.title: Great location - shopping and dining within a block
review.reviewText: The hotel location was great - shopping was right outside the door of the hotel - just turn right and you can see the shops, and there were many restaurants offering diverse options within walking distaance. We would like to recomend Foley's Irish Pub specifically. Taking a cab from the hotel in any direction was very reasonable so you might want to consider it in case the weather is bad, or you have more than two people in your party. Pier 2 Sindbad's restaurant is a must and you can walk to Chinatown and the Business District from the hotel. Shopping included world famous brands so if you are into that kind of thing, it's probably the best hotel for you. The room was very clean and comfortable. If you would like glaasses, however, you would have to call the front desk and order them from room service for a charge.

review.title: definitely will come back
review.reviewText: very convenient, everything is within walking distance. close to hotel parc55, rooms are similar but cheaper, good value.

review.title: best location
review.reviewText: The best location in S.F. Good service.

review.title: Hidden costs!
review.reviewText: Won't go back. The hallways were like a 2 star hotel at best. Four of us reserved a room with two double beds and got a room with one King.... huge charge for a roll away and the parking garage daily charge was outrageous. This is my very first bad experience in years so I am definitely not a complainer.

review.title: had a blast
review.reviewText: staff was professional and helpful. Concierge helped out with public transportation, restaurant reservations. Pool area was great. Rooms were great.Location was excellent.

review.title: excellente hotel
review.reviewText: the hotel was awesome, the bed super comfortable. the hotel is located in a great area near everything. Beautiful city to visit

review.title: Good for a quick stay
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel for the Dodgers/SF Giants series w/a buddy of mine. Staff was helpful and beds were comfortable and room was clean. Great restaurants and diners (cheaper) nearby depending on what you want. About 30 min walk to the stadium and a bunch of great pubs/bars on the way. Why waste the money on a taxi when you can walk and have fun. AGAIN, this was a bunch of guys enjoying the baseball atmosphere. We had no problems whatsoever. There are some panhandlers around but simply go about your business.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was noisy a couple of times I had people try to open my room door. Glad I was in there. The evening conceierg was not polite he consistently provided me and my sister with wrong information I got the impression he didn't want to talk to us. Hotel maintenance and housekeeping were the only bright spots to this stay.

review.title: Good hotel, convenient location
review.reviewText: I tend to pick hotels by location, and this one was close to the galleries I wanted to visit. It's on the edge of a not-so-great part of town, but I never felt uncomfortable. Service was good - the concierge was particularly helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. I asked for a view, which wasn't spectacular, but better than looking at a wall. Recommended.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: Very convenient with good proximity to shopping, dining, and not too far from the ball park. We were very comfortable during our stay.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Overall good place, not great area of town

review.title: Nice hotel but watch out for those added fees!
review.reviewText: Nice clean property, comfortable room, convenient access to all of San Francisco. Better for business that family travel. The added fees were terrible. I can accept the $49 for overnight parking but gym use for one hour was $49, automatic 22% service fee to room service PLUS $5 delivery charge--what's that about? Not to mention the cost of food on the room service menu were very high--$25 for a Ceasar Salad. And then there was the $12 fee if the mini bar contents were not as you found them. I know times are tough for hotels but this was a bit much

review.title: massive hotel in the heart of SFO
review.reviewText: There are zillion rooms in this hotel! But it perfectly located. Minutes walking disance from Powell St BART station. Car rental companies are conveniently located across the street. Rooms are not immense, but they are confortable. I got a 2 double bed room and the 3 of us slept perfectly in the comfortable pillow-topped beds.

review.title: It was a Hilton
review.reviewText: You get what you expect from a huge chain hotel. The service was excellent though and the Starbucks in the Libby was a plus. Our room came with a "view" and contenintal breakfast at Starbucks. The view was not worth it - couldn't see either bridge or the bay. The room was tiny, but otherwise fine. Extremely clean. Overall, I'd stay there again if it was less than the other hotels in the area: Parc 55, and Nikko.

review.title: Stay was ok
review.reviewText: Hotel was huge and in a great location in SF. Parking our rental car was over $50.00 per day which seemed high for a first time traveler to the city. The staff was not overly friendly but did accomidate all of our needs. I will try somewhere else next time but there was nothing bad about this hotel.

review.title: Good hotel, great part of town
review.reviewText: Arrived late because of flight delay; No doorman, had to schlep bags and carryon's to check-in with out help or a luggage carrier. Long wait for bellhop to get bags to room. Otherwise, hotel is first class and in a great part of town. Highly recommended.

review.title: A weekend of relaxation
review.reviewText: I met my college roommate for a weekend of relaxation and catch up. Our room was immaculate and the hotel service was without a doubt - good! We used the spa, the bar and restaurant including breakfast service. We received some great recommendations for food & entertainment from the staff. We had a great time! Thanks!

review.title: What can I say? I had an awesome stay.
review.reviewText: We spent 10 days in and around San Fran. and the 9 nights couldn't have been better at the Hilton.

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: Hotel is large with the feeling of Railway station. However, rooms are excellent in size and quality. Hotel is situated very centraly and close to all atractions. I stayed in two other hotels the following week and they could not come close to quality and value. Definitely, I would choose the Hilton for the next visit.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Very close to great shopping and the trolleys. Extra amenities were expensive (parking and wifi)

review.title: Hall way
review.reviewText: The big hall is very nice, but the hall way of the floor I stayed way too narrow, carpet was red and green look like 60's, the hall way needs remodled, refreshed.inside the room is okay.

review.title: Union Square Hilton SFO
review.reviewText: I enjoyed this hotel very much; it was very big, had a starbucks and the staff, especially Patti the concierge, were very helpful. The floor we stayed on was a bit like a maze, but that is my only complaint. The hotel was also in a great location; close to shopping, restaurants and a a car rental place.

review.title: very convenient to public transportation
review.reviewText: My husband, two children and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in July 09. It was very convenient to public transportation, and the staff was friendly and very helpful. The pool was warm, despite the wind in the city. Pack snacks to bring with you. The in room snack bar is very pricey.

review.title: Pick a different hotel
review.reviewText: The fridge in my room was EXTREMELY dirty. There was mold inside and full of dust on the top. It was discusting!!! The only good thing about this hotel is the location

review.title: Excellent Staff
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful and accomodating. The concierge was very familiar with the city, house-keeping was friendly and flexible, and guest services could not have been more accomodating. The rooms are a little small, but the views are spectacular.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The Hilton is in a great location. Surrounded by good restaurants and easy access to transportation. The staff friendly and helpful. My only complaint was that my bathroom had a foul smell and a tray of dishes layed on the hallway for days a few rooms down. Once I reported both situations they were addressed; however, the smell in my bathroom remain so I suspect it came from the shower curtains.

review.title: Good location!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very easy to get to using the BART Train from the San Francisco Airport. It's also only 3 short blocks from the cable car turnaround.

review.title: Plain hotel on a great location
review.reviewText: Great locaton at reasonable price ! Staying near Union Square and saving on the hotel is great if you don't mind a plain hotel. The room was big enough for three people. Staff placed another bed. Excellent choice either for tourist or business.

review.title: Hilton at Union Square in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Room was a bit small for the price paid. Bed was very comfortable. We liked having the paper outside the door in the morning. Restaurant was grossly overpriced (but then so are most things in San Francisco.) We found a small restaurant down the street from the hotel that was o.k.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel. Everything was well kept with very friendly service. The rooms were nice & were a descent size. Check-in was a breeze, as was every other service we used while we were there. We used the trip desk in the hotel to make all of our trip arrangements.I would highly recommend the Muir woods trip. What a great place. We also took the city tour, it was a good way to see the highlights. The area was good as long as you go to the right when you leave the hotel. There are a lot of homeless people around, but we didn't have any problems with any of them. Just don't say anything & keep on walking.

review.title: Room too far
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was not bad. However, the hotel was so big that you need to walk a lot, and I mean A LOT to get to your room.

review.title: Perfect relaxation and location - can't wait to go back.
review.reviewText: I needed to get away from everything and everyone and completely rejuvenate. The Hilton Hotel at Union Square was the answer. The spa is one of the best!...Outstanding, incredible body treatments. The hotel staff was delightful. The sheets are the softest and the bed is to die for. Don't hesitate - RUN to the Hilton at Union Square.

review.title: Not Impressed and disappointed
review.reviewText: Disappointed with the Hotel, and certainly not impressed with the location. Although near the convention area and some of the tourist attactions, also located within one block of one of the worst parts of town.
