Constantly harassed by panhandlers at the front door...also no wireless access in the hotel and you have to pay a lot to use the computers in the business center. We also had to call for extra towels (there were four of us) every night (for 11 nights), as well as toilet paper (rooms poorly stocked). Limited food service in the hotel (one restuarant and a Starbucks). Restuarant has good food, Starbuck charges inflated prices (walk one block to get the standard Starbucks coffee price)

review.title: 2 nights with 3 kids in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We arrived at the airport and took the train that dropped us off 3 blocks from the hotel. The lobby was full and there was a line to check in. I figured we were in for a 1hour wait to see if we could get an early check in. That was not the case. The hotel staff worked through the line quickly and within 10 minutes we were up in our room.We tried to use the hotel pool but it was too cold even though the pool was heated. Not the Hotels fault. That's just the weather in San Fran. We had breakfast everyday at Maxs which is 1/2 block down then 2 blocks up. The kids loved the pancakes and Wiki sticks.

review.title: On the fence
review.reviewText: upon arriving at check in lady behind counter cranky and very snotty about getting us checked in 45 minutes prior. To be sure that know one else makes this mistake there is no more sports bar or restaurant on top of hotel anymore!! the bar they have is a cold feel about it, very friendly staff though. next day went down to check out to see about getting upgraded, Same snotty lady again with same attitude, I had had enough and complained to manager after that all was made right, changed room and had an amazing view!!!! I would reccomend tower 1 40th or above floor with balcony, Tower 3 has newer rooms though. there is no view of city within hotel unless you get a view room.

review.title: Nice, but don't touch the room fridge - it may cost you
review.reviewText: Great location. Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. It's a huge hotel that's easy to get lost in. Rooms are well maintained but a bit tight. One caveat, review your bill and watch for erroneous charges for drinks from room fridge. They charged me for 2 waters at $7 each - neither of which I used. They did take it off without any argument, but it made me wonder how they supposedly monitored it. I did look into the fridge to consider putting a bottle of water I'd bought elsewhere in there and couldn't because it's so tightly jam packed with their drinks - nothing else would fit. Note for naive travelers: I did not see any Notice in or around the fridge that any of the drinks inside would cost you big time - but I knew better - that's why I bought my own from outside the hotel. It should be posted as a matter of disclosure so naive travelers aren't shocked when charged $7 per item.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: We got upgrated to a room with a balcony and a great view with no extra charge. The hotel benefits from a great location but I would say, rooms need some little re-decoration.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a central location. Walking distance to shops, tours, cable car. Rooms could have been larger, though Hotel was very clean and staff helpful. Take care on leaving hotel. Many homeless people outside all Hotels downtown.

review.title: Wonderful hotel, debatable location
review.reviewText: The hotel, service etc was wonderful. If your goals are to shop or party in San Francisco, it would be an excellent choice. Thankfully, it was very easy to use the transportation system to get where we needed to go. As a family trip the location was not a great one for us. (Crowds, party/questionable neighborhood etc...) next time we would choose a waterfront location, nearer to the kind of activities we enjoy.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: Confirmation#: 3352823195 I'm not to sure what to say about our stay at Hilton San Francisco Union Square. The service we received upon arrival was nice, we were asked if we wanted our bags carried & doors were swung open as we walked in the lounge. After check in, and a ride up to our floor, we were glad to have a place to relax for a bit after our flight. As we enter the room a gust of warm air seeps out as it was quite warm and stuffy inside. A window was quickly opened and then the air turned on and within 5 minutes it was nice in the room. The view was great, but the bed was a bit soft for my liking which i do understand were all different. My back was a bit uneasy throughout my stay, but it didn't keep me from enjoying all that San Francisco has to offer. Everything else was great, we never took advantage of the free breakfast but it was nice to have the option. Also having a Starbucks inside was fancy and a nice added treat. Our only complaint was at night the surrounding rooms were very loud as we were able to hear conversations, TV, foot steps, toilet, shower, sink, opening of drawers, pretty much everything. We ended up just falling asleep with the TV on in order to drown out everything.

review.title: Comfortable rooms
review.reviewText: Very nice and spacious room with comfortable beds for family stay. Only issue is the expensive parking in the hotel and area. Found the parking across the street to have a special, in by 5:30pm and out by 9:30am. If you can get a deal on the rooms, worth it and just take the trains.

review.title: Comfortable Stay
review.reviewText: It was a nice time spent w/ my boyfriend who was visiting for the first time:)

review.title: Nice hotel but before going back would check out other hotels in the area
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice, lobby looks great, rooms are good but could be a little bigger for a double bed room, beds are comfortable. Restaurant in hotel is extremely expensive and would not recommend that for a breakfast. Go to Cafe down the street on Mason. The cable TV is lacking good channels. The Internet in the room has a charge and should be free. The use of the gym on site has a charge as well and should be free. Be careful if you are allergic to feather pillows they are standard in the room and you need to request replacements. Overall I did like the hotel and the location is GREAT.. best feature of the hotel and easy access to the muni and bart system. Would recommend to a friend but would check out other hotels in the area if I returned to make a comparison.

review.title: Great visit to San Fran
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and centrally located for sightseeing around town. We really enjoyed our short stay.

review.title: Un healthy&Nasty
review.reviewText: there was blood on our "freshly prepared room" the moment we checked in! They sent up a housekeeping supervisor up and they changed the linens immediately, but the fact that it was soaked completely thru to the mattress cover was too much for me. they will NEVER see us again...

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: My daughter and I went on a last minute trip to San Francisco, & chose this hotel because it was centrally located. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. We went to bed early every night because we were exhausted after long days of sightseeing, & never had trouble getting to sleep or staying asleep--no noise (I am a light sleeper). We returned every day to a very clean, well-stocked room. We arranged for tours through Tower tours which was right outside the lobby, & the bus picked us up right at the hotel. Our one and only complaint was that the water pressure in the shower was not very strong.

review.title: As I remember it
review.reviewText: This is the 2nd time staying at the hotel and it's still a great stay. My only negative, and it's not the hotel's fault, but parking is ridiculously expensive. Other than that, love San Francisco.

review.title: Not Impresses
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was less then helpful on many occasions. I would not recommend this hotel as there are many other choices in the area.

review.title: would stay again, but get a bigger bed.
review.reviewText: Hotel was located in union square, great access to Bart, Buses, trolley, and light rail. Very clean and nice staff. My only complaint full size beds to small.

review.title: Great Hotel -
review.reviewText: The Hilton is close & convenient to everything - just a couple of blocks off the Muni-Bart-Cable Cars, etc. The hotel restaurant was great with a fabulous bartender. Good to have Starbucks in the lobby. Room attendants were great. Enjoyed the pool area.

review.title: very good location
review.reviewText: Very good location. Lots of places to eat, Mason Grill was good, but the Japanese Rest. down the street towards Market was very good and great prices. Short walk to Chinatown and open market on Sunday.

review.title: In the heart of the City.
review.reviewText: Comfotable and clean. The rooms were a bit small but would stay there again.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel...parking was included in our package which saved us quite a bit of money since some hotels charge per day fees which really increases the price. It was a clean, safe hotel right next to all the shopping at Union Square.

review.title: will stay there a third time
review.reviewText: I really like the open space area in the lobby. It's very comfortable to just sit and have a drink and watch people go by. I wish they still had the bar open in the lobby. We had to go get our drinks from the restaurant off the lobby. We didn't see a waitress taking orders. Check in was smooth and fast. Everyone working there is very pleasant. Our room was neat and clean. didn't have any counter space and the room itself was a bit small. however, everything was clean and the decore in all the room was updated. I will stay there again when I go back to san francisco in the fall.

review.title: 15.00 is the magic number
review.reviewText: I picked the Hilton because I figured it would be a good choice. I have stayed at Hiltons before, thought not in SF. I was dismayed to find out the hotel wanted to charge me 15.00 to workout in their gym. I think that is ridiculous-- in other big cities I have not been asked to pay on top of my room charge. In addition, this Hilton lets people use their workout room for a fee-- people who are not guests. A friend who happened to stay at the same hotel the same week wanted to ue the internet in her room-- it had been billed as having free internet. Nope, 15.00. Same for a fridge. I like the room overall, I just felt really harrassed by how everyone seemed to have their hand out. I know SF is very expensive, but that workout room was a joke. I will say security presence was very good, which made me feel safer-- it was just me and my elderly mother traveling.

review.title: Overall very nice
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice. Always felt safe and comfortable within the hotel and appreciated the many secruity guards - always very nice and polite. Outside safety wasn't an issue except many homeless individuals in neighborhood at night. Be ready to be asked for spare change all the time. Very convienant to local attractions and transportation. Don't walk very far as the hills will kill you - take transportation.

review.title: Can[t ask for more
review.reviewText: We have a very good time at the San Francisco Hilton Hotel, all the hotel staff are very concer to give the customers the best service.

review.title: Hilton Union Square
review.reviewText: The Hilton Union Square was a wonderful choice for our long weekend in San Francisco. It was within short walking distance from everything including, cable cars, muni bus, and many wonderful restaurants and shops.

review.title: Room For Improvement
review.reviewText: For such a highly rated hotel, the Union Square Hilton lacked most of what I would call 4 star quality and service. I've stayed at smaller hotels that were cleaner, friendlier and included more amenities. As a warning to others, I'll mention that the hotel does not offer wifi in rooms and I could not get a cell/network signal in most of the hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel, However was charged almost $2,000 in error!!!
review.reviewText: It was a great hotel in terms of aesthetics, cleanliness, and location. I would recommend it however, word of caution, do not get the mini bar key!!! They charge you for simply having it plus it causes more trouble than anything. During my trip I did not consume anything from the mini bar, I would purchase water and goodies from the nearby Walgreens, upon checkout i was told I had no charges. Three days later back home I was charged almost $2,000 in mini bar charges!!! I called immediately and was told it was a mistake due to a new mini bar system. The lady that helped me was very nice and refunded my money and the overdraft it had caused. Please be aware of this..she told me it was better not to keep the mini bar key and have them make a note that you do not want it.

review.title: A little 'worn'
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located near Union Square, but looks like it could use some TLC. The room was comfortable but everything about the hotel had the appearance of being well worn.

review.title: San Francisco weekend
review.reviewText: Room was small, but just fine for a quick weekend trip for 4.

review.title: Great location, good service
review.reviewText: We were very happy with this hotel. The concierge desk is well staffed with an entire crew of very knowledgable and helpful people. All service was excellent and the entire staff was very friendly, helpful and professional. Starbucks is handily located right in the lobby. Internet access was more than we like to pay, but it worked which is more than I can say about many places I've stayed with complimentary but non-functioning internet service. We felt very safe walking around the area, even late at night -- there were plenty of people out on the town around the hotel. The buses, BART, a drugstore, and popular retail stores are very close.

review.title: Very central; great price
review.reviewText: Very central. Hotel parking is expensive, but door man pointed me to a place half off. Hotel Area is a bit sketchy on one side. I would stay again.

review.title: Conveniently located Hotel with Good Service
review.reviewText: -Nice place -Everything was as require -Pool on the roof very nice -Rooms quiet, Clean, Standard Hotel Setup

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: The service was great from the front desk to the restaurant to the bellmen. Everyone was very helpful. The only complaint I had was that there was a large wet spot between the closet and bathroom in my room when I checked in so I kept getting wet feet. Other than that it was a great stay.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Location!
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay in the Hilton Hotel. The staff was very friendly and the concierge was full of suggestions for good restaurants, museums, shows, etc. Our room was clean and the beds were so comfortable that we passed out every night and didn't want to wake up! The location is also perfect! There is tons of shopping just a few blocks away, and a bus stop right across the street for trips too far to walk. The streetcar is also just a short walk, although it is overpriced ($5 one way) so we took the bus everywhere. One tip: the starbucks in the lobby is very convenient but they jack up the prices. There is another cheaper starbucks on the end of the block that is just as good.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: thought the Hilton was a perfect place to stay in San Francisco - it is close to the trolley and bus stops and walking distance from great places you want to see in San Fran. The hotel was very clean and the bed very comfortable. Just remember you are staying downtown - so at night you can hear the hustle bustle of the streets. Enjoyed my stay at the Hilton at Union Square - and would stay there again!

review.title: Definitely Just A Business Hotel
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel for a quick weekend get away because it is located close to Union Square. You can easily get to transportation such as the Bart and Cable Cars. We were not impressed with the rooms, they were extremely small and had an odd odor. There were three of us and just two extremely small double beds that we had to squish into. I would recommend this hotel to the single traveler who is just going to do a quick turn around trip.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Trip with daughter for graduation. Location is easy access to cable cars, shopping and public transportation. 28th floor view of the cityscape was great, view of the homeless on the streets below not so much. Wasn't comfortable walking the area at night, but cab service was terrific. Room was a little small but clean and beds were compfortable. Service at hotel was awesome, couldn't have asked for more. Helpful, gracious, answered all my questions with a smile and plenty of info. I would stay again!

review.title: Glad I landed at this hotel
review.reviewText: The best thing about the hotel is its location--walking distance to the conference center,midtown, museums, stores, theatres, proximity to public transportation. I didn't get to use the roof pool, but I liked knowing it was there. There is also a separately run spa that looked soothing. Staff was polite and helpful. The room-cleaning staff were very considerate and did a great job. I also used the FedEx and business facilities. It felt effortless to be there. I was a little far from the pool, and didn't realize there were no changing facilites. Next time I will put on my bathing suit before starting for it.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton San Francisco for 7 nights. The location was great, close to amazing shops and restaurant. Cable car just 2 minutes walk. Hotel's own resaurant has great happy hour - ask for the garlic ritz chips. Hotel staff (especially housekeeping) very polite and friendly. We have travelled through Europe and North America and we LOVED San Francisco. If you dont have fun here you never will!!

review.title: Hey Let's have some more On The Go choices
review.reviewText: Hotel location and cleanliness were excellent Would like more choices for "on the go" quick breakfast, etc.

review.title: Great hotel small rooms
review.reviewText: My wife decided to bring the boys with us to S.F. while I was attending a conference. Quarters were tight. They brought up a crib to use for the baby and there wasn't a lot of room after that! The high chair they also brought up wasn't very usable for a baby to feed. It was the kind you would find in a restaurant. There was no table to feed him off of so were feeding him by hand. The hotel is in a good location. There are lots of things to do. It's pretty close to the cable car line so you can get pretty much anywhere.

review.title: Great hotel - perfect location
review.reviewText: Just a few blocks from Union Square, this hotel is in the perfect location to catch a cable car, bus, or light rail. While on the edge of the Tenderloin (seedy district), it has lots of security and it's always bustling with activity. Room was large, quiet, clean and comfortable. Staff very helpful. Our favorite hotel in San Francisco.

review.title: Fun time at Hilton - Union Square
review.reviewText: Great hotel at a great location! We had a wonderful 2 night stay. Good service. Perfect location, everywhere is near and accessible from the hotel.

review.title: Check before unpacking
review.reviewText: Make sure if one needs a safe, to check prior to unpacking. Not all romms are supplied with a safe. A view of panhandlers, street people and a yellow crane; not that's San Francisco.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: I booked,a king size bed, with mini bar, did not get that, paid for it but did not get it, got a smaller room, no mini bar, wallpaper peeling, by bedside, the food way to much money, only if you are rich, would never go back.

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: good hotel for the price we paid! had a huge bed and staff were friendly. maid's were very attentive and always cleaned the room. pool and spa were out of order for all but one day of our trip. this was disappointing as they are really great facilities so make sure you call ahead and see whether they will be open!

review.title: Nice, but additionals are expensive.
review.reviewText: We were going to have room service for breakfast, but it was very pricy. We also got double charged for a small water out of the mini bar at 8.40 per each.

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: Great experience, and a wonderful location to see all of city!

review.title: I would recommend this hotel to friends.
review.reviewText: During my stay I received excellent service.

review.title: Will visit this hotel again
review.reviewText: Everyone was ready, willing, and able to assist in everyway. The hotel is in close vicinity of some major attractions. The Starbucks located in the hotel lobby was a great additions.

review.title: Centrally Placed, Close to Union Sq, Ideal for Transport
review.reviewText: Hotel was centrally placed about 2 blocks from Union Square, Macy's, Bloomingdales, the Trams, the Trolleys (to connect to Fishermans Wharf, Bridge Bikes and Alcatraz) and the BART connection from the airport. Concierge was really helpful with tourist advice, meal reservations, taxi's and directions. Room and Swimming Pool were typical of US hotels. Everything was walkable and Dollar car rental over the road from Hotel main entrance. Wasn't that impressed with hotel bar service.

review.title: Location is perfect!
review.reviewText: The Hilton at Union Square was a great location to stay during our first family vacation with our 19 month old daughter. They provided us with a crib at no charge. It was conveniently located 1/4 mile from the BART station so we didn't even need a cab from the airport. The coffee in the room was delicious.

review.title: Not a happy camper
review.reviewText: The Hotel was not the best hotel I stayed in. I stayed in Hilton hotels before but this one was not the best you have to pay for everything. It was bad enough that there was no parking and they did have a parking lot but is cost you a lot. Internet another charge. If you make a wrong turn you end up by homeless people not one or two but try about 20 homeless people in a 3 block distance. Not good room service and bathroom had no lock.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location for shopping, restaurants.

review.title: enjoyed the hotel
review.reviewText: room was clean & nice and quiet - bed was just right - would stay again

review.title: Very fine!
review.reviewText: Convenient location!

review.title: Would stay again!!!
review.reviewText: Very nice Hotel at a great price. Close to shopping. Very clean, would recommend and would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Very comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hilton San Francisco Union Square for a long weekend in May, 2009. The rooms were very comfortable, and with a nice view of the City. This is my second time staying at this hotel, and would recommend it anyone who wants a very nice hotel close to San Francisco attractions.

review.title: Location-location
review.reviewText: The Union Square location is almost impossible to beat....... very close to Market Street, downtown, Macy's, lots of restaurants, easy access to streetcars and buses.

review.title: The BEST Experience
review.reviewText: This visit was strictly for leisure. The location was amazing. I wanted just to get away and walk around aimlessly, And that I did. The room was exceptional and so was the service. I wouldnt stay anywhere else.....

review.title: Comfortable and clean- but pricey and internet/breakfast not included
review.reviewText: Its in downtown and walking distance to almost all main attractions. The cable car service starts from a few blocks down the street and its close to Union sq. About the hotel- its clean and comfortable, good service but the front desk is a mismanaged. Well, we were there for a conference (at Hilton) so the place was full of people and not v well managed- *eventhough we booked ahead we got 2 twin beds instead of the king/queen we asked for. *also internet was supposed to be free (due to the conf we were attending) but someone made a mistake and we were billed which they refused to cancel. Even then I think $30/day internet is not commendable at all- specially in this century! *no breakfast included or special or anything. *also their room service (for food) does not have many options. We stayed their for the conference but in normal circumstance would not. But then again I guess most hotels downtown are the same- so in that light it may not be a bad deal at all.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Great location.

review.title: Internet is not free
review.reviewText: No free internet...

review.title: Hotel perfect
review.reviewText: The hotel is a perfect location, very close to Union Square. Hotel service was perfect and people very nice. Concierge service was perfect. They were always there to answer our questions. And the price was cheap and for the Memorial day week end! I recommend the Hilton Union Square.

review.title: One of a good choice to stay
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel few times and will continue to stay during my future visits.

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: good place as the location is central

review.title: fabulous in every aspect
review.reviewText: this was a special trip for me and my 6 year old daughter.It was magical for both of us. the staff was respectful and gracious. we were very comfortable. we hope to make it an anual affair.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Great hotel and perfect location!

review.title: i was impress with the hotel
review.reviewText: My stay at Hilton-San Francisco was what I expected.

review.title: Conveniently located
review.reviewText: Could be updated with new tvs. Good location close to BART and trolley service.

review.title: Nice Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Pleasant and efficient check in. Rooms are large and modern. Good condition, comfortable beds. Hotel provides all necessary amenities. Very Large Hotel. Just three short blocks from the Powell St Bart Exit. Easy to walk and can catch at Oakland or SF Airports for direct ride to city. Be sure to see the Ferry Bldg market on Saturday Morn. Lots of local artists, great produce too.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: If you have never been to San Fransico, Stay in this Hotel its close to everything!

review.title: Can't judge a book by it's cover
review.reviewText: When you first walk in, the hotel looks amazing. Beautiful lobby, concierges everywhere (even at 11pm), a Starbucks immediately available - which is a big deal for a Seattlite like me! Not sure if it was Expedia or the hotel not providing a good description, but I purchased the Sight & Sound package which I was under the impression (again, due to lack of description), this would have an awesome view of San Francisco that my daughter could enjoy. This package turned out to be a plasma TV and extra speaker - and an awesome view of the parking garage across the street. Boo! The room was not clean. In fact, my wife found used band-aids stuck to the blanket. The other issue was that we had 4 people, but the hotel requires us to submit an extra request on discovering this fact, to order extra towels. "It's standard" they say. Poor customer service I think. I won't stay here again.

review.title: GREAT PLACE and GREAT LOCATION!
review.reviewText: Two thumbs up across the board! Great location and hotel was clean and comfy. The only downer was the parking...its expensive, we used the garage across the street and paid $30 with in-and-out privileges..normal rates are over $50.

review.title: Good value!!
review.reviewText: Good location,good value for the money,clean,good management!!!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Very clean and a great location for what we needed. A small complaint is that the Starbucks closes too early during the day

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel is centrally located. You don't need a car, it's close to all the attractions and public transportation. If you do need a rental, like we did, you can rent a car across the street. You have many options. We stayed only one night on our way to Monterey and it was great to walk around Union Square and explore. If you book in advance you can get an excellent rate.

review.title: Very nice, convenient & clean
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in a great downtown area, near public transportation and shopping. Its in walking distance to Chinatown & North Beach. The room was updated & very clean. The bed was very comfortable. There is a Starbucks in the lobby, but the 2 Starbucks down the street made better coffee & were much cheaper than the one in the hotel lobby. I would defenitly stay here again.

review.title: excellent accomodations
review.reviewText: only gripe was the price for parking $45 a bit too high for staying at the hotel and not easy to come and go

review.title: Old rooms, small rooms, not a high class hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, but only go there if you have a good deal. This is by far away from the standard of Hilton hotels in the world, poor service, long queuing to check in, small and old rooms, not worth the money you put in unless you have a good deal. Disapointed for the money we paid.

review.title: So much to see, so little time!
review.reviewText: Great place to stay. Clean and comfortable. Close to shops and restaurants

review.title: impressed
review.reviewText: the hotel is close to shopping,china town,union square .

review.title: Will be back
review.reviewText: Hotel was close by all the shopping. Had a great time here. I just wished the pool was open 24hours and the gym/spa was free to guest.

review.title: Hotel Good, But Not Perfect
review.reviewText: The Hilton did its usual with excellent staff, clean rooms, nice bar and large lobby. The rooms were a little smaller than usual and the walls seemed to be thinner than most. I have stayed in many hotels in the Union Square Area and this was is good, but there are ones with larger rooms for the same price and comfort.

review.title: Good Location!! Near cable car turnaround...
review.reviewText: Good location, can hear street noise from room (15th floor) noisy on weekend nights...Great parking across the street, cheaper than hotel parking. Fairly good food offered at hotel.

review.title: Could be better
review.reviewText: The hotel had a nice overall appearance but lacked the polish that I am used to. The room, a suite, was very small for a suite. The bathroom was also small and had spring loaded hinges that kept you closed in at all times. Reasonable if your not expecting to much.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Location was great. Easy walk to main shopping areas and cable car stops. Comfortable rooms.Due to the size of the Hotel it was a little impersonal but it was a pleasant stay all the same.

review.title: Watch for added costs, but still a nice hotel
review.reviewText: Cost for parking at the hotel itself was outrageous, $50.00 per night, and $16.00 per night for internet access is unreasonable. Internet access should have been free. Otherwise, nice hotel, good downtown location, plenty of good restaurants within walking distance. Would still recommend hotel, but park down the street for $20.00 per night.

review.title: Great hotel- great price!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, perfect location, beautiful room, and the price was perfect! the hotel definetely met my 4 stars expectations for a 2-3 stars price.

review.title: Best place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: My husband, two daughters and I stayed at the Hilton in San Francisco and had a wonderful experience. The beds were really comfortable, there was a nice swimming pool and the location was excellent. We were within walking distance of amazing shopping and took a cable car to Fisherman's Wharf. Will stay at the Hilton again! (I recommend valet parking your car in the Hilton... it is safe to leave it and forget it while you are there!) The staff were friendly and courteous too!

review.title: a good value if you like large hotels
review.reviewText: The breakfast situation was poor. The hotel restaurant was ridiculously expensive for breakfast and at 8:30-9 the lobby Starbuck had a line that snaked around the entire lobby.

review.title: Great Family Place
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time at the Hilton. Our family really enjoyed it. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms were immaculate. It was very close to every thing we wanted to see and do. The best place to be if you want to do some good shopping! The only thing I was disappointed about was the hours of the pool. It closed at (pm every night. Too early for when you're on vacation. They definately need to put more lighting in the pool area. Very scary at night. The jacuzzi had more lighting than the pool and any where else.

review.title: Not a 4 Star but OK if you want to be close to the shopping.
review.reviewText: This hotel is fine and we got a good rate but I would have been really upset if we paid anywhere near full price. We have traveled pretty extensively thru US and Europe so I am used to "big city" level of hotel: smaller rooms and everything extra is costs. The room size at this hotel was OK but the room was overall pretty cheap. They did not even have a normal door on the bathroom. Instead a cheap slat thing. No outlets - we had to unplug lights and move a table to dry our hair. The mini bar has a 20% restock fee plus a $12 fee if you leave anything that is yours in it on top of the crazy prices- $18 for a sandwich. It is OK if you are coming for shopping but don't go west of the hotel or one block south especially at night since it is dangerous area. No convenience shop. They had a Starbucks but closed early. A plus is the bed was comfortable and the room was quiet.

review.title: A great central place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: The Union Square Hilton in San Francisco was a great place to stay since it is a very nice hotel and it is just a short walk to all of the trasportation in SF. At Union Square, you can pay just $11 to ride any public transportation for the day or $18 for two days. The hotel was very clean and the staff was courteous and friendly. To save on hotel parking, you can go to the Parking lot behind the hotel for about 1/2 price. I will mostg likely stay at the Hilton during my next next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Close to restaurants and shopping. Easy access to many attractions. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: I will not go again.
review.reviewText: not friendly, rooms small and old, I was expecting higher quality being hilton branch....

review.title: Will definitely come back
review.reviewText: The views from our rooms were fantastic.

review.title: A hotel near to the SFO Cable Car track!!
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent 3 nights at this hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is near to the SFO Cable Car track. It is therefore near to all the major shopping areas. Very convenient for access to anywhere in Chinatown, Japantown, Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf. The front service is friendly. The gym is outstanding. Rooms are clean, functional. We even had a chance to do some wine tasting - for a small fee. The snacks were not great but the wine was acceptable. I strongly suggest you don't drive and park your car at the hotel. Being a city hotel, parking per day will be extremely expensive.

review.title: Gppd Value
review.reviewText: Comfy rooms

review.title: Nice stay in a nice place ..
review.reviewText: Spent 3 days in San Francisco with my girlfriend .Hotel check in was quick ( we were in our room by noon ).Room was clean, bed was just right, stayed on the 22nd floor, nice view of city and bay from balcony .Would recommend for nice 3 day getaway !

review.title: Good for business not so great for leisure
review.reviewText: On arrival to the hotel, the booking was incorrect but this was quickly rectified. The room was very nice. The hotel provided all that we required for a business/leisure trip. The only dissappointment was that we had to pay $15 per day for the use of the fitness facilities. Other Hilton Hotels include this free of charge.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel located close to lots of major attractions in San Fran. Crabtree and Evelyn amenities provided were a nice touch. Concierge on one occasion was rude and unhelpful, when asked about nearby internet cafe's (there was one across the road) and laundries (1 block away). Otherwise a pleasent stay

review.title: Be prepared to pay for extras
review.reviewText: Was disappointed to find out there was a $15 a day fee to use the fitness center. Also a fee for internet service. With the price you pay for the room you should get these included! Otherwise, it was a very pleasant stay.

review.title: Great Experience at the the Hilton San Francisco Union Square
review.reviewText: We had a fantastic stay at the Hilton. It has a great location near Union Square and is located near the Powell Street BART Station and the Powell cable car turnaround. Our room had a great view of the city and the staff was helpful in directing us on how to get around this large hotel which has three towers. The room itself was clean and had upscale bath products. I went with just my wife and we can't wait to come back with the children and stay at the Hilton.

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent our second trip to SF at the Hilton Union Sqaure. Although parking is expensive, it is probabaly typical for this area. The staff and location were wonderful. Standard rooms are a little small, but very clean and quite comfortable. We would definitely recommend and stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Great location and service
review.reviewText: Great service; the concierges were very informative and patient. Great location to all transportation, shopping and great restaurants. Rooms were clean and comfortable. My 2 complaints are that if you have noisy neighbors you can hear them and they do not offer their guests any discount on parking, which is very expensive.

review.title: Nice Hotel at a Great Location
review.reviewText: The Hilton was wonderful! It's in a very convenient location for sightseeing, close to a BART station and several car rental offices are right across the street (and a Starbuck's in the lobby). The room was nice and clean. The bathroom was very cool. I got a great deal on this room through Expedia and would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great Room for the Price
review.reviewText: This hotel was priced right. It was about a mile walk from the convention center to the hotel. Definitely recommend it if business brings you to the Moscone Convention Center

review.title: Room with a view makes a perfect place to stay
review.reviewText: The Hilton Union Square proved to be a perfect choice for a week in San Francisco. Centrally located between Market Street and Union Square there was always easy access to Public Transport, good food and toursit spots. Our room on the 40th Floor with a large balcony overlooking the city gave us space, privacy and surprising value for money. The room itself was large with a super king bed and enough storage space to be sure our mega shipping did not get in the way. The hotel facilities were top rate and the staff were constantly helpful and on time. The only slight reservation was the continental breakfast (free) from starbucks, where to the serious coffee lover its not really my thing, but with a range of great places within a few blocks it was not an issue. We will definitely go back again, just wish it was tomorrow.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was near all the major attractions, that was accomodating. The room was nice size and clean. They have a pool I had a chance to enjoy, that was a plus. Overall I enjoyed the hotel and would diffinately recommend to others and stay again.

review.title: Fantastic Weekend
review.reviewText: This is my 2nd stay at this Hilton and it is very conveniently located to all the major attractions in San Francisco. The concierge staffs were knowledgeable and were able to help us navigate the local MUNI, find the nearest church and mass time and recommend a great dim sum place. The housestaff were very courteous and kept our room clean and well stocked of coffee. We also gotten a complementary cityview upgrade for our engagement (secretely arranged by my now fiancee) and the secret delivery of flower arrangement with help of the congierge staff went without a hitch. The view was absoultely gorgeous at night! I would definetly return to this Hilton when we go back to San Francisco. The only set back is the long line of caffeine seeker in the morning at the Starbucks in the lobby- but glad that there is one there!

review.title: Very decent hotel
review.reviewText: Honestly, I don't understand all the negative reviews about Hilton Union Sq. It's a really good hotel, great location (if you are hoofing later at night, try to walk in the Union Sq direction, and not towards the Tenderloin, at least not past Taylor St, to avoid unsavoury characters), literally within walking distance to major shopping and dining district. Maybe because our room was tucked away from the elevator area, it was one of the quietest hotel experiences we had, ever. Also we didn't experience any of the sound isolation issues mentioned in the other reviews. Housekeeping service was quite good, the check-in process was smooth and effortless, and so was the check-out. The only problems: terribly overpriced mini-bar ($8 for a bottle of Fiji water is a shame. Mini bars are overpriced all over the world, but come on, the hotel could very well make 300% profit by pricing it at $4!) The Urban Tavern breakfast is shamelessly overpriced too. Do NOT go there. Ponzu restaurant breakfast on the corner of O'Farrel and Taylor is a much better choice. Overall: I will definetely stay at this hotel again. Very quiet and affordable.

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, great location! The only complaint I had was we had a mojoto in our room and the maid left the empty glasses there all the next day. The concierge was very helpful in answering our questions on what to see and where to go. Check in personnel was very friendly and made me feel very welcome.

review.title: Great location - tiny room
review.reviewText: We took BART from the airport to the shopping mall on Powell St., then walked 3 blocks to the hotel. The double beds were very comfortable, but the room was too small to fit a rollaway for our 3rd person. Starbucks in the lobby had a relatively inexpensive tasty oatmeal breakfast, and the huge comfortable lobby was great for eating and people watching. All of the Hilton employees were extremely helpful and friendly.

review.title: Loved it!!!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time at the hotel! It was our first time visiting San Francisco, so we needed quite a bit of help finding our way around. The hotel staff was very helpful.

review.title: Worst Hotel Experience Ever,
review.reviewText: Not enough space here to write a full review of this hotel but I will just break it down of my experience. 1) Placed me in a handicap room without asking me if it was alright or seeing if I wanted to wait for a regular room. 2) After requesting to be transferred, I was placed in a room where the toilet flusher was broken and had no handle (the housekeeping / maintenance knew about it but they put me in here anyways.) 3) Shower pipes were mixed up. When I turn the handle to "H" it was actually cold water and when I turn it to "C" it was hot. 4) Toilet would randomly flush during the middle of the night and was really loud. Too many other things happened but I would not recommend this hotel. Front desk staff needs to review their customer service methods.

review.title: Ideal location
review.reviewText: Hilton near Union Square is in an ideal location for getting about San Francisco; great for shopping and restaurants too. Room was always clean and tidy and the staff friendly and informative with maps and advice. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was close to shops and very clean.

review.title: Favorite hotel at Union Square
review.reviewText: Clean, spacious, comfortable room. Friendly, helpful staff. Convenient to Union Square, restaurants, cable car line.

review.title: Hilton Union Square--great service
review.reviewText: Best hotel service I've ever experienced. Concierge always amazingly helpful. Downside: wireless was very expensive. That should really be included in rooms now.

review.title: Hilton Union Square
review.reviewText: Very good hotel. Staff was friendly.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent service, comfortable, clean, and quiet rooms.

review.title: The only hotel I stay in, in SF!
review.reviewText: This is my hotel. It is walking distance to everything you could possibly want in SF. It's clean, modern, luxurious, and pleasant. I wouldn't stay anywhere else!

review.title: Price, location, quality of the Hilton Hotels attract us.
review.reviewText: We researched hotels and the location of this hotel along with the price and quality drew us like a magnet. We appreciated having FedEx Kinkos and Starbucks within the building itself. Very comfortable rooms and nice views from our floor.

review.title: Perfect location for shopping and getting around
review.reviewText: We chose the Hilton as our primary purpose was shopping - great easy walk to Union Square, easy walk from the BART if you are coming in from the airport, easy walk to Market street transit. I have read some comments about the area being a bit less than desireable - yes, it is on the edge of the Tenderloin, but we had no problems - if you want to avoid the "sketchiness" then avoid the area south west of the hotel. The hotel beds are wonderfully comfortable.

review.title: why i was not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was generally nice, I was very dissappointed that they seemed to want to charge for everything, like internet service for one. Comon... its free so many places. Marriot was free last time I stayed there. Parking at hotel was $53 a night!! I kind of felt robbed. Anyway the staff was nice and hotel was clean just don't nickle and dime me to death.

review.title: Union Square heaven
review.reviewText: Loved the location of the Hilton in Union Square...2 blocks to BART station and Powell Street trolly car...Lefty O'Doul's is a block away for decent food and great affordable drinks...lots of SF history there!

review.title: Affordable room, parking is another story...
review.reviewText: Room was affordable, beware of parking $40-50 per day...take BART!!! Room was nice, but small and tight. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance from everything, parking structure is close to room. Overall...nice, great stay!

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: 1) Toilet was broken when we first walked into the room. 2) Entire hotel had an issue with hot water, it wasn't a pleasant experience. 3) Internet connection charge was ridiculously expensive.

review.title: nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: close to mall, union square, cable cars, etc. charges extra for almost everything. Starbucks staff in hotel not very pleasant.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Right in the middle of downtown San Francisco. Excellent hotel.

review.title: Very good for the price
review.reviewText: Clean and great location

review.title: very nice accomodations
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend this hotel , **** four star. conveniently located to great dining and shopping along with san francisco's wonderful scenery .

review.title: Great location, good value
review.reviewText: Well-located hotel in center of SF. The hotel is huge, taking up a full block with multiple towers, so can be overwhelming. However, service is good - rooms are cleaned promptly - and location can't be beat.

review.title: Excellent Service from Reception to Housekeeping!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great to stay at and was centrally located. The initial greeting by the doorman was very welcoming and the reception/check-in was a smooth process by friendly and informative staff. Our housekeeping attendants did a wonderful job which made my business trip quite enjoyable. The rooms were clean, elegant and the view of the city from my room was lovely. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone on business or pleasure. The concierage was also quite helpful regarding nearby dinner spots, China town, etc.

review.title: Recent Renovations are very nice
review.reviewText: Hilton is our best bet for location near Union Square and the theater district. Rooms are clean and of high quality. Staff is Uniformly friendly and courteous.The only down side is parking fees, which are exorbitant.

review.title: sfo hilton review
review.reviewText: rather dirty for a hilton staff not helful

review.title: Great location and hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was great, although you'd think by this day and age we shouldn't have to pay $16/day for internet. All other things considered this is a very nice hotel.

review.title: Dissatisfied Customer
review.reviewText: The hotel is too noisy. The room was close to the elevator and throughout the night as people got off I can hear them speak as they walked through the hall. I was continuously woken up by people walking in the hallway. I was on the 8th floor and was able to hear the traffic from the street and the cars honking all night long. The fan in the restroom was not working and the light fixture in the restroom was broken and had mold in it. Overall, I was extremely disappointed and uncomfortable. I would not recommend anyone to stay at this Hilton. At check out no one asked if I was satisfied with my stay.

review.title: our new home while in San Fran!
review.reviewText: Hotel was great. Location is great. Friendly staff. Very clean. Great Expedia price.

review.title: I would stay there again...
review.reviewText: I thought it was a descent hotel, however geared towards business people. I'm not sure if there was a convention when i stayed there but seemed like everyone was wearing black business suits. Staff was pleasant. Parking at 45 bux a night is a ripoff but it is S.F.

review.title: Excellant
review.reviewText: Can't wait to go back, It was a wonderful experience and the staff were all professional and helpful. The treatment was a wonderful expereince for me and my daughter. We took a mini vacation to San Francisco and had a very good time. Thnak you all for your exceptional custoemr service.I will recommned this hotel to all of my friends and family. It is close to everyhting and in walking distance to many recreational areas and resturants.

review.title: Not the best Hilton in the world, but excellent location
review.reviewText: It's 2 blocks away from everything in Union Square, but I expect so much more from a Hilton. The City Scape restaurant had been closed for month, although it is still feature in hotel presentations. The internet charge is ridiculously expensive. You would expect a business hotel to provide at least in-lobby free internet. This one doesn't. All the other 3 hotels I stayed at during my last holiday did.

review.title: review
review.reviewText: Very good

review.title: Everything is satisfied
review.reviewText: We are very satisfied with the room and service. It's worth !

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The Hilton is in a very conveinant location. It has a lovely lobby area and was very comfortable.

review.title: Awaiting ownership change?
review.reviewText: This was one of least impressive hotels we have stayed at. The City Scape restaurant (still featured prominently on the website) had been closed for some time. Five minutes of standing in front of a concierge on the phone didn't even elicit eye contact. One day our room had no housekeeping at all and we were told (erroneously) that we must of had the "Do Not Disturb" sign out. We did see an official looking notice outside the main entrance proclaiming a petition to change owners. Perhaps that explains the fact that some employees appeared to be "phoning it in."

review.title: Business more than liesure
review.reviewText: Rooms were comfortable and the hotel is in a good location near but not on Union Square. Strange, unusable waste baskets in the rooms. Housekeeping pounded on door about 8am, with or without 'Do Not Disturb' signs on the door handle. Never saw the lobby bar open. Attached bar was small with backless seats, but some good wines. Gift/convenience shop was also mostly closed. Lots of conference rooms and reception areas. Room service was unusually expensive - e.g. $18 for a bowl of oatmeal, $25 for a Caesar Salad, $35 for Eggs Benedict. There are shops, restaurants and bars in the vicinity of the hotel, so it wasn't too much of an inconvenience that the hotel facilities were either unavailable or overpriced. This hotel is generally comfortable, but more oriented towards business than vacation travelers.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This was the most amazing hotel. The people were great and I have never felt safer in San Francisco - hotel security everywhere! Beautiful hotel and was close to shopping and all transportation.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel great, park in some other parking garage for less.

review.title: Good hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Good service; nice heated outdoor pool and spa, but couldn't use due to very cold, rainy weather (week of Dec 14) and the pool closed early (7:00 PM); 3-4 short blocks to transportation hub. Rooms were well furnished and in good repair.

review.title: Christmas Weekend
review.reviewText: Spent the weekend in San Fran and stayed at the Hilton. The area around the hotel is not without its fair share of transients and beggars, but the personnel at the hotel kept them far away from the place. Beautiful decorations in the lobby and staff cordial and polite. Our room was clean and the bed very comfortable. No free internet service so plan on paying for it if you need it. The one issue I had was the size of the room. Smaller than the average hotel room and made it worse with a king size bed. Bathroom had venitian style doors and a little awkward at times for complete privacy. The bar was small, drinks expensive, and appetizers limited to mostly Asian cuisine. If you are parking your vehicle there expect to pay a small fortune.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Location great. Best housekeeping staff I've ever experienced. Only negative is the lack of included internet.

review.title: Nice hotel but definitely a big city hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice. I have no complaints at all about my room. I found the huge hotel lobby a bit overwhelming. It's hard to feel welcome in such a large space. I was also surprised that the hotel internet in my room was not free (there's no wireless in the rooms). Also the exercise facilities cost extra to use, which I have never heard of before in a hotel. I guess all these aspects go with being a big city hotel.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay

review.title: Great bargin for the quality
review.reviewText: It's very close to the major attractions at Union Square. One block from the cable car line. My window in the hotel room faced a huge garage, but the quality of the room is way beyond my expectation.

review.title: I would stay again
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice and located walking distance to Union Square, shopping, restaurants, cable cars, etc. Easy driving access to the major highways. The staff was courteous and offered a great upgrade after discovering our original room was not ready for us. Our room was clean and the view was fantastic. On site tourism desk was nice to have in order to plan tours and day trips. I would definitely stay at the SF Hilton again.

review.title: Great Location - Mediocre Hotel
review.reviewText: It was 9yrs since I last stayed at the Hilton on O'Farrell St, and my visit there recently was a bit of a disappointment. I arrived (for one week) on Thanksgiving Day. When I last stayed there the hotel had a multitude of restaurants, a small shopping arcade and a nice bar. On my return I discovered that they have ripped out the bar, the restaurants and the shopping arcade to make way for a multitude of convention rooms. All very well perhaps if it's a convention that you're attending (and not planning on doing anything else in the hotel). The large (once graceful) lobby now serves as a makeshift lounge area where, in the corner, a tacky makeshift bar is erected in the evening - to compliment the equally tacky Starbucks positioned where once the bar was. Add to this the utilitarian "Urban Tavern" with its garish uninviting and clinical ambience and one is left with a feeling that the Hilton is more about accommodating franchises and concessions than about creating an overall "Hilton" experience. A once great hotel sadly relegated to a hotel in search for the quick'n'easy convention buck. I recommend the Mark instead.

review.title: Solid Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent location and service...could be a bit impersonal but we really didn't care. Generally not happy that Hilton Honors drops you from the program if you don't have at least one stay within 6 months. That's weak and cheep.

review.title: experience
review.reviewText: excellent

review.title: my favorite hotel
review.reviewText: Loved the location, close to everything,such as shopping, cable car, bart and the church.

review.title: Excellent for the price
review.reviewText: We got a real good deal over Thanksgiving weekend. The hotel was as expected for a 4 star hotel.

review.title: Okay hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel had a "refugee camp" feel when checking in, however, the line moved very fast so that was good. Stayed for 3 nights, maid service woke me up at 7:30, 8:00 and came back when in the shower. Prepaid on expedia, and was double charged when checking out on my credit card for the room.

review.title: Union Square Hilton
review.reviewText: The Hilton recently went under remodel and it added a modern updated look to the hotel, which I appreciated.

review.title: perfect location to union square
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Hilton for a Black Friday shopping trip with my mother. We were very satisfied. The concierge held our shopping bags at bell area all day even after check out. Great Service.

review.title: Walking distance from great shopping!
review.reviewText: The excellent location, reasonable room rates, and great service keep me returning to the Hilton.

review.title: Great Weekend
review.reviewText: The only problem was a hole in the bed sheets which was a surprise for a Hilton Hotel. The hotel is in a great location for anything you want to do in San Francisco. We did alot of our Christmas shopping at all of the stores right around the hotel.

review.title: Can't wait to go back.
review.reviewText: Parking is a bit pricey. But the hotel was lovely.

review.title: It's a solid 5
review.reviewText: We were very satisfied with our short stay at the SF Hilton, next time we'll have to stay longer.

review.title: Clean but small
review.reviewText: THe hotel was great, very professional. I was only dissapoointed in the room size. Out King bed was a tight fit! Very appropriate for San Franscico! I would stay again but the prince of parking was absurd $51.00 per night!!!!!!!!

review.title: Perfer my Holiday Inns.
review.reviewText: $14.95 a day for internet!! With this day and age it should be included. This is my first time staying in a Hilton and for the price I was not impressed. They might use a little better quality of materials, but not much. My toilet leaked and would run every 15-20 minutes refilling.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: It was my first trip to San Francisco and was there for a conference. The hotel was very nice, great room and very clean. The concierge desk and the doormen were extremely helpful and we got terrific recommendations. One block away from the cable cars which were fun to take to Fisherman's Wharf. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Good Place to Stay
review.reviewText: When we travel, the hotel is for sleeping, showering, and keeping our stuff together. This hotel was very clean and comfortable. And the location was great. Very close to shopping and to the trollies. The only compliant was there was no fan the bathroom. But this hotel met our needs and were happy to stay there. The parking is expensive but it is like that all around San Francisco.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very good location, very clean, nice furniture, nice rooms. Nothing to complain about.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: not good

review.title: Very enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location, close to Union Square, China Town, shopping and bus/trolley routes. Although the lobby was at times very busy and noisey, the room were very quiet.

review.title: We didnt want to go home
review.reviewText: My husband and i had such a great time we didnt want to leave. The beds were the most comfortable beds i have ever slept in. Any thing we needed the maids were there to get for us.I just cant think of anything bad to say about this hotel.It is very ritzy and and we felt right and happy about being there.

review.title: It worked for us
review.reviewText: Overall, we had a great stay and would consider coming back. We were always at the right place / right time re: service and have no complaints, but we did notice inconsistency in length of time waiting for front desk service and can see how this could be irritating. The pool / hot tub were very small for the size of the hotel - but again - never overly crowded when we were there. The pool closes by 9 pm - a bit early when you are out and about.

review.title: For the price, a deal. Nice, too.
review.reviewText: I think rooms were on sale here, so we thought the value was extraordinary. With its vast lobby and crowded passageways, it was not as intimate or overall as friendly and welcoming as the boutique hotels we usually patronize (and which are slowly pricing themselves out of our reach) but front-desk service and the bartenders were all efficient and personable. Can't beat the location for access to ACT, BART, or Union Square shopping. Loved the "bridge," the glassed-in walkway between towers up on the 15th floor (I think it was).

review.title: Amenities are additional $$
review.reviewText: The rooms were clean and nice, but you are charged separately for internet service, pool visits, and gym visits. You shouldn't be paying additional for basic amenities such as this. I would just keep this in mind if you are interested in staying here.

review.title: So So-- A mixed bag
review.reviewText: The room, when we finally actually got it, was quite nice. The problem was, when we arrived (after calling earlier to confirm) they said they didn't have our room and they would have to put us up in a "parlor room", which had no bed, only a sofa bed. They said they thought they could squeeze in a couple of roll-aways for the kids, but they weren't sure. We said this was unnacceptable, since we had paid for a real room and we didn't want to be sqeezed into a "parlor room". After talking to his manager, the clerk said they would give us a real room after all. The actual room was very nice (it was an upgrade from the room we paid for, which I suppose was why they didn't want to give it to us at first.) Do be careful leaving the hotel-- if you go the wrong direction you are immediately in the Tenderloin district, which is pretty rough. Head east towards downtown when leaving the hotel. It is close enough to downtown and Chinatown to make a walking tour, which was nice. Parking in the hotel lot, which is safest and most convenient, is very expensive. The lobby was pretty noisy, but the room itself was very quiet, confortable, and clean.

review.title: Dated Decor on a Massive Scale
review.reviewText: This hotel is huge, impersonal, and dated. We were on a high floor on a gusty weekend. The wind made a loud, annoying whistle outside our window that woke us up at night. The hallways in particular are very outdated, with the carpet surprisingly worn for a Hilton. Overall, a completely unimpressive experience. We would not go back for the rate we paid.

review.title: Very comfortable place to stay
review.reviewText: My husband and I felt very comfortable staying in Hilton Hotel. Actually, it was my son who recommended it and he was right. Hilton, Union Square is accessible to a lot of things - public transportation, shopping centres, subway especially coming to and from the San Francisco International Airport, land tours kiosk in the hotel, etc. I highly recommend it to any traveler.

review.title: ideal location
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Hilton Union Square for 8 nights found it the ideal location for shopping and sightseeing,with staff very helpful in recommending activites and tours for consideration.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Well situated hotel, close to cable car and shops. Not the cheapest hotel, but very comfortable and clean. Taxis to main attractions were at a reasonable cost and I would happily recommend this hotel for anybody staying in San Francisco

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: It was a great location for getting around to see the tourist sites of San Francisco.

review.title: that little extra would have been a 5
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco for a conference and my husband and I were able to add a few extra days to spend our anniversary prior. My company booked us a standard room for the conference and we upgraded an extra $100/night for an executive king - to make the stay just a little special. The room was nice and the view was nice but after seeing a standard room, was pretty disappointed with what our upgrade included. $100 continental breakfast and evening appetizers I guess. The concierge was accommodating however they did loose a co-workers bag and it wasn't found until after we had to leave for the airport. THey did ship it at their cost. The decor traditional standard but nice. The in-house restaurant was disappointing when 2 of our party had bones ground into their meals. Overall it was a standard experience but comfortable for an newbie to the city.

review.title: Not impressed.
review.reviewText: Upon check-in, the room was incredibly small and with no view. The hallway was long, depressing and felt like an institution. I've stayed here before but only in the deluxe rooms in tower 2. These standard rooms in tower 1 are not good. The front desk staff wouldn't do anything about it. Only after speaking with a very helpful concierge was the room changed to a better location in the same type room in tower 3.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and comfortable. Staff were very freindly and accomodating. Security within the hotel and in front of the hotel was excellent. The hotel was significantly overpriced to comparable hotels in the area. Value for the price is extremely poor.

review.title: Wonderful hotel and location could not have asked for more for the money
review.reviewText: Super location, easy to find and great all round

review.title: great service and location
review.reviewText: we had a super stay here. We used the concierge often and they always had great suggestions. We would definitely stay again.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Nice room, comfy beds, awesome location, great price. The Urban Tavern restaurant was fantastic. Was happily surprised to find a full Starbucks in the lobby. Will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Wheres the ice?
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, helpful staff..until the ice incident.it took going to all hotel floors in the tower, which produed a half a bucket after 30 mins. of up and down. When I called to ask about the problem I was told it would be three dollars for a bucket.After some persuasion a complimentary bucket was sent.Other than that the rooms were clean, and hotel well located sightseeing.

review.title: The rudest people I've ever dealt with at a hotel!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: We checked in after midnite so there was NO valet or bellboy & when we asked for help we were told to help ourselves!!! I was completely astonished when we were charged for valet parking, even though we parked it ourselves! They said since it was past midnite, that they charge the same as valet!! I WOULDNT GO BACK TO THIS HOTEL EVER & I WOULDNT WANT EVEN A HOMELESS PERSON TO HAVE TO PUT UP WITH THESE PEOPLE!!!! RUN, RUN FAST!!!!!

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: i spent my birthday weekend in sf and i had a wonderful stay at the hilton... the hotel is not far from all the wonderful shops and just a taxi ride away from the pier 39.

review.title: It is what it is...
review.reviewText: The special Expedia rate for the 'executive room' made this Hilton worthwhile. The reception area is a zoo, and its layout is just plain bad, but the bed very comfortable & linen very nice. The suite comes with access to the 'Executive Lounge' which is (at weekends anyway) packed with people chowing down the free food. The concierge does nothing to regulate traffic, so things can get a little tense. Go later, and it gets much quieter!

review.title: Good location, BAD service
review.reviewText: My family and I stayed at the hotel for the Labor Day weekend. We arrived on Saturday evening and departed Monday afternoon. The hotel is located in the middle of Downtown San Fransisco, and the location is perfect walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, Japan Town, and close to all the transportation systems. That being said, the hotel had very poor service. When we arrived there we had to wait in for 5 minutes before the two front desk people decided to stop gossiping and start working. We asked for non-smoking rooms, but when we checked into the rooms the rooms smelled of heavy smoking that was imbedded into the walls and carpet. When we called the front desk they said that there were no other rooms available and that we should perhaps keep the window open to let the smell out. Needless to say that was insulting. I spoke to the manager and he told me that they would get us into a new room asap. However, the whole weekend we ended up staying in the same room. Incredible city, worst hilton hotel that I have stayed in.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Registration was well organized and efficient with a host greeting and directing the people in line. The bar in the lobby, available ATM and other services made this a friendly, customer service first type of hotel.

review.title: Excellent value for the comfort and location. Slept like a baby!
review.reviewText: The Hilton has a large parking garage that you can self-park or use valet service for. It is convenient to all the mass transit and good dining and shopping. For a very competitive rate we had luxury, quiet, and a decent view from our window. The staff were all courteous and helpful, even with the hotel booked to capacity.

review.title: PERFECT
review.reviewText: Little pricy but not bad, staff was great, room was great. The only downer was the $50 extra for parking, although you do get in and out priveledges if you want them. Have fun....

review.title: Excellent Choice
review.reviewText: Hilton San Francisco Union Square...excellent location for ground transportation, shopping, government district, China Town, etc. View of Golden Gate bridge and city was wonderful.

review.title: Nothing spectacular
review.reviewText: Hotel is pretty old, room is small, wouldn't rate it as a 4 star hotel. Location is awesome.

review.title: Hilton Hotel
review.reviewText: First of all, I booked the room and requested 2 beds. I got to the hotel and they only had one bed for 4 guests. They were polite enough to move us to the parlor room however it had no beds so they sent 2 rollaways which they charged me $25 for one and a rollout bed from the sofa. The sofa did not have a rollout bed so I had to go back downstairs to request 2 more rollaways. Then security called 2 times within one minute complaining how my guests and i were "too loud" so I told them we would keep it quiet which we did. My guests and I went out on the town and me and one guest came to the hotel to sleep while the other 2 guests went to get food. They came back after a short while and not even 10 minutes later security is knocking at our door requesting that my guests leave. I tried to talk things out with the manager but she would not cooperate so I then was forced to leave our hotel at 3:30am and drive an hour and a half back home. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again.

review.title: it's ok
review.reviewText: we are travelling with my daugther they knew that before, but I have to ask for her bed...

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Usual city hotel.

review.title: best for the price
review.reviewText: i will come back

review.title: lovely hotel...good guests.
review.reviewText: Good stay at the hotel. Decent price.

review.title: recommended
review.reviewText: Recommended. Convenient to popular city tourist attractions, BART station, and MUNI network. No taxi's required. Staff very helpful for transportation info. Also we were allowed to check in early rather than having put our luggage in storage and come back later.

review.title: Great hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I really like the location of this hotel it was very convenient to major sites and events. I would definitely recommend to anyone traveling that wants to have easy access to transportation around the city etc.

review.title: Customer first is definitely NOT their mantra
review.reviewText: - Arrived to find completely sold out of non-smoking rooms which I had requested - Only option was a smoking room (with my daughter who has allergies) - When we arrived to the room they gave us, it was occupied by another guest - The next morning when we came down to move to a non-smoking room which we were assured would be available - we were told again they were sold out. They eventually rectified but the attitude of the desk staff was HORRIBLE!

review.title: it was good
review.reviewText: it was good a little pricy though. but location was great too. u could catch a cable car 1 block away or bus,... . the catch was the parking that wasnt included and was $45 a day!!!!!!!! I ended up parking 2 blocks away in a garage for 25 bucks a day.

review.title: Expectations
review.reviewText: Overall the Hilton at downtown San Francisco met all my expectations re services provided, cleaniness etc. If I had one minor complaint they have several door men who are all dressed for the part. They did seem to spend more time talking than helping hotel customers into the hotel. Other tahn that it was great.

review.title: Underwhelming and overpriced
review.reviewText: Location near Union Square is good, as long as you're not driving. The hotel charges $45/night for parking (over $50 once tax is factored in), a fact *not* mentioned on Expedia and an unwelcome surprise when we checked in after driving from Seattle. Our room was very, very small, though reasonably clean; however, there were no water glasses at all, and the complimentary water in the mini-bar--the only free thing--had not been restocked. Since we only stayed one night, we made do and got the hell out as soon as we could in the morning. I will not stay here again.

review.title: Okay Hotel
review.reviewText: Clean Hotel. Quick service. No Frills.I would stay there again. It is located in a good location.

review.title: Great San Fransisco stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to all major shopping in Union Square. Major transportation to other attractions is close by. The hotel is huge and the decor is beautiful.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Loved the room and comfy bed. Stayed on executive level. Wonderful view

review.title: So-So mega hotel
review.reviewText: Big, loud lobby with boring but well maintained rooms. The food options in the hotel were so-so.

review.title: San Francisco, Ca
review.reviewText: Overall service was not good, which was very surprising to me, as l expected better from the HIlton.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Excellent location and wonderful food in the City View Resturant even if a bit on the high side. We enjoyed our stay and will definately go back again and stay at the Hilton

review.title: Bedbugs
review.reviewText: My daughter was bit by bedbugs the 1st night of our stay. When I reported the incident to the hotel the reaction was disappointing. They did not have a plan on how to handle the situation - other than notifying security to investigate the report. They asked me if I wanted to change rooms vs. telling me that they would immediately change rooms. I wanted advice on how to make sure that I wouldn't take the bedbugs home and the reply was they "weren't entomologists." Basically the expectation from me was for them to take charge and have a plan - they did not.

review.title: Couldn't be closer to shopping!!!
review.reviewText: We had a very good time at this hotel and plan to return.

review.title: Excellent staff and GREAT beds
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel was allways helpful and nice. Even though the hotel is huge, I could allways find someone ready to help me kindly and efficiently. The rooms are rather small but very clean and the beds were really comfortable. For a trip were you are not gonna spend much time at your room, it is more than enough. The size of the hotel, however, makes it a little too busy some times and the block where it is located is decading rather rapidly. I didn't feel too safe walking from the hotel door to Union Square, and you get the feeling that the Tenderloin is expanding.

review.title: Older hotel and huge. Busy, friendly enough.
review.reviewText: Not in a good area of San Fran and people need to know this. Three star, not four.

review.title: Falling behind
review.reviewText: Poor maintenance (plumbing in bathroom), dirty carpets in rooms, very small rooms, would not go back despite attractive prices, but these very prices should have rang a bell... why would a Hilton in such a nice location be cheap?

review.title: Good deal from Expedia, but disappointing for a Hilton
review.reviewText: The Hilton on O'Farrell was well located for shops, trams, the bart and buses. The hotel is very large. We stayed in Tower 3 which had conference facilities on the ground floor which made it a bit impersonal. The lobby is huge and very busy. Excellent view from the restaurant on the 46th floor in Tower 1, but very expensive to eat or drink there ($30 for breakfast!).
