We got a free pass for the gym from the front desk, but the spa was expensive. We stayed for 5 nights and thought the the rooms were ok - not great but then not bad either. They were quite small but they served their purpose - we were really only there to sleep. The beds were comfortable and the pillows were great. The bathroom was a bit pokey though.

review.title: Highly Recommended
review.reviewText: The Hotel is made up of three tower blocks and given its size we were suprised by the friendly and helpful staff. It had a very relaxed atmosphere and suited us perfectly as a family hotel.

review.title: Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice and very clean. The only complaint I had was getting from the parking structure to hotel lobby. Required a long walk. I suggest if you have a lot of luggage use valet parking.

review.title: parking nightmare
review.reviewText: the parking lot that we werer told to park in cost $102.00 for two nights! such a rip off. otherwise the hotel was nice.

review.title: SF Hilton - Not Impressed.
review.reviewText: While the location was good, the rooms are VERY small, the halls dirty, and overall decor very dated. Dissapointing for a Hilton property!

review.title: Very convinient location
review.reviewText: Will consider if revisit.

review.title: Good option for business hotel in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: The hotel room was quite comfortable and all amenities for business travel were there. It is unfortunate however that they needed to charge the equivalent of aobut 15$ per day for use of the fitness facilities.

review.title: Would recommend it!
review.reviewText: We were greeted with a warm welcome as soon as we stepped out of the taxi. The service was friendly and efficient during our stay. Our room was large and comfortable, with a great view over San Francisco. The restaurant on the 46th floor served good food and again views were fantastic. If you want to stay in central downtown, then this is a great choice.

review.title: Convenient Location and Quiet
review.reviewText: Hotel was great, convenient location, very clean and comfortable room, quiet, nice outdoor swimming pool and hot tub, great lobby for relaxing. Bathroom door configuration across from closet and directly next to front door was awkward and very inconvenient Drinks were overly expensive, and there was a charge for using Internet to obtain and print boarding passes. Concierge staff was very helpful with restaurant location. I would definitely return

review.title: Overall a great deal /location---lower floor gets street noise
review.reviewText: If you want a great location to Union Square and just blocks from the Powell BART this is primo. Coffee in room--A must!!! Beddding was top notch--mattress and pillows very good. even tho we were placed in a smoking room there was no "ashtray odor". Windows open--a big deal for us no matter what.Lobby was a little noisy and very busy but we didn't care. Starbucks in lobby. Only negative from us street noise--told this isn't as bad on higher floors.

review.title: I LOVE HILTON UNION SQUARE
review.reviewText: beautiful, well maintained hotel. Service was excellent and the king beds are sooooo comfortable; i have to say after a long day of walking in SF relaxing on the deluxe bed is superb!

review.title: Memorable Stay
review.reviewText: My husband and I went to San Francisco for our 1 year Anniversary. We stay in a junior king suite on the 19th floor it was really nice and the view was great. We ate at the Cityscape restaurant for dinner, which was excellent and the view was amazing. The jacuzzi was nice, but a bit crowded with children. The hotel is in a great location and we were able to find parking close by that was a bit less expensive than the hotel parking. If you are looking for a romantic getaway to San Francisco I would recommend staying here.

review.title: Hilton Union Square
review.reviewText: It was a lovely stay. I only wish I had had a view. Otherwise was perfect.

review.title: Tried to cheat us
review.reviewText: Tried to put us in a smoking room with 2 doubles despite request for non-smoking king. Had to speak to several managers before getting non-smoking queen. Be careful.

review.title: The worst hotel .......!
review.reviewText: No Customer Service at all.......

review.title: Nice hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: Perfect location. Can walk to everything or take the cable car around the corner. BART is just a short walk away.

review.title: Noisy and Over Crowded Hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: It's been a while since I've stayed at any of the Hilton Hotels or affiliates. I was looking forward to staying here for 3 nights to attend a conference. Maybe I picked one of the most busiest weekends - the wait to check in even in the preferred Hilton Honors line was absolutely ridiculous. The lobby's activity (congestion) reminded me of a Vegas hotel. The worst part of my stay was the constant wandering of noisy people going up and down the hallway at all hours of the night and early morning. Not just going back to their rooms, but talking, laughing as if the concern of the other guests didn't matter to them. There was even one lady calling out someone's name -- trying to figure where her room was I guess.The best part of my stay? The Starbuck staff was very efficient and friendly. But that's Starbucks and there's another one in the hotel next to this one. I'll return to stay at the Nikko Hotel next time (later this month).

review.title: Clean, centrally located, good amenities!
review.reviewText: We were booked into a "smoking room" the first night, despite a request for non-smoking.The hotel was full--and despite its cleanliness, the room smelled like an ashtray. We were moved to non-smoking the next day.Staff is efficient, amenities abound--and although the hotel is rather non-descript in its convention-like ambiance--it was a perfect place for the intense busy weekend spent in SF.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I loved the hotel and the view. The only thing I had a problem was our non smoking room always smelled like smoke. The upstairs dining restaurant on the 45th floor would also rush us before closing time. But besides those two things most of the staff was friendly.

review.title: This is not a goof hotel for family vacation. The hotel does not offer anything for young children.
review.reviewText: The pool is located outside and the San Francisco weather is too cold. The hotel across the street has an indoor pool...we will be staying there next time. The parking fee is also very expensive and the parking lot across the street did not accomodate large vehicles. This is a good hotel for business travel not a family vacation.

review.title: great top floor bar!
review.reviewText: Great place! perfect location

review.title: This Hotel is just to silly expensive for what it provides
review.reviewText: The Hotel Parking is incredibly expensive more like 40% of the room charge . Room Service is terrible and again just to expensive. 50 Bucks for a club sandwich is ridiculous

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great place to stay. Comfortable rooms, friendly staff, and easy access to the city!

review.title: Hilton SF Union Sq
review.reviewText: The pillows were so darn uncomfortable, it gave me back issues and a crick in the neck on a daily basis.

review.title: Great locatioin, good price
review.reviewText: We're usually usually put up at another hotel when we're in town (I work remote for a SF based company) and this time I stayed at this Hilton. Great location as it was in the middle of everything (including being near the ghetto) and it was a great price. They upgraded me to a suite with a balcony, which was a delight! Nice staff, good room service, and all around a great say.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Good place in the city and really pretty hotel with good amenities

review.title: UPDATE - Finally received a reply and hotel management made it right. Will definitely return!
review.reviewText: I previously reviewed the Hilton due to a lack of response from management regarding a rowdy group of young adults that were staying on the same floor. I finally recieved an appropriate response from the Hilton and I can say that they have now properly addressed the service issue. Definitely will be returning to the Hilton.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: We were upgraded to a deluxe executive suite from a standard so that may have skewed our ratings. But it was a great place to stay for the weekend. Centrally located. Far enough from the Tenderloin to feel safe. Nice comfortable bed. Nice lobby to hang out in while waiting for friends.

review.title: San Francisco Hilton Ideal For Business Travel
review.reviewText: While not low budget, the San Francisco Hilton was a fabulous place to stay for the three days I was there recently. Since I'm a frequent visitor to San Francisco, I was not there to see sites, but to have my meeting and relax. They promptly upgraded me to a mini suite that put me in the lap of luxury. I chose to eat three meals in my room. Little things impressed me. The desk set up was very professional and there was a rolling table that fit under the desk for eating or writing on a more comfortable chair. The room was unbelievably quiet, even near busy Union Square. For the tourist-minded, the hotel is walking distance from cable cars, the Market Street Trolley, Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach, City Hall and many other sights. I highly recommend this hotel!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was a very clean, beautiful hotel. The room was a little small and the cost of parking was outrageous, but loved everything else about this hotel. Would definately stay there again.

review.title: Good, but not great
review.reviewText: Good location and comfortable room. The hotel needs an upgrade in general.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, comfortable and within walking distance of the Moscone Convention Center. I would certainly stay there again.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: good.

review.title: Wonderful Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was everything we hoped for! A quick walk to Macys (eight stories and a Cheesecake Factory restaurant on the top level!) The only discomfort in the room was the noise from the street, even from the eleventh floor, but it was clean and maintained beautiful and the staff was AMAZING! WE would love to stay at the Hilton SF again!

review.title: It has met our expectations.
review.reviewText: A very busy hotel. Close to shopping, business district, cable car stops and some nice restaurants. Staff were friendly and helpful.

review.title: enjoyable
review.reviewText: we enjoyed the stay at the hotel. it was close to the shopping in union square. very upset with the price of the parking. there was a parking garage just a block from the hotel that was 24 a night, thought we would get a better deal just parking in the hotel garage... Wrong. we could not believe how expesive it was for 2 nights. the room was very clean and comfortable, the noise on the other hand, the 1st night was fine, the second night though we relized how thin the walls were as we had to listen to neighbors enjoying there stay if you know what i mean.... over all we were satisfied.

review.title: June 2008 Stay
review.reviewText: I thought the hotel was at the best location possible in San Fransico. The first night they had no rooms with a queen or king sized bed so they upgraded us on the second night to a junior room ($50 more than we were paying), so overall they are very nice and helpful. The hotel is pretty standard. It was clean and comfortable. The beds themselves were nice on the back and had new sheets. The bathroom was ok. They have nice toiletries (shea butter soap etc). Area is great for tourists and shoppers and very close to the convention center. We thought we'd stay there again if in San Francisco.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great locations, great service, great everything. I highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Had a good time!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton for our honeymoon. Overall, we had a good stay. When we checked in, our room smelled like cigarette smoke, even though it was a non-smoking room. We were able to open the windows and air it out. The bathtub was not completely clean. The furniture and beds in the room were clean and comfortable. We did not have any trouble with noise (as commented on by another reviewer), and we were on the 11th floor. The parking at the hotel was rather pricey, but we used it due to convenience. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend dining at the Cityscape restaurant, especially for breakfast. The service was excellent and the food was delicious, definitely worth the price. The views from the restaurant were breathtaking both during the day and at night. There were only minimal renovations going on at the hotel (another reviewer had mentioned extensive work being done). We would stay here again.

review.title: Very Satisfied
review.reviewText: Very Satisfied

review.title: I recommend this hotel to everybody
review.reviewText: Hotel in downtown close to everything.I liked it.

review.title: best hotel i've stayed in, can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Very impressed with the quality of the hotel, very friendly staff and clean. The hotel is in the heart of everything to see and experience, would stay there again.

review.title: Overall
review.reviewText: Hotel is currently undergoing some renovation so atleast one restaurant closed. Housekeeping and Maintenance staff very polite. Unfortunately high speed internet connection was anything but and was quite expensive. Also I thought I was paying for 24 hours service but was cutoff at midnite so I was very disappointed given that the third day would have exceeded monthly charge of personal service.

review.title: On the edge of safety..........
review.reviewText: This hotel is on the edge of the Tenderloin district and can be a little but shady. Be careful not to go to the South East AT ALL and do not walk around after dark alone.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: nice hotel, great location, comfortable spaces, but bed was too soft for us.

review.title: Great Customer Service - very pleased
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with the Hilton. We arrived in SanFran at 8:30am and needed to drop off our suitcases so we went to the hotel just to get rid of our bags. When we approached the desk, they actually checked us into our room AND we were thrilled. We went upstairs, unloaded our bags, changed, refreshed and then hit the road to see the city sites. Just dropping off the bags would've been great BUT they were so incredibly accomodating and nice, i would stay there anytime. Room was great (not the greatest view BUT in-city what can you really expect). Food was expensive but good, wonderful linens & 1st class housekeeping. IT made our stay sweeter.

review.title: Will definitely recommend this hotel !!!
review.reviewText: This was our very first time to have stayed at a Hilton hotel and was extremely impressed with the hotel...although we travel frequently, we never had the opportunity to stay at Hilton, but from now on, we will definitely consider this hotel when we travel. Everything was exemplary and we particularly were happy with the security feature in the hotel, ie there was always a security guard by the elevators. We got the best value for our money by staying at this hotel, as recommended by Expedia.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: perfect location...great accommodations!

review.title: Might try somewhere else next visit
review.reviewText: For the most part this hotel is what I would expect from a Hilton. Clean, good service, and well kept. The biggest bonus was the starbucks right in the lobby! The Cityscape restaurant upstairs had wonderful views of the city, and the food was good but not the best I have had for the price. Breakfast was especially pricey in my opinion considering what someone will realistically eat in one sitting. Also, the bedding was not quite as comfortable as advertised. I think that it's time to upgrade. I have stayed in other Hilton family hotels where I have been very comfortable which was one reason I stayed here. Overall a good hotel, but I might be tempted to try somewhere else next time I visit San Francisco.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a good location to the shopping district and public transportation available in San Francisco. The staff was friendly and helpful. The lobby was beautiful with comfortable chairs that you can relax in to meet friends for drinks before dinner or after a long day of walking around the city.

review.title: birthday surprise
review.reviewText: this was a surprise trip for my husband and everything was great. we enjoyed our stay at the hilton, great location, everything is right there. we traveled by foot, bart, trolley no need to have a car..the hotel was very comfortable and the staff was very nice. my room key somehow demagnetized and security procedures were followed and it made us feel good. pool and sauna in the evening after walking all day is a wonderful treat.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: We had a great time in San Fran, the hotel was great. Just wish would have gone to the top, the restaurant/bar should not be missed. The view is spectacular. We will be going back !!

review.title: Mostly good things to say
review.reviewText: This hotel is extremely well located-- near the cable car lines and the BART, close to restaurants and lots of stores. The rooms are clean and the Cityscape restaurant on the 46th floor offers wonderful views. Only negative is that the hotel is so huge that it takes a very long time to get to your room and it's easy to get lost.

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: hotel was clean and well appointed for exploring san francisco service was excelent with all the facilities

review.title: One of the best hotels I've stayed at.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a perfect location. It is conveniently located close to the Union Square area and all types of transportation. Walking is also an option from this are.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The overall hotel stay was less than satisfactory. We were planning to valet park our car at the hotel. Once we arrived at the front of the hotel, an attendant directed us to the parking garage to get our car valet parked. Valet park should be from the front of the hotel, especially for a four-star hotel. Don't ever go to the restaurant of this hotel. Although it has a great view of San Francisco (it's on the 46th floor of a tower), the service is absolutely dissatisfying. The server was rude and didn't even "serve" us. Our food came out, in which our steak wasn't cooked to our liking, and we were never asked about how our food is tasting. After our experience there, we contacted the manager of the restaurant and only received excuses for the aweful service that we had. Coming from a manager, this was shocking as you would think they would care more for the customer. As a result, we will never go back to that restaurant. For that matter, may never even go back to that hotel.

review.title: Good Place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is well positioned for walking around San Francisco, being close to Chinatown, SoMa and the Powell street station. It's about an hour's walk to Fisherman's Wharf via Nob Hill, the Cathederal and Lombard street (be prepared for the hills though!) The hotel staff were friendly and checkin and checkout were very quick and efficient. The only issue I have is the excessive parking charges!

review.title: Cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel especially for the price......Was in a very great location....Would stay there anytime!!!

review.title: 16th Floor
review.reviewText: I don't know how I got lucky - but I got a room on the 16th floor. That is where the pool is...it's great to have a pool area in the middle of the hotel. I got a patio and it was very clean and upgraded. I'd love to stay there again.

review.title: pretty good
review.reviewText: It is good place to stay.

review.title: Beautiful and affordable!
review.reviewText: The Hilton San Francisco Union Square was such a treat. The location was prime - easy to get to any part of the city. Lots of great restaurants within walking distance and close to shopping, theater, movies, etc. The room was extremely clean and looked to have been recently remodeled. Beautiful and snuggly bedding - it was so nice. And the shower was great!

review.title: Hilton SF Union Sq Review
review.reviewText: My room was a little small. Some rooms have balconies, see if you can get one of those. I object when Internet access is $15 a day.

review.title: Indulge yourself
review.reviewText: I have never been to a Hilton hotel before, but this one will definitely make came back for more at any hotel of the Hilton family. The employees are cordials and polite, the place is amazing and clean and it's location is amazing close to almost everything in San Francisco. I was on the third tower that have been recently renewed and the room was so good that was very hard to get up and go out. Indulge yourself, it's worthed.

review.title: Basically Happy
review.reviewText: A weekend stay found us impressed with the Hilton's facility and service. But coffee lovers be aware the Starbucks in the lobby closes at 6 p.m. And don't expect to get any sleep. Admittedly, we were there on a busy Saturday nite, but with a one inch gap under all the room doors, the acoustics are terrible, making for a very noisy nite.

review.title: nice place
review.reviewText: great views, clean rooms.

review.title: Would give it another try
review.reviewText: The hotel is very visually pleasing. Unfortunately it was prom night and the hotel was very, very noisy late into the night. Aslo our room was very stuffy We had requested a late checkout and when we returned to our room after our morning run our keys had already been de-activated. The parking garage is very pricey as compared to the public garage directly across the street. Wish we had noted that sooner.

review.title: Welcomed change
review.reviewText: This was actually the third hotel we stayed at in San Francisco. It wasn't the cheapest and it wasn't the most expensive of our stay, but it was definitely the best. The staff was friendly and helpful and we actually felt like they wanted our business (unlike a more "swanky" hotel only a few blocks away). We were very impressed with the facilities, also. The room was clean, there was a Starbucks in the lobby (we spent a lot of time searching for them over the weekend), and the lobby was very inviting for guests.

review.title: Accessible to the city
review.reviewText: The Hilton was right in the middle of all the shopping, easy to get to Chinatown, the bart, the trolley car. The conceirage(Ken) was extremely helpful in finding a very nice Italian resturant within walking distance. The rooms were clean and quiet. The bed and pillows made the sleeping very easy. We had requested a veiw and got one. I would stay again.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: problems with the hotel balance !!!

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: Next time we go to San Francisco, we'll stay in North Beach. This hotel was fine, but it wasn't a four star. Everything is a long walk. It did have a nice outdoor, heated pool and the beds were very comfortable but the rooms were small. It's a good location if you want to shop, but if you're there for the signts, I'd recommend North Beach.

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: My wife and I visited our granddaughters, and stayed at SF Hilton for the first time. What a wonderful hotel. Airy, open, clean and bright. Everything worked great. Great big lobby. In fact, all the dimensions were generous. Excellent service. Very friendly staff. Just made it an overall highly pleasant experience. Would not hestitate to visit again. My thanks to the folks at Hilton.

review.title: First Class
review.reviewText: Everything in the hotel was immaculate and the hotel personnel were very attentive and importantly, friendly as well. We also felt very safe and secure during our five night stay there. Location was very accessible to public transportation. BART transportation to and from the airport was very easy and by far, the least expensive.

review.title: Good quality and location.
review.reviewText: Nice linens added so much to this stay. Very comfortable bed. Motel room was quiet and relaxing. Convenient to all transportation. Great value, prompt and efficient service.

review.title: Good hotel at San Fransico, Great Location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, City scape its a nice restaurant, great location of the hotel at Union Square. Be prepare to pay 32 dolars a day for parking (localted infront of the hotel)

review.title: Swank Shoebox
review.reviewText: Overall, the stay was very pleasant. Although the size of the room was small about 12'X12'. Lobby and service where outstanding! Prime Location!

review.title: SF Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel is centrally located for shopping, dining, public transportation on the trolley. hotel lobby is nice but the rooms are outdated with dirty carpet.

review.title: Very good but,.............
review.reviewText: the one thing I did not like was having to p[ay the parking fees $45.00/day... When we booked it said free parking! Oh! Well what else, they wanted my business... So they did, but not always.

review.title: Good, but...
review.reviewText: Good, but at one point the water in my bathroom turned a sickly shade of brown, and no amount of running the tap would fix it. I had to wait till morning. Maybe there was some pipe maintenance going on? If so, the guests should have been alerted.

review.title: A True Place To Celebrate
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this hotel on many occasions. At each time the service and attention to detail has been superb. San Francisco is usually a place to try a variety of new things - including hotels. But, we like the Hilton so much we never think of staying anywhere else. It is truly wonderful!

review.title: Just fine.
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice. The spa and health club were great. The room was somewhat plain. Unfortunately, the Cityscape restaurant on the top floor was closed during our visit.

review.title: they woke me up at 7 am on a Sunday!
review.reviewText: I was woken up at 7 am by housekeeping! Um... No... The hotel was very busy and they probably wanted me to check out early... But 7 am??? That's just wrong!

review.title: Good location with decent price.
review.reviewText: nice place to stay.

review.title: Luxury and Location
review.reviewText: The service was friendly and accommodating. The location--near Union Square--was terrific for sightseeing. We found a homey breakfast grill across the street, and we liked it so much that we went there every morning. One evening after dinner, we went up to the Cityscape restaurant up on the 43rd floor, where we had the best tiramisou I've ever tasted. The server was very polite, even though we split the dessert!

review.title: Great hotel, close to everything
review.reviewText: I stayed in this hotel 15 years ago, while it looks similar, its been well maintained and updated to meet what I'd expect today. Room was the same type of room with updated furnishings, new door to the bathroom that didn't take up most of the bathroom. (solid) French doors are a great solution to this problem. Bed and shower were great. No complaints. This is right between Union Square and Market Square, so you're right in the middle of everything.

review.title: Most comforable bed!
review.reviewText: The room was well maintained. Excellent value for what we paid through Expedia. And, one of the most comforatable beds I've ever slept in. We wish we could have taken it with us! Know, however, that the walls are a little thin.

review.title: Prime location and awesome staff! Didn't want to go home.
review.reviewText: Having stayed in only a few hotels throughout my 24 years, I would have to say this is one of the best so far. Their housekeeping staff actually pays attention to the Do Not Disturb sign!!!! They even asked if we wanted the room cleaned while we were headed out to breakfast instead of just assuming so. My only concern was the price of the mini bar and room service (which we did not take part in primarily because of the price). The WiFi/internet service did not work or exist for that matter, but there were plenty of safe, WiFi networks* (see tips) established in the area for us to use. Regardless, there was FedEx Kinko's center (as well as a Starbucks) in the lobby that offered anything you would want. I wouldn't stay anywhere else when (not if) we go back. Staying in Union Square allows you to take the cable car up the the piers and provides you with great shopping within a few blocks.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was most helpful the entire stay, room was great, parking was a little pricey so we parked across the street for half price

review.title: not coming back anymore
review.reviewText: I was revcived by the receptionist very poorly, in very bad behavior, in general all the personal were not so kind.

review.title: Can't wait to return
review.reviewText: The hotel was very relaxing and comfortable. The staff was very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Easy access to the cable cars and a great place to stay.

review.title: Will stay there again, if i return to San Francisco
review.reviewText: very clean, my room had beautiful views from the upper floors, friendly staff and a BEAUTIFUL Restuarant on the top floor..

review.title: we loved it
review.reviewText: our stay was great.The hotel is super.The lobby is stunning and the room with the view of the pool is great but I think the view of the city must be better.The beds are the most comfortable in the world and the location is superb.Do not park at the hotel the public parking across is half price.

review.title: Best Hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel,minutes to shopping center.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel, Comfortable good location.

review.title: SF Hilton is terrific
review.reviewText: my favorite hotel in San Francisco

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: The Hilton is in an excellent location, surrounded by lots of shopping and good dining. We were unhappy with the hotel the first night because the bathroom was having problems, but they switched our rooms and made sure we were taken care of properly. The beds were very comfortable.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Location is great, but the heating/cooling wasn't working properly, so I could not get my room to warm up. Rooms were also very small.

review.title: very impressed
review.reviewText: Very clean, close to everything

review.title: Beautiful Room
review.reviewText: The Hotel was clean and comfortable

review.title: Very big hotel
review.reviewText: It is a very big hotel you dont feel warm. And there is too much noise in the rooms where you can not understand the origin of these voices. And becarefull about not to take rooms close to elevators. It has a very nice restaurant 46th floor with a perfect view.

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: Good value for money. You get what you pay for: it's neither cheap nor superexpensive. Location is very convenient: a few moments' walk from Powell st BART station, and a few blocks away from the very central Union square. Sure, there are plenty of homeless around, but that's San Francisco...

review.title: Very good hotel if you want to be in the city centre
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and would recommend it if you want to be right in the heart of the city. The only downside is you have to pay to use the gym and for internet use.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, and in a decent location. The beds were way too soft, and gave us both backaches. We were shocked that internet connectivity costs $14.95 per day, when you can walk to a coffee shop and get free Wi-Fi. Seemed really cheap in this day and age to charge, and to charge SO MUCH for internet use. The room service prices were insane! We ordered one simple meal and it was ridiculously priced. Our room was small and there was a lot of street noise. Next time, we'll look for different accomodations with better amenities.

review.title: A great place to stay!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great- the only minor negat, everything else was superb!ive ( and I do mean MINOR) was the pillows were too thick!) We are used to sleeping with a much thinner pillow and the only choices we had were thick and thicker! Besides this the hotel was superb!

review.title: A Comfortable and Enjoyable Stay
review.reviewText: I was very happy with all aspects of my stay at this Hilton. My room was clean, very comfortable and from its position in tower 3 provided an excellent view of part of the city. The bed was especially comfortable and the pillows superb! Room service was prompt and courteous and the quality of food very good. Its location so close to Union Square was very convenient.

review.title: Very busy unfriendly and bad
review.reviewText: A total chaos with no service

review.title: Mixed
review.reviewText: The hotel had very good services. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. I found the services in the Cityscape Restuarant to be just the opposite.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: Very convenient location to shopping, theatre, public transportation. Definitely would stay here again.

review.title: Very Nice!
review.reviewText: Good location, good services and great room. The only problem is the price of parking. 45 dollars per day, and that kinda sucks, but other than that, I had a great stay at the Hilton in SF.

review.title: San Fransico Hilton
review.reviewText: Overall a good location, good service and great value.

review.title: Very good location and the view from the restaurant is to die for
review.reviewText: Generally a good hotel. Lots of parties on the night i satyed

review.title: Be careful
review.reviewText: The location was good, but the price was not cheap, the room was very, VERY small and old, as the bathroom! And also, U$50,00 just to park the car in there (self parking)! The valet parking is more expensive! Everything was charged, the internet cost U$15,00 a day. No breakfast included. I realized that as more expensive is the hotel, more they want to charge you. I think Paris Hilton is spending too much so they have to charge for everything! I won't stay there again and not recommend you to stay!

review.title: Satisfied
review.reviewText: Room was a little small with 2 double beds in it,and a little dated. Cityscape lounge was very nice, dinner was good although drinks were a bit overpriced. View of city is exceptional. Great location and reasonable price, although any extras (internet access, parking etc. were expensive)

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The hotel is almost perfect. It's worth it.

review.title: Great hotel for the price
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton. The concierge was helpful, and the staff efficient. Our room had a great view too.

review.title: Hotel Description
review.reviewText: Be prepared for much smaller rooms than normal. I felt like I was in the "Shining" with the long, narrow hallways!

review.title: a bit far from expectation
review.reviewText: The room is smaller than what previously expected. The overall service is ok, but I couldn't sleep past 8am every monrning since the cleaning staff talked loudly in the hallyway outside! They were very punctual everyday !

review.title: ok
review.reviewText: ok

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Very small rooms with view of a parking garage. Long check in line

review.title: Lovely stay at the Hilton
review.reviewText: The room was clean, quiet, and spacious. The amenities were many, excellent and appreciated. I would love to afford to stay at the Hilton for my next visit to Paris, France!

review.title: Excellent Value
review.reviewText: The Hilton Union Square is located a couple short blocks from Union Square and SF Center. The hotel was very clean and very well maintained. Concierge gave us a brochure of restaurants within walking distance. It had a description of the restaurant with price range.

review.title: Not impress
review.reviewText: The hotel did not have that personnel touch, no free parking, they charge for parking at the hotel - the rates were outrageous.

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: the toilet ran the first night and we asked to have it looked at. We again asked twice more, but it was not fixed.

review.title: Make you fell welcomed.
review.reviewText: Treat guests with special care. Very professional

review.title: Great hotel for downtown
review.reviewText: When we first arrived, our room wasn't ready of course we did arrive about 30 mins before the 3:00 check-in time. They were having a very large convention. They stored our luggage and we went to grab a bite. We came back 1 hr later and they still didn't have our room ready. They ended up upgrading us to a vacant jr suite. Overall the hotel was great, however, it was very noisy at all times because of the convention. We only stayed their 2 nights. We didn't get a chance to enjoy the restraurants or anything so I can't tell you about those.

review.title: Very comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: I only have one negative comment and that is the concierge desk staff were unfriendly and not that helpful. Not at all what I would expect.

review.title: comfortable, but a little pricey for what you get
review.reviewText: All in all a comfortable hotel, but has some inconvieniences. For a more expensive downtown hotel, I was a little surprised that no shuttle service was available from the airport. Also, if you are not familar with the area, be sure you get directions, as the hotel is a block or two from less desirable areas. Very central for getting places, but also a popular spot for those asking for money.

review.title: Nice Convention Hotel
review.reviewText: was in town for convention @ Moscone.I enjoy walking, so I didn't find the Hotel too far from the Convention Center. Hotel is also in close proximity to Union Square. Nice resturant at the top of the Hotel with nice views of the city- great place to grab a drink. I would definetly stay again.

review.title: Very good as long as the boss is paying.
review.reviewText: Centrally located near many lovely restaurants, Union Square, and shopping. There is easy access to most parts of SF, and the staff is so very nice and accommodating. IT's not what I would call a bargain, however. The rooms are rather small for that price hotel, as are the bathrooms. But, since all of the prices in the U.S. hotels are inflated due to the low value of the dollar against the dollar, this is about what you will get anywhere you go.

review.title: Thought it would be nicer
review.reviewText: nice but overpriced

review.title: Business Travel
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect for business travel. It is in a pretty decent location close to Union Square, shopping and restuarnts. The hotel was clean and quiet. I had to ask for my mini bar key and my room was overlooking a huge parking lot in the main tower closest to the office. Perfect for business travel.

review.title: smelly
review.reviewText: Need to make coridors more brighter and need change of carpet as the musty odor of old carpet is unberable some times.

review.title: auto check-in!
review.reviewText: After many delayed flights, when I arrived at the Hilton the registration line was long too...BUT I discovered kiosks that allow you to check into your room on your own. I also used those same kiosks to check in for my Southwest flight the next day! That was a wonderful-and quick-treat.

review.title: Great view from the room at night!
review.reviewText: If you want to stay in the heart of Union Square,this is the place to stay. The view of the city at night was fantastic from the balcony. There is also a 24 hour Indian restaurant across the street that is great after a night out. The place is clean and the service is great.

review.title: Hiltion Union square
review.reviewText: This hotel is overpriced for a fact that things such as local phone calls and internet use all comes with a fee which create an overall experience unexpected from a hotel that bears the Hiton name.

review.title: Very beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful and close to the shopping district and financial district. The hotel was very clean and had great service.

review.title: Hilton
review.reviewText: had a really nice stay. they did screw up and give me and my fiance two queens instead of one king size bed but we utilized both beds to our utmost satisfaction %-)

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to transportation, shopping, and great restaurants. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful in locating attractions, restaurants, etc. The room was beautiful and the bed was one of the best I've slept on while away from home. We would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Beauitful
review.reviewText: Great place to stay... A bit expensive, but everything in San Fran is. ENJOY the Spa It is worth the extra money.

review.title: A very good hotel indeed
review.reviewText: I had read mixed reviews about this hotel, but kept an open mind as I like to make up my own mind. I have stayed in lots of 4 and 5 star hotels and feel that I can make an informed comparison for other potential travellers. The location was brilliant - just a few mins walk away from Union Square - fab! The staff could not do enough for you - they were friendly always. The hotel was spotless, as were the rooms. (And I am fussy) If you go - stay in Tower 1 and get a room on one of the higher floors, as we did. The view is amazing! - oh and we had a balcony...bit scary though.... We had a really good deal through Expedia doing a flight, hotel and car package - would highly recommend doing it!! We had an absolutely amazing time - you should go!! Ashley

review.title: August stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Conveniently located, nice rooms, parking is expensive

review.title: Hilton Union Square
review.reviewText: The Hotel itself was nice but it is a Hilton so you expect it to be perfect. Parking was very expensive - Usd. 46 as day! Parking close by was available for Usd. 20.- but in a dodgy area, not very safe. I do not know why they call it Union Square as it is not on Union square, not even close. The location of this hotel is just awful.

review.title: Was expecting more
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location and we got a pretty good price. Upon walking in the lobby, the place looks top notch. I guess that's why I expected more. Unfortunetly, the staff was not very pleasant or helpful, our room - especially the bathroom - was tiny, and there were virtually no free extras. The fitness center cost $, the business center cost $, the swimming pool was free but I'm pretty sure it was the smallest hotel pool ever. There's no continental breakfast and all food and drink is waaaaay over priced. I guess this is probably acceptable to the business crowd who writes everything off, but I was hoping to get a bottle of water somewhere that cost less than $4. It wasn't a bad stay by any means...just better suited to the business traveler or someone who's got a lot of money to blow.

review.title: Excellent hotel and location
review.reviewText: Huge hotel yet all the staff were very friendly and service was very personal. Our twin room was huge and beautiful, tea and coffee in room, and en suite bathroom was excellent and well supplied with quality toiletries. The area felt safe and was only a block from the Union Square shops and cable cars. Several good family restaurants nearby for dinner as well as good value diners for breakfast (hotel breakfast was pricey). Would definitely stay here again if the price was right as it was on this trip!

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Location, rooms, service, bars, & views excellent. Make sure you have a drink (or 10) upstairs at the Skybar with I think is on the 46 floor and watch the sun go down over the Golden Gate. Had the best 3 days there !!!!

review.title: Enjoyed out stay, want to go back soon
review.reviewText: Hilton Hotel prived my husband and I excellent atmosphere, service and cleanliness.

review.title: The one should stay
review.reviewText: Nice area, reasonable price and you could walk to union square, China town & Fisher market.

review.title: SF Hilton
review.reviewText: Currently has a reburbishing project that has closed restaurants and entrances and makes getting around the hotel confusing. Business center has polite staff but only one printer/copier for all printing jobs. Someone's print request interrupted my copying job while that job was in progress. The breakfast buffet was ridiculously expensive relative to the food available.

review.title: Fine San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: Service, cleanliness, and comfort were excellent. Not a new hotel, but very, very good condition for it's age.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was in an excellent location, steps from Union Square shopping, cable cars, buses, taxis, BART (easy public transit from SFO). Lobby was clean, well-lit and bustling with activity. Extremely friendly and helpful concierge and check-in staff. Gave great recommendations for restaurants, city activities, getting around, and winery recommendations in Sonoma for a day trip. Complementary room upgrade provided without asking. Security very visible. Room was clean and efficient, very comfortable king-size bed. Room good quality but nothing outstanding for people concerned with that sort of thing. It was perfect for sightseers who weren't spending an awful lot of time in the rooms. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Very nice accommodations
review.reviewText: This is a very large hotel. The hotel was completely full during our stay, however there was very little noise throughout. We had a great time and good service from the Hilton staff. The hotel location was good (downtown), but it is situated on the edge to a rough side of town. It boarders homelessness and poverty. It is an area you don't want to be in after dark.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our 5 night stay, the hotel is in a great location with excellent shopping nearby.

review.title: the location you cant beat
review.reviewText: staff the best i have seen in the hotel buisness

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: From the hotel's location, there was easy access to the BART, cable cars and bus lines. Shopping was especially convenient as was Starbuck's. The room was tastfully decorated and the beds were extremely comfortable. I had read other reviews that said to request a room away from the elevators so I followed this advice and my request was granted without incident. I would stay at this hotel again...no question, as well as recommend it to others.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The location was perfect. Very close to alot of stores and restaurants. Starbuck's on every corner. We had a wonderful time.

review.title: Love the Hilton
review.reviewText: Great hotel in great location. The room was beautiful and the housekeeping was the BEST!

review.title: Clean but....
review.reviewText: The Hilton Union Square SF is a nice clean facility and we received very reasonable rates. However, if after site seeing in the area you want to use the hot tub or pool, I wish you luck. The pool opens at 5AM when I sure hope to be sleeping and closes at 9PM when I'm just getting back from site seeing. If you try to go in the morning they are ALWAYS cleaning it and have it CLOSED. So forget about using it between the hours of 8AM and 11AM. The pool should be open until at least 10PM, preferably 11PM and be cleaned during the closed hours NOT during the limited open hours. Everyone in our group had an issue with this. Room service, drinks of any sort or food is very spendy, but it is the Hilton and SF is an expensive place. Buy your coffee at Starbucks up the street and you'll save $2.50 per cup. Overall I was happy with the location, the room, the rate and the housekeeping.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: It was a great hotel. Very clean and had a nice pool to sit out by. Only thing is location. Your close to everything, shopping, subway, union square but you also have a lot of homeless down your street. makes coming home at night a bit akward. Not sure if that can be avoided though in San Francisco but it is definately less by the warf.

review.title: Disapointed
review.reviewText: Long time to check in. New locks on some doors so we had 3 different key card. Hotel is too big for the staff in place.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed our stay. We booked two rooms as we went with our 20 year old,and 21 yr.old. We found the hotel clean, and staff very nice and polite. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. They run an efficient tour operation,and were helpful. Hilton Union Square is well located to many resturants, theatre, great shopping. Would much rather stay here than the warf. It has easy transportation, and taxis are better than renting. Went to comedy clubs. Grand City Tour is a good idea to get the lay of the land, some history, and good places to revisit. Lous Blues, Stinking Rose, Punchlines, Loris Diner, Botanical gardens, night tour of Alcatraz......Cityscapes resturant at the top of the Hilton was how we ended our time. Really great dinning with awesome views. The gentleman who is host has been there 36 years, and he was so charming and accomadating.Had a fantastic 6 days, will come back and do the wine tour next time! Have a wonderful time.

review.title: Best Location for Walking, Cable Cars, and Shopping
review.reviewText: We just returned from a four day stay for pleasure. The Hilton was the perfect choice. As a shop-a-holic, I was within just blocks of all the major high-end retailers. The cable car and BART station is just a couple blocks away, and we were able to walk to several great restaurants. Our room was clean, housekeeping was very efficient in providing extra pillows and towels, room service was prompt and the food good (although expensive), and the bathroom (though small) had luxury features such as marble and granite and a wonderfully powerful shower head. The bed was comfortable and outfitted with quality linens and duvets. We would definitely choose to stay here again.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The Hilton was a very nice stay. nice room, not bad for the price. what I enjoyed most was the location, a 6 minute walk to catch the cable cars at Union Square, beautiful architecture everywhere. I would however caution walking to far at night. No complaints here.

review.title: Great hotel to go around the city
review.reviewText: The hotel was great for walking around the city. The service was also good, the staff was very nice.

review.title: In the heart of everything San Francisco!
review.reviewText: We were very comfortable, safe and relaxed. The hotel is in the middle of everything and anything you want to do in San Francisco. You can take a trolley car or the MUNI electric bus system anywhere.

review.title: Bed is very comfortable
review.reviewText: The furniture is too big for small room. Tight. Otherwise, very satisfied.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Generally a nice place to stay while in San Francisco. Excellent breakfast/brunch and food services. Concierge misguided us unintentionally regarding comedy clubs, but overall, efficient and friendly hotel staff. Room was not very spacious, but was still comfortable. Good location for shopping and bar/restaurants.

review.title: Friendliest staff I have ever encountered
review.reviewText: This hotel was fabulous. The staff were very friendly and extremely accomodating. You were made to feel very comfortable and welcome. We had some special requests which were fulfilled promptly and courteously. It is definitely a hotel that I would recommend to others.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Close to shops, theaters, restaurants

review.title: Hilton Union Square area
review.reviewText: one of the best hotels i stayed at. Check-in was quick and easy. Room was exta clean, free complimentary good coffee/tea in the room everyday. Local newspaper at the door every morning. I would definately stay at this hotel again. It is in a great location. 2 blocks from union square. 2 blocks from Market street. Is a 40 min walk to Fisherman's warf or pier 39.

review.title: Great hotel needs to have better beds
review.reviewText: This very large hotel is centrally located, with great views of the city and the bay. The lobby area is very well appointed and the concierge services were top-notch. The food in the restaurants was good but expensive. The staff was efficient and friendly. My room was clean and the decor was updated. I had a great view. My main complaint was that the mattresses were soft and after three days I had a back-ache.

review.title: Newly Remodeled Rooms, Comfy Bed...Awww, Yeah
review.reviewText: While the room I had didn't have much of a view to the outside, it was beautiful on the inside. Freshly remodeled with an Asian contemporary look (sliding shoji-screen doors), luxurious materials (such as black stone for the countertops), and high-end fixtures, this room was more than I had expected for the price in Downtown SanFrancisco. Close to Union Square with a spectacular building top restaurant/lounge on the 46th floor with 14-foot high windows gives a panoramic view of all the sights of the city.

review.title: Hilton, SFO
review.reviewText: Considering the size of this hotel, I would have expected somewhere to get a light meal/bar snack after mid-afternoon. The Bar was very dark, and not particularly welcoming

review.title: I can't believe it
review.reviewText: I stayed in a Junior Suite with my 2 year old and my mother. The hotel lobby was pretty impressive when first arrived, but after that, many surprises followed. - internet access in the room is not included, but lobby is free(?) - there's no microwave in the room to heat up milk and food for my baby - the fridge in the room is not cold at all. - the bath room is so small that it can barely fit two person - no body wash provided - the service of the cafe in the hotel was not good. - parking is not included and the price is very $$$ It was not a comfortable stay as I had expected for Hilton.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay overall. Only one bad part was the check in. The valet parking was confusing and the first check in clerk was not helpful when I didn't have my husband's i.d. because he was at the Giants game. Next clerk was extremely helpful and gave us free breakfast coupons for the inconvenience. Rooms very comfortable and clean!

review.title: You Will Like the Place
review.reviewText: Hotel is very convenient located at center of the city where you can easily get to all points of interest via public transportation or walking distance. Especially, the information desk is very helpful to provide direction and suggestion of tour. Staff are very friendly, not common in the big city.

review.title: it is one of the best
review.reviewText: it is really a cool hotel. I spent there fantastic moments that i can't forget it for ever. I really recommend this hotel. IT WAS UNFORGETABLE TIME YOU WILL ENJOY TRUST ME

review.title: Excellent location, excellent service
review.reviewText: We were impressed with hotel, room, overall service from the staff from the front desk to the concierge. Great fitness facility too. A fabulous location, so what more can you ask for!! Would definitely go back and highly recommended.

review.title: Perfect end to perfect holiday
review.reviewText: Spent 4 nights here as the last leg of a two week romp through California - Excellent choice - very high standards throughout and all of our requests were accommodated. In truth a little pricey perhaps eg valet parking but couldn't have had a better way to end our holiday

review.title: Great San Francisco Hotel!!!!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here with our 3 month old for his first "out of town" trip. The rooms were very clean and nice, service was excellent, and the lounge down stairs in the lobby was a great place to watch the giants games! Rooms are small (which is typical of hotel rooms in the city), but the space was utilized well. Nice workout facility, but they charge you $15 a day. They have a discounted rate for 3 or 7 day use passes. I recommend you go to the City Scape Bar on the top floor; Awesome view! We will definitely stay here next time we are in the city!

review.title: Will NOT stay at Hilton SF again
review.reviewText: I had to pay $15/- a day to use the gym which is absurd. It is not the money , it is the priciple- will NOT stay at Hilton again.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Great location for family vacation, a lot of places to walk to right from the hotel, and only 20-25 min walk to chinatown the hotel is in the middle of the main shopping district, the room was nicely decorated and the bed was extremely comfortable, and the food/drinks in the refrigerator was outragiously priced. Overall good experience at hotel, watch out for the homeless guy, just say "NO"

review.title: Great hotel !
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, location was great...cable car stop 2 short blocks away. Little surprised that you had to pay for internet service...room and bed were great....very comfortable..will stay here again for sure ! Very impressed...

review.title: Will definitely return!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel--centrally located near downtown shopping and the ball park--great place to stay and see Giants game--great view of city. That's just for starters. Staff was extremely courteous and helpful. We had Sunday Brunch in hotel restaurant--it was awesome and reasonably priced. The rooms are very comfortable and well appointed--We will definitely return to this hotel for our weekend getaways to San Francisco.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Good spot in the city; close to everything if you like a good walk. Room was a little on the small side, but honestly didn't spend much time in it, so didn't matter. Go to Cityscape for a cocktail and sit back to enjoy the amazing view.

review.title: Good Hotel, Central to SF and good service
review.reviewText: Room was well appointed for the price point and clean. Concierge was knowledgeable and helpful. Have stayed here before and would stay again.

review.title: Excellent room and services
review.reviewText: Excellent location, very helpful staff, clean room.

review.title: In SF
review.reviewText: Very magnificant Hotel and you can have a good view of Maket str and bay bridge when you stay in higher level. Also it has a very convenient location. Nice choice.

review.title: Nice Place to Stay in a Great Location!
review.reviewText: The Hilton at Union Square is a decent place to stay at a reasonable price. The staff was eager to please and the close proximity to Union Square and the BART is ideal. The room was nicely appointed, but small. The MP3-capable alarm radio and granite bathroom floor were nice touches. Be careful though...there are some pretty rough areas within a block of the hotel that you don't want to walk around in at night. Otherwise, I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Will stay there when I can return
review.reviewText: This hotel was in the middle of alot of action. All you have to do is walk outside a few feet and you can find something to do. Just a short taxi ride to the Giants Ball Park. A little expensive to park your vehicle in their garage.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Great location for family vacation, a lot of places to walk to right from the hotel, and only 20-25 min walk to china town, the hotel is in the middle of the main shopping district, the room was nicely decorated and the bad was extremely comfortable, and the food/drinks in the refrigerator was outragiously priced. Overall good experience at hotel, watch out for the homeless guy, just say NO .

review.title: Very comfortable
review.reviewText: Room was elegant and comfortable. The breakfast was quite expensive.

review.title: Pleased
review.reviewText: We requested a room change upon arrival. Our first room was very small and faced a wall about 20ft. away. Our second room was perfect. The hotel is in a great location.

review.title: watch for extral charges when checking in
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times using expedia and have had no problems, but this last time I went the man at the desk told me to receive 2 beds in a room it would cost me 50 dollars more, so I paid, When I check out I brought this up to the lady checking us out of the hotel and she refunded me the money and said this should not have happened.

review.title: comfort and shopping close!
review.reviewText: I was pleasently surprised with the service and comfort of this hotel. I tend to use small boutique style hotels but could not pass the great flight and hotel combo pricing. The hotel is located in a great area for shopping and museums. Great local pub and diners for the younger crowd. Also close to the street cars(pricey now at $5 one way each). Its cheaper to take taxis but worth one ride for fun. I will be back!

review.title: Excelent Hotel, great location
review.reviewText: as

review.title: Hilton SF Union Square is The Place to Stay!
review.reviewText: This was an incredible hotel. The beauty of the rooms, restaurants and view were only surpassed by the fantastic service we received. The bellmen and the restaurant staff were so accomodating to our every question, need, or request. The manager of the hotel took time to just chat with us about things to do in the area and even about baseball. The hotel is conveniently located close to the BART, the cable cars, street cars so we had no need of a rental car. We took advantage of many of the services provided by the Hilton, including spa services. The hotel has a full time tour agent on staff-I highly recommend taking the city by night tour. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to be pampered and treated like royalty.

review.title: Recommended
review.reviewText: This is a marvelous hotel. Cityscape restaurant has a wonderful bar, restaurant and view. The staff were very helpful and friendly.

review.title: Would stay here again and again
review.reviewText: Upon arrival we were able to check into our room early. When leaving the room, we would always return to the room having been cleaned. The staff was very friendly and inviting, we would stay here again and we will recommend this hotel to our friends.

review.title: Beautiful lobby, average rooms
review.reviewText: The location close to Union Square is great, but know that it's on the edge of a sketchier neighborhood. The in-house food is of the "people on expense accounts don't mind paying way too much for mediocre food" variety. Venture out for food, but do have drinks in the bar for an amazing view. The room was decidedly average (loud elevators), but our price was reasonable, so we were happy.

review.title: Would stay here again.
review.reviewText: We booked a double room for 3 of us (2 adults, 5 year old). Double bed was fine for adult & small child sharing. Room was not big but we didn't feel like we were on top of each other. Great to have a pool for break between walking San Francisco. We did not eat at the hotel - not our thing. Not many places to eat in the evenings - better to venture to North Beach and Chinatown. Overall - pleased with our stay. We do not normally stay in such large hotels but this was clean, comfortable and great location.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was better than the pictures I had viewed online. I was really happy with the service i got there. Tina in the tours department was excellent! For going on a busy week I got everything done in no time...it was fast service. Hotel restaurant on top floor view is excellent.

review.title: Hilton's Touch
review.reviewText: I was very surprised by the comfort that the Hilton Hotels have added to their rooms. The bed with all the feather pillows and duvet were very pleasureable. The coffee in the rooms was wonderful and finally the bath products were just the right touch to start your day.

review.title: Would definately go back
review.reviewText: The Hilton hotel on O'Farrell street is ideally located (a few blocks) to Union Square and the main shopping hub of downtown San Francisco. This is not the first time I've stayed at this hotel and hopefully not the last. The lobby is inviting and the rooms are well proportioned, clean, attractive and comfortable. I've never eaten in any of the restaurants in the hotel but they always look busy and atmospheric. The hotel should certainly be on your list of hotels to stay in when visiting the city.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Staff were courteous and helpful, hotel was well located, well worth all its stars!

review.title: Hilton at Union Square is Unbeatable
review.reviewText: The hotel is so lovely. The Citiscape is the most beautiful I have ever seen and you don't have to leave to enjoy all of San Francisco just by watching the fog roll in. I will do this again. I also saw there is a pool and I will bring my bathing suit next time.

review.title: I will go back
review.reviewText: The hotel was in the perfect location.

review.title: only the view
review.reviewText: My room had a great view but: 1) it was difficult to sleep with the elevators' noise 2) the tub/shower was small and too old 3) the furniture was designed in 1950 4) the TV was at least 12 years old 5) the bed was uncomfortable

review.title: Jammed in rooms
review.reviewText: The room was very jammed. not alot of room to walk around in. Also the bathroom was small. No fan in the bathroom either and the doors for the bathroom was odd. The Concierge was fantastic and check in and out was a breeze. Emploees were very friendly and nice. Wouldn't reccommend the room but would for the service and people

review.title: Always a pleasant stay
review.reviewText: This Hilton is top-notch. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable, and the service is terrific. If you can, try to get a room on an Executive floor just to experience the Executive Lounge for breakfast. The view is worth the extra charge. This is the only hotel we stay in, in S.F. It's close to everything.

review.title: Hotel with the best cityscape view.
review.reviewText: When you first arrive at the Hotel Hilton on Union Square San Francisco your first impression will be the size of the hotel as it covers an entire city block. Upon exiting the your limo, cab or transport you will be immediately greeted by the door man with a friendly smile. The first things that me and my wife noticed when we entered the lobby was the size of the crystal chandeliers, the world globe in the center of the lobby and the leather chairs and sofas that are for your comfort. The hotel room was very comfortable with marble bathroom floor and sink top. 300 thread count sheets with thick goose comforter and very soft bed. It is your guarantee of a comfortable sleep. The room has very stylish wood furnishings and is very comfortable although not very large. The price of the restaurants in the hotel Hilton was a little more then I expected but if you would like a nice view from the cityscape restaurant it is worth the price that you will pay to see the city at night or during the day. The hotel souvenir shop is very convenient and the prices are what you would expect to pay at any souvenir shop. During my stay I made all my purchases at the hotel shop the night before coming home 10 minutes before the shop closed. In my idea Hotel Hilton is a very nice place to stay.

review.title: median hotel in san fran
review.reviewText: my girlfriend and i loved the hotel, but when we checked in they failed to communicate to us that the restaraunt would be closed for remodelling. this was an issue for us since i was going to propose there.

review.title: good location, shame about other factors...
review.reviewText: the stay was okay, although a random guy knocked, waited about 10 seconds then just walked into the room and said he had arrived to fix something in the bathroom! he saw us said sorry then left. i assume he was legitimate because we saw the same chap in another room further down the corridor. the service was a bit disappointing, the restaurant was a joke; ye, a great view but thats about it. its a shame that my memories of san francisco are awesome.

review.title: I will return...
review.reviewText: Enjoyed my stay here!

review.title: Would visit again
review.reviewText: One day they didn't come to clean room we had to call. That was frustrating. We had two rooms and they confused door keys. Other than that it was a great stay

review.title: Excellent location. Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hilton Union Square is in the heart of everything in downtown San Francisco. It is very convenienient to grab a cable car or a bus.So many venues are also in walking distance. The hotel is nice, but I wouldn;t necessarily call it luxurious. The hotel staff were very courteous and helpful. We arrived before check in time and we asked if there was a room available for us to check into early. They only had one and we were allowed to check into it.Upon arrival at the room, we saw that it was very small and smelled of smoke, and we only had to wait a few minutes in order to change to another room. The new room was much bigger and better. There are no refrigerators or microwaves in the rooms, only a mini bar which is very expensive. You can request a refrigerator, but it will cost you per day.There is a $15 per visit charge to the fitness center, which in my opinion should be complimentary. The pool is very small for such a large hotel. Sanfrancisco is a very expensive city. Do some research to find the best and most reasonably priced restaurants. There are plenty in the area. Be advised, the weather in the city can be very cool. You need to travel with a jacket.The temps were in the middle and upper 60's most of our stay. That was wonderful considering we're from one of the hottest states you can be in during the summer,Texas.Best rooms are in tower 2. Would go back to the city and to the hotel. Great Vacation!

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: I specifically requested a room away from the elevators to avoid some of the noise in the corridors, however, even though I was given a room away from the elevators, we could still hear housekeeping knocking on doors incessantly in the morning, as well as all the traffic in the street (9th floor), in short, the walls in the Hilton are paper thin. Nevertheless, the Hilton was a great deal from Expedia and the rooms were fine and in good care.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel based on previous reviews and all suggestions were helpful. Our stay was superb! Location is fantastic to anything you want to do...if you can't walk, the doorman will have a taxi for you in less than a minute and Union Square is 3 blocks away. Car rental offices are available across the street, so you can avoid the long lines at the airport. As recommended by a previous traveler, you can park overnight with unlimited "in & out" for $28 in ramp just across the street. Concierge service is impeccable...they suggested excellent restaurants and made reservations for us. We even received preferential seating at one establishment. All staff were helpful. Main restuarant is very $$ - use the concierge for better options. The bars and quick service deli are great. We will return to this hotel...fantastic experience.

review.title: Relaxing place to stay
review.reviewText: Comforting place to stay afer a long day traveling!

review.title: quiet hotel and close to all
review.reviewText: Very quiet stay and everyone very helpful people working the desks. I always enjoy staying here! And will book again soon!

review.title: Too BIg and Busy
review.reviewText: This Hilton is a convention Hotel, so it was extremely busy and loud in the lobby. The main Hotel restaurant is not always open and is very expensive.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Hole in a bedsheet, a dirty bat tube, plumbing problems

review.title: It was okay
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location if you are going to be in Union Square. The beds are very comfortable and the sheets are wonderful. It is very quiet and you cannot hear other toilets flushing or showers running. The only complaint I had was that they weren't very thorough with the cleaning. The bathroom door was all black, as if something had been spilled down it, and no one has bothered to wipe it down.

review.title: Worst hotel in the world
review.reviewText: This hotel had a bad smell like a restroom smell. So I called front desk employee,and asked to them "I want to change the room." But they ignored it. We couldn't sleep at that night. At next day, We asked refund. But they didn't accept it, too. In stead of, they promised refund of parking fee. But After the travel,they didn't refund it until now. So We think they are so rude and mean.

review.title: Spacious room for the price.
review.reviewText: Hotel room is nice and spacious. The $40 parking fee is pricey but that's being in downtown San Francisco. You can still hear enough street noise even from 12th floor. Otherwise it was a nice stay.

review.title: Best beds in San Francisco
review.reviewText: After a few days in China and Hong Kong, after the long trip through Tokyo and after walking lovely San Francisco for more than 7 hours, it was an extreme pleasure to find out that the beds in this hotel are so comfortable. This led twice to my not attending the resturant for dinner!

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: This was our first time to SF, and we were told to stay close to Union Square.... good advice! The hotel is a couple of blocks from Union Square, and a $10 cab ride to the Wharf. All of the "touristy" stuff is very near by.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Fading 1980's grandeur. Hilton Reward points not collectable when booked through Expedia.

review.title: Love the beds!
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel! Is is within short walking distance for Union Square shopping. They have the best beds and pillows. We also ate at their resturant,Cityscape, which is fabulous!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was wonderful, our previous hotel could not provide a handicap accessible room. Called Hilton and they went above and beyond to make sure a room was available for us on a holiday weekend. I would love to come back again and again.

review.title: Just decent
review.reviewText: When we checked in they didn't have the room we booked. We ended up in a room with one bed the first night and my son had to sleep on the floor. They switched us the next day though. There is a lack of places to eat past lunch unless you go to their upscale restaurant at the top of the hotel. Thankfully the hotel is in the middle of the city and you don't have to rely on the hotel for food if you don't want to. That is the only thing that stopped me from really disliking this hotel. The rooms were very small. I wouldn't stay there again with so many other choices around.

review.title: Great place with kids
review.reviewText: Many of the smaller hotels offer cheaper packages however they don't offer the space and ammenities that the larger hotels like the Hilton, can offer. We traveled for work and pleasure and found the hotel very convenient and child friendly. The restaurants were great and the staff was friendly. I visited the Spa and LOVED it! Great location in Union Square and the cable car pick up was 2 blocks away...very convenient!

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location, just blocks from the BART station. Service was excellent. We arrived at 830AM, requested an early check-in and got our room! Our ironng board was busted so we called room service and they were there in 5 minutes to fix the problem. Did not eat in the hotel but there are plenty of good places nearby. I recommend the bar at the top of the hotel for the great view of the city.

review.title: A fitting establishment in Union Square
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly enough. I had one guy behind the front desk that was a little dismissive but that might be 'cause I have dreadlocks. The King room was comfy, well laid out, ... great city view. The elevators are super fast. Room service menu is extensive. You're within walking distance of the touristy areas on one side and the more Downtown San Fran locales on the other. Next time my company books me in San Fran and I have to book fast, I'm gonna look this place up.

review.title: A Grand Day Out
review.reviewText: The service facilities and general quality of this hotel where fantastic. Me and my partner both enjoyed or stay there and came away fully refreshed

review.title: more than what you expect.
review.reviewText: best location, good overall service and polite customer service.

review.title: Where's the Ice? & Parking
review.reviewText: This hotel has fancy silver ice buckets in the room, but the problem is you can't find the ice machines. Nothing in the room tells you where they are, I called the front desk and they said ice was located on the floor above me and below me and they were not there.

review.title: Best Hotel in San Fransicso
review.reviewText: This beautiful hotel sits in the perfect location in SF! You can walk to Chinatown, Japantown, Market Street, the Haight, and just about anywhere else you want. The service and rooms at this Hilton are incredible. This is the only place we'll stay.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Great central location and close to MUNI services for longer trips. Super room rates and staff. Would recommend to others.

review.title: Just what we wanted
review.reviewText: The staff was great but housekeeping was exceptional at least our person Arnel was the best I have ever had hands down.Cityscape the restauraut and bar on the top of the hotel has fantastic views.I would stay there anytime I visit.Great location

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location, close to all major attractions. We didn't have to rent a car while staying at the hotel. It is a bit far from Fisherman's Wharf, but since the hotel is close to the cable cars, we would hop onto the cable cars and go to that area.
