The food is too expensive at the hotel, but when you're so close to different restaurants, you wouldn't want to dine in the hotel anyways! The room was clean and comfortable. We were on the 17th floor (which is one floor above the pool), so we had a good view. The pool area has a small size pool and a HOT TUB!!! Awesome!!!!

review.title: All you could ask for
review.reviewText: great location for shopping, cable cars and transportation/muni system. hotel room service menu and bar very expensive. Plenty of other places to eat and drink nearby. 24 hr. diner and a covenient store. Starbucks down the street too! the heated pool and whirlpool was very nice with pently of lounge chairs. spa service at hotel was great. would def. stay there again!

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Hotel 2 blocks from cable car turnaround, easy to find and centrally located to all the attractions. Staff helpful. Restaurant very over priced for what you got.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Beautiful place to stay, close to everything!!!Clean, nice, lovely!

review.title: Small rooms and the parking garage situation was confusing!
review.reviewText: All in all the experience was good...they were doing maintenence while we were there so some of the elevators were not availble. The parking lot situation is very confusing and they did not mark the entrance and exitsa vey well. It tok us a long time to figure it out and a lot of walking around aimlessly. The proximity to union square was perfect and besides the room being a bit small we enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Its got everything you need....
review.reviewText: Large spacious rooms and the reception hints at luxury. Efficient checking in / out. Helpful staff. Cannot fault this hotel although it can be quite far from the usual tourist traps like alcatraz, golden gate bridge and fishermans wharf. Short taxi journey though.

review.title: Nice hotel for the price good location
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable hotel with a nice bar, food is not too good, drinks are over priced. Service and staff were adequate. I will stay there again.

review.title: Greate location nice view on the high floors
review.reviewText: Greate location nice view on the high floors section one.

review.title: Nice!
review.reviewText: Classy accomodations and a great location adjacent to Union Square and close to the financial district. The bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in; subjective I know.

review.title: Excellent Place to Stay
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights, we asked for a room either off the street, or a room that was on a high floor, we got both! Our room was big comfortable and luxurious! The room service was fabulous, and the staff a delight to be involved with. The day we checked in we had an issue with the modem in our room, the maintenance personnel not only came up and replaced it immediately, but we were complemented with a free movie rental of our choice for the inconvenience of them having to come and take care of it. The hotel is located in an ideal area for tourist attractions, as well as business. You can walk to most things and the BART is located 2 blocks away, so no need to rent a car and pay high prices for parking. This is definitely a hotel I plan on returning to again the next time my travels take me to San Francisco!

review.title: Will stay here again
review.reviewText: Nice hotel.

review.title: enjoyed my trip
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was nice. we were upgraded to a larger room, which certainly didn't hurt. I was disappointed in the conceirge staff there. We had made a request for a fan in the room, and the conceirge staff repeated told us that they didn't have any available. We had to request maintenance to come up because the TV was broken, and they quickly responded to both the call for the TV and brought us a fan. So, overall, it turned out fine. The rooms were clean and the hotel's location was great.

review.title: So many mix ups...it was terrible...for such a great looking hotel
review.reviewText: we booked 3 rooms for 1 night, we wanted to enjoy the parade (chinese new years). well they gave us keyes to rooms that belonged to other guest, luckly they were folks we knew...they charged cc's to the wrong room...they locked 2 of us out of our rooms, cause they mixed up keys, it was so screwed up...i would never book multiple rooms ...they cant seem to handle it, to bad..location was soooo awesome

review.title: Nice but Parking Structure a Mess
review.reviewText: I thought that the hotel was nice and the staff was very friendly. It can be a little confusing to locate your room and the parking structure. This hotel has three different towers. The parking lot was kind of small and there was construction going on at the time I was there. I was kind of disappointed that I had to pay $40 a day to park.

review.title: Wonderful, but no food
review.reviewText: We truly loved the Hilton. However, the only meals that were served were Breakfast in the Cafe and an EXPENSIVE dinner at the Top of the hotel.(If you could even get in as they had it closed for private parties 3 of the 4 days we stayed). The bar service was next to nothing. You literally had to tackle a waitress to take your order or give you your check. Everything else was great. I would just like to see more choices for dining in the Hotel so a tired business person could come back and not have to leave again to eat.

review.title: A good one...
review.reviewText: It's a good choice to stay in San Francisco. Near from the atractions with fair rates and good service. It should be renewed in a short time, but it's ok...

review.title: Great location, very clean
review.reviewText: Standard room is just standard. Nothing fancy. Parking at the hotel was not free which was disappointing ($40/day + tax)

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: Very good hotel in a great location.

review.title: Much better than expectations
review.reviewText: Service was flawless. Desk set up three different rooms on busy weekend right next to each other (by upgrading the rooms free of charge). Great ambiance and excellent location for shopping, restaurants, shows. Stayed in many hotels in San Francisco and this could be the best in terms of location, price and comfort.

review.title: One of San Francisco's finest
review.reviewText: From the moment you pull up to the hotel and the doorman greets you, you know you are in for a real treat. The hotel is simple beautiful and white glove clean. The decor is spectacular especially during the Christmas season. I will return again next year for another wonderful time.

review.title: Great place to stay when Holiday shopping
review.reviewText: great location for shopping and exploring Union Square - The room had been nicely updated but the bathroom was a little cramped -

review.title: Clean room but a little small
review.reviewText: The location was ideal but the room was a little small compared to other Hilton hotels we have stayed in before.

review.title: I would stay again.
review.reviewText: Very pleasent stay. Excellente ubication. Higly recomended.

review.title: Good place to stay for Seahawk Fans
review.reviewText: The Hilton Union Square was beautiful and had numerous cafes and great food. The sports bar is a great place to watch the college games. We flew down there to watch the Seattle Seahawks at Candlestick stadium. Great trip, but they lost!! Hilton was very clean, but the rooms were small, but comfortable. I suggest staying in a deluxe room if with a family.

review.title: location
review.reviewText: Great location just a block from Union Square and restaurants and shops are around the corner. The room was great,room service quick and room was very comfortable and clean. Would love to stay there again.

review.title: Hilton Hotel
review.reviewText: We keep coming back to this hotel when we stay in San Francisco. It is clean, comfortable, and a great location.

review.title: Great Hotel. Can't beat location.
review.reviewText: Hotel had excellent service and was well situation for a short trip to see San Francicso. Very close to Cable Cars, BART, and buses. Walking distance (if you like hills) to pretty much anywhere (San Fran isn't that big). We definitely recommend it.

review.title: SF Hilton - Union
review.reviewText: worth all of its stars.

review.title: Great for Retail Travelers
review.reviewText: This hotel was great for me. I had Saks, NM, Bloomies, and Nordstorm in walking distance from the hotel. It helped that I did not have to get into a cab everyday.

review.title: Really worth staying here
review.reviewText: everything in this hotel is so perfect. Its great place to stay right near union square.. I would stay at the same hotel again if I am in the area in the future...

review.title: Would return but may consider the Wharf...quieter
review.reviewText: Room was a little tight for 2. Heard other rooms are larger.

review.title: very comfortable bed!!!
review.reviewText: Overall it is a very comfortable hotel! But the room we stayed in was really small! It is a 4 * hotel so I expected the bellservice to bring our bags to our room but unfortunately they didn't have enough staff, I was very disappointed! But the bed was sooo comfortable!

review.title: Style
review.reviewText: Decor could use some updating

review.title: Not satisfied
review.reviewText: Well let me tell you about my experience at sanfrancisco it wasent what i expected the hall ways where so plain it seam like its never ending. The walls are so thin you can hear your neighbors at night,that is not good they charged me for using the parking lot,which i thought it came with the package deal.Dont think ill go to that hotel any time soon.......

review.title: Great service , and location
review.reviewText: I recomend every thing in this hotel, the service, restaurants, location ,tourist information, rooms! we had a great time there.

review.title: Pretty immpressed
review.reviewText: I would definately recomend this hotel to someone and I would stay here again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: You couldn't ask for a better location to use as a home base in San Francisco. Very convenient to cable car lines, rental car agencies, and the freeways. Hotel room was small - not quite as small as the boutique-like hotels I've stayed in, but not as large as I expected. Lobby bar was comfortable. Staff were helpful - check-in took 5 minutes. I would stay there again and would suggest to others too.

review.title: A great place to stay
review.reviewText: Really nice rooms and the housekeeping staff is friendly. The hotel is very clean and it's a nice environment. On the other hand, there aren't enough good channels on the cable-TV, and there needs to be more people working at the lobby to assist guests during check-in.

review.title: additional walking required
review.reviewText: Wow! This hotel is HUGE. The room was comfortable and in a good location if you want to be near Union Square, Trolley, Shopping, and BART. The only drawback was the distance required to get around the hotel itself. If you want to go to the pool for example get ready to walk. Or if you need to go back to the front desk it was a hike. After long days of touring, I just want too be in my room quick, and this hotel is a city block long.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is not only clean, comfortable, affortable, but its locations is wonderful.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, although I was not impressed. The lobby looked like a beautiful hotel, but the room was standard. Actually the room was small, but the bed was very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful though. I thought I was going to be a little closer to Union Square, but overall it was nice and quiet and had all the amenities one needs.

review.title: I will stay here again
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in an ideal location. Within walking distance from union square and the cable cars. The only negative is the parking fees at the hotel. I would suggest parking across the street in the parking structure for half the cost (if you don't mind walking). Over all very nice :)

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Very disappointed with overall 4 day, 3 night stay. Room was small. Though exhausted from sightseeing all day, the thin walls made for very noisy and restless nights.

review.title: Fantastic!!!
review.reviewText: Fantastic!!! Close to most of the major attractions.

review.title: noise
review.reviewText: The only problem was the noise. The walls seemed pretty thin and I could here way to much commotion from the hallway and the surrounding rooms. The rooms were also a little small.

review.title: Nice Hotel and Great Location
review.reviewText: The lobby is fantastic and the rooms were very nice, but the bathrooms are pretty small. The hotel is in a great location just minutes from great shopping and dining. And only 15-30 minutes to many other sight seeing areas by foot or cable car.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an excellent location...central to everything (Union Square, Market Square, North Beach, the Wharf). We didn't need a car to go anywhere, it was either walkable (if you like hills!) or reachable by the cable cars. We stayed in a basic room, which was a bit small, but we only slept there. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to be close to everything. It was clean, the hotel staff were very friendly, especially the concierge staff.

review.title: Would use this hotel again.
review.reviewText: The hotel was a great location, clean rooms, and convenient amenities (taxi and shuttle service). Only complaint is the hotel staff on one occasion was not very helpful - attitude of tired of tourists. However, the service improved over the weekend and the staff was more helpful.

review.title: Exceptionally good hotel for the price
review.reviewText: I would definitly recommend this hotel to anyone going to SF. The shopping and restaurants of Union Square were only a couple of minutes walk away from the hotel. The rooms although a little small are very clean and well decorated. The beds were extremly comfortable and bathrooms clean - exactly what you would expect from the Hilton. The bell boys are extremly helpful and directed us to a much cheaper carpark than the hotels. All in all an excellent stay!

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Great location. Helpful staff. Drinks on their top floor with panoramic views... priceless.

review.title: Will definitely be back
review.reviewText: In a great location and everything needed is either on premises or within walking distance. Felt comfortable walking around in the evenings in this part of town. The hotel was passing out ice cream in the lobby during the hottest week of the year - nice touch. Spa personnel was very professinal and nice. The only complaint was that I was above the pool which started getting crowded and noisy by 8AM every day. Otherwise, a great hotel that I highly recommend!

review.title: Hilton SF
review.reviewText: Very comfortable, great location. Walking distance to Union Square, nice art galleries, and theaters.

review.title: Quality, service oriented hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: The view from the 29th floor of the hills of SF was inspiring. Bell hop service was prompt, courteous, and professional. The lobby is spacious and luxurious and a treat to meet business assosciates as well as friends in that environment. Union Square, shopping, restuarants, and even Chinatown are within walking distance. I'd go back.

review.title: The Hilton delivers location, comfort, and class!
review.reviewText: Thank you Hilton for an incredible stay. We were given a view room of the Bay and Bay Bridge! 33rd floor up (executive level)--what a view! The fireworks display on July 4th was unriveled! The room was beautiful -- the bed was so amazingly comfortable (which was a good thing after all our exercise while there -- those hills can definitely kill). Executive Level guests get a morning paper as well as a lovely continental breakfast. When I say continental, believe me this is a better than average continental breakfast (much much more than coffee and a roll). We also had one of the best chicken quesadillas ever down in their lobby sports bar. The Hilton staff was friendly and very accommodating. The location could not be beat...we were a few blocks from the cable car route and within walking distance of Chinatown. The hotel is right next door to some of the best shopping in the west coast! Kudos to all the concierge staff--we applaud your vast knowledge and excellent recommendations for sight seeing. By far the best concierge staff we have ever run into at any hotel/resort. We will be back Hilton within 6-12 months, save us a great view room!

review.title: We certainly enjoyed our stay!
review.reviewText: All of the staff were very generous and pleasant whenever we had questions. We enjoyed the variety of restaurants from which to choose. Our room was comfortable and we felt safe. Also enjoyed the newspaper each morning and the coffee maker. We will definitely stay at another Hilton when we take another trip.

review.title: Had a great time
review.reviewText: The hotel is located a stone throw away from the Union Square. Very impressive lobby. The rooms are clean, comfortable and have just the right amenities...

review.title: Beautiful hotel located at Union Square
review.reviewText: Beautiful, clean and centrally located. I loved the view from the VP room and the restaurant. Thanks!!!

review.title: Great location for shopping!
review.reviewText: Hotel is located only blocks from San Francisco's best shopping. Very nice hotel although they charged a ridiculous amount to park in their garage. Centrally located in Union Center - this area is okay during the day, but did not feel comfortable in the evening. Room was comfortable and staff helpful. Don't count on using the pool - it's outside and water was freezing!

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: This is my second time using the Hilton. I really like the rooms and the service is pretty good. However the room service food is awful and at $40 a night for guest parking, and $10 a day for internet, its very pricey. I think they should at least offer internet for free.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel...room was a little small, but comfortable overall. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Fantastic! We'll be back!
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel. Everyone was very friendly, accommodating and helpful! The location was central... close enough to walk to China Town, Union Square and the cable car turn-around. Rooms were nice, and the views were great! Ask for a bay view. Swimming pool was good to have for the kids after a busy day of sightseeing.

review.title: Great deal!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great! The location was awesome. The staff recommended two great restaurants and we loved it!!

review.title: Excellent quality and value for money
review.reviewText: Excellent location just 5 mins walk from Union square and cable car stop. Room is large and in excellent condition. Decent breakfast with good selection of restaurants and bar within the complex. I will definitely use this hotel again on my next trip to SF.

review.title: Would Stay Here Again
review.reviewText: We had a fabulous view of the city with really comfortable beds in a quiet room. Safe neighborhood just blocks from shopping, trolley stop, Union Square, restuarants. We will stay here again.

review.title: right in the heart of san francisco
review.reviewText: wonderful champagne brunch sunday atop the hotels' restaurant Cityscape. staff was very friendly and accommodating, sports bar was a bonus to watch the world cup and play pool. the spa was a treat, would recommend massage as well as the manicure/pedicure. the facial however was a bit mediocre but overall great staff and the robes were really warm.

review.title: Liked the location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Easy access to Union Square and the BART rail station so travel from the San Francisco airport was a breeze. Everything we wanted to see and do was with in walking distance. All the car rental agencies where with in a block of the hotel so it was easy to get a rental car if needed.

review.title: Hilton San Francisco downtown
review.reviewText: Fine hotel with excellent service and food. Room was at pool level with outside private patio. The hotel dining was very good for breakfast, however pricey. Cityscape restaurant at 46th floor was in all respects excellent. Parking in the hotel garage was VERY expensive considering paying room price for 6 days. As everything is expensive in SF, it may not bother some people.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Hotel is walking distance to fantastic shopping, a cable car line, a myriad of small but good restaurants, Chinatown and even two Walgreens. The room was small since I had my mother and adult daughter with me but we got along fine for close quarters. I was able to print our boarding passes in the hotel lobby at a kiosk designated specifically for that purpose...at no charge! I would definitely stay there again, given reasonable rates.

review.title: Great choice in Union Square
review.reviewText: Location is excellent - near shops, restaurants, cable car. Rooms are small, but comfortable. Service is good. Lives up to the Hilton name.

review.title: Somewhat noisy
review.reviewText: I recently spent a weekend at this hotel. Everything was up to par for a hilton except for the noise. Much of this was due to the design of the doors into the bathroom. Whoever designed the room layout installed small "French Doors" going into the bathroom. The doors were constantly banking shut due to the stiff closure springs. Whenever this happened (seemed like at least every 15 minutes) everyone throughout the entire floor could hear it.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Myself and four other ladies spent five days at the Hilton San Francisco. The location was great for us right off Union Square. We were a block from all the shops. The rooms were nicely appointed compared to NYC last year!! The rooms were very clean! Very nice stay for all of us. Highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: First class hotel!
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, clean hotel, and everything you need at your fingertips! This hotel is beautiful inside! Negatives: We had a room facing a concrete wall with a not so pretty vent outside our window. We also had a crying baby on the other side of the old, thin wall. Other than that, it was great! Our bed was super comfy!!!

review.title: Smoking rooms
review.reviewText: If you request a smoking room, ask for a floor above floor 10. The view from floors 9 and 10 are a grey stucco wall about 3 feet from your window.

review.title: A Enjoyable visit at San Francisco's Hilton hotel..................
review.reviewText: We had a great time during our stay in San Francisco at the San Francisco's Hilton hotel. It was very clean, quiet and centrally located to all of the city and the city's attractions. Everything was top notch and very professional. The only flaw was that when me and my wife rented a car for one day to drive around the city and to visit Oakland. The overnght parking rate at the hotel was a shocking $45, which seemed a little high. Overall the amenities and the room and service of the hotel was top notch, during a busy holiday weekend at the hotel.

review.title: Underwhelmed
review.reviewText: Felt like I was going back to my old college dorm. Actually I would have prefered the dorm where two people could actually stand in the bathroom at the same time and could also walk side-by-side down the hallway, niether was the case at the San Francisco Hilton. On a positive note, the lobby was very nice and the hotel was close to the cable car station on Powell.

review.title: Great area to stay
review.reviewText: We found that the Hotel always had either garbage or room service trays in the hallways. The rooms where nice, no bathroom privacy though. Check-in and out where easy and the front desk was very knowledgable about the area and things to do.

review.title: Efficient hotel, good location
review.reviewText: This hotel is very large and is located just off Union Square. The room I had was small but comfortable and clean. Reserving, checking in and out went very smoothly and the hotel staff was very efficient. Especially the location is great. The hotel itself is nothing special, the city has hotels with more charm for the same price, but maybe with less comfort. What I thought was a bit annoying was that you had to pay extra for WiFi. In most hotels in the US of half the rate you pay for the Hilton, this is complementary.

review.title: Good for a Large Chain in SF
review.reviewText: Although I am a frequent boutique hotel traveler, I really enjoyed the Hilton. They had a good sports bar, many TVs if you are trying to catch a game.

review.title: Completely impressed
review.reviewText: My daughters and I loved the hotel. It was more like a small city encapsulated in a hotel. Everything you could possibly need, was there. We will definitely stay there again.

review.title: good enough hotel in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Good location for shopping and easy approach to anywhere in San Francisco. Hotel room is very well arranged but I felt it was little small and tight. I want to stay again if I go to San Francisco next time.

review.title: Good Hotel downtown
review.reviewText: This is a nice Hotel you'll enjoy your stay there. Staff is friendly,courteous,helpful. The hotel is clean, rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. You can't say that about all hotel beds.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: The front desk staff was very attentive. Several features inside I couldn't wait to get back to relax after a hard days work. Overall the hotel was great but I wish I didn't have to pay a daily rate for high speed internet service. I will definitely visit again for business or pleasure.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Near Union Square, it was close enough to financial district I could walk to work. The rooms are a little older, but nothing to be concerned about. It's probably been overall the best hotel/hotel room I have stayed in so far in SF. Rooms are very quiet, which is a big plus after long day of work.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located in downtown San Francisco. The staff was very helpful and the rooms were beautiful. We were very pleased with our experience and would definitely return.

review.title: Great hotel, convenient location
review.reviewText: The hotel -- true to the Hilton brandname offers excellent service, spacious rooms, clean and comfortable. The staff is attentive and responsive. The hotel is conveniently located at the downtown area, close to Union Square, not far from the SFMoma and the convention center. One caveat only: not all rooms share the magnificent views of this beautiful city.

review.title: A Solid Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hilton San Francisco provides first rate service. The staff are extremely cordial and accomodating. It is located in a good location with easy access to shopping, restaurants, and the cable cars. The room was comfortable and clean but a little cramped, a lot of oversized furniture in a small area. Overall, it was a nice hotel.

review.title: Too Large For Its Own Good
review.reviewText: After staying at the hotel next door the day prior, the Hilton rooms felt small. My kids were playing near the beds and I could see dush particles floating in the air. Shouldn't all hotel have LCD tvs now? The local cafe was awful. My kids barely touched their breakfast and I don't blame them.

review.title: Centrally located to most things
review.reviewText: Our stay was great! The beds are like sleeping on clouds. We were in walking distance to Union Square, Market St. and Powell St. (Cable cars) It was a nice relaxing trip and you have to visit Spa Fusion and get a massage!

review.title: Luxurious beds, Great Location, Wonderful Staff
review.reviewText: They allowed us to check in early after a very long flight and the front desk was very pleasant. Service at the restaurant was not very good, but the rooms were very nice, albeit small. Wireless internet available in the lobby at no charge using my laptop, but didn't work for me in my room. Still, the bed was very cozy and the bathroom was a nice marble tile. I'd definitely stay here again. $10 for everything store in the lobby was very handy for getting a scarf when it got chillier than expected.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: Compared many reviews of different hotels..This one had the most amenities for the price and the location. Just a few blocks from Union Station and the BART. Given what others were saying about hotels in San Fran (i.e. the size, cleanliness, etc.)this really seemed top notch. I would definately stay here again and hopefully sooner than later. Oh..and the staff was very friendly and helpful!!! Was in town for the David Gilmour show in Oakland and using the BART was not only affordable, it was took us 1 block from the show!!!

review.title: An Ellegant Place In San Francisco
review.reviewText: The San Francisco Hilton is a great hotel that offers great services and confort at an affordable price. I don't hesitate in recommending this hotel in the heart of downtown.

review.title: good place in the center of frisco
review.reviewText: hilton has it is!!

review.title: San Francisco downtown Hilton
review.reviewText: Pros: Great location. very clean/comfortable. Cons: Charge $10/day for using fitness center.

review.title: Extremely good and affordable too
review.reviewText: Extremely good, perfect location, four stars for the price of three. Though parking is rather expensive. Nice view restorant on 46th floor. Be aware that food may not available there after 9 pm, only drinks...

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Big Hotel with great service. Only confused about arriving and pulling up to check in at the main entrance. Was told to pull around to the back entrance because the front was for taxi's and limo's??

review.title: Big is good
review.reviewText: Union Square is full of great, small hotels. The Hilton is huge, but does not allow that to lower its service level. Several restaurants, prompt and courteous housekeeping, good desk service (except for trying to register electronically), etc

review.title: I Really and Truly Left My Heart in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is a gem. Service is top-knotch. Food is delicious from Room Service to the Bar downstairs to the Cityscapes Brunch!!! The Brunch was absolutely delicious; variety of foods and service was just perfect. Everyone that worked at the Hilton were courteous and helpful. We will be travelling back there next year as five days in glorious San Francisco was not enough for us.

review.title: This hotel rules!
review.reviewText: This Hilton is beautiful. They have redone several floors, and the rooms are elegant, comfortable, and stylish. The hotel is within blocks of China Town, Japan Town, Market Street, Union Square, and the Mission District. This is the only place we'll stay in S.F. It is worth the price, and the amenities are terrific.

review.title: Great location in San Francisco - Very Impressed
review.reviewText: My husband and I were celebrating our 25th anniversary with this trip to San Francisco. We absolutely loved the architecture and beauty of the city itself. Our hotel was just beautiful - staff was very courteous, kind and helpful. The food at the hotel is fabulous. Try the Cityscapes Brunch on Sunday. Amazing! The only disappointment I had was there was no HBO on the TV because I wanted to watch the Sopranos premiere.

review.title: Very nice hotel for the price
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the perfect location, very close to Union Square.

review.title: Well worth the visit
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and very nice. The lobby area is very impressive when you first arrive. Hotel is close to the square and very central for site seeing and walking.

review.title: best hotel in usa
review.reviewText: like a home away from home.it was fab from the lobby area all the way to the roof.the resturant "cityscape"fab servie food great.the spa highly recomended.very convent for the tourist and shop addicts.you would never stay any where elsr .enjoy

review.title: Standard know-what-to-expect hotel, too big/Vegas style configuration
review.reviewText: The hotel is fine overall, but its confusing 3 tower configuration can be a bit impersonal. However, the staff was very attentive, and the room up to expectation.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a good area. I stayed here for the MacWorld Expo and it's not a bad walk to the Moscone Center.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: This is a perfect place to stay. Union Square is close to all the sights of San Francisco. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Very convenient
review.reviewText: The location is really good and the service was great too. The room is not very spacious but clean.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Internet access only available in lobby or 9.95 a day. Unable to print boarding passes. These are complimentary at other hotels in SF. Room was musty and toilet did not work. Asked to be moved to room on same floor to be with family, but hotel staff seemed not to care and we were roomed 6 floors away.

review.title: very good stay
review.reviewText: perfect room and nice atmosphere. very good connection from hotel to city, downtown, shopping, sights etc. over-all service was (very) good but concierge only OK

review.title: Fine
review.reviewText: Good downtown location. Large hotel is comfortable. Indoor parking.

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: Very nice

review.title: Surpassed our expectations.
review.reviewText: We had read some of the previous reviews before travelling and because they'd recently re-decorated this hotel some of these review didn't hold true. It was a beautful hotel in which to stay over the Christmas period with only a stroll down the road to all the major shops, cable car and other transport. Union square is definately the place to be when staying in San Francisco.

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: it's very close with Union Square...very convienince

review.title: Convenient location and great value
review.reviewText: Hotel is located near Union square in short walk to all shopping and short ride to all attractions and tourist destinations. It has all you need for business travelers or tourists.

review.title: Nice lobby
review.reviewText: One of the largest and nicest lobbies I've seen. The cleaning could have been better. We found a sweater in the room!

review.title: Best Located Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is luxurious and don't miss to go to their level 46 Cityscape restaurant for SF city view.

review.title: Delightful Stay
review.reviewText: We had a very non-eventful trip to San Francisco, and the Hotel was about the only thing that was consistently good. One thing I hadn't anticipated...it costs about $40 a day to park at the Hotel with taxes, yikes! We ended up paying more than an extra night just to park my car. Factor that into your expenses if you're driving!

review.title: Great hotel but noisy, walls are paper thin!
review.reviewText: Bequtiful lobby, rooms are not spacious but pleasant, not a very nice view of the city.

review.title: we enjoyed every moment!
review.reviewText: Beautiful! Great location.

review.title: Reasonable Selection
review.reviewText: Good location, typical (good) Hilton service, reasonable price

review.title: Fabulous Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was absolutely a great experience start to finish. The staff was extremely professional and the hotel itself gives the feeling of luxury. The rooms were comfortable and the location is convenient to all SF attractions.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: I wouldnt stay their again.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is very well located and it is easy to get transportation, although you can walk to see many of the sites. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I was in town for a conference, and found it to be one of the best locations I have experienced.

review.title: Best location hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is the best in location near the Union Square.

review.title: No problems & loved the day spa!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the Union Square area. It's a typical Hilton and was very comfortable. I loved the day spa and treated myself to a massage while we were there. We didn't use the restaurants but found some fun & kid friendly diners for our breakfasts nearby. Several car rental agencies are directly across the street.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and very clean, but the rooms were small.

review.title: early check in
review.reviewText: I did early checked in. They assined some room. But the room was not ready yet. every thing durty at that time. But after call room service, everything OK.

review.title: hotel the best
review.reviewText: well worth the stay

review.title: Wonderful place to stay in the heart of San Fransico
review.reviewText: Walking into the Hotel is very impressive. The same impression and feeling was felt throughtout the rest of the business. We also enjoyed a great meal from the 46th floor. It's a great view and atmosphere.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Everything was great. Onlny concern was that the Housekeeping was knocking on all the doors at 8:30 in the morning on Sunday. Even though it was not our room it was very noisy in the hall. Had we wanted to sleep in a little it would not have been possible. Luckily we were not in San Fransisco to sleep in.

review.title: Beautiful Views
review.reviewText: The Hotel was very convenient for our needs with friendly staff and gorgeous views. Our room smelled like cigar smoke even though we were in a non-smoking area.

review.title: Focus on value and location
review.reviewText: The hotel is undergoing a renovation. Tower 3 is still in a less than up to date state. Location is great, and if you don't need to spend a lot of time in the room, then there is good value at this property.

review.title: Drab interior
review.reviewText: Corridors up to the rooms looked shabby.

review.title: Big but very comfortable
review.reviewText: I've stayed there twice. The first time my room on O'Farrell was extremely roomy and comfortable, this time our side room was cramped but comfortable none-the-less. The location is ideal. The lobby is cavernous. The staff, impersonally polite. Tip: Parking directly across O'Farrell St. is a flat $18 per day with unlimited in-and-out. Parking beneath the hotel runs $35.

review.title: Nice hotel, but next to a spotty part of town...
review.reviewText: The service and comfort of the hotel was excellent. The area of the hotel is very close to a bad part of town (per my sisters who lives there). Walking around the hotel neighborhood is fine during the day but you may want to take a cab at night. Our package also included a rental car, but we ended up spending more for parking (at the hotel alone) than the rental car. Save your money and take a cab to your destinations, you'll save the stress and hassle.

review.title: Nice hotel; small room
review.reviewText: Overall, a Hilton is a Hilton, but the room was very small, the furniture was old and beat up, and the rug was dirty and stained. Not what I expected for the price.

review.title: Very Impressed with this Hotel, would definately go back
review.reviewText: The hotel was right in the center of everything, we could walk to the Wharf, Chinatown, Union Square, ect. Hotel staff was nice and curtious. Room was clean and comfortable. We enjoyed our stay!

review.title: very impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel was new and clean! Room was great and he views are grande. Would recommend to anyone.

review.title: SF Hilton Very Nice
review.reviewText: Great experience. My only complaint is that the room doors seemed very thin. We could hear everything going on in the hallway and had some rowdy neighbors. Otherwise, very secure, clean and comfortable. But if you're planning on having cocktails, I'd go to a local bar as the hotels we're very expensive.

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: hilton sf is a good hotel actually to stay at .. near to everything .. nice service .. take a chance

review.title: Not impressed at all
review.reviewText: The hotel charges $36 a night for parking! The hotel rooms are VERY small and the hotel is a maze to get through. The pool is outdoor, but small and on the rooftop, which in San Francisco makes for a VERY chilly/windy experience sunbathing. The hotel is in a good location, but I would look elsewhere.

review.title: Hilton San Francisco - Newly remodeled and fantastic!
review.reviewText: Probably the nicest hotel we have had the plesure to stay at. The staff was extremely professional and treated everyone like you were their only guest. Next trip to San Francisco will include a return to the Hilton San Francisco!

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Close to restaurants, shops, and Cable car

review.title: Thanks for a great stay!
review.reviewText: Hotel is beautiful. Staff are very pleasant and willing to assist with questions. One negative was the price for parking at the hotel ($40+ per night). Parking is a problem in SF, but the price seemed a bit steep.

review.title: Overpriced, unimpressive, public toilet
review.reviewText: 1) Outside of Hotel smells like a public toilet. 2) In a Bad neighborhood. Unsafe to go out at night. 3) Agressive homeless people abound. 4) Bathrooms have closet doors that do not lock. 5) Do not take children 6) Two-bed, room was so tiny that a room servuce cart will not fit in the room.

review.title: Treat Yourself!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is classic elegance. The lobby is beautiful with its carpteting, seating and chandaliers. The hotel staff is exceptional and will bend over backwords to make your stay pleasurable. The conveniece and diversity of all the restaurants in the hotel was nice. The rooms were clean and fairly roomy. I look foward to visitn SF and this hotel again!!!!

review.title: Awesome Place
review.reviewText: This hotel is centrally loacted in San Fran. Near downtown and just a trolley ride away from Fishermans Wharf. Personnel at the hotel very very nice and friendly. Rooms were very clean and the customer service was excellent. Highly recommend to stay here.

review.title: I will stay here next time again!
review.reviewText: Excellent amenities all together. One of the very few downtown hotels with a pool. Clean & attractive and in a good location near shopping and Chinatown.

review.title: definitely not a 4 star hotel
review.reviewText: we found the hotel to be satisfactory, but definitely not a 4 star. the rooms were adequate, with just the basics. the staff was friendly but didn't make up for the rest. parking was extremely expensive, public lots located close by would have been a better option.

review.title: no disappointments
review.reviewText: Clean and crisp environment, meets or exceeds what you have come to expect from hilton. the hotel seemed a bit overwhelmed by large conventions at the time of our stay, but hotel staff kept up and stayed friendly and efficient. No disappointments.

review.title: Very good service
review.reviewText: Good service, very comfortable, good restaurant.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Great neighborhood (and close to even greater ones!), well maintained hotel. Would be better if the halls were brightened, but in general a great value for the money - especially when purchased with air on Expedia.

review.title: Jennifer's review
review.reviewText: Great Beds!

review.title: Can't wait to go back !
review.reviewText: I can't think of one negative thing to say about our stay. The lobby was beautiful,staff including housekeeping friendly and helpful. After a day of sightseeing couldn't wait to get into the most comfortable bed ever.

review.title: Would definiitely go back to this hotel again
review.reviewText: The first room we were given was not non-smoking, did not have a king bed as requested & had an ugly view. A quick word with the front desk & our next room was perfect with a a gorgeous view of the skyline & bay. Housekeeping kept the room & bath immaculate each day. The lobby was spacious & elegant. Also, the proximity of the hotel to Union Square and Market St. were a definitely plus. We loved our stay!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: location of hotel was great. Everyone there was very friendly. will definitely be staying there again.

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is huge. At first I was alittle put off about how far away my room was from the elevators (quite a hike), but I found eventually my own shortcut - it seems my room is actually closer to the tower 2 elevators, even though I stayed in tower 3...whatever. Decent area, I walked to SBC park twice from there and there were several good places to eat and shop close by.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Good location, great service.

review.title: Great Hotel Staff
review.reviewText: After reading other reviews, I was a little worried about the size of the room. When I checked-in, I told them right away that I needed a roll-a-way bed in the room. The staff said that because of this he would give us a bigger room with 2 queen beds and there would be plenty of room for the other bed. When we got to the room, the 3rd bed was already in the room with our luggage and the room was a perfect fit for us. All of this at same price. I felt that the parking fee charged at the Hilton were a little high until I saw the security and other prices for parking in San Francisco. It was well worth the price and it includes in and out service. We have made several trips to San Francisco and stayed at a different place everytime but not anymore. We will always stay at the Hilton during San Francisco visits from now on.

review.title: Do not stay here if you have a car!!!
review.reviewText: Outside of the ridiculous charge to park your car it was not a bad hotel. I really don't see how this is a four-star, though. Any of the nicer hotels in vegas are better. I guess its the dressy outfits the doormen wear. The room was okay but the mini-bar didn't work. Also, the cafe closed at noon for some reason. That was hard to believe. There were also a lot of small things such as the fact that the nightstand needed re-finished badly. The city itself was wonderful but if you are there to see the sights, (tourist visit), you are much better off staying nearer Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was located in the middle of san francisco near all the shops etc. just a short taxi ride to fisherman's wharf.. hotel restaurant had an excellent breakfast all employees were very courteous and helpful

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The hotel is great.

review.title: Will Stay Again
review.reviewText: The Hilton San Francisco is a beautiful hotel and within blocks of Union Square. The staff was friendly, courteous and very helpful. The room was extremely clean and extremely comfortable. Their feather beds and down comforters were a delight after a long day of sight-seeing. I will definitely stay again when I return to San Francisco.

review.title: I was impressed with the staff in the hotel. Very friendly and helpful
review.reviewText: The hotel is very clean and beautiful. The staff were nice and very helpful.

review.title: Excellent hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is huge. But, they really manage it well & provide excellent service. Has a nice feel to it. Got a great value by booking through Expedia.

review.title: Would stay again.
review.reviewText: Room was small and bathroom was small. The first nite stay was terrible.. The sound of running water all nite kept us awake. Complained the next morning...said they could not take care of the problem now and would move us to another room. Second room had only 1 bed for 3 people.. called desk again, gave us another room, which was FINALLY a very nice room..So the rest of the stay was fine. Hotel staff was very accomodating.

review.title: Convient to Union Square
review.reviewText: Enjoyed my stay very much and the convention halls are the largest I've seen in a hotel

review.title: nice location
review.reviewText: room's a bit small. but good service

review.title: Good Room-Good Price
review.reviewText: Huge hotel with overwhelming logitics - but close to everything and clean enough for a compfortable stay at the end of a sight-seeing day. Easy walk to Union Square, cable car stop etc.

review.title: A bit worn out, but great location.
review.reviewText: I did not have a good first impression of this hotel. First of all, it's on the edge of the Tenderloin area, but you soon realize it's also on the edge of Union Square and Nob Hill, which was great. The hotel employees were grubby looking and the conceriege was very snippy when I called with some questions prior to our arrival. The rooms need to be upgraded but were OK. I was surprised that this Hilton was rated a 4 star hotel, but overall it was an OK experience. Probably wouldn't recommend it.

review.title: Room was very small
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby is spacious and grand, but my room was the size of a postage stamp. It also seemed very daed. For this to be a Hilton, I was not very impressed. I will stay somewhere different the next time I am in San Fran.

review.title: Nice and Clean
review.reviewText: Very nice and very Clean.

review.title: I would definitely come back
review.reviewText: The Hilton was a great place to stay. An elegant hotel in a location close to restaurants, trolleys, etc. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Loved This Hotel
review.reviewText: Spent a week at the Hilton for our anniversary and we were very impressed. Lobby is beautiful. Starlight Room on the 46th floor is a must. The view from this restaurant is breath taking. Food and drinks were very good. Service was quite good. Every employee smiled and greeted us at every opportunity. Housekeeping was a very friendly and she kept our room very clean. Read some comments that this hotel was too close to the Tenderloin district. Never found it to be a problem. They have uniformed security ( also very friendly ) at each entrance and near the elevators 24 hours a day. Many times there was a uniformed S.F. police officer outside the main entrance. Never saw anyone in or around the hotel who didn't belong there. Just a block and a half to the cable cars. Near several outstanding restaurants. Walked to these with no problems. Many travelers and business types on the streets. Cable cars will take you to many other restaurants. Room not big but big enough. Eleventh floor. No view but didn't matter. Don't stay in a room near the elavators! Can get noisy. That was the only negative. Would stay there again especially for the price ( included with the flight and car ).

review.title: Dining
review.reviewText: In-hotel dining facilities were limited in their hours

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: The Hilton was very nice. The refrigerator/honor bar in our room was broken, everything was warm. That was the only bummer. The hotel is in the tenderloin district, two blocks from the cable car. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Need more than one restaurant in such a big hotel. Also need someplace to eat other than the bar during non-meal hours.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The service I received from the concierge to the bellhops was excellent. Friendly, helpful. Never waited long (5 minutes max) for service. Wonderful location - within walking distance of shopping center, cable car, tons of restaurants. Loved it. Will definitely return. For a large hotel, I never felt like I was in a crowd.

review.title: Big Hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: It is a huge Hilton in the tourist area of SF. I was only there to sleep, since it was a business trip.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Overall the Hilton was great. You cannot beat the location. My only issue was with noise from adjacent rooms and the hallway. Since we didn't spend much time in the room, it really wasn't a problem.

review.title: Nice Location
review.reviewText: Beautiful lobby, Pleasant staff, Nice location.

review.title: Total San Francisco Experience
review.reviewText: Only a 5+ hotel could serve you better! From valet parking to the maid service was extrodinary. Truly a San Francicso experience!

review.title: Definitely recommend
review.reviewText: Beautiful accomodations, pleasant and very helpful staff, great location - would definitly go back!

review.title: small rooms
review.reviewText: Great location downtown if you don't mind the street people hitting you up for change. Very small rooms with a great view of the roof of the building next to us. Bed was very comfortable. Outrageous prices in the restaurants but plenty of places to eat for a more reasonable price a couple of blocks down the street.

review.title: the lobby is nice...
review.reviewText: you can tell that the hilton spends a lot of money on the lobby but not much on the rooms. if you plan on spending all of your time in the lobby i would suggest you go there. if not...stay somewhere else.

review.title: Great Location and Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location convenient to everything. The bed was exceptionally comfortable. The room was smaller than we had anticipated and the bathroom was very tiny. However, many hotels in large metropolitan areas can be somewhat smaller, so we don't know if this should really impact the hotel's rating.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: good centralized location, near shopping and all public transportation. room was a little small, but well kept by very friendly staff. view from cityscape bar should not be missed.

review.title: Hilton SF
review.reviewText: Great location - easy access to Union Square and the BART. Bed could have been a little more comfortable, but overall, a decent place to stay.

review.title: Great location one block from Union Square
review.reviewText: Room service was delivered sooner than I was told and it was hot! The apple cinnamon crepe breakfast was excellant!

review.title: Decent hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in close proximity to the convention center

review.title: Rated too high
review.reviewText: Small rooms, with maid noise in the early mornings.

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: My only dissatisfaction was with the size of the room--not very large.

review.title: Hotel was very nice - fun vacation!!!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and very well situated in downtown. We stayed in two rooms, the first one had very nice new bedding but the second was not as nice.

review.title: Always reliable
review.reviewText: Since 2000 I have used this hotel when I go up to Giant's games with my kids. Easy parking, great central location for food, shopping and specialty shops. And a 10.00 or 50cent taxi/bus ride to the park.

review.title: Was this really a Hilton Hotel?
review.reviewText: I started my stay by asking someone that was entering thru the hotel's employee entrance where I could park temporarily checking in. The third time he finally looked at me like I was an idiot and should know that I should just go around the corner. A stranger explained how to enter from that area. I got my bags from the trunk of my rental car and had my hands full as I went to the door to enter the hotel. There were two hotel employees in uniform on a smoke break that were too busy to assist me with the door until one of them finally held it open as I was halfway thru. I asked a guard regarding temporary parking while checking in and unloading instead of having my wife wait in the car in an unauthorized area. He told me he had no clue and I should refer my questions to the front desk when I checked in. When we got to the room my wife went to the restroom to wash her face and found the sink was clogged and would not drain. Maintenance did respond quickly, but this is something that the maid should have reported and had taken care of prior to our arrival. It would have been easily spotted while cleaning the sink. Also had difficulties while trying to get a waitress to wait on me for a takeout order at the hotel's grill. The other waitress that was off shift bailed me out. She took care of my order in a professional and courteous manner. The reason for our trip: To celebrate my Bithday. In spite of the hotel, we had a great time in The City.

review.title: Nice place, a bit too large for me
review.reviewText: The hotel is hard to find from the 101. I like the more upscale hotels personally, and this one was definitely up there. The hotel is an entire city block, so be prepared to walk around the massive lobby before finding your tower and elevator.

review.title: Bit Pricey for the Stay
review.reviewText: Room was 'functional'. Asked for non-smoking and was stuck with smoking. Don't park in the hotel, parking prices were astronomical. Hotel Layout was odd. Buildings are seperated into 3 towers. Tower 3 rooms are generally far from tower 3 elevators.

review.title: Good base for exploring San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hilton Hotel is in the heart of downtown, close to public transportation, Powell St. cable cars, Union Square, and Market St. The room was large enough, decently equipped, comfortable, if in need of a bit of maintenance. The hotel has many services we did not use this trip, but very well might another time, including a health club and a spa.

review.title: Nice Hotel, Good Location
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hilton on O'Farrell St. for 3 nights in April 2005. The service was great, the employees were helpful and very nice. Our room was in tower 3 and was clean and tidy. It's not a small "boutique" hotle so if that's what you are looking for, this isn't the place for you. The hotel is HUGE with restaurants and shops, etc. There is an outdoor pool area on the 16th (I think) floor that is small but really nice too. Very close to Union square and easy to get to public transportation. If you want to rent a car there are 2 rental car companies across the street and they let you rent from them but then drop off at the airport, which was nice. Also across the street they have a deal where if you drop your car off after 5:30pm and leave before 9:30am they only charge you $12.50 a night. I would stay in the hotel again and would recommend it to friends and family.

review.title: Hotel room bed was wonderful
review.reviewText: We were really impressed by the comfortable bed and overall service of the hotel staff.

review.title: Hilton San Francisco
review.reviewText: the room was too small, the tv did not work and it cost me $15 to have 2 diet cokes delivered to my room

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Within walking distances to shopping area and attractions.

review.title: not impressed.
review.reviewText: not very clean. room small. great the price though.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel,great location.Trams and shopping around the corner.Close to China Town also.Rooms very clean and beds SO comfortable.Staff helpful and friendly.Ten out Ten.

review.title: Clean but small
review.reviewText: I was surprised how small the rooms were.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. Rooms were small but very nicely decorated. Parking was the downfall - $80 for two nights.

review.title: Good place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: My first stay at any Hilton ever... the deluxe room looked more like a standard room that I've stayed in at other hotels, so I'm a little disappointed in that. Everything was neat and tidy. Bathroom was neat, too - everything functioned properly. The lobby was nice... and the staff was friendly. The location helped, as well - probably the reason why I'd stay there again.

review.title: Hilton San Francisco
review.reviewText: We arrived Tuesday night around 9PM. We checked in. Our room was on the 16th floor near the pool. It was a little smaller than we thought. The room was comfortable and homely. We woke up to find a USA today paper. The sun came into our bedroom around 9AM which was nice. The hotel has a nice sports bar with San Francisco merobelia. Everyday the bar has 1/2 off entrees which we enjoyed. We were lucky because on the Friday that we were there the CityScape Restaurant would be open. It was under renovation. The restaurant is on the 46th floor. It has an amazing view of the whole city. The bay bridge and the San Francisco bay bridge was in clear view. The night we were up there you could see the Giants Stadium. The food was fantastic. I didn't like the cold bread they served. I didn't like that you had to pay $8 per day to use the gym at the Health Club. It was nice any way. The staff were a little noisy in the early morning near our room. I would stay at the hotel again.

review.title: Not spectaculor enough to warrant high price
review.reviewText:
We stayed four nights at this hotel in early April 2005. While the lobby looks spectaculor, the rooms are just average. No view, very small bathroom and a tight room. Granted we just got the basic room, but I imagine most of you are in the same boat financially as us (Don't have money to burn to upgrade to one of their suites). The restaurants and bar in the hotel are overpriced. $7 or so for a corona, breakfast for two cost us nearly $40. We didn't try their Japanese restaurant or CityScape restaurant because we didn't feel like shelling out $100 for dinner. I think the Hilton caters to business travelers who have company money to burn. 
The positives to this hotel are their employees, most of whom go out of their way to be super nice, and the hotel's location. The hotel is just a few blocks away from Union Square and Market Street. Overall, I would have rathered stayed at a hotel near Fisherman's Wharf... seemed like there was more tourist stuff going on around that area.

review.title: "Great Location"
review.reviewText: The San Francisco Hilton is in a very good centralized location.  It was a couple of blocks away from "Union Square" and only two blocks away from the cable car line that transports you any where you need to go.  The hotel was minutes away from "Nordstrom's" shopping center.  The only problem was the size of the room, so when booking, book larger than the standard size room.  But, other than that the "Hilton" is a great choice.  Great shops and restaurants inside of the hotel if you don't want to venture out.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful, but in a lousy neighborhood, I would love to stay with the Hilton, but not at that location.  I stayed in the same hotel eight years ago, but the neighborhood it is in has declined over the past decade.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Nice clean hotel close to great shopping.

review.title: Absolutely Beautiful....
review.reviewText: This was one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in for some time..... The dining upstairs was impeccable and the views breathtaking... We will definately return for many more visits....

review.title: Too Cold
review.reviewText: The heater didn't work too well. I wish they can change the blanket to down comforter, so it would be more comfortabel.

review.title: Fancy, and Worth Every Dollar
review.reviewText: Elegant hotel with employees that are there for your service. Exceptional service and care.

review.title: Hilton Tower Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great hotel only a short walk from Union Square.  Fantastic Spa!  The concierge and Tours Desk make seeing the sights and traveling with a group of seven very easy.  New Year's Eve was very active at the hotel.  They provided extra security and services to make it a great evening.  Highly recommended.

review.title: SF Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We have stayed in San Francisco each year.  This was one of the better Hotels that we have stayed in.  Centrally located, excellent room service and everything you need at your disposal.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Close to Union Square. Large comfortable room.  Plenty of room for a family of four.

review.title: It was GREAT- even though there was a strike going on!!
review.reviewText: We ate in 3 of the hotel's restaurants & they were wonderful!!  The hotel is beautiful!  We would definitely go back.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel, but did have difficulty making dinner reservations at the resturant.
